Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to Pefect”
Reviews.Author: bumper1965
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 8 nights at Mahekal. If your usual level of accomadation is the Four Seasons or Ritz, please go directly to their websites. Still reading? Good. This place is on the best section of beach in Playa. We stayed in an ocean front room, but if your budget says "garden view," please go ahead and make a reservation. The grounds are much better than the pictures and the garden view rooms are actually quieter. Now some important points: The beach in the town of Playa is totally public. It's a very mixed group of wonderful people and a number of families. Pretty much everyone will feel comfortable. Regarding the ocean front room: The ocean is very audible in the ocean front rooms at night. If you're a very light sleeper, or not accustomed to really hearing the ocean at night, you may want to consider an ocean view instead. The staff: They're all very friendly and helpful. But do yourself a favor and get 20 and 50 peso bills. Tips left on the hotel bill don't necessarily mean better service. The rooms: immaculate. They are a little rustic in that there are heavy duty wooden shutters in parts in lieu of glass. However, that is traditional and doesn't make it more noisy or less air-conditioned. Now the honest part: The food is sort of a work in progress. They were trying a mixed menu (one fixed for the meal plan and another with supplimental charges). The breakfast was very good, but sometimes the service seemed a little overwhelmed. Lunches are generally better and what we chose. The two times we had dinner, it was okay, not great. Given the number of great places to eat on 5th, I'd recommend trying them (like Origins across from the main entrance). And the bar....the one with the swings was okay, but one bartender struggled to make a margarita that wasn't sweet. The pool bar was better (where you have breakast - 2 for 1 happy hour). The smell: yes, people have mentioned it here so I'll address it. Unless you are EXTREMELY sensitive to smells (perfume, etc), you honestly won't notice it. However, it did rain one night while we were having dinner well west of 5th Ave (El 10 - Argentine steak house) and WELL away from the beach and that was when it was most noticeable. I have no reason whatsoever to believe there is any problem with the quality of the ocean water. Don't worry about it. Over all, I'd definatley recommend this place, even if you only stay in a garden view room. You'll have a great beach, nice people, a very nice room and a short walk into town.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise -Best Beach in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine182206
Reviews.Content: What a gem! This is the perfect resort for those of you who are not into 5 star huge all inclusive resorts. Mahekal is an "old school" beach resort and is so unique. It was all about the beach, the hammocks and the relaxing atmosphere. We loved every minute - even when it rained. We had a lovely room ( top floor with palapa roof) with an ocean view on the caribe side. Even though we were only a couple of rows down from the bar, it wasn't too noisy (until our last night which was the beginning of Spring Break - keep that in mind when booking). Great restaurant across the street for those nights you want a change (Origenes) with wonderful Spanish guitar music and the best margaritas in town. We stayed for 2 weeks and never felt like it was too long in one place. Most guests were quite envious of us when they heard we were staying so long! We met many guests who were "repeaters" from 4 to 25 years which speaks volumes for how special this resort is. We also have to mention how fantastic the staff are. We had a special bond with Manuel - he provided the best service we have ever had anywhere in our travels! The staff work very hard to make guests happy and we appreciated that. Tip: Get a fridge for 5 usd per day and bring bug spray for night time wandering. For tours in Playa del Carmen we would recommend contacting Mayacan Eco Tours. Great experience for our first time in the Yucatan!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and non cheesy family friendly hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_V_NYC
Reviews.Content: After hours of researching where to stay (if at all) in Playa and being faced with a plethora of extremely cheesy all inclusive properties, we stumbled upon this amazing resort on Tripadvisor. After we read all of the positive reviews we booked and could not have been happier. The staff at this resort are phenomenally friendly and attentive. There are half/full board dining options you can select, we opted for half board and could not have been happier as the restaurant in the evenings is actually really lovely. Breakfasts are phenomenal, a few tables outside for al fresco beach-side dining (amazing, especially with a hyper toddler in tow), the food at lunch too was amazing. There are two pools and an outdoor spa to utilize and the beach is beautiful, plenty of sun loungers and beach shade with umbrellas to chooe from. Never at any point did we feel that we were unwelcome with our baby and toddler, which was a huge relief. The resort was hugely popular with European visitors (esp French and Dutch), extremely nice and laid back vibe throughout. As its in the far north of Playa you are about 5-10 minutes walk from the hub of 5th Avenue, but not in the thick of it, which for us was perfect. Surrounded by lots of fabullous stores, bars and restaurants. There are no TVs or telephones in the guest rooms but this was the appeal of it for us. If you can't survive without the above and are looking for butler service its not for you, BUT if you aren't this is resort is nirvana. Can't recommend the hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Thatched roofs in near paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at Mahekal Beach Resort 3/7-3/15. We had been reading the Trip Advisor reviews for months and thought that there was no way this place could be so perfect. Well it is! We had a second floor "ocean view" three rows back and loved it. Only had to use the AC one night ( and that was because of the rare wedding party across the street). The breeze from the ocean was perfect. Rooms are very well done, always clean and stylish. This grass thatched rooms are very similar to ones we had in Tahiti many years ago. The second floor rooms offer a little more privacy and air. As everybody writes, the staff makes Mahekal a 5 star resort. Our shuttle arrived at around 10:00PM and they rushed us to the dinner that they had left open for us and a few other late arrivals. We met Rogelio that night as our waiter and he was fantastic throughout the week. It ended up that he was our primary waiter most days and we were glad that he was. However, all of the waiters were very good ( Eliazar ). Boli helped with dinner plans and arranging the shuttle back home. Uri helped with check-out - insuring that we had coffee and a wake up knock on the door at 4:00AM for our return ( the security guard also helped out with these details ). The half board is a good way to go so that you can enjoy lunches or dinners in town. The pools are small but quite honestly we had an almost private pool for 3 of the 8 days we stayed. Most people use the cabanas at the ocean instead. We did both. The grounds are very well maintained and the gardening is creative. We will return here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxed break on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kalokol84
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful relaxing break after a hectic up every morning tour. The hotel was simple quiet with out hut right on the beach beautiful. Many hours spent in the hammocks on our veranda reading to the sound of the waves and the happy people on the beach. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, staff”
Reviews.Author: JSAATY
Reviews.Content: Resort maintains its low key yet beautiful setting, great food, warm friendly staff. For a week of relaxation it cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “25 years of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: djpetrie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 2 weeks at Mahekal Beach Resort for our 25th year of paradise. We alway go in February and meet some friends that we had met over the years. We have found that not only have we met wonderful people from around the world but we feel that the staff have become our friends too. One cannot beat the friendliness of the staff and we believe that is because it is not a hugh resort. It is small, very clean and relaxing. The fact that there are no televisions or phones in the rooms gives us the opportunity to meet new people and visit with old friends. The food this year was exceptionally good and the new chef and menu has made a difference. Due to the growth of Playa del Carmen it is accessible to walk to town and other places for lunch or dinner. Should you have any questions or want information, please feel free to e-mail us at dpjp65@comcast.net. D & J Woodstock, IL

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for....”
Reviews.Author: Kittypatrol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do not like all-inclusive mega-resorts. Thus, Mahekal was a perfect choice for us. The grounds and the beach are lovely. We enjoyed spending our days under one of the many palapas which are solely for Mahekal guests. Our room could have used a little love, but it was extremely clean and we only slept there anyway. We had breakfast and lunch at the resort each day and ate dinner in town. The best lunch options are the sandwiches, in my opinion. We booked our transportation through the hotel and it was seamless and worth it. The location is perfect. We loved being able to walk through town in the evening, stopping at various places for a drink or two. It had been ten years since our last trip to Playa and the city is unrecognizable from what it looked like a decade ago. I'm not saying that is bad thing, it just is crazy how this once small little strip has grown into a land of Starbucks and Haagen Dazs. One plea from me to you: Please don't have your photo taken with the baby animals they have on display on 5th Ave. I did a lot of research upon my return because the men trying to get you to pay to have your photo taken with the baby lion said that the little guy was "on loan" from the Mexico City Zoo and they had the "certificates" to prove it. NOT TRUE. It is a total sham and these animals shouldn't be on display just to make money for a few jerks.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing. Great beach”
Reviews.Author: carentholder
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved our stay. We originally had an ocean view room in the Pueblito, which I would not recommend. It was old and oddly laid out. The bathroom was funky at best. We then "downgraded" to a garden view Pueblito room which is much newer and esthetically much better. We did not, however, receive a refund since we had prepaid for the room. The breakfast is great. Lunch not that wonderful. We only ate dinner there once and it was very good. Location away from honky-tonk of 5th Ave is great, but within walking distance of some nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DTtrip
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of 10 for a birthday celebration. Reservations, airport transfers and even a random delight for the birthday girl - all fantastic! Rooms are simple but comfortable and clean. It's all about the beach and hammocks anyway. Two meals included per day made things effortless - we had breakfast and lunch on site and dined in town for dinners. Happy hour was a fun transition after a day in the sun and a massage at the spa even better. Definitely recommend if you are looking for an effortless beach getaway with awesome service and a few comforts. Perfect if traveling alone, as a couple or with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Most Memorable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Cristina R
Reviews.Content: My sister got married at this resort on March 3rd and although the trip was great because we were celebrating, everyone at this resort made the experience so much better. All the staff are so nice and welcoming. They greet you by your name and give you such personal attention and service that you do not see in the big hotels. The resort was beautiful, clean and well maintained. It was the perfect place to dis-connect, with no tvs or phones in the room. There is one area on the resort by the bar/pool that does have wifi. The food was excellent. Strategically located near 5th avenue (within walking distance) for shopping and many other restaurants. The beach was great and it was nice to not have to get up at 5 am to secure a chair by the ocean. I want to specifically thank Dulce the wedding coordinator for all her hard work to make my sister's day so perfect. Her attention to detail and hard work was above and beyond. Special thanks also to Jose and Vicente who provided us with superb service. If you are looking for a quaint, quiet, relaxing place to stay you have to stay here. The other reviews are right, the pictures do not do justice to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very relaxing, loved the hammocks”
Reviews.Author: cmce79
Reviews.Content: we stayed the first week in may 2011. perfect weather, no rain. We stayed ocean front in 27 P. the beach is clean beautiful white sand, right out our front door, hammocks on our porch , great for relaxing with warm breeze. breakfast is excellent. the location is perfect, close enough to 5th ave, but also very quiet. I can not wait to return...If you looking for a place to stay that is clean, quiet, with the best beach..this is the place,,feel free to email any questions you may have that i could answer....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Leonie B
Reviews.Content: My wife and i are from the Netherlands and been for the first time in mexico and stayed for 1 week at the Mahekal Beach Resort. It was..Fantastic! The resort is even more beautifull in real than we saw on the pictures. The whole crew is really great! The reception desk crew, the kitchen crew, the gardeners, the housekeeping, everybody seems to work there with a smile and where very friendly. Especcialy the restaurant-crew and Mr. Boli, the concierge who made us feel at home in Mexico and the Resort. Many thanks to the whole crew! Really great food, beautifull beach, fantastic atmosphere because of the garden and the very nice build houses. Everybody who plans a trip to Playa del Carmen should considder staying at the Mahekal Beach Resort!! When its possible whe sure will! A good shopping tip: At the authentic maya market in Puerto Morelos is where you can find al the beautifull mexican souvenirs that everybody wants the take home but there handmade by the people who sell them and are really good priced!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST VACATION EVER”
Reviews.Author: Snjezana H
Reviews.Content: We used to live in Mexico and stayed at Playa Del Carmen many times, but this was so far the best experience ever!!! Absolutely the best vacation we ever had! First of all, the photos and description don't do justice to the resort. It appears smaller then it is, but the way the bungalows are distributed, he whole resort feels so intimate and pleasant. Like a little piece of heaven! When we arrived,at the reception we were greeted with cold water and moist towels that smelled sooo nice, a combination of lime and lavender. The whole staff is friendly, nice, professional, accommodating any needs you might have. The rooms clean, again that beautiful lavender scent, beds comfortable, linens fresh and cozy, daily supply of organic shampoo and lotions. The food was amazing! Congrats to Chef Armando! And the Spa...you have to try their spa! The treatments are reasonably priced and the massage therapists are great! Try the Angel Vail Massage, fantastic! Thank you Gabriel, you are an Angel! We don't remember staying at the resort so impeccably run, so clean and beautiful, overall, we can't wait to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: AxxNL
Reviews.Content: The resort looks even better real life than it does in the pictures. It's not perfect and it's not full service, but that's not what we needed. What we needed was a quiet place with a great open plan with a little bit of nature and the sea close by. We got exactly that. Personnel was great.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place!”
Reviews.Author: Geoff M
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the best vacation we have ever had. Mahekal is sensational in every way. It starts with all who work there, every single employee was fantastic, friendly, helpful and energetic. The resort was impeccable, could not be cleaner, more tasteful or better run. the gradening, the plantings, the whole facility just beautiful and perfect. And the food was excellent. I cannot say enough good things. Mahekal employees do a flawless job and all who work there bring joy to peoples' lives that will not be forgotten. Of course if we I can do it, I will take my family back in an instant. I will recommend the resort at every opportunity. I extend my thanks to the entire staff. Every single employee deserves a heartfelt thanks and congratulations for doing their work exactly as it should be done. With great appreciation to Mahekal Beach Resort, Geoff McCullough

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha B
Reviews.Content: We went to Mahekal for our honeymoon in October 2011 and it was beautiful. By far the best resort on the 5th Avenue with lovely rooms, friendly staff and good food. Breakfast every morning by the beach, fresh towels, beach side service all made it extra special. We didnt have the best weather, only a few days of sun, but this did not dampen our trip and the resort was fantastic. The road leading to the resort had some of the best restaurants, including a juice bar and yoga place just next door, perfect! I would recommend this resort, it will not dissapoint!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Mahekal”
Reviews.Author: travelhex
Reviews.Content: We have spent 8 nights at the Mahekal Beach Resort within one of the Ocean View rooms. We were a little bit sceptical if the hotel can meet our expecations but Mahekal was the best choice for us. Location: The hotel is located at the beach, approx. 10 Min from the 5th Avenida, and not directly within all those fancy beach clubs having loud music all day long. But if you want to go there, it is just a 5-10 Min walk and you can be right in the middle of the party. Rooms: We have chosen the little bit more upscale ocean view rooms which absolutely made our expectations. We had 2 queen size beds (OK, we wanted to have King Size) but our room was huge. The bathroom had Mexican style tiles on the all, walk in shower, hot/cold water was without any issues. Additionally we had a fantastic terrace facing to the ocean front with 2 chairs, 2 hammocks and a small table.Excellent to hang out and enjoy a sundowner. The only thing that we missed was a mini-bar. Food/ Facilities: In Mahekal you can choose if you want to have lunch or dinner. This is totally convenient if you want to dine outside of the hotel or stroll around in the evening. The dinner varies between buffet and a la carte. The food is not five star bur a solid 3-4. You will always find something tasty. The a la carte menue is also a solid 3-4 star. The breakfast has a huge buffet and you can order hot meals. Those are very good and should not let any wishes open. The presentation of the food is also OK, lets say also 3-4 stars. The service both at the breakfast, lunch and dinner is excellent.Even though there are many guest they knew our room number, our favourite drinks and were extremely friendly. We were really happy, that the staff members paid a lot of attention and didn't treat us as if we would be "any guest". Excellent!!! Between 4-6 pm there is a happy hour where you can enjoy cocktails for 50% off within the hot jacuzzi and facing the ocean. We hung out there every day. Also check in and check out was without any issues - Uri, the guy from the front desk was very professional and open minded. The hotel has an excellent dive shop enclosed (at the beach front), this one is not directly related to the hotel but works together with them. If you want to learn diving, do it there! We already decided to spend another vacation in Playa del Carmen next year and we will definately go back to the Mahekal!We have seldomly made a better choice for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: beanblossom1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed the Mahekal - the staff was very friendly, food was excellent, rooms very comfortable. This is a very low-key facility - rooms do not have TVs, radios or even clocks - but the beds are comfortable and the showers work well. We stayed in the Garden area which was quite nice - and still only a short walk to the beach. Every room has a sheltered porch with two hammocks and a table and chairs. The location is near (a couple of blocks away) from the main shopping street. The beach is well maintained. All-in-all, a very nice place and a good value. A few complaints - could use better internet accessibility and some of the hotels in the area have music blasting a bit too loudly at times.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bills.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis D
Reviews.Content: Love Mahekal, we returned for our second visit, It was going to be our Vacation Destination. The staff overall Wonderful, Manuel, Alberto, Happy hour crew. We just had the best and most relaxing trip. We checked out ,had a cab waiting didn't check our bill at checkout. Got home and looked and found to have charged for 4 lunches.(1048.00 pecos). We had told girl at checkin we would being having lunch the rest of the week. We didn't have dinner any of those evening. Contacted Front end manager 0n 2/19 let him know and requested credit. Senor Oswaldo Jiminez has yet to confirm credit 2/24. He should take notes from his great staff on Customer Service

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is "Magical!"”
Reviews.Author: ChellinND
Reviews.Content: My husband and I discovered Mahekal when it was named, "Shangri-La Caribe" and no matter the name, this resort is fantastic and one-of-a-kind! We have stayed at this resort several times with just the two of us, with our boys and with other couples. Every time seems to be better than the last, if that's possible. Our last visit was in early December with friends and we had one of the beach view bungalows. Ours was the second row from the front and right on the pathway leading to the bar. We were upgraded to this one and it had a few extra amenities and upgraded decor pieces. Outside the patio we had two large planters and in addition to the normal hammock hanging on the patio, we had some pretty little lanterns, that staff would light at night, giving a real romantic and beach vibe to our little home. Inside the room we had two double beds, small desk and chair, two large closets, and sweet, stylish bathroom. A wooden, sliding door was the entrance to the bathroom and inside was a funky, metal mirror and wooden pegs to hang towels and clothing. It was updated and just really simple and cool. Keep in mind, if you are a regular at a "W" hotel or "The Ritz" then this may not be for you. The bathroom is small and simple, and yes, you will have a few tiny, teeny ants once-in-awhile around the sink. It's the beach. Little guys get in and no, you will not die. I love the chunky, wooden blinds that open up to let the fresh ocean air in and sounds of the birds. This resort has all the amenities you NEED. Nothing extra. No tvs, no radios, no clocks, no telephones...it's Heaven. The Beach. Let's get down to business. The Beach. I think the section of beach in front of Mahekal is some of the best in Playa del Carmen. Yes, it changes. In December there were sections of the beach that were just completely gone; right up to the porches of the beach bungalows. But I bet it's already changed again. The beach is just amazing. It's the best place to relax on the chairs under a palapa and people watch. Complete relaxation. And no beach vendors to ask you to purchase something. It's awesome. You can drink, eat, sleep, read, laugh, talk, play in the ocean, love your partner, hate your partner, play frisbee or just be on this beach. Breakfast and Dinner. I LOVE Breakfast at this resort. I've said it before, and I'll say it again,"It's my happy place." I love walking down the beach to the pool area and huge palapa breakfast room or walking down the gorgeous, tiled pathway. Either way you get to take in all the beauty of the ocean and beautiful flora and fauna of the resort. The landscaping is amazing and so gorgeous. They obviously take a tremendous amount of pride in keeping up the appearance of the grounds and it shows. We love sitting poolside and enjoying breakfast outside. You can either order off the menu, Heuvos Motulenos is soooo good! Or you can go inside and select a nice hearty breakfast from the items they have to offer buffet style. Dry cereals, breads, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, meats, cheeses and fresh fruit juices. I think it is really good and a nice way to start the day. The staff are all sweet, friendly and will do anything for you! I cannot say enough about all of them. They make a simple cup of coffee a real treat. I was really wistful when I enjoyed my last breakfast there, knowing that the next morning I wouldn't have the luxury of walking down the beach to have these wonderful people make my day brighter. The Sunday night Fiesta is really good. Although we spend most of our time experiencing all that Fifth Avenue has to offer, the Sunday night is something that you should do. The array of dishes that are served are all delicious and give you a real taste of some traditional Mexican food. Again the same wait staff are eager to make your Fiesta fun and they love to offer you a "tequila slammer" before being seated. It's cute how they watch for your reaction. We love to cheese it up and ask for another! lol The best part of the evening is the Marache band that comes around to the tables and plays. The musicians are extremely talented and have a great sense of humor. When you get into it, they love it and get into it and it's so much fun! Mahekal is truly a place to relax and enjoy yourself and your family. The staff are warm, welcoming and work so hard to make your vacation memorable. I am so excited that I am returning in April. Mahekal, here I come!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolaChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many, many hotels from rock bottom to ultra spiffy. Mahekal is not spiffy by any means but it is charming, lovely and has many plusses. First, the staff are wonderful. Everyone is friendly and they were very responsive to our requests. The setting is great. We had an upstairs ocean view room which was private and the view was beautiful. The rooms are simple but adequate and the beds (or at least our bed) are very comfortable. The grounds are well maintained and very clean. I did not miss having a tv or phone at all because my idea of vacation is really getting away from the world. The beach is great and is right there. Our only quibble here is that Wifi throughout the complex, as opposed to the bar and the lobby, would be great. The location is good ... far enough away from 5th Avenue to get away from the crowds but close enough to be able to walk there easily. Breakfast and lunch are good. Unfortunately, the two times we had dinner, the food was abysmal. The entrees included in the "free" meal are very limited. You have to pay extra for premium choices. Don't waste your money! The food at dinner was not worth it. However, lunches were fresh and delicious. My husband and I both had massages which were wonderful. The bar was a lot of fun. The bar staff was very friendly and efficient. As nice as it was, I would definitely not stay here during the rainy season. The palapa roofs are not waterproof! I was disappointed with the town, especially 5th Avenue which is one long, often tacky, tourist strip. The restaurants on the Avenue are mediocre and way overpriced. Do not bother buying any basics, such as wine, beer, tequila, etc. there as they probably cost half at the grocery store or Wallmart. There are some places to note however. The restaurant directly across the street (Origines) is very good and they had great live music at dinner. The monkey joint up the street is also very good and nicely funky. And there is a nice place at the corner of 38th and 5th to get coffee. If you are looking for upscale luxury, glitz and lots of action, don't waste your time at Mahekal. If you want a laid back and relaxing experience, give it a try. I would definitely come back to the resort. Playa del Carmen I am not so sure about as I prefer to have authentic experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: Nancy929x
Reviews.Content: My husband and I hadn't been away without kids for 10 years. Mahekal was the perfect choice for us. We had breakfast and lunch at the hotel and we were able to explore the great dining options in Playa at night. The restaurant directly across the street, Origenes, was superb! One of the highlights of our trip. The snorkeling excursions from the hotel were very good. If your walk down the beach right past where the boats are and swim out to where the last one is, there is a fantastic reef right there. We've snorkeled in a lot of places and this was right up there with the best of them. Breakfast was good, with limited options. Same with lunch. We ate dinner there one night and were unimpressed. Anything that we liked on the menu was "extra.". Can't say enough about the people who work there. EVERYONE was nice. We had an ocean view room and we were glad we chose that instead of ocean front. The ocean front rooms were literally ON the beach, which is cool, but there are people laying out and walking past all day. Not much privacy. The rooms are simple, but comfortable. Would recommend this resort for adults more than kids.

Reviews.Title: “Better Options are out there!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M
Reviews.Content: This resort is by no means a 4 star resort. I would say 2 1/2 at best. Secrets is a 4 star resort with 5 award winning restaurants! This is not even close. Some things were good, not great: *Comfy bed, great mattress *Location on beach was pretty good, however, the resort is smack dab in the middle of a public beach access. Guess what, you get the overflow of families parking themsevles right in front of you blocking your beautiful view with their umbrellas. On the other hand, it is a short walk to the center of town and much better food. *Staff was overall friendly and helpful. Did get the feeling that front desk was very full of themselves and not very accommadating or friendly. NOT SO GOOD STUFF: *ROOMS-yuck, A/C didnt work properly, porch ceiling leaked and you could see the buildup of mold, no fridge, no tv, no phone (they dont want you to bother them), no iron, NO INTERNET SERVICE except in lobby and bar area! OMG this is 2012. Get full service internet! *The first room, 2P we had was small, no drawer space, with tiny bathroom and deck area looked right out into public access! We then took over our friends room when they left early, 1P, same price but their room had large bathroom, large living space, drawers, larger deck overlooking ocean. *Rooms themselves were in need of upgrading. Original workmanship was crappy. Tiles didn't match, tiles were not even or level. I could have done a better tiling job after watching youtube! *HAPPY HOUR bar-SUCKED! where do I begin. Not enough staff, not enough seating, lasted from 5-6. Too early for normal people. NO MUSIC, one TV, 80's style furnishings, inefficient staffing, bartender actually has to write down your drink order, give it to guy at computer to make receipt, make drink, give you receipt and wait for you to sign! In a word the MOST BORING HAPPY HOUR I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED. YAWN FACTOR WAS A 10. ARE YOU ALIVE PEOPLE? *POOL, in need of repair and updating or at least a coat of paint. Hot tube was being used as kiddie pool! Not enough chairs at either pool. Pool not heated. *FOOD-It was at best OK. Breakfast was same everyday! Small buffet with fruit and cereal. You could order eggs any way you want them. Nothing else. Nothing special. Felt like I was home. Lunch was passable with more options. We only did dinner once as it was so bad. I would suggest going into town for dinner. Much more exciting. * People at this resort are so boring. You need to take a pulse. Think they were asleep by 9! Basically don't expect to be living in luxury or pampered in any way. If you want a drink while on the beach, go to Walmart and stock up. It will be faster. Then you have to keep going to bar and ask for ice, but still better deal and service if you BYOB! Also, they nickle and dime you at ever turn. Nothing is free and there are no perks of a true 4 star hotel. you are better off staying at a nice boutique hotel in town for between $80-100 USD and eating your meals on 5th ave.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect concept for a beach resort”
Reviews.Author: d4vancouver
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the Mayan Riviera (after many trips to the Pacific coast of Mexico) was enhanced by the Mahekal. How often can you stay in a cabin that sits on the sand, a one minute walk from the beach? Watching the sun and moon rise from the porch, listening to the surf and relaxing in the hammocks are special pleasures. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful and the food was good. The half-board system was ideal for us. We could eat either lunch or dinner at the Mahekal, and go out on the town exploring for the other meal (and Playa has some superb restaurants!). The location -- just two blocks beyond the 5th Avenue Promenade -- was ideal. And the price was reaonable -- good value for money. This place is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PSilvain
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The room was really great as was the rest of our stay. We loved the property. Never did we miss TV or phones-they just are not necessary for a relaxing vacation. the location is perfect-a few short minute walk to great restaurants and shopping! Staff is very helpful and it really was one our our best vacations ever!! Food was great-we ate breakfast and lunch every day and choose to go to town for dinner each night- and that worked our really well for us- We cant wait to return and plan to bring my parents for a getaway soon.

Reviews.Title: “10 Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wshws
Reviews.Content: 1. Closer to the Beach. 2. Location 3. Nice & Clean comfortable room. 4. Includes breakfast and dinner. 5. 2 swimming pools. 6. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. 7. Hammocks 8. Playing games~ pools, ping-pong, cards and volleyball. 9. Walk to 5th AVE. 10. Don't need TV and telephone in the room. My husband wants to got back, someday!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Place”
Reviews.Author: Denice R
Reviews.Content: This was my 22nd year staying at Mahekal...formerly known as Shangrila. The new owners have made it better than ever. If you want the best vacation, without the distraction of televisions and telephones...this if the place. A thatched roof beach resort - it is an oasis amoungst the large hotel chains. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful - the management is on top of every detail. Breakfast and lunch overlooking the ocean. Dinner in an open air dining room in the "jungle." Simple elegance in the most friendly environment. Guests actually talk to each other and all the children play together. Everyone meets at Casa Club for happy hour. I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “gilligans island on steroids!!!!”
Reviews.Author: miculah r
Reviews.Content: me and my favorite girlfriend have been coming to mahekal since 2005....as much as i hate saying this (because i dont really want the world to know about this place) it is by far the best resort we have stayed in the carribean....we dont like mega anything----not a ritz kinda guy either---- we want days to be quite and nites to have a little action ----if we choose. no tv no radio ---no phones---- just perfect down time........but.....not only do we want a perfect setting at day.. we expect great food and wine at nite...the resort hotel has very acceptable food...now dont take that as a off handed compliment..breakfast really has all we need ....tend to eat very lite.... fruit and toast.... lunch is great because they will bring whatever you want down to your pallapa on the beach...we love the fish tacos and the ceviche...we tend to drink a nice bottle of wine with lunch .....so the staff knows to bring us a wine bucket too.... now for dinner ......they serve buffet style on some nites.... and others you order off a set menu...we found all to be fine....now for the real secrete for all you foodies out there......the restaurants that are close to the resort are wonderfull... Como which is a 5 min walk away is as good as any restaurant ive dined anywhere in the caribbean....they had fresh kumomoto oysters....flown in .....really......in playa!!!! wow.....across the street from the lobby of mahekal is a restaurant that serves the best mole sauce ive ever had....great for lunch.....we have eatin at most all of the nicer rests this side of fifth avenue....now for the real find ........the place to buy wine....up arond the corner-- down 5th about 10 mins walk... i forget the name ....but you cant miss it ....its on the left .....anyway --goncello the owner... is very knowledgable.....im a french and US kinda wine drinker....he has a little in stock but not much ..so i told him what i like and he would hook me up wth a nice spanish or south american brand....we bought a couple of cases thru our stay... most were nice.....ps he also sells reidel glasses...below my cost!!...(im a dealer too) so we bought 2 to use thru the week...i know glass snobs...sorry..... so armed with our wine and glasses we would pick out a restaurant for the nite and sit down for a nice casual meal.....oh yeah ..no corking fees at the restaurants.....wow again.....and dont worry they dont mind at all ---and are very helpful with the decanting... so you see....we expect a great place to stay.....it must be very laid back with a great beach...nice rooms.....and good service .......we really like that bars and places to dance are close by ......i didnt e ven tell you about the cuban bar up the way with great music and mohitos.......we love wine and are pretty particular about what we will drink......food is a major part of our lives... traveling is always centered around the cuisine we will eat while we vacation....we love the fact ...we leave missouri at 7am....and land in mexico before lunch....sooooo after traveling through out the caribbean..... we have decided mahekal is the best overall price value resort we have stayed in....now that being said ....please book sandles or the riu and leave this place alone....its probably not what u r looking for.... but for us ....its paradise!!!!! i am an interior designer by trade and own two retail outlets...i am amateur cook and oenophile ...i have the greatest girlfriend and we tend to enjoy life to its fullest.. ps im not a typist.... my secretary is.....shes just not here right now.. 9 w

Reviews.Title: “My Heaven...”
Reviews.Author: Jody B
Reviews.Content: My husband I just discovered this beautiful place...so peaceful and still so close to the main shopping strip. We loved the atmosphere and the outdoor airiness. Having checked out of a few other eating establishment we decided to eat at the hotel...this was the very best food we have had in a long time..also very reasonable in prices for the quality. I cannot find any fault here..unless you need glits and glam because you will not find it here...thank goodness. Love the Hammocks outside our room... we stayed 7 day and didn't want to leave...

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place. We spent five days there and didn't want to leave. The atmosphere enables you to truly escape the realities of life. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself to a Massage on the Beach (or two)”
Reviews.Author: barbara o
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed visiting Mahekal (Shangri-la) for almost 20 years. Each time we arrive there are a few changes - usually subtle and for that we are thankful. Within the first few days we book massages on the beach (Gabriel & Blanca are favorites). This experience with the sound of the ocean, the gentle waves, and the natural setting is something that over 90 minutes transports us from the hectic schedule of home and travel and the realization that Vacation time has arrived! Truly a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “If you do not want an all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: vaxeli
Reviews.Content: If you don t want an all inclusive, then this is definitely the place. For 2600 pesos per night incl breakfast and dinner the rooms in the Pueblito are area are clean, simple and far from noise but still not far from the beach. You have a direct access to the beach and 5th avenue is at the corner. We visited from there Coba, Tulum, Chichen Itza and Valladolid. Also went to Xel Ha which is a nice place to entertain and snorkel as the River part is not crowded. Do not miss Pueblo Morelos at 30km with its quiet beach ans bars and more than all a snorkelling trip to the coral barier. We paid 25usd for and accompanied trip of 2 hours with magnificent fishes.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: Ward M
Reviews.Content: 16 years and still coming back. It is such a fun, laid back, wonderfully relaxing place without a phone in your room or a tv blaring in your ear. Kids around the pool, adults talking, the sound of wind, waves, and yet it is quiet. Excellent staff, food, and you sit next to the ocean or inside comfort....it is not at all like an all inclusive, thank goodness. It is specially unique.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel and really unique - but beware the smell and noise”
Reviews.Author: Holidaysking
Reviews.Content: I booked Mahekal for our winter break after much research. We wanted a room right on the beach; we wanted to be within walking distance of shops and restaurants; and we wanted a place with some character and on a human scale, not an enormous all-inclusive. Mahekal ticked all these boxes. Food was good (lunch better than dinner in our opinion). Rooms are basic but nice enough (a/c was ineffective, but it wasn't hot enough for us to need it). We had an ocean front which was huge with a lovely terrace right on the beach. We hired a fridge from reception - $5 a day - to save buying ice. Staff were friendly and helpful and good with our children, I have no complaints about service. And the cleaner kept the room immaculate (with incredible towel art!). However - 2 things stopped this from being the perfect choice. One was the smell, which, as other reviewers have mentioned, wafts around the beach and particularly when paddling/swimming in the sea. It's not pleasant, and certainly not paradise. Whether it's sewage or mangroves, I don't know, but just beware if this is likely to bother you. The second thing was noise. We were very unfortunate in that we chose to be in Playa during the BPM dance music festival - which we had no idea was happening until we got there. It went on all day, all week at two beach bars either side of the hotel - Mamitas and Canibal Royal. The relentless thumping baseline drove us crazy and there was no where to escape. The hotel were sympathetic (the staff were going crazy too) and did offer to move us to another room but it wouldn't have helped. Reluctantly, we chose to end our stay early and move on, at our expense. So - just a word of caution. If music and noise are likely to irritate you or ruin your holiday, check to see what festivals are on, or what is going on at the beach bars, and definitely don't go during BPM.

Reviews.Title: “Generally we are not resort people, but Mahekal has set the bar high”
Reviews.Author: coast_to_coast_250
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the top floor of a unit in the garden section. Although it was more affordable than the beach front units, we liked being set back from the beach and the spaciousness of the room. It was a quick walk to the loungers and beach area anyway. We did not see any nudity on this area of beach as other reviews have mentioned. The room was spacious and airy (no need for a/c which was in the room all week, just the ceiling fan). The room was nicely decorated, had a comfortable bed and had a great walk in shower with a separate room for the toilet. The deck had two comfortable hammocks as well as two chairs and a table. Firstly, we did not have to wear bracelets as the staff at the front desk, dining rooms and beach area know who all the guests are. On a couple of days, there was an odor at the beach, but this is from the mangroves that are not close by and not from sewage. It did not stop us from sitting for hours on the beach. The section of good beach area in front of the hotel was kept raked of any seaweed. Although we are fairly fussy in our choice of good restaurants, we enjoyed the meals for breakfast as well as dinner. Any request to have half a portion or sauce on the side was always met. Although we were happy with everything at Mahekal, the highlight of our stay was the staff. We had two bottles of water set in our room each day which we supplemented with more which we purchased at a nearby convenience store. I appreciated not having a phone or TV in the room. I feel confident, that had family tried to reach us, that staff would have found us if we were any where on the property. There was one computer set up in the lounge to check emails, but most people used WiFi with their own hand held devices in the library. Because we were at Mahekal during New Year's, there were parties and bands down the beach. The noise was not the fault of the resort, and the next time we visit, we would choose to stay other than during a major holiday because we go to bed fairly early. All the staff were great, but especially Rogelio and Juan who took such great care of us in the dining room. Front desk staff, the concierge and the staff in the spa were also wonderful. Even the grounds crew took the time to say "Buenos Dias" as they passed. We did have a good hair dryer in our room. We swam a short while in one of the pools, but we came to be on the beach and since we were so comfortable, we did not spend much time at the pool. There were sufficient palapas so we were always able to be out of the direct sun. There was discreet security and we were never approached by vendors on the beach as we had anticipated. The entertainment in the dining room was pleasant. The location was easy enough to walk to the Fifth Avenue and the surrounding streets whenever we wished and this gave us good options for a light lunch or mid-afternoon coffee. This is not a big, impersonal resort. We said "we pay for what we don't have"; large crowds of guests, swim up bars, unlimited drinks and the noise that often accompanies these parties. For anyone going to Playa del Carmen and wishing a more personal holiday in a pretty setting, then I would definitely recommend Mahekal.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Quite, tranquil atmosphere, very laid back. After reading several reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to give the resort a shot. I loved the hammock in front of our room. The staff helped us get a rental after our scheduled car was not satisfactory. Be advised there are no TV’s the beach and the atmosphere is your entertainment. BE ADVISED, it’s a nude beach.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate review: Unassuming and Peaceful Mahekal”
Reviews.Author: akagresch
Reviews.Content: For starters, I have NEVER writen a review of anything. However, in researching for another vacation, unfortunately not riviera maya, I found myself wandering and checking out mahekal and the various comments and finally wanted to offer my opinions on the resort. I appreciate all of the comments offered for this and other places and have found it very helpful in planning that "next vacation", regardless of where it could be. I try to escape the daily grind of life and work in cold wisconsin, so when we had the opportunity to travel again and re-visit playa , choosing Mahekal again was the easiest decision. I guess then that we are Mahekal veterans! Based on most reviews, Mahekal is doing just fine! In my opinion, your vacation and/or resort choice depends on what you are really looking for. Seems simple. If you are looking for the massive all-inclusive resort that spans acres upon acres, mahekal is NOT for you. If you want the obnoxiously loud massive hook-up/dance bar with multiple plasma's tuned to ESPN, Mahekal is NOT for you. You will not find any PGA style championship course, the wimbletonian style tennis facilities, nor the plethera of restaurants offering every cuisine imaginable or the private infinity pool draining into the carribean! What you WILL find is ultimately a memorable vacation consisting of an unassuming, peaceful, and relaxing oasis away from home. In a nutshell Mahekal is simply near perfect. For starters, the staff is truely amazing. From the front desk and the entire supporting staff to the poor bellhops carrying all of our heavy dive gear 3 flights to the top penthouse (#18, highly recommended) you are greeted with familiar smiles and greeted by name (after nearly a year in between vacations!). After wandering the immaculate grounds you are greeted with hugs, not uncomfortable nods of acknowledgement because you are one of thousands staying at their resort. You are now their guest. From Rogelio and the entire staff, they rememebered us by name and familiarity as we reacquainted ourselves with our most recent trip experiences, our families, and jobs and swap stories of their lives as well. The grounds are clean, immaculate, and groomed daily. The rooms (penthouse #18, ocean view #17) were perfect, clean, and simply mexican. Again ... no plasma ... no radio ... no disturbance. Just the crashing waves of the carribean, the occasional geecko on your balcony, and tropical birds singing greeting you in the morning. The food, very good. I recommend, as others, the breakfast and dinner. I NEVER had a meal that was disappointing. Recommend the theme buffet dinner, which has good variety. Also order the lobster off menu if you want for a bit extra or the octopus on the casual lunch menu, which is fantastic. Because you typically get only two meals, you have a great opportunity to hit 5th ave only a short walk away. HIGHLY recommend "la cueva del chango" straight down the street from Mahekal, walking distance is only 30 yards, the best restaurant in playa i have been to. Quiet, simple, relaxing, great staff, awesome food no matter what you order. The dive shop, also very accomadating. Greeted once again with a familiar smile from Roman that remembered us from our last trip. This despite going to cozumel for diving for the entire day numerous times ... sorry Roman ... but its true ... cant compete with the drift dives off cozumel and diving palancar! So its simple, the way it should be. Plenty of activity around if you want or even need it. Close, but not too close to 5th ave, tons of shops, bars, restaurants, the ferry to cozumel, all mostly walking distance away, always felt safe. Will be back some day, hopefully sooner than later. Will most definitely (and already have)recommend to our friends and family to stay at Mahekal, without feeling they might be disappointed in OUR choice. This is all coming from someone who never writes/reviews anything ... ever.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time in 6 years we hung out at this resort. Love the feel of the place. It feels like an oasis when compared to the other resorts that are going real modern and fancy. Mahekal keeps things simple, and the people that work there are great. They treat us like family!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but somewhat lacking”
Reviews.Author: moniquitachula
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly nice hotel, with included breakfast and dinner which makes life a lot easier. However, for the amount of money I paid (around $200 a night) I did find it lacking. There is no TV or phone in the room, which I don't mind except that it can be somewhat of a hassle to get concierge services or anything sent to your room because you have to go get it yourself. There is no hair dryer or any other essential, and my shower could not keep a steady temperature-either boiling or cold. Location is good, you have to walk about 5 blocks to where the action of 5ta Avenida starts, but it is 38 streets away from the Ferry and 36 streets away from collective Taxis. Overall, if this is a family vacation where you want to stay in your hotel and relax, this is a prefect place to do so. If you want to be out and about, visiting Parks (Xplor, Xcaret, etc) or the ruins, you can get a much better deal for your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Thao M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahekal for 6 nights in December with family and friends and had a wonderfully relaxing time. Check-in was a bit slow, but friendly. The resort was undergoing a bit of a renovation so our kids' got upgraded for free to some ocean-view rooms. Our rooms were all simple, quaint, and clean. The beds were super comfortable. There were screens on all the windows as well as AC and ceiling fans (so no bug bites!). The resort is right on the beach, which, for some reason has a sulphurous smell. You get used to it quickly, but still.... The beach itself is quite lovely here. Part of it is a bit too rocky to swim in, but the other part is perfect. It's raked every morning. It's also guarded. Service is pretty good. Laid back, not fussy. Starting around noon, there's usually someone taking drink and food orders on the beach and by the pools. The resort is not fenced off or anything, but it seems safe enough. We used the in-room safes as advised and had no problems. There is complimentary coffee every morning at the bar. The restaurants and food service seem OK, not great (we took the no-food option). Cocktails were rather weak. Not a problem, though, because lots of good restaurants and bars are very close by. In fact, that's probably what we liked best about this place -- the location. Right on the beach, but also walking distance to the "strip" of Playa del Carmen. Our teenage kids loved walking into town and checking out the shops and getting snacks. The location also meant that we didn't need a car yet could get to all sorts of great restaurants. In fact, one of the best is L'Origines, which is across the street from the resort's reception hall. It's not part of the resort, but seems almost attached to it. We'd definitely love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Super Familiy reunion in the best "personal" hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelissaCordoba
Reviews.Content: I am a frecuent traveler to the Riviera Maya, and this hotel really surprised me in a positive way. Everything was great, service, food, location, lay-ot, rooms, etc. I really enjoy the fact that there is no childs club, so that way you have a real vacation time with your family !!! I will return I really loved it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: TennWriter
Reviews.Content: The Mahekal Resort was home for a week and it was a delightful place to stay. The rooms were lovely and simple, but incredibly clean and well-maintained. The food, especially breakfast, was delicious and fresh and could be had beachside each morning. The bartenders were friendly, the concierge helpful, the front desk accommodating, and all the staff kind. The spa's speciality is massage (not nails) and everyone in our group raved about these as the best massages ever! I loved having wi-fi in the lobby but not in the room, which made the entire week peace-filled and quiet. The beach is superb with all the shade and sun you could ask for. I look forward to going back someday.

Reviews.Title: “great get-away”
Reviews.Author: 12345Ohio
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, setting, food, and service. Cannot wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Robert_J433
Reviews.Content: I would like to start out by commending Oswaldo (front desk mgr) on his professionalism, friendly, caring attitude and great customer skills. He is a credit to the resort. Thank you Oswaldo! This hotel hits all the right notes for us. The architecture fits the location, the rooms are well appointed and very functional, the grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the location on a great stretch of beach, close to town and to many good restaurants and bars is perfect. We did not participate in the meal plan so can't comment on the food but the two restaurants and pool/beach-side dining areas are very nice. I would agree with some of the other posts that the bar could use some attention . . . a more upbeat attitude from the bartenders and cashier, better appetizers and better drinks, and maybe some new pool cues. The music selection was good. Mini-fridges in the rooms and/or an ice machine/s around the property would be nice. Not much fun lugging a bag of ice from the little tienda two blocks up (15 pesos) or from the Mega (9 pesos). They do sell it at the bar (when they have a few bags) for 60 pesos! All in all, a beautiful little resort hotel with a great location! -Roberto & Constanca

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: shreid
Reviews.Content: I arrived with a group of friends for the week after Thanksgiving. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The service was friendly and easygoing. The housekeepers entertained us with towel sculptures everyday. I enjoyed the food, especially breakfast - I'd suggest breakfast and lunch instead of dinner. The overall atmosphere was relaxed and comfortable. I had two of the best massages I've ever had and look forward to returning. A very special thank you to Bolli, the concierge who helped our group with snorkeling, day trips and dinner reservations. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Simple luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bahamamon
Reviews.Content: Here is where get away from it all,while still being in the midst of it. Mahekal has a location that is hard to beat. On site you feel like you're in a jungle oasis,but just a few steps away all of the diversions of Playa are waiting. The included meals are simple but delicious. The bed is soft,and the staff friendly. I admit I do miss TV, and prefer margaritas elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view with sea breeze”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaHondurena
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the resort, but stopped for lunch, kids had hot dogs, hamburgers, I had the mole enchiladas. Service was fast, view was great. Menu was simple, good for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing beach resort”
Reviews.Author: Debra69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mahekal Beach Resort for a week in December and loved every minute of it. We moved to the Mahekal after one night at another resort and were not disappointed. There was just one room left, but it was great. We were at the back but had nice views of the sea from our balcony. The hammocks are a great touch! We were lulled to sleep each night by the sounds of the waves lapping (or crashing on) the beach and awoken by birds singing and squawking every morning. This place has a real 'outdoors feel', which we thoroughly enjoyed. Breakfast was great. Lots of choice, well-prepared egg dishes, abundant fresh fruit. Too bad about the coffee though. We didn't eat lunch or dinner so I can't comment on the restaurant. The bar has very limited snacks (American-style tortilla chips and 'cheese' dip and microwave popcorn) and isn't cheap, but there's a 2-for-1 happy hour starting at 5 p.m. The rooms are simple, but clean and the beds are comfortable (if you like firm). The rain shower is nice, though the fixtures are starting to corrode. There's plenty of closet space and a sizeable safe, big enough for a laptop. There are screens and hardwood shutters on some of the windows so you can have fresh air in the room without worrying about mosquitos (of which we saw very few). We never turned on the air conditioner. The huts are surrounded by lovely plants and trees which are well looked after by the gardening staff. There's sand everywhere so you feel like you're always on the beach. There were always beach chairs available whenever we wanted them, but that may be due to the less-than-ideal weather. While we were there, several meters of beach were washed away by strong waves and wind. The staff provided good, friendly service. When the rental car company didn't show up at the agreed time and we were unable to reach our travel rep who had made the deal for us, the concierge quickly arranged a car for the same price (which was less than the rental company's published rates). We had a lovely, relaxing stay and would definitely return to the Mahekal and recommend it to friends. On the recommendation of the receptionist we ate at La Cueva del Chango, down the road. We enjoyed it so much that we returned for lunch/dinner several times. Excellent food, creative menu and good service. There are 3 menus in one (breakfast, lunch and dinner) and you can order from any of them all day long. Prices are very reasonable and the food was the best we had in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Money pit”
Reviews.Author: 2cute4men
Reviews.Content: This Is by no means a resort . If you are going on vacation to be pampered this is not the place . Service sucks and they nickel and dime you to death. The food sucks . If you don't want to be broke by the time your trip Is over go to the Walmart in town to by your alcohol and snacks. Also buy ice because the hotel charges way touch for that as well. Playa del Carmen is nice but this resort sucks .

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in a hammock!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma B
Reviews.Content: This resort ticks all the boxes. My husband and I stayed in many places during our honeymoon and the Mahekal Beach Resort really stood out. It is in a perfect location on the beach with gorgeous huts where you can relax on hammocks. The food was also delicious!

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Magical Place”
Reviews.Author: RFJM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we had in mind. After debating whether or not to stay at an all-inclusive resort for some time, I decided to go with something more quaint and was very glad I did. We stayed in an ocean front bungalow directly on the beach and fell asleep to the sound of the waves every night. Location: The resort is located at the beginning of Fifth Avenue, but far enough away from all the noise. It was an easy walk to the 20 block stretch of hustle and bustle. It was extremely quiet and relaxing every night, which helped with our 2 year old who went to bed early. I thought the location was really perfect. Food: I loved that the resort offered half board (breakfast plus one other meal) because we never got bored of the food and were able to take advantage of the wonderful restaurants in Playa del Carmen each day. For lunch, we were able to choose one main meal off the menu (didn't include appetizers or drinks) and for dinner we were served a buffet appetizer and a choice of one of 4 main meals (and dessert). Breakfast was plentiful! There was a buffet to choose from and you were also able to order food off the menu (pancakes, omelets, eggs any style, etc.) Sweet bread, fruit, fresh juice, cereal, yogurt, chilaquiles, sausage, hash browns were all part of the buffet. We never left hungry. Dinner offered a choice of beef, chicken, fish, or pasta and was always delicious. Room: We opted to splurge on the ocean front room and were glad we did. Our room had 2 double beds on a split level and a beautiful bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the ceiling fan kept us cool each night (we never used the a/c). I loved the organic soaps they provided and the way they created animals out of our bath towels each day. Nice touch! My son really got a kick out of it. If I could change anything about the room, I would add a small dresser with drawers instead of only the 3 shelves and 12 hangers in the closet. Things got a little unorganized over time. I would have also loved a small refrigerator in the room, but someone told me after the fact that they are available upon request. Our bungalow was slightly set back from some of the others I saw, so if and when we return I would request #31 because it was closer to the ocean and nothing was in front of it. The Garden View rooms were about a 1 minute walk to the beach and looked very cute. Staff: The staff was wonderful! They were all friendly and accommodating. We were constantly greeted by everyone and they made us feel very comfortable. Overall, we had a wonderful stay. I would definitely stay there again if we return. The beach was beautiful and clean, the food delicious, and it was a peaceful, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IslanderOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the upper level of the garden view pueblito section and found this to be ideal - nice and peaceful setting overlooking the water feature, with hammocks on our balcony. Rooms were fine and the maid always made quirky designs with the towels each day. There were loads of staff around and the place was very efficient. Mexican buffet on our first night was superb - maybe that's because we'd just come from bland Cuban food or the two large happy hour cocktails but it was excellent. Other meals were good and breakfast was also very nice. I'd highly recommend eating out at least 1 night and would suggest you look no further than Xulam - it's #1 rated for a reason - superb!! The one big negative point during our stay was that my wife left her camera in the bar one night and we've yet to hear if it's been found - totally gutted as it was our honeymoon and had loads of photos from USA/Cuba/Mexico :-( Some improvements the resort could make; (1) light on stairs to rooms on upper level (b) put fridges in rooms (c) add another computer or two in the bar area (d) put in place some system re sun loungers - lots of guests put towels on the loungers then don't turn up for hours - very rude Resort is only a 5 min stroll to 5th Avenue and the shops/bars. Other tips; (a) Tours - we only did Chichen Itza. It's a must see but is a very long day in a bus. Tour cost US$50 (b) Airport to resort - think a taxi cost 500 Peso and the ADO bus was 116 Peso + 50 taxi from PDC bus station to resort

Reviews.Title: “Best Time Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Cara C
Reviews.Content: You must stay at Mahekal when in Playa Del Carmen. I stayed 11/11/11-11/15/11 and loved every minute. Hammocks hanging from every room for each guest, beach huts, swings at the bar with ping pong and pool to play plus being right on the beach makes this the best place to stay. And breakfast and dinner are included! You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Paradise”
Reviews.Author: packyourbagsagain
Reviews.Content: I have hesitated at writing this review because I believe this resort to be one of those gems that you don't want everyone to know about in fear it may become overpriced and lose its charm. But I have pushed my selfishness aside to share this very special place which completely lives up to its name: Magical. I have been to this resort twice and cannot wait to return. It is simple, understated, quiet, and quaint. There are no phones or tvs in the rooms. There are no long lines at meals or seven restaurants to chose from. There are no huge swimming pools or loudspeakers with games and events. There are no florescent bracelets. There are no crowds. There are, however, individual thatched roof rooms along winding sand paths - each with a little veranda compelte with swinging hammocks. There is a fabulous bar with swing seats (and pool and ping-pong tables) hosted by a darling tender Vicente who mixes great, reasonably priced drinks - always with a smile and sometimes with a joke. There are two beautiful palapa restaurants - one for breakfast/lunch which looks out over the gorgeous beach, and one for dinner that is tucked away in the back of the property that is one of the most beautifully romantic places I have ever been. And there is THE best stretch of beach in all of Playa right in front of the resort. All of this would in itself make this a lovely place. But what pushes Mahekal ahead of the rest are its people. The staff are AMAZING - gracious, hardworking, kind and warm hearted, and who truly make you feel like family. This is my favorite home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but ?????”
Reviews.Author: hbriverrat1
Reviews.Content: The great - beautiful grounds right down to the outdoor palapa check in and waves just outside out beachfront room to give us the best sleep of our lives But the quirks start from there. First we were reserved and were given a beachfront casita. The room itself was great as was the private porch and hammocks. But we had the one casita that had hazard tape and palapas on their side directly in front of our room. So our beachfront casita ended up really being a view of yellow caution tape surrounding the entire area in front of our room. If we stood up on our tippy toes you could kind of see the water? We politely complained and they acted like it was no big deal and there was nothing they could do or move us to. Mind you we paid a hefty premium for this "view". We only spent half of our vaca at this property (4 nights). on the very last day at check out time work crews started taking down the tape and uprighting the palapas. The manager walked over to us as we were on our balcony and said they were taking them down to not obstruct our beautiful view. We explained we were checking out and he LAUGHED. He said it was where they put everything when they were preparing for hurricane Rita. Ok, I get it but that was weeks ago and it was only the stuff in front of our room that was left and what the attitude and lack of any kind of reimbursement bugged. The food for lunch was fantastic and the pool outside of it was amazing with a great view of the ocean. The beach below this area is the place to go for the best seating as well. The main part of the beach is a local favorite so good luck getting a chair and the sea was rough in this area. No snorkeling here unless you are looking for a work out and nothing really to see anyways. The main bar for lack of a better term for it was terrible. The yawn factor is beyond and the staff is terrible. They act like an all inclusive which it's not where they don't care. There is always one guy that is at the end of the bar collecting and looking over receipts and the main bartender clearly can not stand his job. No music, sad little ping pong tables, a out of balance pool table...that's it. I get relaxing vibe but this place is awful. Do yourself a favor and walk over to the place directly across from the lobby. It too has the relaxing vibe but in a great way, amazing service, out of this world food, and overall a great experience. So much better than giving that ridiculous bar at the resort business with their microwave cheese sauce nachos and microwave bag popcorn Don't get me wrong. This place is nice but the service is just ok, the beach is packed and rough, the bar is terrible so the highlight ends up being the lunch place and the pool outside it so it seems like there would be better choices in the area and we will not be returning. The best part about this place is the restaurant that isnt even a part of them across from the lobby and the one stand out guy, Rojelio like Roger he kept saying. He ran circles around everyone else at this resort and saved our stay. And we really enjoyed the person that was cleaning our room. He was so funny and nice. Everyone else could care less. This should give you some idea of the general attitude at this place. The bartender said his favorite saying is GrinGO with a lot of emphasize on the GO part.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beeps11
Reviews.Content: Nice beach, friendly staff, good food. Multiple pools, but they are not heated so it can be a bit chilly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLSF
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 6 days at Mahekal. It was the perfect place for our relaxing getaway. The beach is pristine, the water turquoise and warm and there is always a palapa to get some shade. Our ocean view room on the second floor was lovely with a balcony and two hammocks. Breakfast and dinner was consistently good. Service was friendly and attentive. The restaurant staff (Juan, Alberto and Jorge) were exceptional. And the daily towel art in our room was very entertaining. This is a classy, comfortable, beautiful and non-pretentious paradise on the best stretch of beach in Playa del Carmen. And it is a quick walk to all the hustle and bustle of 5 avenida. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Imperfect, but charming”
Reviews.Author: drpipt
Reviews.Content: Mahekal has some flaws, but the location, friendliness of the staff, and interesting layout redeem the property. The pros: Our room was spotless and housekeeping was terrific. Our ocean view room was very spacious, though basic. The hammocks on the porch were great, and I was happy to be on the top floor of our unit. The food was really pretty good -- not 5-star good, but I was never upset with any meal. Lunch was the least impressive choice. Breakfast and dinner were much better. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The property is fairly peaceful, and the layout is interesting. The waitstaff in particular are terrific. The cons: The level of service is a bit lacking in some areas. We stayed here for five nights. We asked for a second key to our room on the first day and were told to come back the flowing day. We did but no key. I finally gave up after the third day. The front desk is often understaffed, though they are very helpful. The furniture in the bar is very uncomfortable. The bar stools are too high for the bar, the regular seating is quite uncomfortable as well. Not conducive to just hanging out. During our stay, extensive maintenance was being done on the two bungalows next door. This was reassuring in a way--they obviously maintain the property, but it was not relaxing to listen to a chainsaw running intermittently for three to four hours. Also, there was a sulfurous smell coming off of the ocean, the source of we never did identify. It was pretty nasty -- esp after a night out at the clubs. This was not in the resort's control, but it was unpleasant. All in all, I would recommend this place to friends headed to Playa, but it would be nice if the service gaps were addressed and the ocean didn't smell like rotten eggs half the time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for quiet beach stay”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyhb
Reviews.Content: stayed in a small building of our own, basic and clean. right on the beach. it's at the far end of the touristy strip, so a bit quiter. ate in the restaurant one night, limited menu but excellent food and lovely setting on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Melita B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their Ocean View room for 5 nights. The rooms are basic and spacious. The housekeeping staff were beautiful. They always smiled and entertained our attempts at broken Spanish. We told her it was our honeymoon and each day she arranged our towels on our bed differently with flowers, it was very sweet. It is great value for money with two meals a day included. You are walking distances to 5th Avenue (the main shopping and eating area) but yet you are right on the beach to avoid all the hustle and bustle if you choose. We had a hurricane approaching during our stay and I can not speak highly enough of the staff and their attentiveness to our needs and keeping us up to date. It's perfect to avoid the big resorts, I loved being able to leave a window open and sleep with the fan on and not having to run the air conditioning all night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location And Stay”
Reviews.Author: jitzutravels
Reviews.Content: We're not big on the all inclusive hotel concept, but we did like Mahekal. We had a balcony room one row in from the ocean and it was just perfect. The hotel isn't massive but it is bigger than those small cabana places you'll find farther south on the coast, like in Tulum. The room had two hammocks where we spent many afternoon hours when the sun got hot. And the ocean and its sweet sound was always right there. The room was perfectly comfortable and we encountered no mosquitoes and few other bugs at all. Food: I was dreading the food because of what we read. Our experience was that all meals were acceptable. Breakfast was the best, with wonderful sliced fruits all ripe, juices, and great Mexican egg dishes. Dinner was always satisfying, even if the dishes were simply prepared. We ate lunch at the hotel twice and felt it was the least satisfying choice...the dishes were hit or miss. We preferred to lunch at La Cueva Del Chango right down the street, which was extraordinary. Service: Our waiter Jose works like every shift and he went out of his way to say hi during our 5 days there. We'd see him at 730am working breakfast and at 7pm at dinner. We always gave him and the rest of the staff tips...they all work really hard and were always friendly. The only knock is that during our 5 day stay the ocean smelled like sulfur about half the time. It may be coming from Cozumel, but it wasn't pleasant. Mostly it wasn't an issue for us but if this is the kind of thing that is a dealbreaker for you you should call them and ask about it. It might be a temporary or seasonal thing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: cozzgc
Reviews.Content: Wife and I decided to head to Playa del Carmen to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. After reading reviews (didn't want all inclusive, but did want to be near town), booked at Mahekal. Turns out it was exactly what we wanted - smaller, quiet resort, with good beach, and walking distance to downtown Playa. Access to downtown/5th ave was an easy and safe walk; convenience store close by for water, beer, cooler, etc. We stayed in one of the Caribe rooms - was perfectly fine, nothing fancy - 2 queen beds, and the hammocks are a very nice touch. We knew there would be no phone or TV, but not having those really did add to the relaxation factor more than we had anticipated. Breakfasts were very good....lunch and dinner too, especially when they had a buffet - good selection, and still fresh. In the general the staff were all extremely friendly and always willing to help. The front desk was a little understaffed at times, but again, they were extremely helpful whenever we needed anything. The grounds were absolutely beautiful - very "natural" looking, but always well manicured. Beach was terrific, soft white sand - as we took walks down the beach, noticed that all the other hotels were either extremely loud (club music) and/or all the beach chairs were crowded all next to each other.
