At Mahekal, you get some personal space, a quieter part of the beach (with some locals there - it is near a popular beach access spot - but that was never an issue), and never had a problem getting a couple of chairs under a palapas. Have to agree with others - probably one of best beachfront locations if you want to stay away from the mobs, but be in striking distance of the action....If/when we get back to Playa, will be back at Mahekal!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Saint Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Johanna R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at Mahekal Beach Resort. We had a beautiful room overlooking the pool and ocean but we agreed there wasn't a bad spot to stay at this resort. We had walked all up and down the beach in playa and decided this was the cleanest and most beautiful beach front there. The staff was amazing! They were very accomodating and genuine. If you are looking to get married in Mexico, the Wedding Coordinator, Ayahamint is awesome. She is forever our friend. The location is great becaues it is right off 5th Avenue but at the end of it so you don't get a lot of the traffic. It does feel very private but close enough to all the action. We actually tried an all inclusive for the last few days of our trip but decided to go back to Mahekal to spend our last day. We will not stay anywhere else when we go to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Angel C
Reviews.Content: Very nice beach front property. Rooms are nice but simple. The staff is exeptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a large nice buffet with plenty of choices, lunch and dinner are served. All three meals were really good. You have the option to choose dinner or lunch. Will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: alexandria22
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Very low-key with amazing staff. The clients are at least half Europeans, many returning after many previous visits. It is definitely a bit more rustic than some people will be looking for (no TVs, for example), but perfect if you are looking for a break. Perhaps most importantly, our porch had two hammocks, so we did not have to take turns : )

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is truly Magical”
Reviews.Author: Sassygirl18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mahekal for 8 nights in October 2011 and LOVED this resort. We are already dreaming of our next visit. There are so many things we loved - where do we start? Best beach location in Playa...on the quieter northern end - no blaring music or mobs of people. We were always able to get a couple lounge chairs under a palapa umbrella in the shade. The surf was gentle - some days the surface of the ocean was almost as smooth as glass. Breakfasts were great - all you can eat from the buffet plus you can order a hot entree off the menu (omelets, pancakes, French toast and several hot Mexican entrees). The breakfast buffet included breads, pastries, cereal, oatmeal, sausage, home fries, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola and 2 different types of fresh squeezed juice each day (my favorite was the watermelon juice!). A special shout out to waiter Rogelio, who was beyond sweet and made us feel like instant friends. We opted for lunch instead of dinner for most meals and walked into town for dinner each night. At lunch, we thought the shrimp and fish tacos were great, as was the fish sandwich and Mexican platter. The one dinner we had at Mahekal was mediocre. A note regarding beverages: coffee and juices are included with breakfast, and each room gets a 1 liter bottle of spring water/day. Otherwise, you must pay for all beverages, including bottled water. Great restaurants we visited for dinner in Playa: El Fogon, Carboncito's, Baremar, Como Como and Piola - absolutely AWESOME food at all of these restaurants. We were very happy with our upper level Gardenview Pueblito room. This section is more quiet and private than other sections, and the rooms appear to be larger than the more expensive ocean front rooms (we peeked in a couple vacant ones). The bed was comfortable by Mexican standards, and the linens and pillows were soft and comfy. The AC and ceiling fan cooled the room off very efficiently and we appreciated the safe to store our valuables. The only down side to the room was the shower. The water pressure was practically non-existent (picture trying to get a shower standing in a light rain shower outdoors), and the temperature took a long time and a several minutes of fiddling, to get right. The staff at Mahekal are all helpful and friendly and the cleaning ladies do an awesome job and always leave adorable towel art every day. 2-for-1 happy hour from 5-6 p.m. was a real treat every day (and a nice bargain!). The swimming pools were beautiful, albeit chilly, so we mostly stuck to the beach for swimming. Helpful tips: ask the reception staff for a small refrigerator ($5 extra/day) and go to the Mega supermarket to stock up on beverages and snacks. When in town, pay in pesos to get the best price. There is an ATM in the Mega supermarket - put in your ATM and get pesos. You can also purchase liquor at the Mega and at Walmart in town. The front desk can book a transfer/taxi for you back to the airport when you are ready to leave for $55 USD. One more tip: although a 10% tip is included for the wait staff, do tip more. These staff work really hard and are not paid much.

Reviews.Title: “Cool property, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: gyorigabor
Reviews.Content: We were in one of the oceanfront properites and it was really nice, two big beds, AC (too smalll to cool down the whole air) and a fan (more useful than the AC). The only thing that they are not really prepared for is pouring rain for a longer period of time. Also the breakfast is good, but the selection gets boring after some days.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Isia B
Reviews.Content: Mahekal was great.. do not expect luxury.. Just a little haciendas on or close to beach.. Lobby staff was very nice and helpful .. diner staff was just OK..except Marcus who was our waiter at romantic dinner on the beach...great guy with a greatest life story..any way ,do check your recites that you have to sign ..the tips are always included!! Every restaurant you go.. We change dinner for lunch because was terrible! Breakfast was OK..continental... room was OK... air-conditioner very loud above your head..try to get a night snooze... make sure you get a second floor room just in case of rain...first floor people got flooded!! Tulum was great!! For $ 40 you can get 2 hrs. really that's all you need... next door restaurant is A must!!! As for the 5 th. ave, as always is over priced and shop owner will knock you down for a buck!! .. however you can buy there any liquor because alcohol is very expensive in the hotel and restaurants... we will be back at Playa del Carmen but will try different resort...

Reviews.Title: “Mostly happy”
Reviews.Author: davidandnell
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the mahekal and overall enjoyed our experience. We had a deluxe room right on the beach with a private plunge pool that we loved. Staff, especially Jose, were for the most part friendly and helpful. There were a few things however that could have been a little better. Firstly, as I mentioned we had a great bungalow right on the beach. This was great during the day but I have to say we felt a little vulnerable at night. The hotel does employ security and there are police that patrol the beach, but because of the lack of phone in the room (and we had no cells) we felt a little concerned at not being able to alert anyone should the need arise. Maybe an assistance call button or something similar could be installed in rooms to put guests at ease. Secondly, as we do not usually stay at all inclusive resorts we were a little confused at how the account worked each night at dinner. I still don't really get why we had to sign a check each night even though our dinner was included. Maybe this was for tips? I think this matter, as well as which drinks were included, could have been clarified at check in. I know there were other guests who were also a bit confused about what was and wasn't inclhardly Thirdly, we were very disappointed on one afternoon when we went to go snorkeling to find the water sports center had closed for the day two hours early! We queried this with both reception and the concierge but neither was very helpful and we never got to snorkel. Despite these complaints we would definitely return to the mahekal. A couple of tips- don't get a massage At the hotel. There are beach massages just north of the mahekal for a fraction of the price  Also don't pay to have your laundry done by the hotel, this is really expensive and there is heaps of places around playa that will do it really cheap. We went to a laundry right up the street and paid about $4 USD for 4 kilograms of laundry. A really great place for lunch was baremar right up the street on the corner of fifth avenue. Super cheap and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is a treasure- experience it at least once!”
Reviews.Author: stuball_vt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights in June with my wife and 2 sons (11 & 14). I had researched quite a few hotels, both large AI resorts and smaller boutique hotels and thought the combination of low-key atmosphere, beachfront location and walking distance to town would suit our vacation plans perfectly. It was spot on! The beach was gorgeous (I never saw much past 1/2 mile north but the beach south didn't even compare). Our beach was wide and clean and uncrowded. The staff was ultra accommodating and pleasant, we especially bonded with Rojalio who really went out of his way to say hello to the boys and was never without a smile. The rooms were exactly as described, clean and simple with plenty of room. We NEVER missed the tv or phone. We caught some football (soccer) in the lounge area one night but in our rooms we read or slept, usually tired from a full day of sun and travel. The hammocks on the porch were a highlight and we loved our unit (10b). It was a stand alone building two rows off the beach. We had a water view and gentle breezes. The food was good; we really enjoyed breakfast and on the days that we weren't exploring we preferred having lunch as our 2nd included meal so that we could eat in town for a multitude of dinner choices. Plus town was more fun at night and not too hot. I could go on and on but we all really had such a great stay. The boys loved the pool by the Aventuras dining area and my wife and I usually relaxed on the beach in and out of the palapa shade and we all enjoyed the perfect temperature ocean. We would go back in a heartbeat. We spent 3 additional days at a lovely hotel (Intercontinental Presidente) in Cancun but our hearts belong to Playa and the Mahekal Beach Resort.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Mahekal and I absolutely loved it! Peaceful, quiet, and in a great location. Tons of chairs available on the beach, and someone to come get your drink order while you were there! The included breakfast was wonderful, and the restaurant staff, especially Alberto, were fantastic. So friendly and welcoming, despite my very limited Spanish. Mahekal isn't exactly "luxury" resort, but I do not consider that to be a negative. It was comfortable, clean, and relaxing. All of the staff were more than willing to accommodate any request. Happy hour was from 5-6 (wish it was maybe an hour longer), and I tried to go to 5th Avenue for dinners out. Again, I can't wait to go back to Playa, and Mahekal will be my choice of hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: gypsy26
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the Mahekal and we loved it. IF you are going to stay in playa del carmen you should definitely stay here. The resort is on the beach and very cute filled with coconut trees and other greenery. There is definitely room for improvement when it comes to the actual rooms as they are all out-dated and old. This used to be a Shangri-la Caribe resort however it has been taken over by a private investor (out of the US i believe) who has not made too many changes. You can definitely tell that the rooms have not been renovated since. If you want luxury well this isnt it. but if you want a comfortable stay with a perfect location then you should stay here. The mahekal offers little huts sprinkled on the beach. no television, no telephones. just you, the jungle and the beach. the staff is amazing- they are all sooooo nice and go over the top to make you are more comfortable. i was so sad to learn that they make only 80 pesos for 12 hours of work a day... thats why we were very generous with tipping. most of the workers come from small mayan towns in the yucatan peninsula and work day and night only to take the little they earn back to their families. As a north american we often forget this. The food was great. You get an option of breakfast and lunch or dinner. We opted for lunch everyday. There are too pools which are very small but perfect given the location on the beach we rarely used the pool,. there is also happy hour every day from 5-6 with 2 for 1 drinks. They have a diving center where you can sign up for daily activities (extra charges ofcourse). We rented snorkelling gear and had an amazing time. if you opt for the palapas roof rooms- becareful as most of them do leak if and when it rains... we experienced that our first night. plust we had a little visitor who was walking over the top of the palapas in the middle of the night which freaked me out but we later learned it was the racoon type animal whose name i forget at the moment. very cute! It was also walking distance to 5th ave and some amazing, less touristy restaurants just steps away from our hotel. i can go on and on about this and will write an overall review on my travel/food blog www.hungrynomadeats.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: wannabeplaces
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Mahekal for a few nights at one of their ocean view rooms. The location and the views were awesome. It's only a few minutes walk to the "happening" (and generally overpriced) 5th av restaurants and shops. Our room was quite comfortable even though the bathroom could use an update. I'd have liked to see a mini fridge or ice box or something to keep our water/drinks cool in the room. But, the views from the room and the fact that it's literally on the beach (well, maybe 8 steps away) can't be beat. The staff was quite attentive. The food was pretty good (breakfast and lunch/dinner was included). Do check with the servers before ordering any drink (including water) at dinner as we assumed that it was included. It wasn't a big deal and we should've checked but, we'd liked to have known that in advance. Overall, would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadn77
Reviews.Content: We had a warm welcome by the staff, the hotel is BEAUTIFUL!!!!!. Since our arrival Boli (concierge) had everything prepared at our Ocean view villa, my husband planned a surprise for me and Boli was very helpful, he is indeed a great value for the resort, always smiling and willing to assist you with everything you may need. Our room was very cute, it had a palapa, a couple of hammocks and the view to the ocean was just stunning and what we needed, Jose Luis the bellman was really nice to us and attentive all the time. The food is delicious, real mexican flavors and the service is great, Manuel is so friendly as well as his cousin (sorry i forgot his name). The location of the resort is SUPER, so close to 5th Ave. and to the dock so you can go to Cozumel. There are few details about customer service from Front Desk that they need to work on, some maintenance in the areas, the shop or store is not well equiped, but everything can be fixed. Special thanks to housekeeping for having our room always clean and ready. Overall we would love to go back and we hope we will, thank you for making our stay a memorable one!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Playa, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: UofATess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 days in mid-August, upgrading to a beachfront room just a few days before we arrived (thanks to an unexpected raise at work!). I'll start by saying, if you go to Playa del Carmen and want to be walking distance to 5th Avenue, this the best place to stay. And the only place I would go back to. I was not impressed at all by the other hotels in the area, even ones that ranked higher than this one on TA rankings. The lobby is so charming upon arrival, with a great "reading room" where you can borrow books, leave books and flip through coffee table books. The resort is split into two sections with a public access walkway down the middle. This means there are ALOT of locals on the beach at all times, however, we did go when it was VERY hot weather so I imagine the locals were just trying to cool off. Our beachfront palapa was beautiful from the outside, literally a 10 second walk to the shoreline. Great patio with hammocks. Really something not most get to enjoy ever in life=) The inside was in need of major updates, the A/C was probably stuck at about 78 degrees so my husband was constantly hot and trying to cool down, and some of the curtains had big stains on them. The bathroom has literally almost no lighting when the sun went down. We were in 34 P. We were very happy with the food. Each morning with the half-board package we had, there was a huge buffet breakfast and then a menu you can order of off that features great Mexican breakfasts, omelettes and even pancakes. Lunch was also really great, we did this over dinner most days. There's a two-sided menu you can pick from with great Mexican dishes from tacos to ceviche to chicken sandwiches and burgers (the burger was actually pretty amazing!) Dinner was also great the two nights we did it. The daily happy hour was a steal, with most drinks just $5 and offered at 2-for-1. The staff was not memorable really at all. I will say that we had originally booked a room in the Garden View Pueblita area and we would have not been happy there. There are a lot of rooms, stacked into one area and all the balconies open right up to your neighbors. It was really kind of weird and like a huge communal tree house. The beaches were pretty beautiful and you could walk a decent distance both ways. There was some major seaweed at times, but that could just be due to currents. I will say this about Playa, it's very touristy and not quite as charming and quaint as I had imagined. Most of the restaurants along 5th Ave. were really expensive, which was kind of surprising considering the hotels in town are not that nice. There was though ALOT of great Italian. We asked our waiter at Origenes, which is a great restaurant across the street from the resort, for his favorite spots in town and they were some dive Italian spots that had $2 wine and great pizzas! I will also say this, we went in August and it was REALLY hot. And we were coming from Phoenix were it was 110-plus degrees. I think our stay would have been more enjoyable if it wasn't so hot, but beware, it was VERY warm and AC is almost non existent at local restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ina great town”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one week at the Mahekal and it was like paradise. Whatever room you choose, you are steps from the beach. The beach is protected by Cozumel, so no enormous crashing waves.Good for young children. The most beautiful beach in the area. Locals add color and did not bother us. Plenty of beach chairs. The rooms are polynesian style with thatched roofs. They are kept clean. Good air-conditioning. Occasional ant visitors. Hey, you're in nature. Breakfast is good and they'll make about anything you want. Dinner menu is mediocre, but in the one week we were there, they had four special nights, each featuring really delicious food. There was live music three nights. The bar is a nice place to meet other guests and have a drink. Try the Mojito! The wait staff and bartender all very friendly. Guests are from all over the world: Europe, the U.S. and Canada. Everybody speaks english. No problems with the front desk as other people complained about. Great place for the money. Two pools. Although the resort is quiet, you are a five minute walk from fifth Ave., the main drag where there are tons of restaurants, shops and bars. Prices seemed fairly reasonable. Shopowners are aggressive which gets a little wearying but we learned to just say no. It is a lovely street. The town is much more charming than Cancun. There is lots to do nearby, if you have the money. We drove to Tulum but did not tour the ruins as it was just too hot to do in July. We did have Cervezas in town in an outdoor restaurant and bought a blanket. Don't be afraid to negotiate. All in all, a great vacation. Only complaint is the mosquitos which were bad. Bring repellant and bite meds, as you will get bit even with repellant on. Also do not rent a car from Thrifty in Cancun. They rip you off on insurance. This is a place we would definitely like to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: psj11
Reviews.Content: We visited Mahekal just recently and loved it. The environment is so awesome. It is few blocks away from 5th ave street. I think the end of the 5th ave street starts near Mahekal. We used to go to the 5th ave street once every day and the street is very good. In 20-30 min one can reach to Calle 1 which is where ferry terminal for Cozumel is located. We are vegetarians. We were able to survive well here. The best part of breakfast is fresh fruit juices. My only complain is that they keep just one vegetarian item on menu for dinner. Same thing for warm breakfast - only one item Molleate (we do not eat eggs). I also wish that they would offer at least non-alcohol drinks inclusive. We found prices little high but everything on 5th ave street is also expensive. It is no cheaper than US. There is not refrigerator in the room. In really warm days it is inconvenient not to have a refrigerator in the room. Also, there is no ice machine on the property so one has to go and ask for ice. They give only one water bottle a day. We used to walk outside and buy cold water bottles from OXXO - 1 L bottle costs 11 pesos. the same costs 25 pesos at the resort. The beach is very good. They provide beach towels at the reception and everyday one has to exchange them with new ones. At first it seemed annoying but later I found that it is their way of the security guards to make sure your items are protected when you are enjoying the sea water and away from your chair. They do not let people use their beach amenities if they are not staying at the resort. They identify the guests by their beach towel :) Their entire staff is very friendly. We were initially assigned a room which I did not like and they immediately changed to new one that I liked. They try to do everything to make sure you can enjoy the vacation time. Overall it is very nice place to take vacation and relax.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect quiet pkace in the centermof pkaya del carmen”
Reviews.Author: adrian-ch-1
Reviews.Content: it is a very nice hotel with bungalows. it is very close to the 5th avenue where you find a lot of stores and restaurants. the sea is also nice for swimming and the beach is clean

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Resort - I would return”
Reviews.Author: jwall915
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my spouse for four nights in late July. The purpose of going to Mexico was purely to get away for some R&R and basically do nothing all day. I got what I wanted, and wish I could have stayed an extra day. This resort is a good value and I do recommend it. There are just a few quirks that prevent me from giving it five stars, but I would stay there again. The pros: -Beautiful decor. I really loved the atmosphere. It's very tasteful, and very Mexican. -The staff is terrific. They speak English and they seem to genuinely love customers and guests. They are great with giving directions and recommendations and attending to problems very promptly and with a smile. -I loved our room. We stayed in a garden view room, and the beach and pool were a short walk away. It was always spotless after a cleaning. The bed was comfortable, it had a fan and an AC unit, both of which really cooled things off. The bathroom was spacious. We had a spacious front porch with two wonderful hammocks. The hammocks are stored in the closet in the room, and they are very easy to assemble. -The beach is beautiful. The beach chairs and umbrellas are plentiful, we never had a problem finding a spot for two. The water was fantastic. -Pools. The resort has two pools, both of which have chairs and umbrellas aplenty. The water is great, and the pools are cleaned regularly. We enjoyed the pools and spent a lot of time there. -Bar. The bar was great. Happy hour is from 5 to 6 pm daily and it's a two for one. The drinks are really good. They aren't watered down at all, and the pina colada was one of the best I've ever had. -This resort is family friendly without antagonizing singles and couples. There were lots of children there, but also lots of couples with no kids. I have no kids and generally do not enjoy "kid-friendly" places. This place struck a perfect balance though. -Location. Terrific location, as 5th Ave, the main drag of Playa del Carmen, is a five minute walk away. Shopping, restaurants, even a Starbucks is within very easy reach. Cons: -The food options. I'm a total foodie, and when I visit Mexico, I want Mexican food. I researched a lot before booking this resort because I wanted one that would serve authentic regional fare. The website is a bit misleading. This resort is not all-inclusive, it's semi-inclusive, which means you get breakfast and either lunch or dinner included. But all alcohol and one meal a day is on you. The first night we ate dinner at the resort because the website indicated that dinner service included Mexican fare. It does not. Know that before you go if this kind of thing is important to you. However, their breakfast and lunch options do include Mexican food. So we were pretty happy eating breakfast and lunch at the resort and the venturing down to 5th Ave for dinner. -Quality of food. Definitely not the worst I've tasted, but also not the best. The breakfast items are hit and miss, although the lunch is pretty good. Not outstanding, but good. -Drinks are not included. I fully expected that alcohol would not be included but I was not expecting that things like cola or bottled water wouldn't be included. That seemed a bit cheap to me. Overall, I enjoyed staying here and would do so again. If you go, say hi to Miguel the resort cat. :)

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal Beach Resort is "Magical"”
Reviews.Author: chargersboltman
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to tell people that this resort is amazing! It is a tropical paradise tucked away on a beach with beautiful landscaping of coconut palm trees and tropical flowers. This is a resort for those who love to feel like they are on a tropical island. It is NOT a Marriott or a Westin and that's the great part. You stay in these little casitas that are somewhat rustic with thatched roofs and hammocks on your porch. You still have wonderful maid service and the hotel staff is simply charming. They hired the right people to work at this little paradise because they are nice and friendly and want to help make your stay enjoyable. The food and the dining areas are amazing. The pools are refreshing but are basic but you have a nice view from the pool to the Caribbean coastline (you have a nice view from anywhere on the property. ) We took the kids and they enjoyed it as much as we did. Plan to stay here if you want to "get away from it all" and soak in the relaxation and recreation. It's a quiet property with an occasional live musical performance in the bar or dining room. I hate to talk so well about it for fear that it will become more popular and I won't be able to make a future reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VJCS
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great spot. If you want a small hotel, with excellent facilities, and a good beach with safe swimming this is the hotel for you. It feels quite intimate and there is planty of space with two pools. The beach front is wide and never gets too busy. Close enough to the centre of Playa Del carmen if you want to walk in during the evening. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: oahoffman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here on our honey moon and absolutely loved it! The palapa huts were so cute and comfortable. We felt safe and the staff was very pleasant. The food was fabulous and the drinks were also very good. The actual beach itself is beautiful and there are plenty of fun activities (snorkeling, parasailing, fishing, etc.). The huts do not have TVs or anything like that but there are hammocks to lay in and internet at the main lobby. We would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful and quiet Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Paco_Irene
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week in a private and beautiful bungalow Ocean front. Breakfast and Dinner were included. The quality of food was very good and they changed it continously (Mexican, sea food, BBQ, etc...) Also there was a bar to try Tequila and Mexican beers. An SPA and 2 swimming pools are part of the offering. The beach is beautiful and not crowded and a diving center ia available. Totally different to the All Included Big Hotels very popular in Ribera Maya

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: sandymccord
Reviews.Content: "Magical Mahekal". This place is fantastic! It was everything we thought it would be. Great rooms, beach, food and staff. Special thanks to Gabriel in the Spa. He is wonderful. We have been vacationing in Mexico for the last 9 years and this was by far, the most romantic and relaxing place. We are hoping to go back in November. Thanks again to everyone at Mahekal for the perfect vacation. Sandy McCord

Reviews.Title: “It's an absolutely fantastic place !”
Reviews.Author: timal156
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well equipped, cozy and comfortable. The food is delicious and the people are absolutely wonderful. It's walking distance from the shops and restaurants. We really can't wait to go back after the great holiday we had!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique paradise”
Reviews.Author: solemareh
Reviews.Content: The place is wonderful, exotic and elegant at the same time, perfectly clean, beautiful architecture, good food, very nice beach and warm blue water...Only a few minutes walking from the city centre but immersed in the amazing natural atmosphere. We want to thank all the staff and in particular Ignacio for the kindness, we felt like at home. Greetings from Italy (ciao!)

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem. A dream come true.”
Reviews.Author: unswervingly
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier about my familys stay at the Mahekal. The place was so ....tasteful! I am so impressed at how they have maintained this place to be very low-key and not commercial or hoax-y at all. This place is everything that is described on their website. We felt as if it was even better than we could have imagined. We stayed in adorable little cabin type thing just steps away from the beach. We always found a beach chair easily. There were never any lines to wait on. We felt as if we had the place to ourselves, as it was hardly ever crowded on the beach or in the pools. It was just a very short walk into town. We felt completely safe, even as 3 women travelling alone. There are security guards on the beach and all throughout the town. Breakfast was included, and then you could choose to have either lunch or dinner there as part of the plan. We chose dinner most nights. The lunch was also excellent. Every cabin has its own front porch and 2 hammocks at least. This is a place for reading, swimming, and relaxing. The water was sooo warm that we swam in it much more than we expected. The grounds and beach are immaculately cleaned. Drinks are not included at dinner or during the day..keep that in mind. Dont worry about what you eat at the hotel or in any of the major restaurants in town. We didnt have any problems digestive-wise. Its possible to takes lots of trips from Playa del Carmen, but honestly what you'll want to do is park yourself on a beach chair, or in a hammock and lounge. In the stores, do not pay anywhere near the first price they give you for jewelry. usually they will go down to about 40% of what they originally say. Haggle a little :) thank you mahekal for offering us a much needed refuge!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic....once again!”
Reviews.Author: camboy70
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low key resort on a world class beach, this is the place. Great atmosphere, great service, great location, good food, good value. Did I mention the beach? Well it's fabulous. We will be back soon for our fourth visit in six years.

Reviews.Title: “Bungalows on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: memse
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a different kind of hotel you should consider the Mahekal Beach Resort. We needed a room in Playa del Carmen for 1 night on our way to Cozumel so I wanted a beach property that was reasonble. I reserved a beach view room which was 1 row back from the beachfront bungalows. If we'd had more than one morning to enjoy the beach I would have gladly paid the extra for a bungalow. These could be in a movie! Our spacious 2 bed room had a large private deck with a passable ocean view. It was neat & clean and on the 2nd floor. The property is spread out with bungalows and small 3 story buildings with maby 2 rooms per floor. I'm giving this a 4 star rating for the warm ambiance even though it has a slightly funky atmosphere because I prefer this for a tropical retreat over a more modern monolithic hotel wrapped around a huge pool! The room rate included breakfast & dinner but not alcoholic beverages. The room had AC but WiFi is only available in the reception palapa building. We arrived at the hotel right about the time dinner was over but the friendly staff made sure we got hustled over to catch the tail end of the buffet which was good despite being cleared away 10 minutes after we sat down. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is that it is a $6 dollar, ten minute taxi ride to the central area of town for shopping, restaurants and night life. That said, paying for a taxi is CONSIDERABLY less than what it costs to rent a car in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place, however quit expensive for what they offer.”
Reviews.Author: Breathless81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahekal for 10 days in July. All in all we had a great time. The location of the hotel is great as it is off the famos 5th avenue in playa but not too far away. We loved the beach there and gave the dive shop on their premises good business, as they had a couple of great guides and a lot of nice dive spots can be accessed right from that beach by boat. We experienced some down points though which I would like to share: - the management is very inflexible when it comes to ther half board arrangement. you cant book without it and have to have breakfast and and dinner or lunch in teir restaurant. while breakfast was okay (lots of fresh fruit and eggs served to your liking incl. mexican specalties) dinner and lunch werent so exciting. fresh salads and veggies where only very little available and the overall quality of the food was medium. we chose to have lunch and go out for dinner, as a few very good restaurants are nearby, - the only wireless available at that time (but for free!) was in the bar. my personal opinion is, that in todays world wirless should be available in all hotel rooms for free. - having worked in the service industry myself ive noticed that nobody at the reception ever asked how our stay was even though they several chances. - prices for coffee and beer seemed quite high to me. we re in mexico.... - bar and restaurant where not always whiped clean and left sticky for the next guest. - beach towels are supplied daily by the hotel which i consider a great service. but you have to swap them at the reception and sometimes have to wait a little as staff was busy. they should move this service down to the beach somewhere and not bother te front desk staff with this. As I dont really rate a hotel by how they fold their towels and even though there were nice arrangements on the bed every day it didnt get me excited. I'd rather have the management investing in some of the points above instead. I must say though that the restaurant staff was very friendly. Overall I would still recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magical!! Plan to return in 6 months if possible!”
Reviews.Author: RubyRed2
Reviews.Content: Believe every positive thing you've read about this truly magical place. We've vacationed in these areas before and this is by far the best 9 day vaction we've EVER had! This isn't the typical skyrise with marble floors and food to make you throw up. This is a true getaway from the outside rushed world to a calm, relaxing tropical paradise. No loud music or crazy people running around. Pure beautiful landscaped grounds with chirping birds in the morning and the day,and a few steps from the ocean. Fifth street is two blocks away with local shops, restaurants and bars for nightlife. Staff was great, no foreigners. Locals only with true mexico hospitality..special mention to Rogelio, Ivan and Alberto. Our vacation wouldn't of been the same without them. Rooms are very clean, AC works great and the hammocks on each room are awesome. Mexican night on Sundays for dinner is wonderful..fabulous mexican food with mariachis. Can't beat the local flavor. One thing to point out is that entertainment is limited. We were there 9 days and there was Sundays with Mariachi and a local band another day and that was it. The bar area could use some spice. Pool tables are runned down, the drinks are very watered down (not worth the price), makes you want to go to sleep when you go in there instead of continuing to have a good time. One note, take mosquito spray. Due to the recent rain they do like to come out and attack especially in the evenings. Front desk staff is average..not exceptional. Don't except a celebrated greeting when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spro9
Reviews.Content: Mahekal Beach Resort is the best kept secret in all the Maya Riviera! Gorgeous property - radically well-maintained grounds, fabulous beach, sincerely warm and helpful staff - and prime Playa del Carmen location (at the quiet end of Calle 38, one extended block from all of the 5th Avenida action). Our "Ocean View" room was literally 3 paces to the beach, with an unobstructed view of the Carribean. On site restaurants were very good - not gormet - but we didn't leave any meal dissatisfied. If you don't like what you see on the menu, grilled lobster is available for a modest surcharge. Lunch at the on-site restaurant was excellent (their Mixed Sea Food Taco - shrimp, fish and octopus - was the best taco in town). No TV in the room? So what - our family actually spent 11 days talking to each other. When you read this review, please bear this in mind - I was totally against spending our vacation in Mexico - we have, for 5 of the past 6 years, spent our July vacation in Negril, Jamaica, where I was very, very happy. But after our stay at Mahekal, I do believe that I have turned the page on Negril, and anxiously await our return to Mahekal next year!

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: moocow719
Reviews.Content: We gave our daughter a trip to Mexico for a college graduation gift, and chose Mahekal Beach Resort . I cannot say enough wonderful things about this place. We loved it! The staff was fantastic. Everyone was so friendly and so helpful. We loved the quiet palapa huts, so quiet and comfortable. We did not miss the TV at all. The food at the restaurants was outstanding. We enjoyed every meal. We will be staying here again the next time we visit Mexico!! I would highly recommend this place...!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Mahekal!”
Reviews.Author: RaymondM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful week at Mahekal back in March. While the resort isn't perfect, it suited us great. The laid back style and location were exactly what we wanted. There are a lot of reviews that go into detail about the hotel, so I won't do that here, but below are a few things to know before going. The bad: - The front desk staff didn't seem to know what they were doing or at least the woman who checked us in didn't. It wasn't a good first impression. - The dinners weren't that good. We ate there three times and none of them would be considered good. Adequate or ok maybe, but not good. That said, you can trade your dinner (which is included) for lunch and eat out, so this isn't a huge deal. - Drinking water. They give you 1 liter of water a day per room. That wasn't enough for the two of us. While they will sell you more ( for normal US prices), I ended up walking up 38th street to the OXXO (two blocks away) and buying 5 liter jugs there for what the resort wanted for 1 liter. The good: - The staff, with the exception of the front desk people, were all great. They went out of their way to make our vacation great. Rogelio, Gabriel, and Juan deserve special mention. - Location, Location, Location. Mahekal is both right on a great beach and in walking distance to all of the action of 5th Avenue. It offers the best of both worlds. - The grounds are beautiful. The grounds staff work diligently to keep Mahekal clean and it shows. - Good breakfast and great lunch. Wonderful food and the view is priceless. The best part is that if you exchange dinner for lunch, both meals are included. - Happy hour! Buy one get one free. Some tips: - Take a little time and read the reviews here at Tripadvisor. It is amazing how many people seem to go and not know that there are no TVs or phones and then complain about it. - They have a few mini fridges that you can rent, so if you want one, ask. They give preference to people with medical conditions and those with kids, but we were able to get one. That was real nice. - If you are a light sleeper and want to sleep late, you may want to bring earplugs. The birds at Mahekal get up early and like to sing. We thought it was great, but others might not. - Don't let the idea walking to 5th ave. daunt you. The walk isn't bad (we always felt safe) and the bustle and excitement of 5th ave will serve as a nice balance to the laid-back style of Mahekal. Overall, we would suggest Mahekal to anyone looking for a laid-back vacation in a beautiful environment. We are already talking about ditching prior plans to go to Bermuda next year and head back to Mahekal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: SnyderLP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Playa del Carmen for our anniversary and enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Mahekal. Likes: - Value - Very reasonable prices for a basic room with deck and two meals a day included. - Service - Felt taken care of at reception, housekeeping, and especially in the dining room. - Food - Great variety and we felt everything was of very good quality, compared to what we'd heard about inclusive hotels. - Location - Enjoyed being able to walk to 5th (but not right on it) and being right on the water. Dislikes: - Location - The beach here does have a gassy smell, some days more than others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, beautiful, and secluded”
Reviews.Author: KmlVail
Reviews.Content: I was there for a friends wedding in early June. Get a beach front villa and you will have one of the best vacations ever. The staff is great! I have already recommended it to my parents for a future getaway. I have stayed at great resorts and Mahekal is among the best!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love!”
Reviews.Author: PixelBliss
Reviews.Content: This place is paradise. Beautiful, quiet, clean and safe with a laid-back atmosphere, good food and great service - even on the beach. The staff is attentive and nice, and the grounds are gorgeous. We stayed on the top floor of a Garden View Pueblito and loved the view and the way the sun shines on the balcony in the mornings. We also liked that there was no TV in the room. Overall, this place is charming and the perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. You can relax on the beach, swim in the ocean and pools, eat good food, nap on a hammock, stroll into town, take day trips to Tulum or Xel-ha, etc. We absolutely love it and look forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous! Great Value! Will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: MtnSailor
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel rooms, large tiled bathrooms, fans and air conditioning make for excellent cabana-like rooms. Each equipped with two hammocks for a lazy day at the beach. The sand is clean and pure, the food is excellent (2 meals a day are inclusive) and the location is central to every shop, restaurant and anything else you could want. This is truely a diamond in the rough.

Reviews.Title: “MAGIC in Mexico--Mahekal: My Personal Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Lillimarie
Reviews.Content: I am almost nervous to write this because I don't want the peaceful, serene, ambiance of Mahekal to be ruined by hordes of drunken tourists. Oh hell no! This place is simply the best. I have stayed in all-inclusive mega-resorts in Playa my previous three trips to Playa Del Carmen, and hated the loud constant music at the pools, the time share sharks lurking in the lobbies, and the mobs of loud, intoxicated visitors. This place is not for you if you crave the loud pulsating music, rowdy crowds, and never-ending spigots of hard liquor of the all-inclusive resorts. BUT if you want the experience of a staff that caters to your every need--great food from both restaurants, quiet relaxing pools with no music except for the breeze blowing through the palms, and a beach that surpasses all others--Mahekal is the place to visit. Not one room there is more than minutes from the beach--the grounds are clean and tropical, and the pool bar has a great happy hour. NO TV. NO PHONES. NO RADIOS. NO PROBLEM!!!! I loved it, and will return next year and every year after that I am physically capable of traveling. Keep Mahekal magical. Guard the serenity. Honor the tranquility. You can walk to the bustle of Quinta Avenida for the partying--or stroll up the beach to Mamita's for the party atmosphere. Leave the magic of Mahekal intact. It is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: burch78
Reviews.Content: Steps from the Beach and Beautiful place to stay. I would definitly recommend this hotel to any couple needing a nice quiet vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but it can get better”
Reviews.Author: summergirl1141
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at Mahekal. We were a little dissapointed when we were taken to our "ocean view" room. It was not really an ocen view...but I guess that is their idea of it. It would be nice if they respected your request when it comes to having the type of bed you want. We didn´t like having to queen beds instead of one king. If you are going to book it, consider paying the extra money for a beach front casita. They are totally worth it. Unfortunately, there was not one available during the days we were staying there. The food is great, but we weren´t impressed with the dinner. Besides, there are so many good places to eat out on Playa, we suggest you go out at night and try them. The beds were a little hard and the water in the shower takes a while to get warm. You can bring in your own drinks, that you can buy in a little store that is located 1 block from the hotel. After all we really enjoyed it, because it has a great beach area and we loved Playa del Carmen. It is a town with so much charm and with people from so many different countries. tip: do not exchange all your dollars at the airport, they have such a low rate and you will get a lot more money if you wait to exchange them at Playa. There are several places where you can get pesos. Also you can get a bus (ADO) from the airport to Playa del Carmen. Then take a taxi to the hotel. It is around 20 dlls round trip. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love Mahekal!”
Reviews.Author: GeraldineJohnson
Reviews.Content: Mahekal is a beautiful, comfortable place to stay in Playa del Carmen. The casitas and grounds are gorgeous and well-tended. This is a VERY clean place. The housekeepers do a fantastic job. Same for bellmen, front desk, security and the restaurant staff. The location is perfect: on an absolutely perfect beach and 5 or 10 minutes walking to many nice restaurants and shops. Taxis are plentiful, safe and inexpensive in Playa. I was there with my 16 year old daughter and we two ladies felt absolutely safe during our entire visit. Playa is a safe place. Use common sense just as you would in any city; we found Playa to be safer than our hometown of Milwaukee. So many people warn us or ask us about safety in Mexico. It is a problem in the north, but if you are thinking about Cancun/Playa, just come. Don't believe all the talk from those who do not know.

Reviews.Title: “Magical - if you are a Mosquito!”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun055
Reviews.Content: We are just coming back from a stay at Mahekal. The hotel grounds and the bungalows are very nice as previous reviewers have said. But there are swarms of mosquitoes!! It is close to impossible to sit outside in front of your bungalow in the evenings or mornings. You'll be eaten alive by mosquitoes! Some of them are even active during the day or make their way into the bungalows. This seriously ruined the fun of of staying there for us. What's the point of having a bungalow on the beach with a nice deck and a hammock if you have to lock yourself up inside armed with insect repellent? After getting 40+ bites (on one person!) on the first night we went to buy insect repellent first thing the next morning at a pharmacy a few blocks away (corner 38 and 30 av). That reduced the number of new bites we got each day but it remained a significant problem during our stay with a substantial number of bites every day and the inconvenience of repeated applications of the repellent. It would have been nice if the front desk would have told us about the mosquitoes when we checked in. We would have been able to use the repellent right from the start. Interestingly, I noticed that the front desk staff has a bottle of repellent that they are using frequently. Nice! We told the lady at the front desk about the mosquito problem we are having but she didn't care much. We asked if we could move to a bungalow that has more of a breeze but she said that these bungalows would be in a higher category which required an extra charge and she can't say if it helps anyway. When I asked if I could see an alternative bungalow she refused to hand me the keys and called the bell boy so he could accompany me. I got the keys after more discussion but I was shocked that apparently I was not trustworthy enough to get keys for 10 minutes to look at a room. That reflects the idea of customer service the front desk seems to have. In contrast to the front desk, the rest of the staff was very friendly and did go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excatly how you would imagine paradise!”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Mahekal Beach Resort, to celebrate our Birthdays. What a great experience- excellent location with close proximity to 5th Ave., yet secluded enough in a lovely neighborhood. The beautiful and lush grounds are well kept, two refreshing salt waters pools to choose from, great breakfast buffet spread, and pleasant staff. We choose to do the package, which included breakfast & either lunch or dinner. We tried dinner one night and was no impressed, but breakfast and lunch are good. Our casita was within 80 feet to the ocean.. so amazing to just walk out and jump right into the warm waters of the Caribbean. Lovely stay and will definitely go back with friends. Thank you Mahekal for a wonderful Birthday memory, see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “This place is like the smurfs village - Perfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: RigoM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 11 playa. It was in front of the swimming pool. It also had the view of the ocean. I heard the best room is 4 caribe which has a jacuzzi. We had 2 meals included since it was part of the package with bookitcom. The breakfast were great.. staff was very friendly.. Dinner had live music and the food was okay. I really liked this place except for servers did not keep refilling my glasses of wine after I bought a bottle. what else... free parking.. happy hour.. and near cute restaurants. There is a massage place next to the hotel which offers the combination massage for $35. Try the local tacos al pastor in the town... there are delicious. Also ask for a guanabana juice in front of comericial mexicana.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Donnerfairy
Reviews.Content: Been going to Playa del Carmen for many years at least twice per year. Since it was low season, I figured I would stay on the beach as deals were great. Mahekal is perfectly located (we had a bungalow with ocean view). Beds were extremely confortable. I would have preferred the 2nd floor bungalow, but we were two friends so the 1st floor had 2 queen beds. Our room has tiny ants on the sink several times and I found the staff less than what I would expect. The bartenders seemed grumpy and I think the staff could have better service skills. I didn't like the lunch and I think breakfast buffet is awesome . I would like it better to only get breakfast and not pay for other meals, however, I got a good package deal so it was all included. I would never pay the rack rates for the food and all.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was a dream!”
Reviews.Author: HappyAsheville
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I spent 8 wonderful, relaxing days at Mahekal. This was our second trip to Playa del Carmen but the first to Mahekal. Our goal was to do nothing but relax, read and swim, and we met that goal 100% in this lovely resort. If you are into the all-inclusive swanky big resorts, then don't go to Mahekal! If you love a smaller more personal resort with plenty of peace and quiet (except for those darn Starlings) and TONS of character and ambiance, the go to Mahekal! The individual thatched roof cabana type rooms can't be beat for charm, and we stayed in a third floor (not for the faint of heart) penthouse (30P) which was so worth the climb to reach it (I am in pretty good shape for a 45 year old woman, but it was a butt and knee workout going up and down several times a day). The room was overly spacious and simply furnished and decorated. No electronics at all, which was a welcome detox from TV, phone and radio! A clock would have been welcomed, and I have mixed feelings about wi-fi. To get wi-fi, you must go to the lobby or the bar adjacent to the lobby. This was fine for us, as I only needed to check email daily. But there are times when the only way to get away is to continue to work some, and wi-fi in the rooms would be welcome in that case. The high pitched thatched roof was not only charming but kept the room cool. We didn't turn on the a/c at all during our 8 day stay (it was 90ish outside). Housekeeping did a wonderful job. Our only room complaints would be that it could use a chest-of-drawers and that the casement windows don't stay open too well in the ocean breeze and could use some support. Penthouse 30P is at the far south end of the resort, and it has plenty of privacy and a lovely ocean view obstructed only by some great palm trees. It was quiet and had a nice sized balcony for lounging in the shade (not late afternoon). The king size bed was very comfortable. Loved the tiled shower from which you could also see the ocean! If you need privacy in the toilet area, however, this won't work for you as it only has a swinging bar door. The staff was exceptionally friendly and any need was accommodated. All spoke some English and most were quite fluent. Rogelio among the wait staff is wonderful. All the wait staff were all wonderful, but Rogelio is particularly outgoing and friendly, and we enjoyed him very much. The beach is the best in Playa, but it is still a public beach (which we think makes it more interesting) with armed beach patrols and some degree of trash despite their daily efforts at raking it. The beach was fairly quiet without as much jet-ski and para-sailing traffic as we remembered from a prior visit to a nearby resort. This is probably due to the fact that the Mahekal attracts a more sedate, mature clientele than its neighbors down the beach where there is more activity, and to the fact that the water was pretty choppy most of the time we were there. There were always plenty of lounge chairs in the sun or shade, and the hammocks were heaven! A waiter came around a regular intervals to see if we needed anything. The beach was great! Playa del Carmen itself continues to become a more gaudy touristy town with residual charm. The "newer" developed North end toward Mahekal is nicer, and there are a few decent restaurants within an easy walk of the resort. The closest block of 5th Ave is Italian, and we loved the pizza at Amore. The Mahekal restaurant provides breakfast and either lunch or dinner. Since we didn't want to leave the beach during the day, we switched dinner for lunch all but our first night. The breakfast and lunch menus are adequate but limited, and the food was just "ok." It would be nice if the resort would provide unlimited purified bottled water, but you only get one modest bottle per day. We walked out twice to a convenience store a few blocks away to buy cheap gallons of bottled water. You must pay for all drinks other than coffee with the meals, and it does seem that they could include a beverage! We would return to the Mahekal Beach Resort again and again, but we are finished with Playa del Carmen which has so little to offer in culture or natural beauty other than the beach. There are too many other Caribbean locales to explore!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Mexico and this resort was beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: MissyHudson
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of traveling here for my cousins Wedding on May 28th, 2011. The staff was so friendly, food delicious with plenty of options. Loved our room 11P! Air conditioning working, queen beds, very close to pool/breakfast area and beach. The view from balcony was top notch (loved the hammocks). The other family members had reserved expensive rooms and they were not as pleased (more inside the property). You must check out the pottery cart in the bar. You can paint your own or buy from the artist. Such a nice keepsake!! If you go, don't forget..eye mask and/or ear plugs (sun and birds can be up early) pepto (just in case, I felt fine), good sunscreen and big hat (i forgot my hat). The sun is very strong and the family members that didn't protect and hydrate all day were throwing up at night. The bottled water is always available. Practice a little Spanish, the staff speak English well but it's always more polite to "try" to speak in Spanish. After awhile, it became easier and quite fun!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: TGU-ORD
Reviews.Content: All previous reviews are accurate. This place is not a mega resort, at capacity this place does not look full. Laid back. Staff is great. Front desk is great. Restaurant staff is outstanding. Beach was never crowded, except for Sunday when locals rightfully come to enjoy the beach. But even so, there were plenty of lounge chairs available. I was here for a wedding and these guys made the difference, attentive, quick, plenty of them around. All friendly. I think service is the hotels best attribute. During my stay it was hot, humid, but breezy. I stayed on a top floor inland cabin, so I just opened all the windows and turned on the fan. That was enough. I did not turn on a/c. If you want 75 degrees, then Cancun and PDC are not the place for you to visit. I thought that Breakfast and Dinner are better than Lunch. So I would opt to leave hotel for lunch. A five minute walk away and you are in the pedestrian zone with plenty of restaurants having tourist prices. Two beach towels are provided. Rooms are very simple decor, but functional. All doors, windows work. Bathroom has good water pressure, plenty hot water. All is clean, nothing seems deteriorated or worn. All rooms have a deck or patio with two hammocks, two chairs and table. If I ever return to PDC, I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Family Wedding at a beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: keirapat0924
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Playa Del Carmen for a cousins wedding at Mahekal and had an amazing time! The resort is right at the beach which was fabulous and so convenient. The staff was very helpful and the food delicious! My husband and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We will return, no question!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1215
Reviews.Content: We brought our 2 kids (9&5) to Mahekal for a family wedding. It was a "magical" experience all around. The food is delicious, the staff is wonderful, and the beach, well, it's just plain paradise. I loved the fact there were no phones/tvs. One reviewer mentioned brooms in the rooms, which I think is a brilliant idea. Even though they have an outside spigot to rinse your feet, it can still get pretty sandy inside. We stayed right on the beach and the most amazing experience was swaying in the constant beach breeze in a hammock that hung from our terrace looking out at the beach and ocean. My only issue was our particular unit's a/c didn't work that great, and it got HOT. That said, It wasn't bad enough to change rooms, and during the day, the breeze is great. Those birds do get you up early, but I figured it was the best way to enjoy the beach before it got to be sweltering hot. Another highlight for us: Mexican fiesta night. Delicious buffet dinner and Mariachi band. Would not hesitate to return or recommend this property. It's rustic, charming and chill here, if you are looking for air conditioning everywhere, or fancy upscale accommodations, this place is not for you. The 24 hour beach security is excellent-- but the resort's beach is shared with public access. For us, this enhanced our experience, as my son befriended a local boy with whom we will keep in touch via email! We look forward to our next trip to Mahekal...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Magical...but,”
Reviews.Author: lf644
Reviews.Content: We LOVED LOVED this resort. This is my 2nd time to Playa and my first time to Mahekal Suggestions first..IF and I say IF I had to nit pick... a broom in the room would have been nice. Although the sand is part of experience and the housekeeping staff kept our room immaculate... at night after a hard day at the beach it would be nice to sweep a little sand out of the room and patio. We had a NEWborn ..that's right about 4 mo old baby in the room next to us and the "mother of the year" left her kid in the room with a baby monitor while she was at the bar...WOW! But, that's not the hotel staffs fault. As when we complained about the noise from a new born crying its eyes out they happily moved us to another comparable room. Thanks staff! Although, there were a few guests that complained about noise from a wedding party we didn't hear a peep. The wedding party was annoying at the pool as there seemed to belong in Cancun (college kids, from Brooklyn, NY..ick!) The bartending staff didn't get our orders right all the time..However, we don't speak Spanish so that's not their fault (as we are in Mexico..so we didn't expect them to speak English). Now the good!!!!.... Those complaining of no phone and TV should shove off to a MEGA resort. The no TV and phone was relaxing and tranquil. The hammocks and ceiling fans on the patio OH YEA!! NICE!! The food was great and we are picky eaters. The wait staff really nice...(Don't forget to ask for your check..as it's rude in Mexico for them to bring it to you..it's like them saying "we are done with being hospitable..get out") It's up to you to decide when you want to leave. BBQ and seafood buffet night was awesome...We live in San Diego so Mexican fiesta night with Mariachis was not our thing. Xel-ha and Coba are great excursions and Boli (the concierge) is not only helpful but, honest. He listens to what you want. He will sell you want you want even if it's not the most expensive; a very nice thing to have in a concierge. If you are not an earlier riser Mahekal may not be for you. The beautiful jungle birds and wildlife will wake you every morning at 5AM. But, we thought it was a great part of the experience! Watch for the Coti's as they can be vicious if felt threatened. We also made friends with a stray cat who was adorable and slept on our patio every night. If you run into this cat, don't be afraid she is a sweetie and the bodega on 5th sells cat food for 2 dollars. She'll chill with you when you nap in your hammock. Sunblock/Bug spray combo is a must for the beach. Beds are comfy, grounds are immaculate, the spa staff rocks (I gave a 100% tip to my massage therapist.) The beach is gorgeous; the beach lounge chairs comfy, drinks are reasonably priced (don’t forget to tip this includes you!!! You cheap Europeans!!!)… I could rave and rave!!! All in all; this place is heaven! We will be back and sooner than we planned... We LOVE Mahekal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Rincon74
Reviews.Content: The Mahekal, is located in the Playa del Carmen hotel area but outside all the noisy and night life action which makes it ideal for a relaxing trip , but still gives you access to Playa restaurant and night life in a walking distance (5 min). The hotel has nice facilities ideal for relaxing in a couple or family vacation due it´s a kids frendly location that in Playa is hard to find, the rooms ara little houses very typical of the region with all the ameneties. The only thing is that theres no TV o phone but is part of the concept, and WiFi is available in the Club house area and in one of the pools. The food is very nice, and you have brekfast and lunch or dinner in your rate, that based on the prices of restaurants in the zone it makes this a good deal, and the quality and variaty is very nice. Breakfast and dinner are buffet and lunch base on a wide menu. The beach is not crowed except for sunday that can be a little bit by locals but still not asr crowed like the ones in the central hotel area. Staff is very frendly and will assure a nice vacation

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfectly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: KBrownlee10
Reviews.Content: Even though we were travelling with 3 kids 9 and younger, we still felt like we were taken away to a quiet resort away from it all. The staff was wonderfully friendly and especially sweet with the kids. The pool were perfect for kids. We easily went from meals to beach to pool to bar and back again. I always thought it was funny that the kids were asking to go to the bar, just because there were swings and pingpong and pool to entertain us all. There was always a wonderful variety of food deliciously prepared. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Even better, after all these years!”
Reviews.Author: JennieShortridge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been traveling to the Yucatan for over 20 years, and staying at Mahekal (formerly Shangri-La Caribe) almost as many. We chose it over all of the other resort in the ever expanding "Riviera Maya" because it embodies the spirit and beauty of the Yucatan and the Caribbean rather than re-creating just another mega resort that could be anywhere in the world. We chose it initially for the bungalow-on-the-beach experience, and fell in love with the people who work at Mahekal (many are the same two decades later). We love the low-key lifestyle we live at Mahekal, mostly barefoot, grabbing a beer or snack when we need one, breakfasting on authentic Mexican egg dishes like Huevos Motulenos, devouring fresh, simply grilled fish for lunch. New owners took over in 2008. We'd heard the place was getting torn down, and it broke our hearts. What we didn't know until the year was that the economic crash of recent years actually SAVED Mahekal from distinction. Funding and resources dried up, so the new owners re-invested in the resort instead, with wonderful results. The employees all stayed! When there were no guests at the resort, when the economy and swine flu and then trumped up reports of violence in Mexico scared tourists away, the employees never lost one day of work. They helped fix the place up instead, gardening, painting, whatever needed to be done. The guests are back now, and it is an even happier place than it used to be, because everyone knows what could have been lost. Visiting now is even sweeter than before. Some rooms have been remodeled in a more modern Mexican motif. I miss the old Mexican tiles, but I love the comfortable beds, the nice linens, the thoughtful touches like reading lights over the bed, extra storage capacity, rain showers, and beautiful artistic touches. The evening restaurant has stepped up its quality and the food is consistently great. The menu hasn't changed so much (lots of terrific regional fare mixed with just enough European/American dishes to satisfy those who need a little comfort from home while traveling) but the preparation, the flavors, the freshness, all much improved. We noticed extra security on hand, but never felt we needed it. Still, for some wary travelers, be assured: they've got your back. The town of Playa del Carmen continues to replicate up on itself, now spreading north even of Mahekal, but when you're on this little oasis of a resort, you'd never know it. All ou see are sand and turquoise sea, gorgeous flora, and friendly faces.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler0222
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved it here. The resort is exactly as it is shown in the pictures on the website. We vacationed with our 2 children, ages 9 and 11, and had such a great time! The snorkeling right outside of the hotel was good, the pools were nice, the grounds were very well kept, the employees were very nice. Our server, Rogilio, was the BEST! We loved him. My kids said that he made our vacation more fun. :) The food was excellent- others had said that it was just "OK", but we found it to be very good. There was always something that all of us liked. No complaints whatsoever. The ambiance in the restaurant at night was so wonderful. There was a live band every other night, which was a really nice addition. Breakfast overlooking the ocean was great. Lots of food to choose from. We would definitely return to Mahekal!!

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Paradise with my family”
Reviews.Author: AnnD_11
Reviews.Content: Truly a unique spot where the many of the rooms are their own individual palapas. The hotel is nestled in a tropical setting located right on the beach and the grounds are just beautiful. Our rooms were complete with hammocks and the staff could not have been nicer! Our kids could start swimming while we ordered breakfast in the mornings and if they wanted a rest from swimming or the beach - they would head to the recreation palapa located by one of the 2 pools - where they had their choice of billards, pingpong and/or ceramic painting. We met people from all over the world - a majority of them - returning clients which is always a good review!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: This is probably the most beautiful ‘hotel’ I have ever stayed in. I use the word hotel advisidly as it’s not like any other I have been to. There are some things I didn’t like but the beauty of the setting and the almost total tranquility made up for them. The hotel is made up of many cabanas and a few rooms set it sandy gardens, imaculately kept. Many, including ours have views of the Caribean. Our room was delightful, two large beds, with a good shower room. There are no phones or TV’s, which for once I found rather nice. Two hammocks hung outside our door on the small veranda, beyond that, the sea. Breakfast, next to one of the two pools, overlooking the sea, was great, very American, but the waiters were, really, a bit thick and it’s pot luck whether you get what you ask for, better to take the buffet. The evening meal, which we only took once, was in another restaurant at the back of the resort, buffet style and fine, but not great and why not use the nicer one overlooking the sea? Besides the waiters, well most of them, the staff were great and very helpful, especially the concierge, bar staff make a real effort as well, I'm now addicted to Pina Colada's. Playa Del Carmen is OK but at the end of the evening it was lovely to get back to our lovely room. A small piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “True To Word, Magical!”
Reviews.Author: vaishk
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck us about Mahekal Resorts, Playa Del Carmen was its contrast to many other resorts dotting the Yucatan Peninsula. It doesn't boast of an all inclusive tag or have one of those artistically overwhelming entrance. It is nestled near the ever busy Fifth Avenue but provides complete bliss and peace. The view is awesome. You wake up, come on to the porch and the beach is right there, waiting for you. You could either go for a swim or watch the blue, blue beach from your hammock. The price of your room covers a breakfast and a lunch or dinner, which is an awesome deal for you wouldn't want to miss breakfast! The service staff are ever helpful, the beach towels are always clean, warm from the sun and readily available. My husband and I especially loved the swimming pool and the pool view bar which served yummy Mojitos and the all time favorite Corona. Can't wait to go back already!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow: Better than Ever.”
Reviews.Author: cohorn
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have visited this property. The first was in 2007 for 5 nights, then 2010 for 7 nights, and this year for 10 nights. We have already started saving for our return next year and are hoping for 12-14 nights. What a truly relaxing, beautiful and friendly experience. The staff are wonderful, they remembered us from the previous years and went out of their way to welcome us and make us feel pampered and at ease. We especially enjoyed chatting with Rogelio, Jorge, Manuel and Jose. We learned that a 10% gratuity is included on the bill at dinner for drinks, but not for service of the food at breakfast or for the evening meal. You may want to tip your waiter directly to ensure that they are being compensated fairly for all the hospitality, hard work and service they provide. We experienced these tips being graciously and gratefully accepted. Improvements are noted throughout the property, from upgraded linens and bedding, to higher end toiletries, and the dinner meals were most enjoyable this time, as they included greater variety and more fresh vegetables and salads, than in previous years. They were so good we didn't bother to switch them for the lunches. Our children (boys 11 and 14 years) absolutely relished this experience and were quite happy with the simple pleasures at the resort, playing in the ocean for hours, playing pool and ping pong, hanging out in the hot tub at sundown and painting ceramics. What a treat for us to see them unplugged from electronics and truly appreciating their surroundings. In the bar/ activity palapa, Julianna manages the ceramics, with help from her sons, and all are very talented artists. Julianna and Jose custom painted stunning, large platters for me, which are now hanging beautifully in our home, eliciting many compliments. We have stayed twice in garden rooms and this time in an ocean view room, which was merely steps from the ocean. We found that the ocean breezes kept the room cooler and airy, without the need for air conditioning, despite the weather being 25 celsius at night. The rooms were kept very clean, with an ever changing array of towel art and flowers, and the maids and gardeners were also very friendly. The beach was perfect for an early morning run, an afternoon siesta, or a later in the day walk to town for fruit or ice cream from the vendors. And yes it is the best part of the beach for miles. A vendor sells fresh fruit in a cup for $2.00 right beside the public access to the beach, steps from the hotel's beach chairs. The fresh mangoes, coconut, watermelon and pineapple were fantastic. Boli, the concierge, recommended us to go to Plaza de las Americas mall, one day for mexican ice cream and we also bought a styrofoam cooler to keep our drinks cold in the room. We went on one full day tour from Edventure Tours and had a great time. The highlight was swimming in the open ocean with sea turtles. WOW!! All in all this is a fantastic place to spend a vacation. I searched the internet thoroughly, from the Caribean to all over Mexico, looking for an alternative vacation beach spot, but was unable to find another hotel with these qualities. We were thrilled to hear that the hotel was not going to close as was previously reported during our first trip and we urge the new owners to continue to retain the unique charm and character that is Mahekal. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “best place on earth”
Reviews.Author: alo24
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough about Mahekal. The beach was awesome, service fantastic and the massages under the palapa were truly relaxing and exhilarating. I just cant say enough about this place. The breakfast was great the only minus was the dinners. I felt the dinner buffets didnt have enough options. Lunch was great- ordered it from our casita and the ceviche was fresh and full of flavor.

Reviews.Title: “SOOOOOO much more than just a resort”
Reviews.Author: Playabeso
Reviews.Content: Wow, that is all I can say about staying here at Mahekal. Everything was amazing with our room, the location of the room, the beach, the food, etc. Okay, I'll break down some of the components of our amazing trip. ROOM: was 52A, by the garden view, aka we watched the cute fountain from our room, and it was really relaxing to swing in the porch hammocks and watch the fountain and listen to the crazy jungle birds. The room was tidy, and the AC worked well. The bathroom was clean and had character with the funky colored tiles. Note: the shower is an open one, something to keep in mind if you are sharing a room with someone that you are not comfortable with them seeing you fully naked. There's a free safe in the room, and they give you complimentary bottles of water each day that you stay. Also, you may walk through sand to get to your room, but they mop the floors every morning, so the sand doesn't accumulate.
