Make sure to talk to the concierge "Bali", he is awesome and will give you the best referrals. We had wanted to snorkel, but the waves at Playa were too choppy and the port was closed. The 3rd party company who does the snorkel rentals, etc. referred us to Cozumel or Akumal. Basically we ended up renting a car for $45, rented snorkel equipment for $10 (all through the resort). With our 1 day rental car, we drove to Tulum to see the ruins and then went to Akumal to snorkel on our own, aka it was free. All of this was based on the recommendations of “Bali”. It was the best idea ever honestly! RESORT: Everything is so close together, it's awesome. It literally was a 1.5 minute walk to the beach. We only had breakfast and dinners there, both of which were really good. The pools were nice and clean. The beach is clean and you get to hang out with the locals since it’s a public beach. Happy hour is offered from 5-6pm and it’s buy 1 get 1 free special. The prices are in pesos (make sure to bring more pesos than your form of currency, ie. USD or EUR, pretty much all the places were wanting pesos). Drinks at the hotel were honestly the cheapest ones I saw in comparison to places on 5th Ave.; they were between the 40-65 pesos range. Try the “beach kiss” which is pineapple juice, cream of coconut, and Malibu blended with ice. It smells like Hawaiian Tropic, but tastes phenomenal! 5th AVE: Being 2 girls on a vacation in Mexico, there was never a time where we didn’t feel safe. The 5th Ave area is super trendy and busy. Make sure to walk all the way down, there are so many cool things that you wouldn’t expect to be there. Overall, I will be coming back to Mahekal pretty much for the rest of my life. It was so tranquil that it was hard to leave. I’m secretly thinking about it for a destination wedding because it was an unforgettable experience. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, low-frills vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kelly5280
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific time at Mahekal. All the reviews are right--the staff are fabulous. The food was fine, not great, but the atmosphere in the dining halls made it a special experience. We had entertainment on a few nights, and by mid week, we knew many our wait staff and fellow guests. Our kids had the run of the place--it's that safe--and made friends with other guests' kids. Nightly Happy Hour in the 'club house' was a treat--the kids met their new friends there for ping pong & pool & "kiddie cocktails" while we sat at the bar. Our rooms (we were in 36A & B: oceanview was more like a 'glimpse') were just OK. The beds were comfortable, but too close, and the bathroom was humid and smelly. 36A's AC was WAY too strong for the small room, so we had to turn it on and off all night long to keep the humidity down! We either froze or were hot and sticky. (36B was more comfortable.) We would have liked a room fridge, but bought a cooler & ice at the little tienda up the street to keep cold water bottles on hand. I'd have loved a broom, too! Since the whole resort is on sand, it's hard to keep it out of your room, especially with kids running in and out. One sweep per day by the housekeeper wasn't sufficient. I'd also have liked shades to block out the morning sun! The room was bright by 6am! The turquoise water was perfect--warm & shallow a long way out, though rough. The location is great--close to 5th avenue, but far enough away from the pushy vendors and mayhem. We would go back, but next time, we'll shell out the extra beans for oceanfront. We'll forego some of the excursions we took this time and spend more time enjoying the relaxation and beauty of the resort. This was the perfect "off the grid" vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded and Not Crowded - Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: queemysmommy
Reviews.Content: After much delineration, my husband and I finally decided that yes, we would go to Mexico for a short stay. We looked at many different resorts, including some of the big, all-inclusive ones, which seem to me basically like land locked cruise ships. (Blech for me) We settled on Mahekal Beach Resort (formerly Shangri-La) after reading reviews on every single site we could find, and a very thorough google-image search of the resort. I am SO GLAD we came here. We only stayed for four nights, but it was HEAVEN. It is just far enough away from Playa Del Carmen that at night it is silent. Its about a ten miunte walk into the heart of 5th avenue. The resort is right on the beach, and is almost spotless. We stayed in the back in the garden view pueblitos - very secluded and very private, but also, comfortable. We absolutely loved it. It was small and perfect, felt clean (although I will admit sand does get everywhere) and felt like it was ours in a short span of time. The staff was so wonderful, very helpful and overall very happy. Everyone was pleasant and enjoyed a laugh with us whenever we wanted to chat. The food was, for us, just ok. I am vegan and my husband is vegetarian, and we are from NYC so we are accostomed to bold flavors. The food seemed a bit bland, but thatmay be just to keep the most amount of their clientele happy, as there did seem to be a number of people from smaller areas (though we did run into a few other New Yorkers) The beach was GORGEOUS. Previous reviews I read complaints about a fishy smell and lots of seaweed on the beach, but I'm not sure if these people have ever been near a large body of salt water, since that's kinda the deal. The staff worked hard to keep the beach free of seaweed, and most of the sand in the water in front of the resort is free of shells etc (there for easy on the bare feet) I honestly have no complaints whatsoever about this place - we will DEFINTELY be going back next year, and hopefully each year after that :) I do not think we would have been happy at one of the large crazy all inclusive resorts, our airport shuttle stopped at one on the way out and it was kind of horrible feeling. Especially after leaving what felt like our own private paradise. They want to help you to make your trip as enjoyable as possible, and the conceirge will help you to plan day trips to surrounding areas or tell you about local establishments you shouldn't miss. This is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Total perfection!”
Reviews.Author: kdcMaine
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time at this property, the 1st under the new name. I just adore it, so lowkey and friendly. This is not the place for someone who wants the big resort experience, but if you want a simple accommodations, and a gorgeous location and real hospitality... Then you cannot go wrong! I will be back next year and the next and the next...

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: wcabell
Reviews.Content: By far the best place to stay in Playa. If you want a low key, laid back vacation, this is the place. If you want room service, satellite TV, $10 drinks, go to a large "chain" hotel. Our family of 4 (6 and 8 year olds) will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJunior
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from an amazing 7 day trip to the Mahekal Beach Resort. We originally booked our first 4 days at the Mahekal and were going to look around town and the beach for the remaining 3 days (since we had never visited Playa Del Carmen and were worried about where to stay.), but after checking into an Ocean Front room we quickly realized that we would not want to stay anywhere else! I can't say enough about the location, staff (Jorge, Alberto, and Magelio). This is truly an amazing place like no other in all of Playa. The stretch of beach is perfect and the food was amazing. The meal plan of Breakfast and Lunch or Dinner is just perfect for a trip to Playa where there are so many great restaurants. We would always wake up and have breakfast at the pool overlooking the beach and then choose to either have lunch and then dinner in Playa or dinner at the resort and relax with a game of pool or pingpong in the Casa Club Bar. We already are talking to friends about booking a trip with a larger group of friends and family. This would be a perfect place for a family reunion, wedding or a romantic getaway! Can't wait to return to the Magical beach. Regards, Mike

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: griffithross
Reviews.Content: We stayed at mahekal March 5th-12. It was a wonderful experience all around. The food at breakfast and dinner was awesome. This is so much more than just a hotel. I would like to thank the staff for making our stay so enjoyable. Thank you Jorge, Rubin, Luis, Ivan, Rohelio, in the restaurants. Thank you Rafael and the two young ladies at the front desk, also to the bellman, and the cleaning staff. Everthing about Mahekal is unique. It is a rare find indeed. Go, enjoy the experience!!!! Griff

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: DocGirl13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our fourth stay at the Mahekal (formerly Shangrila Caribe)...and we love it just as much now (if not more) as when we started four years ago. We visit during the first week or two of March every year. The weather is perfect...still not too hot and little to no rain. We absolutely love it and wouldn't consider staying anyplace else in Cancun/Playa area. The resort is very clean and well kept. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. A shout out to our friend Rogelio, who served us so well during our stay. As many other reviewers have noted, the atmosphere is casual..I love walking the paths through the sand in my bathing suit. If you don't like this type of vacation, then this is not your place. However, if you do, the Mahekal's stretch of beach is one of the best I've ever been on..white sand and turquoise water that is so warm you can walk right in. Our typical vacation day was to rise for breakfast, lay on the beach, try the pool for a while, try our hammock for a while, nap, happy hour, and dinner. Repeat. Although you feel like you're in your own little world, the Mahekal is not isolated... it's an easy walk to get into downtown Playa del Carmen. The Mahekal guests are varied and range from young couples, families with small children, families with bigger children, and older adult couples. This is not a spring break establishment. The guests also come from many countries, including Canada and Europe. I like the fact that it's not just Americans here. Despite all the bad news about Mexico, we felt totally safe in Playa and at the resort. We did see a policeman with a machine gun in downtown Playa; however, I was happy to have the police presence. In no way did it feeling threatening. This year, we were vacationing with my husband's cousin and new wife who were on their honeymoon. I had asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation for their one week anniversary and he suggested we eat on the beach under the moonlight with lighted torches. ..and so we did, and for less than the restaurant would have cost. It was really unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Place for 24 years”
Reviews.Author: djpetrie
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have enjoyed many years at Shangri-la caribe, now Mahekal Beach Resort. It is very special to us as we are now married 50 years and enjoy a honeymoon every year in this paradise. The thatched roof hut that we love is 9C and we have met many wonderful people from around the world. One special couple we have been friends with since we met them in 1989. We have also kept in contact with many others. The staff from all departments make this place very special. The rooms are very clean and the beach view is fantastic. We enjoy the hammocks, the beach, and the wonderful food. A special thanks to Emilio, the general manager, Oswaldo in reservations and the waiters who are fantastic and make you feel at home. We have already made our reservations for next year and look forward to seeing everyone again. D&J from Woodstock, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent in EVERY way!”
Reviews.Author: SusanEisenberg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been searching high and low for a 'spot to call our own'... a familiar place to retrreat to in order to get away from the hustle and bustle of every day living in Mexico and we found in this resort! Tucked discretely away just minutes from Playa Del Carmen this resort transports you back to a simpler time. NO phones or TV's - what a way to unwind and regroup! As soon as we saw this resort we know we'd hit pay dirt! BINGO - our fantasy come true. As soon as you arrive you are treated with smiles and helpful tips that make you fit right in. The staff are beyond amazing here. You're truly in vacation mode within 5 minutes of walking through the door - how nice! If you are looking for 'fancy' and 'plush' then this is not the resort for you. But if you're looking for the simple pleasures and a place to decrompress 'away' from the insanity of an all inclusive then you've the right spot. No loud bars, noisy bands - just the sound of the ocean outside your bedroom door lulling you to bed. NO TV's or phones to distract you.... after all you're here to unwind right? The resort accomodates all sorts of couples from young to old, with children and without. It didn't matter.... my husband and I have never seen such well behaved and happy adjusted kids. It was a real treat seeing all ages enjoying the magic of this resort. The food was just fine - not Morton's but if that's your cup of tea then this resort is not for you. We did venture out once to sample the local fare but all in all found plenty of things to eat right at the resort. The beach is AMAZING! We walked for an hour and a half and still could have gone on.. just dreamy! Sure we had the company of some locals but it's their beach and there was plenty of room for all to enjoy. NO morning scramble for lounge chairs either YIPPEE! We cannot say more positive things about this resort and will be coming back next year NO DOUBT and years after given the magic of this place. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at a great place, with great people.”
Reviews.Author: sarge307
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Mahekal since 1989 when it was known as Shangri-La resort. While we have not been every year, we have stayed many times over the past 22 years and we have never been dissapointed. The setup is like a village, complete with thatched roof huts. The rooms are maintained by excellent staff who clean the rooms daily, providing fresh linens and towels and of course, towel creations. The resort offers a 2 meal program. You can have either breakfast and dinner or breakfast and lunch if you notify the front desk the day before. This is not an all-inclusive resort insofar as liquor is readilly available in many forms but not included in the room packages. There is so much to say about Mahekal that if anyone is interested, please contact me at dsbaker@shaw.ca or 604-574-1937 and my wife and I will be more than pleased to describe our experiences over the years. And yes, we have already booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karrindevail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married on the white, sandy beach, with the crystal blue waters as our backdrop at the Mahekal Beach Resort in February. From the moment we walked into the open air lobby the service and atmosphere were impecable. The cozy bungalows nestled amongst the trees and on the beach made you feel as if you were in a tropical oasis, yet you have the convenience of the 5th avenue restaurants and shops within walking distance. It was the perfect setting for our wedding and our 40 guests to vacation in Mexico. The food, grounds and housekeeping were all fabulous. Great breakfast with fresh fruit, pastries and eggs to order; a lunch menu, that on many occasions we had delivered directly to the beach; and fantastic dinners with a variety of choices each night. The rooms were cleaned daily and we were always excited to see the next towel masterpiece waiting for us on our bed, one day we even had a bride and groom towel arrangement! As far as the wedding goes we have to thank Aya for getting everything right, down to the smallest detail. We had a rehearsal luncheon the day before the wedding with of course fantastic food and beverages for all. We were also able to set up our computer to their sound system to create a personal and memorable experience for us and our guests. Aya arranged for my dress and veil to be pressed before the wedding, in additional to helping set up beach front pedicures for me and my bridesmaids the morning of the wedding as well as a delicious breakfast delivered to our room to enjoy while getting ready. The flowers were beautiful and perfect, even down to blue rose pedals for the aisle to tie into our blue wedding color theme. Also a special thank you to Rodrigo and Fernando for taking the most beautiful photos we have ever seen www.rodrigodelriolozano.com. The cocktail hour was beautiful, followed by a perfect reception. Thank you to Ricardo and Benji our DJ's, we had a ball, busting a move to their music expertise... discomovilcancun.com. We also had so many comments on how delicious the dinner and wedding cake were. Thank you also to Urs, Oswaldo and Nyx for all of your help during the wedding. I cannot say enough great things about this resort! The bottom line is if you want an amazing vacation in Playa Del Carmen, go to the Mahekal; and if you want an amazing wedding in Playa Del Carmen, go to the Mahekal. It will definitely be a vacation spot for us and our guests for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for a destination wedding”
Reviews.Author: marriedinplaya
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding and reception here in January of 2011. We had 90 family members and friends attend. Everyone had a wonderful time! I did not hear any negative experiences from the guests. They were very impressed by the resort and everyone felt safe. The resort has a rustic and peaceful feel. It is on a beautiful beach, but is also walking distance from downtown and all the nightlife. It really felt like a tropical get away, unlike many of the modern, crowded resorts in downtown Playa. The rooms were simple, but clean. The food was great, especially breakfast! The staff were very profressional and friendly. The wedding coordinators were very helpful and flexible. They coordinated the vendors and were able to plan the event via email and phone calls. I really do think this place is a hidden gem. It is a smaller resort, so it is perfect for a destination wedding. We plan to go back to Mahekal for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “If you ever wondered what heaven was like, this is the place to experience it.”
Reviews.Author: KAMMnMM
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for complete peace, beauty, and relaxation away from the crazy commercialism of Cancun, this is the place. The resort is located only 45 minutes south of the Cancun airport and the resort will arrange for transportation to and from the airport for you. The staff is very friendly and welcoming and will go out of their way to assist you with whatever you may need. The property itself is very beautiful and landscaped throughout with lush gardens. It is as close to paradise as one can get. Mahekal is in walking distance of 5th Avenue (main strip for shopping, restaraunts, etc.) Mahekal has a wonderful wedding planner on staff who helped arrange everything for my wedding from the flowers to the hair dresser, photographer and priest. The resort and beach is beautiful, the food is outstanding, the people are extremely friendly and welcoming, the atmosphere is completely relaxing. Without a doubt, this is one of the most amazing experiences I have ever had and am looking forward to going back again this year....and hopefully many more to come.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag in Playa”
Reviews.Author: teeby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mahekal 12/26/10 to 1/2/11. We were a group of three families with 6 adults and 9 kids ranging from 9-17 that travel together every year. I would say that like life, this resort is a mixed bag of good and bad. First the good: You are located right on the beach, the beach is nice, you get to chose either breakfast and lunch, or breakfast and dinner, the food is good to very good, the resort is close to downtown about a 10 minute walk for restaurants and shopping, the rooms are rustic but ok-we liked having our own "hut" with ocean view and hammocks are a nice feature, staff is very friendly and when they are motivated the service is good, the landscaping, grounds and physical appearance of the resort is nice, we loved having fresh seafood for lunch every day at the Aventura restaurant by the pool facing the ocean. It is also quiet for sleeping at night. The staff and people that we met were in general very friendly. We enjoyed walking into town for dinner and night life most nights. The New Year's Party was included as part of our meal plan. The food for New Year's was very good and the party was ok, though nothing special. The negatives: Transfers are not included, it ended up costing our group of 15 about $250 RT with a private transfer service, Google Playa del Carmen transfers, the hotel quoted us $900 RT. Drinks are not included in the meal plans and all of us love to drink on vacation! This means every water, coke, beer, pina colada, margarita, etc. Our extra bill was over $400 and we were one of the cheap ones! The rooms are rustic, there are no tv's, telephones or refrigerators in the rooms, this could be a positive for some people. The water pressure is poor and the bathrooms and rooms are in serious need of updating. There is really no live entertainment to speak of at the hotel, there is a bar with pool and ping pong tables and TV that was quite busy. The pools are too cold, so none of the adults really used these. There is a public walkway that runs right through the middle of the resort to the beach, meaning that during weekends and holidays locals fill up the beach right in front of the hotel. In addition, there is a sewage smell not too far to the North of the hotel that when the wind blows from the North, these factors definitely affect your beach experience. All in all, we had a nice vacation; however, for our next trip, we will probably look to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: NicoleElter
Reviews.Content: Mahekal was everything we imagined and more. From the time we booked the trip to our cab ride to the Cancun Airport, they were more than willing to help with anything and everything. Concierge: Boli, the concierge, was THE BEST! He was so friendly and really went above and beyond. He made dinner reservations for us, organized a snorkel trip with others from the hotel and booked us horseback riding. He made everything so easy, we told him what we were looking for and he delivered! He offered up suggestions of things we might like to try and did everything with a smile. I have nothing but great things to say about his service. Hotel: The hotel is a hidden gem! The grounds and rooms are really unique. I was very happy to not be in a high rise building. It really allowed for a true "beachy" feel. The hotel was very casual, but beautiful which made it all the more relaxing. There was no pressure to have anything but your beach cover up on while at lunch or at Happy Hour. It was so nice to be able to walk off the beach at 5PM, sandy and in flip flops and head straight to Happy Hour! Food: Breakfasts were included and were great! Many options (yogurt, delicious fresh fruits, pastries, eggs, cold cuts, etc.). You had the choice of eating lunch or dinner at the hotel. We had lunch there every day. What I loved the most about their food was that it was simple and fresh. They had several healthy options, so that you didn't feel like you were gaining 10 pounds during your stay. It was the kind of food that you could every day and not get sick of. We had dinner at the hotel twice. Both nights were buffet. They were good, but not as good as the lunch. I think that is typical when you eat buffet style. Playa: Playa was a great place to walk around at night or during the day. They have so many great restaurants, it's really hard to choose from!! I ate at Fusion, El Tortuga and John Gray's. All awesome places that I would definetly recommend. Also, there is a great coffee place on 5th Avenue: Au Cacao. They had the best iced coffee I have ever tasted. ** I do have one suggestion though. Depending on the room you are planning to stay in, be sure to request an exact room or don't give up until you get what you want. My boyfriend and I paid for an Ocean Front room, which we thought would be our own private bungalow on the beach. It turned out that we were in more of an Ocean View Room, 27 Playa. It was not a private bungalow, it was connected to 4 other rooms. 2 next door and 2 above. We were very, very upset when we saw this (even though it was directly on the beach). They said they get complaints a lot about that room, and the old management did have it listed as an Ocean View Room. There were several other people who were upset with their room location (almost every person we saw checking in had an issue). I think they may have been overwhelmed, as the hotel was fully booked. We never ended up being able to move rooms and they would not refund us for the Ocean Front, but we got over it once we stopped and realized how little time we actually sat in our room. All in all, the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beach Getaway”
Reviews.Author: aw123
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Mahekal. The resort was beautiful and relaxing. We spent all day laying on the beach under the palapas. We felt that the resort was well represented on their webpage / in the photos here on Tripadvisor. It really was what we had been promised - a beach getaway without phones, televisions and blaring music. Property and staff: The resort is well maintained, they have a big crew and they are constantly sweeping the paths, raking the sand, etc. There were security guards on the beach, making sure that the loungers were always available for guests. (take your hotel towel with you when you go to the beach so they know you belong to the resort!) We had a cheap room in the back and were very pleased - it was spartan, yes, but clean and romantic with a big porch w/ hammocks and plantation blinds and screens on the windows instead of glass. Food: Breakfast was as others have said, awesome. Lots of selection, fresh fruit, fresh fruit juice, coffee, tea, yogurt, granola and cereal, breads, and a menu of hot items. Lunch was menu in the same building as the breakfast. They also have outside seating at the pool, overlooking the beach. There were three vegetarian items on the menu - Veggie Fajitas, Veggie Tacos, and Veggie Flautas. Basically mixed, cooked vegetables, with different breads/sides. I had the fajitas and flautas, both were good, and the vegetables were lightly seasoned so they had a nice flavor of their own. Dinner was sometimes menu and sometimes buffet. We alternated eating lunch and dinner at the hotel. Both the times the dinner was a menu, there was a vegetarian entree (cheese ravioli, and veggie stirfry), on the day there was a buffet, it was seafood themed, so I was left eating sides. There were a lot of sides however, and I didn't go hungry. All beverages (including water) are extra at dinner. Drinks: Happy hour is 2 for 1 from 5-6pm. Big turnout for this, and they did also have a selection of fancy non-alcoholic drinks that some people were ordering for their kids. Pina coladas were good with fresh pineapple juice. The prices I remember are: Corona 35pesos, Pina Colada 55pesos, Margarita 55pesos, flavored margaritas 65pesos. Most of the mixed drinks were between 50-65, and the beers were all 35 (I think?). So the 2x1 made it a pretty good price! Guests: Mix of people - young couples, families, and older couples. There were quite a few well behaved children around. Some Americans, Canadians, and a mix of Europeans - German, Italian, and French. Playa: Cute, touristy town. Lots of restaurants. The trinket shops were pretty crap, didn't find any really good crafty things to buy. The Mega is only a short walk away and you can get sunscreen, water, snacks, etc. much cheaper there. Sales people weren't too pushy and never touched you or shoved things in your hands. Also there weren't any people begging, or selling things on the beach, which was nice. Other Comments: 1. Bring bug spray! It is a tropical climate and there are a lot of bugs in the evening. 2. Carboncitos was a nice restaurant - had the vegetarian tacos w/ cheese, very good! 3. We used the ATM at the cancun airport in Terminal 3, just outside the bathrooms when entering Cancun to get pesos for the trip. When we got home the card was frozen, it had been compromised by someone trying to take money out elsewhere in MX : ( It was not a pleasant surprise after such a nice trip. Next time we'll order pesos at our bank before going and only use the card as an emergency back up.

Reviews.Title: “terrible communication from wedding coordinator”
Reviews.Author: smattes82
Reviews.Content: just wanted to write a quick note about our experience with Mahekal. My fiance and I planned a scouting trip to playa del carmen and wanted to tour Mahekal as a potential wedding site. I asked them around 2 weeks in advance for a tour and meeting with a wedding coordinator and we never heard back from them! I wrote 2 follow up emails letting them know I hadn't heard from anyone and still no one responded. We went to playa del carmen and back (without going to Mahekal) and around 5 days after getting back (around 3 weeks after writing my initial email) I get an email from Ayahamint Aguirre, Wedding & Sales Coordinator asking if I had received her last 3 emails. I said, of course not since I've sent you multiple emails asking for someone to respond. I asked her to resend her original emails, and I haven't heard back from her. I checked my junk and spam folders, nothing. That was around a week ago. Even if she did try to send those original emails, (which i highly doubt) something is wrong with their system or internet. Just wanted to let potential wedding couples know the difficulty they may be in for trying to communicate with the wedding coordinator. After this frustration, I could never give them the chance to be our wedding location.

Reviews.Title: “Well done...”
Reviews.Author: GETAGRIPNYC
Reviews.Content: its on the mellow end of playa del carmen. Nicely done lobby, well maintained grounds, nice pool and bar. I stayed in a garden publeto, it was comfortable and simple with nice bathroom, high ceilings, simple furnishings. cool private patio with a hammock. I wanted to move to a room on the beach but they were all booked. If you enjoy the simplicity of tulum, you will like the rooms and the resort. If you need a TV and a chain hotel vibe, its not for you. The food was good, simple and fresh and the restaurants around the hotel were the best in the area. The staff was helpful, non-intrusive and multi-lingual which was helpful b/c many of the other guests were French... I had a totally chill long weekend. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: MexTraveller99
Reviews.Content: Agree with what everyone has said before - this is a beautiful place to unplug and enjoy a relaxing beach vacation. Gorgeous property on one of the nicest beaches in Mexico. One caveat - get the best room you possibly can. Our first 'Ocean View' room had no ocean view whatsoever, was right next to the bar and pool, and had an unpleasant smell. Late night negotiations went nowhere, but we went in the next day and were moved to a true Ocean View room - our own beautiful little cottage actually. Same room category and price! We saw other people doing the same thing next day - don't stick with the first room you get if you aren't happy. Definitely stay close to the ocean - it makes an incredible difference in your experience here even though it's a small place.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magical Mahekal”
Reviews.Author: PatMedart
Reviews.Content: We love Playa and this was our second trip to this resort town. Mahekal is in a great location. It is far enough north on the beach that the beachfront is not overly crowded, yet it is close enough to the shopping strip that you can walk. The staff is lovely and the resort is very clean and safe. We stayed close to the beach but not directly on the beach which was ideal. We could sit on our porch and watch the ocean and the pool yet had privacy that the beachfront apartments did not. Breakfast was always nice. Dinners were good but it is a buffet. A buffet would have been ok a couple of nights but not every night. Internet access is localized to the bar and registration area. The pools are pretty but not big. If you want laid back luxury, a nice location and a pleasant experience, this is the place in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bipper
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks at Mahekal and had the time of my life. Wonderful hotel and great beach. The hotel is just as great as the reviews on Tripadvisor says, and I would love to come back some time. Tips: Rent a fridge in the reception - 5 US dollars pr. day Borrow a hair dryer for free in reception (or bring your own, it's pretty basic) If you need to leave early in the morning before breakfast is ready (7.30), ask reception to prepare something for you. They are happy to do this. you will get a ham and cheese sandwich, a banana, a small youghurt and chocolate milk. Take a taxi to Mega and get everything you need from groceries, to toiletries, batteries, water, etc. Mega is much better than wallmarts which is right next door. The taxi is 34 pesos. Walking would probably take more than 30 minutes and you might not like the look of some of the streets. The hotel recommends that you take a taxi when you go to Quinta Avenida (5th Avenue, the main strip in Play). this is not necessary, just go left when you exit the hotel and Quinta is the first street you meet. The further down you get, the more happens. Lots of bars, restaurants and souvenir shops. The hotel is located on Calle 38. There are a few nice restaurants and a good hammock shop on this street near the hotel. Quite charming area, actually. very unlike Quinta. There is a mini supermarket (quite dirty and not very nice) on the corner of Calle 38 and Quinta. If you continue down Calle 38 to the next corner you will get to Oxxo. this is also a mini supermarket and much nicer. Some kind of chain. it has an ATM inside. Nice to know: the beach is beautiful and the water wonderfull. however, be aware that it is a very very busy beach (in february). There is plenty of space and loungers on the hotel section of the beach but in front of this is the public section. here you will see large mexican families, large groups of young people hanging out and having fun, and many many tourists from nearby hotels without beach. There is also massive water sports actions - jetskies, parasailing, banana boats, fishing boats, speed boats, etc. Not very tranquil. Finally, there is a constant stream up and down the beach of joggers, walkers, etc taking pictures and videofilming. It did not ruin my experience, just don't expect to feel alone/private. there is also a beach club south of Mahekal. if the wind is in the wrong direction, you can hear the techno music. Choice of accommodation: We opted for the Seaview rooms and that was perfect for us. The rooms directly on the beach have the best views of course and is only a few meters from the edge of the water. but they also have no privacy. So be prepared to be filmed and ogled while sitting there. The wind is also very strong and cooling. Nice when you are in the sun but too cold for me when you are in the shade. We had a nice view but also shelter from the wind - number 31B. The downside was the proximity to the pool area and the bar. I would not recommend getting a ground floor room - again because you have no privacy. The first floor rooms feels very private. Well, I coud go on and on and really I can only give my warmest recommendation. If you have any questions, just write and I will help if I can. Regards Birgitte

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: williamtaylor39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place years ago when it was called Shangri-La. It is under new management. Clean as a whistle, really helpful totally friendly staff and the food is now excellent! If you want an good old time place in a beautiful non commercial setting close to town then this is it. We opted to have lunch and breakfast and have dinners in town. Playa certainly has changed and it is full of half empty and half built condos but Mahekal is just about perfect. A peaceful enclave with lots happening up and down the beach and in the nearby town.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel without all the hype”
Reviews.Author: radams006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay at the Mahekal. We had an Ocean Front room that was literally 10 paces from the water. Large deck with hammocks were wonderful. The first night there was a wedding, so it was very loud until 1am, but every night after that was absolutely perfect. We actually didn't miss not having a TV or phone. I brought my Ipad and we watch a movie on it 2 nights. Breakfasts and lunches were very good. Best part is the fresh squeezed OJ! Dinners were average, but we went out most nights. Two great resturants right up 38th - Piola (great wood fired pizza) and Origenes were both excellent. There are 2 pools. The one by the ocean was much nicer with less young children in it each day. Rooms are thoroughly cleaned each day, but we did have some ants each day. I guess that's a trade off for being steps from the ocean. By far the service award goes to Jose the Bellhop. He was genuinely friendly and had a smile we won't soon forget. Location to 5th ave. was perfect. Far enough to get away from the crowds, but within walking distance. Security was outstanding. We had security guards walking our beach every night - all night. The only reason I don't give Mahekal 5 stars is the price for what you get. Close to $400 per night was a bit high for the rustic atmosphere that you experience here, but all-in-all a great hotel with good service and a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal okay, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: adamnewcastle1
Reviews.Content: We went to Cancun in October and stated at the Le Meridien. To compare the hotels is not entirely fair as the Le Meridien is a fancy full service hotel and the Mahekal is a bit more primitive. The Mahekal theme is primitive, no tv's, no phone, no clock, etc. That is all fine on paper but in our opinion for a hotel that lacks those things should be less expensive. They market their higher price being due to the included food. But unless you really enjoy buffets and very similar food for every meal you will want to wonder off resort to mix it up. Only other interesting things was the beach blanket situation. They make you initial next to your name when you check in, but they do not elaborate on why you are doing so. But if you leave your beach blanket on the beach they inform you that there is a $50 USD charge to get another one. I guess beach blankets are very rare in Playa Del Carmen. Overal we liked it, locals very nice, felt safe in town and didn't have any problems with the water. On a positive note the beach was great, although a bit more attention could have been paid cleaning up the garage on the beach, perhaps this is because it was a public beach, but we didn't run into as much trash on the beach at the Le Meridien. But if we were to do it again we would prefer going back to Cancun and staying at the Le Meridien.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mmorto001
Reviews.Content: The mahekal was perfect from beginning to the end. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was perfect. We selected oceanview and we were on the 2nd floor. The balcony was HUGE. The room was great, king size bed. The beach was secluded. The food was okay. We never ate dinner there just breakfast. It was nice having breakfast ready for us every morning. The bar was fine. It was nice to have the internet available if you needed it. As far as location this resort is perfect. It was a couple of blocks away from 5th ave which was fine. I would take that walk over being ran over by people and not be secluded. Trust me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best place for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: K8Cruz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mahekal last October for our honeymoon. Our time there could not have been more perfect. The grounds are breathtaking, the staff is incredibly accommodating and kind, the food is terrific, and the rooms are great. Mahekal is full of charm and was exactly what we were looking for. It was an intimate experience and we will absolutely be back. Our second floor room was immaculate and cleaned by the nicest people every day. We just loved swaying in our hammocks, reading at night. I read one post that laptops didn’t fit in the safes but we had no problem getting our rather large Gateway laptop safely inside. That being said, we never felt the need to use the safe as the property is very secure. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning. The fresh fruits were always delectable and their molletes are to die for! Not surprisingly, the waiters were all tremendously helpful and accommodating with our “spanglish.” Sitting at a table next to the window looking out over the ocean – it is a scene I reminisce about often. We never had a problem getting a palapa on the beach and neither pool was ever crowded or loud. We went to happy hour at the bar a few times – really incredible deals and a wonderful atmosphere. Our concierge, Ignacio, was tremendously helpful. He arranged a few trips for us when we asked and gave us his honest opinions about places to visit when we wanted to go on our own (definitely check out the Cristalino Cenote if you have time). We very much liked being on the outskirts of Playa del Carmen. It was quiet all the time. Getting to the center of town takes moments, literally.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great atmosphere, great beach”
Reviews.Author: nbk13
Reviews.Content: Mahekal gives you a perfect balance between the beach and the city. You are right next to 5th avenue, so there is no need to rent a car if you plan on going on daily trips and just staying in playa del carmen. Many daily tours provide transportation anyways. The beach was great. It is the best spot really, all the way at the end, far away from all the loud and crowded areas, but still very short walking distance the center. At times, it smelled like seaweed intensely, but not very often. The sand, and the water was amazing. The service is incredible. Everyone is very helpful and friendly. Boli, the concierge helped us a lot with tours, and renting a car. I really recommend taking his advise. Our room was right next to a construction so we couldn't sleep well the first morning, then they moved us into a different room. Make sure your room is not next to a construction area when you are booking. The partial ocean view rooms didn't seem nice at all. We were at the pueblitos, they are the cheapest but I think they are the second best to ocean front. all the others are too close next to each other, all you see is some view of the ocean next to concrete. Don't complain that it smells like mold. It will. You are in the tropical climate, and it's humid. You can drink 2 margaritas for 4$ at happy hour! :) There is no wi-fi in the rooms or restaurants. It's only at the lobby and the bar. Breakfast is great. Fresh squeezed OJ. The other meals get too repetitive, they need more variety. If you have more than 5 days, I really recommend spending a few days at Tulum. If you are interested in the culture and history of the area, spend a night at Valladolid on your way back from Chichen Itza.

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is a beautiful Caribbean getaway, hassle free with excellent services”
Reviews.Author: kyElaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our time at Mahekal. We are return guests. The property continues to be clean, well manicured and beautiful. The reception, staff, services, meals, atmosphere, etc. all fantastic. And, oh the Sunday night Mexican buffet makes for a fun evening. We plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelByDotty
Reviews.Content: If you would like to go to a quiet, beautiful place on the beach this is perfect. You can choose to stay right on the beach - or back in the gardens. The staff is incredible - everyone wants you to have a great time. If you want a place that has TV's, phones, nightly shows etc. - don't go here. This is paradise at its finest!

Reviews.Title: “Breathless, unforgettable, the best ever”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon201009
Reviews.Content: Mahekal is the best place, where we have ever stayed. The resort is near by the Caribbean see, just some steps from the turquoise water. If you are lucky, you have a panoramic view to the sea from your bed. The staff is very friendly and helpful with good English, and they have all of information about each sights. We spent there our honeymoon, and we received a very nice welcome gift on the first day. The restaurant is also perfect with wide variety of delicious national and international food and drink speciality. You can absolutely relax here without TV and telephone ring in your room, you only have to enjoy the relaxing wave of the sea. If you wish to have some excursion, you can choose from many programmes, e.g. delphin discovery, snorkeling and scuba-diving, adventure park. We make you sure, you will never bore in Mahekal and if you have already been there, you want to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal was everything we wanted and more!”
Reviews.Author: inevittable
Reviews.Content: I went for a week to Mahekal with two friends. We're in our mid to late-20's and were looking for a cheaper place on the beach in Playa. We got a great deal on a Garden View Caribe room from expedia.com, but we had no idea what a great place it would be. Mahekal is a great place if you're looking for a great hotel that emphasizes the beauty of where you are. The hotel is made up of individual bungalow style rooms that have only what you need: a bed, a desk, and a bathroom. Thatched roofs and porches with hammocks complete the perfect setting for a beach getaway. The private beach has tons of chairs and palapas and you get fresh towels every day. The staff is beyond friendly and helpful. (Ignacio) Boli was friendly and hooked us up with a great private snorkeling tour and a tour of Chichen Itza. Nyx provided great restaurant suggestions, and the rest of the housekeeping, bartenders, and everybody else were always happy to see you. The location is about a 5-10 minute walk to 5th Ave, the main drag of Playa. The walk is well lit and we never felt unsafe. Even closer is a small bodega with cheap water/beer so you can fill up. Playa has so much to do and so much to see that we could have used another two weeks there! Free wi-fi in the lobby and bar area, free bottle of water in the AM, and 2x1 happy hour from 5-6pm every night completed the perfect vacation. The only thing we wished the hotel had was a small fridge in the room to keep extra food/water/beer. They are in the process of remodeling every room and the restaurants in the hotel, so there is a bit of construction, but it really wasn't a problem. The rooms could use a bit of updating, as our bathroom looked a little worn (e.g. the mirror was a bit rusted and the bathroom looked like it could have used a refreshing touch up). However, I think it's clear that our room hadn't yet been updated. There wasn't much sound insulation in our room, so expect to be woken up (if you're a light sleeper) to the sounds of tropical birds early in the morning, but by that point you should be out on the beach or exploring anyway! A word of warning - if you're looking for a fancy hotel with internet, tvs, and other amenities, don't come here. BUT, if you're looking for a beautiful hotel in the best setting (when we were picked up for our tour of Chichen Itza, all the other guests commented on how nice our hotel was - they were definitely jealous!) in Playa del Carmen, book a room immediately and stay for as long as possible! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Mahekal!”
Reviews.Author: Beaverto
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mahekal. Had a "beach view" room on the 2nd floor. It was great!. Good beach view and could here the ocean all night long. The staff were excellent everywhere at the resort. Restaurant overlooks pool and ocean, great view. Good breakfast which included fruit, juice, rolls, hasbrowns and sausage. They cook to order eggs, omletes, french toast and a variety of Mexican egg dishes. Only ate dinner once at the resort which was ok. Like the last reviewer didn't really like the coffee to much, not out of the ordinary outside the US. The rooms are sparse but clean, no TV or couch in the room, which I knew before I went. There was a hairdryer and safe.There was also AC. The bed was comfortable to me, firm matress and soft pillows, had a deck with chairs and hamocks. I stay in hotels at least 100 days per year and this was exacty what I was looking for. Not an all inclusive or regular type hotel room. The location to me could not have been better. We walked the entire beach and I thought this resort had the best location look and overall feel. North end of town. The beach is not as crowded and yet only a few blocks from 5th ave and a ton of restaurants etc, could not have been better. The bar has 2 for 1 drinks 5-6pm. If you are looking for the lap of luxary type room it may not be for you. But for us it was exactly what we wanted! We ate at around 6 restaurants in the area, hit and miss. My favorite was the Argentinian restaurant at the corner of 32nd and 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “great beach front”
Reviews.Author: drchrisf
Reviews.Content: this place has no frills. No TV, no radio, no clock, and yes no heated pool. What it does have is a very unique set up. They have 9 ocean front bungalows that are right on the beach. There is nothing else like it in all of Playa. It is well worth the extra money to be able to drink a bottle of wine on your front deck in a hammock at sun set. Or have your kids play in the sand and water right in front of you. The breakfast is included. They serve fresh fruit and it is good (coffee not so good). They include breakfast and a choice of lunch or dinner. I would choose lunch because it is better. Go out at night to some of the great local restaurants. My family has been to this hotel over the Christmas break 3 years in a row. The Cyan ha dive shop is on site and very good. The water temp is 78 degrees . The diving off of Playa is as good as Cozumel. A dive in a cenote is well worth it. The hotel is on the northern part of Playa away from fishing boats and crowds. The beach is wodnerful with locals always out in force. This hotel if very casual you can walk all over with bare feet and no shirt. Drink prices are very reasonable. This place creates an exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: snlpacific
Reviews.Content: The resort is simple and beautiful. We were supposed to have an ocean view room, which was a bit deceiving as we were infront of the ocean but in a bit of a sandpit that really didn't allow for any ocean view. We asked to be switched to another room, which none were available, so we asked again the next day and my husband was taken to 4 different available rooms later in the day and was allowed to choose the one he wanted. This in my opinion was over and above what we were expecting and we were happy with our choices. The rooms are very basic. No TV, no phone, no wireless access ( it is available in the lobby at no charge), we didnt miss any of this at all as the sound of the ocean was lovely. Beds were ok and AC worked great. We had a bit of a problem with those little sand ants or whatever they are, in our bathroom and coming in under the front door. They managed to get into our suit cases too, so dont leave suitcases on the floor. Maid service was GREAT! They made cute animals out of the towels for our kids and placed their teddy bears next to them to the delight of our kids. AWESOME. However, most inconvenient was that there was no mini fridge, cooler or ice machine in or around the room. With 2 small children in such a hot environment, they need water alot as they tend to get burned, dehydrated and get sun stroke very easily. Water at the resort was VERY expensive as was ice. Even if you do buy ice, which we did once, there is no where to keep it! So my husband went up the road to a convenience store and brought back ice and a styrofoam cooler. That was OK, but the ice didnt last long in there either. Really if you want to keep a few cold beverages in your room you are kind of hooped. And going up to the store to keep buying ice was insane. That being said, the breakfasts at the resort were awesome. Great selection, great service, again paying for water. Dinner was also included in our stay but I admit we only ate there a few times.We found the dinner menu to not have much that was appealing to our kids, but they did have the salad bar. It wasn't that great for us either . We found it VERY difficult to find any authentic mexican food, not even any tacos or fresh salsa anywhere to be found, which was pretty disappointing. Overall I would definitely stay at this resort again. It is beautiful and quiet. We were happy to return to our cabana after visiting friends a a big resort down the beach that had music blaring day and night. However, a decent cooler/mini fridge and access to an ice machine is a must unless you like to drink warm beers, warm water and prefer your rum and cokes warm with no ice. Which we really don't.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Christmas at Mahekal.”
Reviews.Author: hampdenLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2nd Christmas visit to the Mahekal Resort. It's location is great because it's just a five minute walk to the town but even more importantly it's beach is one of the best in Playa and not very crowded. The first time we visited it was just my wife and I. This time we brought along our brother and sister in laws who had an 8 month old baby. This changed the perception of the hotel slightly. For people coming to this hotel with infants you must be aware there is no way to heat water in the hotel room and the hotel bar cannot always do it. i would recommend buying a device to heat water if you have a small child. The staff continues to be friendly and welcoming as in our previous visit. The hotel allows you to change your dinner to a lunch if you notify them by 1230pm. One of the few issues with the hotel is the lunch service. It is very slow. Expect lunch to arrive on average 50 minutes after you order it during the high season. These were the only issues that came up. Rooms are clean. We had ocean view rooms which we were happy with. 22B upstairs and 22A downstairs. Prices of drinks were very affordable and happy hour 2 for 1 drinks were very popular as well. Overall it's a great place to stay, especially with a family.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience!"”
Reviews.Author: Jrankin
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this resort, including a stay a few uears ago when it was still Shangri-la Caribe. I usually hate to go back to the same place twice, but after 6 days at Christmas, I was glad I did. There are a few things that make this resort unique among the many in the area. First, it has a fantastic location, as you can walk easily from the hotel to many good restaurants, shops, beach clubs, water sports and (it sounds like a negative, but I was happy to have it - Starbucks!). Yet, the resort still feels small, removed, and in touch with nature. It's great to be able to leave for an hour or two to get lunch/dinner, shop or just explore without needing to make complicated arrangements or drive to an "attraction". We chose to explore our restaurants at lunch (Cuerva de Chango, Origines, and a beach club to teh north that had great food), but the town has a lot of night life as well. Second, the rooms are about the closest you can get to the beach anywhere except in Tulum. We had an oceanfront room - Playa - and I could see the water break on shore from my bed, and sitting on the porch was as good as being on the beach. Third, although very simple, the resort seems to attract a relatively sophisticated crowd (we heard all kinds of languages!) many of whom are repeat clients who vist every year. There was a nice mix of couples, families and and other groupings. As described, the rooms are very plain with no TV, radio or clock, and visitors seem to like it this way! We saw families chatting, playing games, reading etc and all seemed very content. I might suggest a laptop with a few movies to avoid technology withdrawal, though! Fourth, since the resort is "in town", there is a chance to interact with locals of all types, and watch a facinating parade of people up and down the beach. I do miss a few of the luxuries, but the atmosphere (and relatively good price) probably would not be the same if they were added. Jorge and Rogelio took great care of us at each meal, and were patient and cheerful with our requests and attemts at conversation in Spanish! All in all, a very sucessful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Mahekal, lives up to it's name!!!”
Reviews.Author: LPBJ
Reviews.Content: where do I start... After staying for 10 days here this is the only place I would recommend to stay, from the minute we arrived the staff greeted and couldn't do enough for us. We had such a great time and all the staff were so friendly. We stayed in an ocean view room which gave us the opportunity to watch the sunrise most mornings. Accommodation included breakfast and either a lunch or dinner which worked out well as it gave us a great chance to experience and adventure out into 5th Avenue and (highly recommend Piola just up the road). All the meals we had at Mahekal were substantial portions and in the evenings of the nights we had dinner the service was professional. The lunch menu has a great variety which is great for kids. Each room includes 2 hammocks on which you can use at your leisure, the rooms are cleaned and well looked after. Drinking water is provided for you each day. Although there was 4 of us, a bungalow room is quite small for 4 so would either recommend 2 rooms or ask for a slightly larger room if they are available. One of the days it was my birthday and my husband and the kids asked Ignacio (concierge) if they could set up a suprise in our room and the staff set up our room with balloons, streamers and a beautiful fresh fruit basket. It made my birthday very special!! Thank you to all the wonderful staff for making our stay so special you truely all made our holiday very special and have already recommended this to many friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go again in a hearbeat”
Reviews.Author: Nan999
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot Americans without much travel experience. The beach is great and there are two meals included in the room rate. A WONDERFUL restaurant across the street "Origenes," means you don't even have to venture out into the lovely real world of Playa del Carmen before you've had a chance to study your phrase book... Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly - not your standard hotel-chain”
Reviews.Author: DawnB_ChicagoArea
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart David and I spent 5 lovely days and 4 lovely nights at Mahekal Beach Resort. I can not find enough words to praise the staff and management of this small piece of heaven! We left Chicago on a snowy morning, and arrived at the Cancun airport to 80 degrees and sun. The driver from Mahekal was there to meet us, even though the plane had been delayed for over an hour. After a 35 minute drive to the resort, we found our reservation was in perfect order and our beachfront bungalow was ready for us. I took some deep breaths of the sea air, felt the sand between my toes, and our short vacation began with some unwinding at Happy Hour at the Casa Club. Vicente, the bartender, knew our names when we gave our numero de habitation. Dinner that night at La Loma Restaurant, with great variety in the included meal plan, plus other options, was delicious. And that was the way things went for the next 4 days. The staff made it their job to know everyone by name, to remember what they like, and to be so friendly and accommodating that I felt like I was among good friends. Breakfast at the Aventura Restaurant is a wonderful spread of fresh fruit, deli meat and cheese, juices, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, granola, pastries, plus eggs cooked to order, pancakes or French toast, and lots of coffee! Can you tell I love to eat? I would call the cuisine at Mahekal Beach Resort “metro-Mexican,” a delightfully tasty mix of Mexican and Mayan flavors, plus much, much more, to satisfy most palates. It certainly satisfied mine! The resort is set up like a village of cabanas, connected with sidewalks but surrounded by pristine white sand. The landscaping is lush and colorful, giving the property a woodsy feel, and is meticulously maintained. I felt relaxed just walking around the various property locations, because of the natural beauty, and the pathways are well-lighted at night for security. Our cabana was much more than we expected. Spacious, with very comfortable beds, an enormous tub and a great shower, toiletries and a hair dryer, lots of bath towels and beach towels, air conditioning and a ceiling fan, and hammocks on the front porch. And housekeeping was just excellent. Our front door was 25 yards from the water’s edge. Each cabana has the added amenity of an outdoor rinse faucet next to the porch, so you can avoid tracking sand in with you. What a great touch! Then there is the beautiful, beautiful beach, with great swimming, sunning, people-watching, walking or running, and a dive shop right on the beach, with equipment for snorkeling and scuba. Just feeling the sun in December is so incredibly therapeutic to us northerners. Yes, I used lots of sunscreen. Mahekal is kid-friendly, with 2 beautiful pools in addition to the beach. The Casa Club has ping-pong and billiards, tv and a computer for client usage, and is a wireless hot spot. Mahekal is located just a few blocks from Playa del Carmen’s 5th Avenue, and about 3 blocks north of the main tourist district with its fun shopping and restaurants. And of course, there are many off-site activities for families, and a little internet research in advance can get you discounted tickets to the local theme parks. We enjoyed a day at Xcaret. But for me, the relaxation of the feel of the sand and the sound of the surf was the best, and the pampering of the wonderful staff of Mahekal was as warm as the sun. Thank you to Elizabeth for her attention, to Rogelio for bringing out the sun, to Vicente for his masterful margaritas, to Manuel and Ivan and all the others whose names I am sorry to have forgotten. I hope to bring my 2 daughters back for their college graduation presents in a couple of year, and start a second generation of love for Mexico and for this location. I expect to be back to Mahekal before then!

Reviews.Title: “total ripoff”
Reviews.Author: lilynmaro
Reviews.Content: I paid for a ocean view room expecting a beach house with some class since it was a 4 star hotel. what i got was a room with no phone no t.v. and absolutely no perks of a 4 star hotel. there is absolutely no 4 star service in this place. you are basically on your own after you check in. i wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless they really wanted to pay $250 to stay next to the beach with an uncomfortable bed and a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if u want to stay in a room with no tv and phone.”
Reviews.Author: Tpass
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the ocean view room and there is nothing in the room. Basically u sacrifice the ups of a 4 Star hotel to be next to the beach

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Beach Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jnebra
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great "castaway" hotel, the Mahekal Beach Resort in Playa del Carmen. What a great experience! Was upgraded for free to a Penthouse accomodations just steps away from the shimmering Caribbean Sea. The room was cooled nightly by ocean breezes along with two ceiling fans. The offwhite drapes billowed at night to help lull me to sleep, creating a true tropical getaway environment. Two meals were included each day with good food and faster than usual service. In the morning coffee was offered, as I ran around shooting pictures of purple, blue and gold sunrises--pure bliss for the romantic at heart. Two pools were embedded in the jungle sands amidst lush, exotic foliage. Never have I ever seen a more relaxed or beautiful setting for a vacation that was relaxed and renewing. A very mixed group of people which was fine for all. Not many children because this resort is more geared for adults to unwind. The views from the resort of the aquamarine sea were unparalleled to many other places I have stayed at over the years. Very friendly staff who gave everyone space. Constant maintenance of the grounds keep the Mahekal at the top. I walked all around town and the tiny, noisy hotels that cost more could not even come close to what was offered here just a few blocks from Fifth Avenue. The rooms are in palapa huts with rustic woodwork but with an upscale twist that makes them look like what Tarzan would live in if he had some dough. Pool tables, ping pong, happy hour, ceramic painting, I could go on and on with the offerings and yet this place is very laid back and quiet. If you are tired of the slick, all-inclusive, non-stop noisy atmosphere of the larger complexes, then kick back here--you will not regret it ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Wedding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Macwizard
Reviews.Content: I am an extremely detailed, type A personality so you can imagine my trepidation in planning a destination wedding from the U.S. Urs, the wedding coordinator, made the entire wedding planning experience a joy and easy. I bombarded him with questions throughout the year. He always responded promptly and worked with me on every single dream I had for the wedding. I am forever grateful for his expertise, easy-going personality, and kindness. Once we arrived in Mexico, Urs's professionalism and warmth continued. In fact, every single employee at the Mahekal was absolutely outstanding. As our 130 guests began to pour into the resort, every single guest felt welcome and comfortable because of the Mahekal staff. The Mahekal provided a heavenly experience for me, my husband, and our guests. A gorgeous beach is easy to find, but a small resort with the perfect combination of warm surroundings, friendly staff, and excellent service and food is much more difficult to come by. What the Mahekal provides is truly paradise. I am extremely blessed to have been married at this amazing resort.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking...”
Reviews.Author: mimigidget
Reviews.Content: that's all I can say about the hotel and its location! My family has visited every summer for the past 6 years and they've enjoyed it every time. July 4th weekend was my first visit! It was very relaxing and the service is impeccable. I'm not one for beaches so I won't be visiting again, BUT I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is Magical”
Reviews.Author: Lesliesu123
Reviews.Content: If you are searching in Playa del Carmen for a place to stay...search no further...this is your SPOT! Mahekal is a small beach front resort located in Playa del Carmen. Each palapa style room at Mahekal is unique and has a terrace or porch area with Mexican style hammocks for total relaxation. There are a variety of rooms to choose from, ocean front, penthouse, ocean view and garden view. The rooms are spacious with ceiling fans and air conditioners...each bathroom designed with unique colorful Mexican tiles. Each palapa style building has 2 guest accomodations-upstairs or down. Mahekal is a place to relax and get away from it all so rooms do not have televisions, radios/alarmclocks or telephones. If you're looking for this...go to a BIG all inclusive and enjoy time spent in your room! Mahekal offers a MAP food plan which includes breakfast and lunch or dinner. It is well worth it to choose this option. Breakfast is served in Adventura restaurant each morning with a buffet style array of fresh fruits, juices, cereals, yogurt, oatmeal, cereals, breakfast danishes and of course coffee. In addition you can order an omlette, french toast or other items from the breakfast menu...all part of the MAP plan. You can choose to eat lunch or dinner as part of the plan...swapping them out if you so choose. Each day's menu is posted at the reception area so you can make an informed decision. Drinks (alcohol or otherwise) are NOT included in the MAP plan. Dinner is also served buffet style most nights and the menu is varied with something for everyone. There is usually fresh fish, poultry, pork and plenty of veggies to choose from. If you prefer to swap lunch for dinner, a typical lunch menu is provided with everything from tacos and hamburgers to club sandwiches and pasta. I was always able to find something that I liked each day from the dinner or lunch offerings. Mahekal also has happy hour each day at the Tiki Bar complete with billiard and ping pong tables and swings where you can sit and sip your favorite cool drink. The beach is gorgeous at Mahekal. Palapas and lounge chairs are ready and waiting your arrival to shade you from the heat of the day. Each guest is provided with a beach towel which can be exchanged daily for a fresh one. All of the staff is wonderful at Mahekal (Pedro is my favorite) from the waitstaff, grounds keepers to the maids, each and every employee at Mahekal is proud of the resort and it shows in their attitude and the way each guest is treated! Something that is not advertised at the resort is that you can rent ($5 per day) a dorm style refrigerator during your stay which I found most helpful! There is a small mini super store at the end of the street where you can find snacks, juices, sodas and most anything you might need. Of course Mahekal has a gift shop with various sundries the resort offers drinks as well at the bar or as you lounge on the beach. A short walk down the beach or street is the famous 5th Avenue with hundreds of shops and restaurants to suit any style or budget. A must visit! You will love all that Avenue 5 has to offer! I have traveled all over the Caribbean and the Yucatan and I have to say that Mahekal is perhaps one of the nicest places I have ever been. You will not be disappointed in any way! Enjoy your trip and enjoy the MAGIC of Mahekal Resort!

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing and naturally beautiful hotel on the Playa”
Reviews.Author: JSHOCKDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Mahekal for a week ending on October 2nd. This was our third visit to the resort and the 2nd in 2 years. This time we stayed in the Penthouse 30P and last year Beachfront 31P. Both rooms are fantastic with a simple beauty and comfort that the new resorts simply cannot duplicate. Beautiful grounds, a staff that go the distance to meet our every need, and the sights and sounds of the beach and water that is truly the stuff of dreams. The photographs of the resort on the web site is exactly what you can expect to find once you arrive. it can also be found on google earth for a different perspective. If there is an improvement that I would like to see, it is in the quality and variety of food. The breakfast is simple and filling. The lunch menu (which can be substituted for dinner with advance notice) has a better variety and is better prepared then breakfast or dinner. WE have always found it to be the best of the 3 meals available. The dinner offering/menu is only OK. To suggest that it is any more, is simply not true. That said, we both highly recommend Mahekal Beach Resort and have found the reviews on Tripadvisor to be accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation to it's finest!!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun98
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews before choosing this hotel. So, I feel that I knew what to expect when I got to this resort. If you expecting a luxury hotel room with all the amenities, you won't find it here. The rooms are very basic with a bed and desk. There is a full bathroom and central air conditioning. However, the windows open with wooden blinds and they are not sound proof in anyway. You get to listen to all the birds and wildlife as you wake up in the morning! We did find a few critters in our room but again this is a thatched roof room with screened windows. It heavy rains the thatch roofs do leak a little. We loved every minute of it as it was very peaceful and quiet. It was probably the most relaxed that I have been ever! We ate breakfast and lunch every day at the resort. The breakfast was ok. I have been to many other all inclusive resorts that had much better assortment at breakfast. As for the lunch, we found them to be wonderful! We walked to 5th Ave every night and at dinner there. Our dinners ranged from $25 to $120 depending upon where we ate. I would highly recommend Casa Mediterraneana. We spent about 60-70 for dinner at Casa (that is 2 dinners, 2 glasses of wine, 2 bottles of beer and dessert). From talking with other people at the resort, I understand that we did not miss anything with the dinners. Happy hour is every night at 5-6pm. The beers are $3.50 and the mixed drinks range from $4.50 and above. They do have wine there but i did not try it at the resort. Helpful Hints: 1. You can rent a refrigerator from the front desk for $5 a day (remember the rooms are very basic and do not come w/ a frig) 2. You can rent bikes to go into town for $4 an hour or $10 a day (don't quote me on these prices because we chose to walk) 3. You can rent boogie boards for the water for $4 an hour or $10 a day ( we did this and it was a blast). 4. Taxis - they cost about $3-5 to go into Playa del carmen. 5. To walk into Playa del Carmen - takes about 15 mintues to get into the "heart" of things 6. They have snorkel tours that leave from the beach in front of the resort for $25 per person - you leave at 1pm and get back at 3pm. Price includes snorkel equipment. Overall, I would go back to the Mahekal in a heartbeat! It is quit different than an all inclusive to be sure what you really want when you book this vacation. This resort is very very quiet with alot of relaxation. If you want activity and entertainment, I would suggest an all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “umm.no”
Reviews.Author: nyc41
Reviews.Content: OK..I'll start off my saying my fiance and I were soo excited to arrive at Mahekal as friends who stayed there years ago, RAVED about it. We arrive..to blank stares...not very welcoming at all. the food was just OK to be nice..and our room...a PREMIUM beach view room...terrible. the A/C didnt work and was soo humid..I felt even after showering.. dirty. The sheets felt wet...it was gross..oh and not to mention...some sort of rodents poo on our bed AFTER it was made up. I was looking forward to a place with a quiet beach..but be warned...Mahekal's adventuras side and caribe side was smack right in the middle of a public access beach so the beach was CROWDED. You see not many people in Mahekals beach chairs (as off season)..BUT inbetween those beach chairs and the actual beach..were TONS of locals, families..umbrellas (not belonging to any of the resorts nearby) oh and let me mention a day club call MAMITAS down the beach..where we had to basically step over some guy passed out on the beach with a beer in his hand. NOT this quiet, private beach I was envisioning AT ALL. We ended up checking out and going to another resort. SOOOO disappointed. So much for that wedding location we were hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Crescent Moon to Honeymoon to Full Moon”
Reviews.Author: nordie65
Reviews.Content: Mahekal (means Magical in Spanish)Beach Resort is truly that, a magical place. We arrived with high expectations. After nine days we departed at three in the morning with high expectations of returning asap. It was the whole enchilada. We stayed in 6 (p)laya, the penthouse overlooking the Mar De Caribe. If you want to get away, read lots of books, totally relax and forget about the world, this is the place. If your looking for a traditional hotel room with a frig, room service and elevator, this is not the place. Robinson Crusoe and Tarzan would love this place. We even got to hold and set free in the sea little newly born Sea Turtles.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort that still has a charm that other hotels don't!”
Reviews.Author: Sealbeachgirl713
Reviews.Content: The Mahekal (formerly the Shangri La) is an amazing resort without being ultra modern or flashy. The rooms are palapa style "huts" on the beach, with basic amenities, but you don't really need anything because the sea is right at your doorstep. The staff is very helpful and sweet, especially the activities director, Boli. The food at the restaurant is decent, although we prefer to try out the local restaurants rather than eat at the resort. There is just something special about the Mahekal--it truly is "magical"! If you can splurge, I would definitely recommend getting an ocean front room. Sitting on your patio in a hammock with a cold drink watching the waves crash only a few feet from you is the very best part of staying at the Mahekal!

Reviews.Title: “I cant explain how lovely it is!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nmimiya
Reviews.Content: It was my best vacation I ever had in my life. Me and now my Fiancé we went for vacation for six days. We had the best time ever. The resort is the best resort ever. All the food was excellent, the breakfast is delicious. The Dinner is fabulous esp. the day they have the Sunday Mexican Feast is best ever. The beach is gorgeous, the wave, blue water you don’t want to move around when where else. There is restaurant called origins right across the street from the resort. They have live band every night. The music is slow, and very romantic. MY boy friend now fiancé propose in that rst. It was very romantic and very emotional moment. The manger and the guys are the nicest people on earth. The rst have the best food, best MOIJTO, best Deseret. The other thing is shopping area and other rst in 5 the avenue which walking distant form the resort area. So it is one of my places I really want come and have a wonderful time. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach in Playa del Carmen...a few steps from your room.”
Reviews.Author: CityCountryMouse
Reviews.Content: We had a penthouse room. No critters, no sand in the room, large room with beautiful bathroom with Mexican tiles. Very comfortable bed (for us), clean room. No TV, radio or phone. If that bothers you, don't come to this place. Negatives for the penthouse room: third floor (if you have a disability or can't climb in the extreme heat, reconsider), a bat in the palapa.
