Otherwise great. Room rate (rather high) includes buffet breakfast and dinner. Pretty good food, great friendly service. Nice, small pools. The real pluses are the best beach in Playa, right there, food service on the beach....lovely landscaping...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it -once i got over the shock of just how basic the rooms were”
Reviews.Author: Scez79
Reviews.Content: I had booked this myself so was aware there were no phones or tvs, I had looked at pictures also but was surprised and probably disappointed at just how basic the room was. I don't know what I had expected, maybe a fridge, maybe newer curtains that blocked the morning sunlight out or maybe a thatch roof without so many obvious holes in it. But you actually don't need any of that and it encourages you to spend all your time out except for sleeping and showering. And the rooms were always beautifully cleaned. The staff were the best. Loved them. Definitely the highlight of all the places we visited during our trip. They were friendly and helpful and attentive but let their personality shine through. The beach was lovely and there were heaps of loungers so you never missed out. It was a short walk to 5th Avenue. The meals were pretty good, breakfast was great. Dinner was always pretty good too, we had a few lunchs at the resort and i was getting a bit over the lunch menu by the end. If I found myself back in PDC I would definitely stay at the Mahekal again.

Reviews.Title: “Not our style”
Reviews.Author: CAishome
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Mahekal after 5 nights in Tulum at the Cabanas La Luna (fabulous) and, wow, what a let down (for us) to come to Playa after an idyllic week in Tulum. This hotel is just average in our opinion, not sure where are the rave reviews are coming from. It was like an slightly upscale motel room, really, at $300/night for 'oceanview', which it did not have. Beach chairs not that comfortable (itchy fabric), drinks ok, but nothing like the great margaritas we had all week in Tulum at La Luna, and it was hot on the beach, too, in comparison to Tulum which is known for it's breezes which made being there in August totally do-able. I will say that the staff was friendly and accomodating. We decided when planning our trip to spend one night in Playa so our young adult daughters could 'play' a bit--but the town, to us, is way too tacky, honky-tonkish--not our style. And, compared to the beauty of Tulum, Playa (and the beach area in and around the town where this hotel sits) cannot compete. We did find in walking towards 5th Ave. area from hotel (not on beach, on streets) that this part of town seems to be going through an upscale-like renovation. We found a newly-opened wine bar called "Cava" just up the street from Mahekal that was great. Also, there was a cute coffee bar/lunch spot just 2 doors up from Cava that we had a nice breakfast at. And, must put in big thumbs up for Cafe Celine==yummy pattisserie on 5th Av as you walk towards town. We would love to go back to Tulum, but won't be back to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, food and location BUT terrible room!!!”
Reviews.Author: esl_7
Reviews.Content: we have come back to mehakel after 3 years , now with 2 young children (2 and 4 years old) last time we have been with one baby, and had a great time this time we were disappointed the food (even better this time!) , location and the beach are all great! really perfect location! and good service. but the room was terrible: too small (although we took a big room) just enough place for 2 beds and small table the flour was ceramic (last time it was wood) so it was very sleeper which was very difficult for us and for the children (you are all the time wet because you are actually on the beach) and a lot of animals! a lot of ants in the room, bugs and disgusting cockroaches! i know it is a place on the beach but still, you pay good money so you do not expect to meet a dead cockroach in the morning and in another day a flying cockroach in your room!!! So unfortunately, next time we will not return to this place

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal was Amazingly Magical..”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlpa1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mahekal for seven nights and it was honestly one of the best places we have ever visited on vacation. I had high expectations after reading the reviews here and other places and the resort and its staff did not disappoint. We arrived very early and our room wasn't yet ready. No problem. The staff invited us to change into our bathing suits and enjoy the property until the room was ready for us. They even greeted us with cool towels and water and took our bags so we could head to the beach. The beach at Mahekal is one of the best in Playa. It's wide, white sand is beautiful and the water is perfect for swimming because there is no rough reefs. There were always plenty of lounge chairs on the beach and we could always find a spot under the palapas. I personally preferred the caribe side. Yes, there is public beach access right at Mahekal, but it was no big deal. The beach never seemed crowded and the water was always way less crowded than areas south. We stayed in the pueblito garden section and our room was less then a two minute walk to the beach. It was quiet and tranquil there. We loved it. The only reason I would spend more money to upgrade our room was to take advantage of the ocean breeze. Back in the garden section all the lush tropical landscaping sorta steal the breeze :) Other than that our room looked the same as a beachfront unit i peeked into. In fact, I thought ours was nicer with a nicer headboard and more closet space. The rooms are basic but nice and comfortable. Our air conditioning was very cold and the ceiling fan made it feel down right frigid if we wanted it, so no problems there. It was always cleaned perfectly each day. The shower was open and big. Our room was very close to LaLoma where you eat dinner. Meals at Mehekal were excellent. Try the white fish...sooo good. In fact, try it all. We loved it, especially Mexican Fiesta night. The waiters are all really nice. Our favorites were Ivan and Juan. Brekfast was amazing with fresh fruit, cereals, pastries and made to order eggs, frensh toasts or pancakes. Mahekal even has a great lunch menu and u can eat right on the beach. So excellent. Drinks are cheap and happy hour features a 2 for 1 special...can't beat that. The resort is set up like a little mayan village with rooms in individual bungalows or two-story casitas. They all have their own porches with hammocks and little tables. I loved swinging on the hammock. One night I could hear music playing. It was so nice. Also this resort is close to the downtown, shopping area with restaraunts, stores, clubs, etc. You can walk or take a cab. It's also just a short cab ride to the collectivo stand that can take you to tulum, akumal, hidden worlds and several cenotes and other activities. The collectivo is way less expensive than a cab to these places and so easy to use. You can get to tulum and back for $6 a person instead of a $90 cab ride!! Anyway, back to Mahekal, the staff and the surrounding make this place so speacial. It's not like a big, impersonal super-all inclusive. The staff knows you and is very friendly and helpful. The vibe of ths hotel is very laid-back and really hosts a great mix of people from young couples and families. We met guests from around the world there. Everyone kinda of is just there doing there thing, enjoying the sights and sounds of the Caribbean. We loved it and highly recommend staying there. Thank you Mahekal for an amazing trip. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Heinen
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, queit, and clean. REALLY ON THE BEACH. Small resort with personable staff who seemed to sincerely like us. Very reasonable prices with good food. This is where to go to get away (no TV, phone, or in-room internet.) Great romantic get-a-way. Good response from staff for taxi and shuttle service. I felt like the staff was always on guard to protect us and never saw any "strange" persons walking about. I never felt taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Debrakadebra
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Mahekal followed by 3 nights at an all inclusive and our family (husband, me and our 20-year old daughter) all liked Mahekal much better. The people at the Mahekal are part of the reason, the other is the beautiful beach and the cute bungalo type rooms. We had the same waiter for most of our stay. His name was Juan and he was so sweet, friendly, and attentive. I felt like we were leaving a friend by the end of our stay. Boli at the concierge desk went above and beyond in helping us plan our activities--again, more like a friend. Vincenti at the bar was also the greatest. Location: perfect beach, uncrowded, hammocks on your private covered deck, nice jungle feel throughout the resort yet right at the ocean and close to downtown. The towel art that greeted us each day when we returned to our rooms was ADORABLE. I never thought we would get such a kick out of towel art! The lady at the front desk when we arrived was a bit uncommunicative but the one there as we were leaving was sweet as could be. It was quite a contrast when we moved to the all inclusive which was loud, crowded, impersonal and the beach was not nearly as nice. Mahekal was worth every penny, and we thought pretty reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal: Your home away from home--you are treated like royalty there!”
Reviews.Author: Kayaking-Flatwater
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation abroad. As such, I read and studied and reviewed others' input about Mahekal before booking it. Two friends joined us. They have many overseas experiences and affirmed the Mahekal decision was a good one. Where to start? 1. Service: The service by the wait staff was unmatched by anything in my 44 years of living. The wait staff consisted of local men who worked to calm every fear, service any need, and address any concern. The language barrier of English-Spanish was cheerfully met with patience and calmness to educate each other. My family befriended Rogelio and Ignacio (wait staff) throughout our stay. They were part of a class act at Mahekal. I have no bad reviews or negative comments to offer readers of this review. All of the folks at Mahekal were top notch but the wait staff were the ones with whom you interacted the most. 2. Rooms: The rooms give you a sense of ownership. They are simple cabana types structures with three important features: a comfortable bed, a cold air conditioner, and a shower. We expected a traditional room (like any chain hotel/motel) but that's not what Mahekal is about. If you find yourself wanting to stay in the room, you ain't living the experience. The room was secondary to the beach. We resorted to our rooms to sleep, get cleaned up quickly and head back out. For that the rooms were great. There are no TV's, no radios, no phones, no nada! You don't need, or want, all of that when you are there. The rooms are a place to sleep and get cleaned up. 3. Beach and Ocean: Awesome, incredible, missing it all ready, clean, seductive, and every other good word that goes with the beach experience. There are plenty of beach lounge chairs under palm trees. The salty air gives the edge you need to stay cool and comfortable. The people are beautiful, the sand is white, the water is blue, and the swimming is relaxing. 4. Security: There are several men dressed in professional uniforms who oversee the security of vacationers. I wasn't sure who they were at first, but I learned they are your version of community protectors. They watch over the beaches being mindful of your presence and needs while staying alert for any problems that may come to the beach and resort. Their presence is subdued by their ability to blend into the background, but it is appreciated because they truly watch out for the vacationers. No complaints from me about them. 5. Food at Mahekal: All inclusive? No! I made the decision to not go all inclusive when I weighed the cost and benefit. At Mahekal, you get two meals as part of your experience. Breakfast was awesome. They offer so much--it was great! The second meal could be either lunch or supper. We chose to make our second meal supper because the day was consumed with beach sitting or fulfilling other plans in Playa. The dining facilities are beautiful, well-kept, soothing, quiet with live music, and simply unparalleled in my experiences. You won't be disappointed. What does "Mahekal" mean? In our last day, we asked. The word "magical" is phonetically pronounced "mahekal" so the resort owners creatively named the resort "Mahekal" to match the phonetic sound while giving it a Mayan-name appearance. The experience matched the name--it was a magical visit. We will be going back for more. The Jones family (Cibolo, TX) and friends (San Antonio, TX).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendrobn
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this hotel. This was our first time to the Yucatan Peninsula. We used this trip as our last hoorah before our 2nd child is born.... so it was mostly just a relaxing time and we didn't go there planning on doing much of anything. A few things that you should know: There is no wifi in the rooms. If you want to connect ot the Internet you should go to the lobby or the swing bar. Breakfast and Dinner is included. If you want to switch your dinner to lunch, go to the main desk and ask to switch before 12:00. You can always eat lunch in the restaurant anyway, and just charge it to your room. Try the shrimp fajitas! You can also order lunch/drinks on the beach.. they have a waiter out there who will take your order. We took the ADO bus from the Cancun airport and a cab from the bus stop to the resort. Total was about $30. If you take a cab from the airport it's $90 and a shuttle will be $60. We arranged a cab through the hotel to get us back to the airport. We just went the day before and told them we wanted a cab to take us back to the airport. It was $45. The swimming pool near the breakfast area tends to be cooler because of the ocean breeze. We liked both pools, but during the hottest hours definitely use the pool with the ocean view. There are plenty of lounges with Palapas. You don't need to get there early to 'save one'. We didn't spring for an ocean view room, and didn't feel like we were missing out. It was about a 3 minute walk to the beach, and at 6 months pregnant, it was fine. It's about a 10 minute walk to 5th Ave. It's a long walk when it's really hot.. but when it cools down at night, it's not a problem. We took a cab to Walmart to get big jugs of water for the week. There are cabs waiting at Walmart to take you back to the hotel... so don't worry about transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LennyLovesSpaghetti
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and very unique place to stay. There were only a few minor flaws, but the overall charm of the resort more than make up for them. If you don't mind going without phone and TV, this is the place to be. I am a TV-Facebook addict and I did just fine without them for a week. Instead, I read a ton of books and just enjoyed the sounds of the ocean. You will never have a more beautiful view from your room. ROOM: We stayed in Casita 31P, which is a little more expensive than the other beachfront bungalows, but very much worth it for the location. We were directly on the beach. Walk off the cute deck (complete with hammocks and a table and chairs) and you are on the beach. The ocean is just yards away. You could not ask for a better view. Any closer and you'd be afraid a shark might eat you in your sleep. The bungalow was really neat. It has a super high thatched roof and is decorated with beautiful handpainted tiles throughout. The a/c works OK, but there are two fans which help out a bit. The bathroom is pretty, but not fancy. The sheets are scratchy. Other than that, it's perfect. BEACH: We had no trouble finding a palapa on the beach except our first day there when there was a wedding right in front of our bungalow. The locals come down on the beach, which would be fine, except they tend to sprawl out directly in front of the beach chairs and block the view. Luckily, they are only around on the weekend. The beach had a sulphur-ish smell certain days and if you walked a ways down the beach past the resort to the left, the smell was so bad it is vomit-inducing. Thankfully, it is only mild at the resort and occasional. The ocean was very warm, but it was not crystal clear like you'd see in Aruba. POOLS: The pools are nice when there are no kids in them. FOOD: Breakfast is like a buffet from your dreams. Fantastic. You have your choice of lunch or dinner. Lunch was a la carte and good. Dinner was good, although people seem to complain about it on here. I am a vegetarian and I always had something to eat on the dinner buffets. A few more options for vegetarians certainly wouldn't hurt. There was a cat that wandered around and begs off of you. She only likes meat. Give her bread and she'll turn her nose up at you! BAR: Drinks are good and cheap. Really cheap. Yeah! CHECK-IN: We got there after a long day of travel and were told our room wasn't ready, which ticked us off because it was after 3 p.m. check in and we had the most expensive bungalow. Plus, we were really tired. Someone checked out late so we didn't get into our room until after 4 which stunk. CELL PHONES: My husband's phone got no reception, but mine did. Make sure you authorize international calling before you leave though because I could receive calls but couldn't place them. LIZARDS: You see a few here and there but not as many as Aruba. DOWNTOWN: It is just a short walk. Like 5 minutes to the top of the main strip. The strip is so long you'll never walk it all and it is loaded with bars, restaurants and shops. After awhile you'll get really sick of the "Come look in my shop. Just browsing." And they even bug you to come in their restaurants which is odd. The restaurants were never busy and there is a delicious pizza shop called "That's Amore" I forced my husband to eat at three times. Also, there is a really beautiful shop full of authentic shells this American artist turned into light fixtures, called Maya-xel. BUGS: Mosquitos and other evil beasts are all over at night. Bring tons of bug spray. Like four bottles. Not kidding. TULUM: We loved our day trip to Tulum. Got a cab at the hotel and he waited for us for two hours to view the ruins -- and didn't charge a fee to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Mountainlover15
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 days at the Mahekal with family and I can tell you that it is the best hotel on the beach! My brother and I did extensive research on the internet before deciding on the Mahekal. Because it's the low season, we paid bargain prices. Of course, it's hurricane season, so we knew the risk, and sure enough, Tropical Storm Alex hit the beach the same day we arrived! But, regardless of the rain and wind for the first 3 days, we had a great time in the water, at the resort and around town and a lot of that was due to the incredible staff at the Mahekal. The resort has a very familial feel to it. I have travelled enough to foreign areas to know that things don't always look the same in real life as they do on the internet. The Mahekal looks just like the pictures on it's website. It is about a 45 minute taxi ride from the airport at Cancun. The resort is well kept, incredibly clean, has very friendly staff, excellent food with a nice selection...even some for vegetarians such as myself, good drinks, convenient location to the main strip for shopping, the most gorgeous stretch of beach in Playa, 24 hr. security around the resort and on the beach, a great concierge who will be glad to arrange tours for you and if you have any concerns, the front desk will do their best to take care of your needs with a warm smile. One thing to note...there are no T.V.'s in the rooms or phones, which we knew ahead of time. That didn't bother me, even through 3 days of drenching rain and wind from the tropical storm. If you like to read before bed, then bring a book! If you forget... like I did..there's a library in the lobby with many interesting novels left by previous visitors that you can borrow. The bungalows are unique and more natural than your usual hotel room, because of the palm thatched roof. The roof is quite tall and goes up to a peak, so you have a feeling of spaciousness. The floors are lovely ceramic tiles. The bathrooms have beautiful painted tiles in the showers. The towels are plush and new looking. The beds are clean and very comfortable. The windows are louvered wooden slats that you can open to let the nice breeze in. There are screens on the windows. There were no mosquitoes while we were there...perhaps because of the wind from the storm. There's also A/C in the rooms, if you prefer that and ceiling fans. There are 2 hammocks on each balcony. The resort provides a free, large bottle of drinking water everyday when they clean the room. You can buy more for $2.00 a bottle. The maids make cool towel sculptures each time they change your bed. There's a safe in the closet. There are 2 swimming pools that are clean with beautiful landscaping and the occasional iguana peeking out at you. You can eat breakfast and lunch at one of the resort restaurants that has a thatched roof and faces the beach with large, open windows. Tons of fresh fruit, cereal, croissants, sweet breads, yogurt, juices, oatmeal, sausages and more are at the breakfast buffet and you can order eggs, omelets, pancakes, etc.. We ate lunch out everyday and then ate dinner at the resort. There's a separate restaurant for the night meal that has a natural rain forest feel to it, surrounded by large palm trees and other landscaped vegetation. It has no walls, but a large thatched roof, ceramic tile floors, white table cloths, nice selection of food at the buffet or you can order from the menu, lovely music which is sometimes live, candlelight..very romantic feel to it. The Mahekal is the pearl of the beach. You will not be disappointed! P.S. Just F.Y.I...The only con of our trip that I would add has nothing to do with the Mahekal but sadly with our tour to Chichen Itza which is a 3 hour bus ride from Playa. I have seen other Mayan ruins and was looking forward to the tour, but there are so many vendors/gypsy types all over the site that they ruin the experience. It's hard to take a photo without someone trying to sell some tourist trinket to you. It would be fine if the vendors were corralled near the entrance, but they are free to go wherever they want, apparently, and there seems to be hundreds of them. I have heard that Coba is the better ruin to visit and it's only 45 minutes from Playa, which includes a stop at Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Our wonderful week at Mahekal Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaJo
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about Mexico and the Mahekal Beach Resort. Everyone we met there was friendly. It was nice being away from TV and computer. If you do bring a laptop there is computer access in the bar and lobby. Transportation to Hotel : We booked ahead with Cancun Transfers. I would recommend them. Paid with credit card when booking and tipped with US cash. Driver stopped along the way to the hotel so we could get a cold beer for the ride. [insert link] Mahekal Beach Resort: Beautiful smaller hotel with bungalows. We stayed in an oceanfront bungalow on the beach, 1C. Loved it. We never felt we didn't have privacy. We loved that we could just step out onto the beach. We could hang out on our porch to look at the beautiful ocean, watch the sunrise and people watch. Our bungalow had two queen beds and a bathroom. There was a small safe in the room that opens/locks with a key. Air conditioning was fine. Our housekeeper left beautiful towel art every day. There was a hairdryer provided. We asked for an iron and ironing board and kept it in our room all week. There are two pools (medium-sized), that never seemed to be crowded. Two restaurants, one which served breakfast and lunch. The other dinner. One bar with pool table and ping pong table. The staff , Gabriel, Boli, Jorge, Vicente (bartender), and everyone else were so nice and helpful. Coffee is served in the AM at the bar and in the Aventura restaurant. It usually was out by 6:30. We bought a coffee maker, coffee, sugar, sweetener, and non-refrigerated cream at Mega and used it in our room for the week. We are early risers. From the resort we could walk to 5th Ave in a few minutes. Very safe. We walked to Mega also. Taxis are always available and are inexpensive. Cab drivers took pesos or US dollars. Beach: Beautiful beach with no rocks and very little seaweed. The beach is raked daily. Water ranged from very calm to having some pretty good waves. There were no issues with getting a chaise lounge every day. There are plenty. The beach is good for walking and/or jogging. We took a walk every morning. You can also have your lunch served on the beach as well as drinks. Security: Always had two security guards on the beach (24x7). Never felt any concerns about security at the hotel or in town. Places to Eat - Recommended Mahekal - Breakfast Buffet which had fresh juice and fruit; eggs (including Mexican skillet egg dishes), pancakes, french toast to order; sausages, hash browns, toast, croissants, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal. Wonderful! Mahekal - Dinner - Sunday nights is Mexican night with buffet and band. It was fun! El Fogon - We went twice and loved it. Authentic, non-touristy, inexpensive and great food. Very casual. We had the frijoles charros (bean soup), tacos el pastor (tacos with pork), and arrachera (flank steak). We washed it down with cold Mexican beer. Piola - This is right up the road from the Mahekal. Great margharitas, bruschetta, and pizza. The salads were good as well. Great atmosphere and service. http://www.piola.it/mondo2.php?menu_number=3&lang=en&id=32 Origenes- Also right up the road from the Mahekal. We stopped in for drinks and appetizers. Great service and live music. We wanted to go back for dinner but ran out of time. Tour: We did the Tulum and Beyond Tour and had a great time. We would definitely recommend this company! They pick up / drop off at your hotel. They provide drinks and snacks. We toured the Tulum ruins, snorkeled in two cenotes, and hung out on a secluded Tulum beach. Our guides set-up and served us lunch on the beach at Tulum. We booked it the day before and paid in US cash. We also included a tip for our tour guide Ader and driver Pablo. http://www.yucatreks.com/ Stores: There is a store right across the street from the Mahekal that sells ice, beer, soda, water, snacks, etc. Opens at 9:00AM. They took pesos or US dollars. There is a store that opens earlier that sells the same (and throw-away cameras). Go up the street to the circle and make a right. The store is down a bit on the left side of the street. Mega is like a Walmart. They have food, clothes, appliances, etc. Can walk there in about 15 minutes or take a cab for a few dollars. There are cabs lined up in front when you leave. Money / ATMs: Used an ATM at the Cancun airport and Mega to get out pesos. Tipping: We tipped Mahekal employees in either pesos or US dollars - no issues. We tipped daily for housekeeping, breakfast, lunch, and drinks. Sunscreen: Brought high SPF sunscreen with us and needed it. Purchased additional at a store on 5th Ave. Bug Spray: Brought bug spray with us just in case. Used one day only on our porch for some mosquitos. We also needed it on the Tulum trip. A relaxing vacation at a wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in area with a few minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: Beccaboo19
Reviews.Content: We went to Mahekal for our honeymoon late June and we were impressed! From reading almost every review on TripAdvisor, we knew that this hotel would provide us with the most relaxed and quiet atmosphere in the area and we were right. There were a few flaws we experienced that I assume are rare based off of other reviews. The disappointments: -When making our reservation we specified that we were on our honeymoon. The hotel offers a complimentary honeymoon package (sparkling wine, fruit basket, etc) in room. When we arrived we did not received this package and had to ask THREE times for it, each time we were assured it would be delivered that day. By mid-week we gave up. It was disappointing to be promised something and not delivered. -The oceanfront rooms are mostly 2 beds, and despite asking for a king bed prior to arrive(we are on our honeymoon) we were placed in a room with two beds. Again, not a big deal, but the reception desk was very unhelpful with this situation. -If you are in the Adventura section and there is a wedding going on you will be up until at least midnight listening to the loud party. The wedding receptions are in the casa bar/lounge and the music is so ridiculously loud that for two nights that we experienced weddings, we were without sleep. I would recommend staying in the Caribe section, if possible for this reason. -In our experience, the folks at reception were pretty useless and vague with answers. From the honeymoon package to exchanging money, we got a lot of "no" answers and not a lot of help from them. It seems this is the biggest flaw in the whole resort, based on other reviews, but definitely not a deal-breaker. Now...on to the good!!! The resort is on the north side of Playa, which is so dramatically different from the beaches closer to the main strip. We were right next to the local entrance to the beach, but the beach somehow remains empty and beautiful. The security is amazing. At no point did we feel unsafe as they are patrolling all day and night. We always had lounge chairs on the beach available for us and the beach/water was always clean and beautiful. The waitstaff are amazing!!! They are attentive and kind and do the best to make your stay enjoyable. Breakfast is a buffet with egg and pancake to order options. You do not need to charge anything for breakfast, but we tipped our waiter daily because he did a good job! You have the option to have either lunch or dinner at the hotel, if you choose lunch you must inform the front desk before 12:30 that day. Lunch is MUCH better than dinner, with options from club sandwiches to delicious mexican specialities. I highly recommend the Res Y Locos tacos! Dinner changed every night and we only enjoyed the Mexican Fiesta night, which was a buffet. Most of the time the meals were pretty bland and bad. If you like cats, you'll enjoy the two local kitties that join guests for dinner and beg you for scraps. You never need money at meals because everything you drink at the meals and bar can be charged to your room. The walk to La Quinta is right up the street, taking no more than 5 minutes to get there. Mahekal is on the quiet Italian stretch of La Quinta, which is much nicer in our option than the crazy touristy area closer to the Cozumel Ferry, unless that is your scene. You HAVE to eat at La Cueva De Chango restaurant right up the street from the hotel. The food and atmosphere is amazing and the artwork is done by one of the servers. Yaxche Mayan cuisine on La Quinta is highly recommended as well. We were in the middle of Tropical Storm Alexander when we were there and the rooms are made to let in a lot of breeze and light, so the rain and wind flooded the room a bit over the weekend. However, the staff were quick to clean it up and were constantly grooming the grounds during the storm. The cleaning staff are amazing and will create beautiful towel sculptures on your bed every day!! **A word to the wise. These rooms are your basic rooms with no frills. The rooms are also on the beach and have lots of bugs. If we left any piece of food, gum, candy, or soda out for more than 15 minutes we had swarms of ants. Do not bring sweets as the ants will go nuts for them, unless you don't mind the company! :)

Reviews.Title: “The secret beauty of Playa”
Reviews.Author: cedric02
Reviews.Content: Working in the luxury hospitality industry, I spent so much time online looking at all the resorts in PLAYACAR and their reviews on Tripadvisor. I really wanted real vacations away from the croud. The ALL inclusive resorts with 1500 people in the morning at the buffet breakfast was definitely not for me. I was looking for the utlimate peaceful hotel with a friendly atmosphere. Mahekal was the one and only....Settled in on of the most beautiful beach in Playa, this small resort is like heaven gardens. Attentive and friendly staff, very good food, fantastic value for money, I really can't wait to book my next vacation there. All the palapas are very private and all have their unique style. I really enjoyed mine in the caribe section. I really forgot the notion of time overthere. It feels so good to find a place like this where the serenity and the simplicity of the resort and the beauty of the destination merge together and make your stay so memorable. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical vacation!”
Reviews.Author: txtraveler2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an 8 day stay at Mahekal. This place is wonderful!! The entire staff went out of their way to make sure we had all we needed during our stay, and did so with a smile on their face! The concierge, Boli, was very helpful and the bartender at night, Vicente, was also very good (just to name a few). The food was outstanding at all three meals, we never ordered anything that was not good. The drinks were reasonably priced and very tasty. We especially enjoyed the Mexican buffet on Sunday night!! They had live entertainment and excellent food! Mahekal is a very laid back place and the rooms are simple, which is exactly what we were looking for. The grounds are very well kept and the staff is constantly working to keep the place nice. There are plenty of chairs on the beach and resort security assists to make sure that only hotel residents use the chairs. The beach was beautiful. We walked down the beach in both directions from the resort and found that it was not as nice anywhere else. If you are looking for a fancy place with televisions, phones in the rooms, and jacuzzi tubs then this is not for you. We did not miss any of those things when we were there and can't wait to return next year!! We stayed in 29P and it had a great view of the ocean. It was on the far end of the resort and was very quiet (the penthouse is right above this room). Great service, great staff, and excellent food!! Also, only a few minute walk to 5th avenue where there is great shopping, food, and drink!! Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, friendly staff, perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: gmz18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from celebrating out anniversary in Mexico. We stayed at Mahekal for 7 nights. This place is wonderful! The grounds are amazing, the beach is beautiful but what truly makes this place feel like home is the staff. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. We stayed in room 8A that was ocean view room but it truly felt like an ocean front as we were steps from the beach and could feel the ocean breeze every day/night. The rooms are bare but are kept extremely clean. If you expect luxury this is not for you. There are no TV’s or other electronics in the room but that did not bother us at all. The place is like a little paradise. There is a lot to do in the area; the resort is just a few minute walk from the 5th Ave where you can find all different restaurants, shops, galleries and other entertainment. I truly recommend Mahekal for a romantic, relaxing getaway. Special thanks to Boli and Gabriel who organized transportation and tours for our stay. I can’t thank Boli enough for his kindness and lending his camera for a day when our broke down. Also, special thanks to Jose and Vincente, our friendly servers at the resort restaurant. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect getaway....”
Reviews.Author: etrain33
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Mahekal Beach Resort for 5 days and it was everything we hoped it would be. The resort is very quiet, very clean and well kept. There are plenty of chairs on the beach for the taking, the pools are never over-crowded and the ocean was warm, clear and amazing. The beach was very clean, never too crowded, we found a nice spot to the far right of the Aventura side in the shade that was great for a post lunch ciesta. The resort staff was always very courteous and willing to assist you in any way. We had a ocean view room (11A or Once A) which was great. We could easily see the beach from our porch hammocks and could feel the constant breeze all day, which was amazing. The room was great, very basic, very clean and relaxing. Great shower and bathroom. We selected the breakfast and lunch option which worked out great for us. Up early in the morning for a run or a walk on the beach (which my girlfriend loves to do...), followed up with an excellent breakfast. I can't imagine anyone not being satisfied with the selections available at breakfast. Tons of healthy options that is unless you are use to dining at a Denny's Mega breakfast buffet, this might not be the place for you. Lunch was good too. It was nice to be able to come in from the beach, grab a bite and then get back out to the beach for the rest of the afternoon. A lot of 5th Ave opens around 10-11AM, so lunch options are available there, but it is several blocks away. To do's: Be sure to go to 5th Ave in the evening for nightlife, drinking, dining and shopping. A great time. After dinner buy a nice cigar from one of the many shops and hit up one of the many dessert / wine bars. Also be sure to rent the hotel bikes and cruise up and down the back streets of Playa to see the rest of the city outside of 5th ave. Also a great time. We hit 3 or 4 different beach bars on our bike journey and had a lot of fun. Overall a great time and I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a relaxing vacation in a beautiful resort on a beautiful stretch of beach. Special Thanks too: The Honeymooners - Mobile Alabama The Swiss Family Robinson McGavin (comma) Shooter Austin Jake and Vienna

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: amyl89
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon at Mahekal. This place is truly paradise - you won't miss TV or phone. I highly recommend getting a room on the beach. We were in 28P and could sit on our balacony and watch the sunrise in the morning and see the stars at night, while watching/listening to the ocean. I am a vegetarian (my husband a meat eater). Fortunately, there were several options for dining at the resort and in town. The food was excellent. You are allowed breakfast everyday and either lunch or dinner. FYI -You can even order lunch from the dining area and the staff will actually bring it to you at the beach/pool. The service is first class. The staff is so hard-working and friendly. They go out of their way to ensure each guest has a positive experience and has everything they need. The concierge, named Bali, is amazing. He is very familiar with the activities in the area and can help you plan your stay. I recommend seeing him when you first arrive.

Reviews.Title: “This place really is a magical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: aeaton12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just go back from our stay at Mahekal. It was the best hotel I have ever stayed at! We had a beautiful little bungalow with the traditional palapas roof. It was just so wonderful! We had hammocks on our porch, a view of the ocean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Mahekal is located within walking distance to tons of great restaurants, shopping and buses that will take you to lots of Mayan adventures. We were there for a wedding, and let me tell you, if you want a fantasy wedding that feels like a romantic movie, this is the place to get married. It was just stunning. The food is great at the hotel as well. We opted for the breakfast and dinner option. Although it is not an all inclusive resort, it is very affordable and drinks are very low priced. There is also a happy hour at the bar by the pool (they have swings!) and we figured that we actually spent less than we would at all an inclusive resort! We even saw a concert on the beach one night! Mahekal has it all! The beauty, the convenience of location, affordability, the food, tranquility and the bet that we will be back to visit again another day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: ireneper
Reviews.Content: Mahekal was absolutely perfect. Hammocks, small bungalows, beach palapas, good plentiful fresh food, lots of adorable paths and nooks and crannies, and generally very clean, safe, comfortable with some touches of luxury. We did not see a better place in all Playa del Carmen, and it completely satisfied my beach-front vacation fantasies of drinks on the beach, reading in hammocks, wonderful warm water, etc. And far more romantic than anything we saw in Cancun, where we spent our last night. A few things to know: the food really is good, and you can switch between dinner and lunch at the resort if you want to go out. You can walk to Fifth Avenue, which is the main strip and it is nicer on the north half than the southern half; however, the streets between Fifth and the beach are more local and less tourist-y, and have some nice surprises like a really good tequila bar. Mahekal doesn't offer that many activities, and you can't snorkel right off the beach (nothing to see). But if you rent a car, you can go to nearby cenotes, and Xel-Ha. All in all Mahekal was one of my best beach vacation experiences ever, and I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, "Old School" Tropical Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: If you want South Beach ambiance complete with sleek Euro furnishings, a beach cluttered with beach beds and techno music thumping all day and night, this place is not for you. If you want renaissance splendor with marble and crystal, a Jacuzzi on your balcony, five restaurants where you line up at 6 a.m. to make reservations and pools where you can play the towel game to your heart’s content, then this place is not for you. If you want beaches where you’re lying inches away from someone talking nonstop on their cell phone, this place is not for you. And if you cannot live without television or a phone in the room for 24 hour room service, this place is not for you. On the other hand, if you want a small, intimate, laid back beach resort with colorful palapa style accommodations where you can laze away an afternoon on your patio in your hammock; if you want beautifully maintained grounds where paths meander throughout, connecting the cabanas, pools, bar, and restaurant; if your idea of a perfect beach is lying under a palapa, far enough away from others so that there is a sense of privacy, then this place is for you. I would definitely describe Mahekal as barefoot chic, with excellent attentive service, whether you’re at breakfast, dinner, by the pool, or on the beach. THE ROOM We had a ground floor cabana in the Pueblo section, set in the garden and close to the La Loma restaurant. This was a very quiet section of the resort, and after seeing the other areas, I was glad we chose to be set back a bit. I felt that there was more privacy and less foot traffic of people coming and going past your patio. The room was small but spotless, and the A/C was the best we had anywhere. In case you get chilled like we did, there is an extra blanket in the top part of the large closet. Speaking of closet, there were tons of hangers, lots of shelf space, and a small safe that will hold passport, money, etc., but not your laptop. There was always plenty of hot water which came up very fast. The patio had two hammocks, and a table with two chairs. Every day we received a bottle of water, and some extremely creative towel art from the ladies who do the housekeeping. THE FOOD Having read the very mixed reviews, we were a bit concerned but need not have been. Breakfast was amazing, and so extensive that I do not understand how anyone can possibly have lunch afterwards, provided they took full advantage of the buffet. There were always two different kinds of juices (varied from day to day), fresh fruit: papaya, mango, cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple, bananas and grapefruit. They had plain and fruit yogurts, several different kinds of cold serial, and the most delicious hot oatmeal. There was also ham and cheese and sausages put out every morning, along with hash brown cakes and different kinds of bread. On top of this, you could order eggs any style: poached, scrambled, ranchero, boiled, fried, eggs motulenos, or toluquenos, (two delicious Yucatecan style), you name it. After all this food, lunch was not happening. Dinner was almost always very good. We ate dinner out twice, once because we wanted to go back to Yaxche after a terrific lunch there last time (big disappointment), and the other night because the a la carte menu did not appeal to us (salmon with chaya and chicken with mushrooms). The other nights ranged from the good to the outstanding. They especially went all out for the buffets. Maya night they had Salbutes, which are little tortillas filled with shredded chicken, avocado, and onions, Yucatecan chicken, cochinita pibil, fish baked with achiote paste, fried plantains, rice and beans, fantastic little meat balls, etc. The Mexican BBQ buffet had the best skirt steak, so tender, and delicious, grilled chicken, grilled fish, ribs, sausages, and lots of sides like guac and pico de gallo, and rice. On another occasion they had fish in parsley sauce, steak brochettes (delicious), duck breast with mango sauce (wonderful), and pork with tamarind sauce (this was only ok because it was a bit too sweet for me.) I was disappointed in seeing the menu for the day we were leaving: Caribbean buffet with paella, shrimps in wine sauce, and some other things that looked really good. I would recommend not missing any of the buffets. Those were our favorite meals. They also make terrific soups: pozole, sopa Azteca, and a German soup with cabbage and sausages that we did not try but sounded good. Menu for two days at a time is posted in the lobby in the morning, and you can switch out dinner for lunch if it doesn’t appeal to you. SERVICE Everyone, from reception to wait staff, housekeeping, grounds crew, and so on was very friendly, helpful, and professional. Special mention to Rogelio, Ignazio, Juan, and Ivan, but not mentioning any other names does not imply they were lacking. This was an incredibly nice staff, one that really contributed to making our stay special. There is service around the pool up front by the ocean, and also on the beach. So if you want to eat or drink something without leaving your lounger, they’re there for you. Security is top notch; there are several guards patrolling both the beach and the grounds around the clock. There is free wireless access available in the lobby and the bar by the pool. Pretty zippy, so there is no interminable waiting for pages to load. There is also a massage hut along with other spa services offered. Bikes are available for guests and are a good way to get around. POOLS There is one pool by the bar where they hold happy hour and another up front by the ocean, where the Aventura restaurant is. We preferred the one by the ocean for the view, the water was cooler, and it was deeper. Plus it was just a hop to the beach, so you can go back and forth between the two. The other pool heated up very quickly so it was more like sitting in your bath tub. Plus it tended to be more crowded, and the water is very shallow. That makes it better for children. DRINKS Between 5 and 6 drinks are two for one and the frozen margaritas are outstanding. They are 45 pesos each, except during happy hour, so even at regular time they’re a bargain. I loved the fact that they were nice and tart instead of the sweet mix so many places uses. I also had a pina colada at the bar up by the beach which was great and so strong there must have been mostly rum in it lol. Bloody Mary’s are also terrific, and the restaurant La Loma serves wonderful wine, both red and white, for 50 pesos a glass. A terrific deal for “winos” like ourselves  The happy hour bar could use a little sprucing up to make it more inviting. A few more tables with chairs, a some more bar stools would definitely help. THE BEACH Just beautiful, soft sand, turquoise water, gentle waves (except for the first couple of days), and perfect temperature. There are plenty of loungers with palapas, so you do not have to play the towel game. MISCELLANEOUS We didn’t spend much time in town, but it’s there if you need it for nightlife, dinner, shopping, seeing and being seen, etc. We ate once at Babe’s Noodle Bar, which was very good and very inexpensive. The restaurant Yaxche moved, and unfortunately seems to have left its Maya identity and food behind in the old location. I will review it separately, but it was a big disappointment after our last visit. If you need laundry done, there is one on the right side of the street the hotel is on, between 5th and 10th avenue. Open at 8:00, and done in an hour. We paid 45 pesos for about 4 pounds of clothes. All in all we had a wonderful time, and will definitely be back to the Mahekal. It certainly lived up to its name. For around 120 dollars per day we had a terrific room in a beautiful place, and breakfast and dinner for two. We felt that it was the deal of the century and glad we were able to take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, charming, quiet, laid back”
Reviews.Author: Roger040
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, laid back, no frills hotel right on the beach. It is an "old style" hotel of huts and cabanas laid out on winding paths. Tho it is not new, it is clean and basic (no phones or TV's) with large rooms, outdoor decks and moderate furnishings. Price includes 2 meals a day and the food is good. The beach is beautiful and not overly crowded like some of the other hotels. It has 2 nice swimming pools as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding, Perfect Resort”
Reviews.Author: jlp913
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married at Mahekal Beach Resort in April 2010. We had nearly 40 family and friends with us. All the comments we got back from our friends were positive, and my husband and I really liked it. The beach is great, the staff was awesome, and they did a wonderful job with the wedding, despite the rain. The location is ideal because it is away from the busier stretches of beach in Playa, but it is still a convenient walk into town. The food was also great. My husband and I moved to an all-inclusive in Playa for our honeymoon after the wedding. While the all-inclusive was certainly able to provide a bigger variety of food, just as a function of size, the quality at Mahekal was far superior. I had the molletes and lime soup at both resorts, and definitely enjoyed Mahekal's version better. I would definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for an affordable destination wedding resort. I can not say enough about how wonderful the staff and wedding coordinator/food & beverage manager were.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal beach front getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gilly0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights after staying at Cuixmala (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!) in Manzanillo on the West Coast of Mexico. It was a perfect finish to our trip. The hotel itself is great but the setting and the beach is even better and quite spectacular. The only thing that lets it down a little is the food and the interior of the room is a little dated (but still very clean). You are only a short stroll to the superb 5th Avenue restaurants and shopping. Eldiablo Cha Cha Cha and also Casa Abela is a must for eating/drinking. The hotel is just outside of the strip although we saw this as a benefit and each night we took the hotel bicyles to ride around the corner to the bars and restaurants in 5th Ave. We enjoyed the ride each night to and from the hotel. The beach was beautiful and we had an Ocean View (not ocean front) room and it would be recommended that you get one. The hotel was very clean and tidy and everyone was very helpful with every request. The concierge managed to arrange a last minute trip across to Isla Cozumel for scuba diving with a dive master that he knew. We got across just in time and had a private lesson with the dive master Edmundo, ask for him, his company is called Cha Cha Cha. We would recommend this hotel because it was just outside of the busy strip but close enough to be a short walk away. It would suit man different people and young couples in particular. There are no tv's, phones, internet or radios in the room which we saw as a good thing but be aware of it if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding place!”
Reviews.Author: nycdoc123
Reviews.Content: We were married there this march. Couldnt have been more perfect. Staff was wonderful. Scenery was amazing and the food couldnt have been better. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise, have to try a second time.”
Reviews.Author: mysweetgb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mahekal in middle of April, after high praise from my sister. We all went as a family trip, with an almost two year old and seven year old. Even after much urging from my sister for us to get an ocean view room, we reserved the garden view caribe. So our first night was in 28A garden view room, and decided she was right, to move to an ocean view. The rooms really vary, and the garden view ones with two beds are small. My sister’s room was nice in the garden section one bed, with the palapa style roof. We moved to 16P, which was A lot nicer than our original room. Amazing difference, huge room, with balcony, and great view, in the adventura section. There happened to be a monsoon during our stay, and unfortunately it rained so hard, the palapa roof of our room leaked and it flooded the floor, and made the beds wet. So had to move again, and Mahekal did so graciously. The room was not as nice, but it worked. All the rooms are quite simple, with tile floors, firm beds, and wood shutters for the windows, and had it been sunny I think they are very nice. With the wind going so strong it made it loud through the night. I liked the beachy feel and primitive nature of the room, but being that our power went out one night, and had a problem with the rain another, it would have been nice have a phone in the room. Hard to trek down to the lobby in that kind of weather to get some help. Note: Bring flashlights. You can hear the ocean from your room, and the beach is fantastic. Perfect beach, with gentle waves the kids could play in. The view from the breakfast room is breathtaking, and the pool is perfect for dipping, and running down to the beach. We thought the food was great! We liked the French toast and pancakes in the morning for kids, along with an array of fresh fruits and pastries. I loved the Huevos Rancheros. We ate for three nights at the hotel, and enjoyed all of them. Our table was decorated extra special two nights, and it really made our trip special. The servers here are wonderful, made us and our kids feel welcome. Rogelio was so sweet and attentive; my son just loved a balloon animal he made for him. Reuben was so attentive, warm, and made our meals just perfect. I thought Mahekal was a beautiful resort with gorgeous landscape. You walk through the property and think they have maintained keeping an it lush, beachy, and exotic. The birds you hear in the morning, trees, and sandy pathways, really let you experience paradise. You are not paying so much for the amenities at this resort, but more the beachfront experience. There is a sulphur odor to the beach, and I kept thinking about it, so I do say, “almost paradise”, in my title with that, and because we did not get to go to the beach a lot with the rain. Both are not the resorts fault, but had an impact n our stay. With children it might be worth noting, there is not too much activities in the room, or the resort except for the beach, or a wonderful so if something happens with the weather you do have to get creative. Like hang out at Mega, store in Playa.  We did try the bar and played pool and ping pong, and that is the extent of a children’s area. It didn’t really affect us, but would be nice to have more for kids to do. The best part of our trip was the beach massage. It is a must try! Overall great family vacation, and will go back so that Mahekal can really shine. 

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with small-resort feel”
Reviews.Author: SeaSport22
Reviews.Content: just got back from a week at the Mahekal beach resort in PDC. We had a large group who traveled from all over the globe for a friend's wedding. Overall, a very enjoyable week. Very nice accomodations, although for the money, I think the units not immediately ocean front are better value (still get a peek-a-boo view of the ocean but much less/night). Two meals/day included, and all food was good with good value. Staff was outstanding-friendly and accomodating. Made us feel special and appreciated. Dive operation affiliated with the resort (Buceo Cyan-Ha) was top-rate, with good equipment and knowledgable and skilled staff and divemasters. Highly recommend this location and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: egarenal
Reviews.Content: This is a resort located on the beach and 4 or 5 blocks from the famous 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen so you are near but not inside of the center of the action giving you a more intimate environment . The breakfast and the dinner are included in the price but you can always change your dinner for lunch. The quality of the food is not 5 stars but is very good. The waiters and the people working in the hotel are really nice and friendly. They will always try to please you and you will feel more like in a family than in a hotel. If you go to the 5th Ave. I will recommend you the mexican grill La Parrilla with greats meats and good prices. Also the restaurant Madre Tierra is very good. I will recommend you to visit Xel-Ha and to take the Sea Passion catamaran tour to Isla Mujeres.

Reviews.Title: “awful experience, front desk staff rude and unethical, left early”
Reviews.Author: jessiebrawer
Reviews.Content: We used to come to this hotel every year when it was the Shangri-la Caribe. It was probably among my favorite places in the world, with the new owners, and managers it is a completely different experience. I would not recommend it nor I will never go back. The front desk staff is rude and truly shockingly unhelpful. I don't know if it is just a language barrier (if so, they need to hire workers actually fluent in english) but we were repeatedly quoted one price at the beginning of a transaction (price of upgrade, room rate etc.) and then charged radically more at the end. When confronted about this discrepancy the women at the desk, in collusion, deny everything and make you pay their price - what can you do? It is their word against yours. Get EVERYTHiNG in writing - or videotape all conversations... or avoid this maddeningly frustrating experience altogether. We decided to end our stay early rather than accumulate more unpleasant memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what it is ...”
Reviews.Author: Fab_Ham
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Playa for a wedding that was at an all inclusive resort. However, we are not "all inclusive" type of people and ended up at Mahekal on a suggestion from a friend. Glad we did. Although I had requested an early check in via email we were not given one. I understand this policy when a hotel/resort is at capacity but I am 99% sure that this was not the case. We were only an hour early but they still made us wait. Luckily we had a car so we left our stuff locked up and headed to the beach. The location is AMAZING. We opted for one of the cheaper palapas and were less than a minute from the beach. Plenty of chairs and umbrellas for guests to use and the towels that we were given were big and soft. Major complaint here is that the beach had a sulfer smell to it. I don't know if this is the norm or if something was going on, but we jokingly referred to it as "Egg Beach" all weekend. Our room was on the second level. Some concerns: When sleeping with our heads by the headboard it felt like our feet were higher, which was very uncomfortable. The first night we ended up sleeping with our heads on the opposite side, which resulted in the air conditioning blowing directly on top of our heads. The next night we decided to just deal with it and went to bed normally and found that the condensation from the air conditioner would occasionally drip water on our heads while trying to sleep. No bueno! The air does not filter into the bathroom and so it is very hot in there. There are bugs, but this was to be expected. Just tiny ants, not a big concern at all. Overall the room was a little stale smelling and there just wasn't enough wind to air it out. The balcony was amazing and the hammocks that they provide are extremely comfortable and fun to hang out in. Bonus points for having an outdoor fan. We loved both of the pools and the bar with the swings. Last but not least, the food is mediocre at best. The included food was a bonus for us, we did not book at this hotel knowing that we were going to get a breakfast and dinner. However, if this is something that is going to make or break the deal for you I will say that I would MUCH rather dine anywhere else. So, if you are willing to put up with a few bumps in the road for an amazing location and access to great pools and a beach this place is for you. If you are picky about things like bugs or bad food - you may want to skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic, beautiful, get a ocean front cabana”
Reviews.Author: HughesMstar
Reviews.Content: We had a cabana on the beach, so awesome of course. The place is beautiful, friendly, clean, and you really feel like you are in an exotic location!!! it is pricey.....for sure, but what a vacation!!!!! A waiter there, Rogelio, remembered us from last year, asked about my travel companion of last year, a little boy who is precious to me and I was so touched. Meet Rogelio.....TIP EVERYONE. They deserve it. GREAT people!! ESPECIALLY the waiter Rogelio...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent low-key vacation”
Reviews.Author: lcsmith51
Reviews.Content: My husband, twelve-year old son and I had a wonderful experience at Mahekal. We stayed in the Aventura section which may be newer because our room seemed very fresh, especially the tiling in the bathroom. The bedding, etc also seemed new-ish. The hotel location was really perfect, close enough to town but on a great stretch of beach. The food wasn't great, though. Breakfast was fine, with tons of fresh fruit and good coffee, and eggs etc. to order but dinner was only fair and often not at all hot and just not the highest quality. Service was very friendly and seemed really genuin, though. Compared to the price of other resorts, it was a great value. Overall, it was really charming and relaxing spot, if not totally luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “No other resort in Playa Del Carmen can compare!”
Reviews.Author: kac9679
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mahekal last September before the name change, and I returned to Playa Del Carmen last month but stayed at another resort and it was a HUGE mistake! I wanted to return to Mahekal but my friends urged me to go to a 100% all inclusive resort. While they spent time at the loud and annoying beach at the hotel I returned to the beach in front of Mahekal. There is absolutely no flaws with the resort. Last September when I went with my mother, when she went to bed early I had fun playing Ping Pong with the servers at the restaurant :) They are the best staff and knew I was alone with my mom and kept me entertained. The service was excellent, the food great, and the best beach in Mexico! The part of town where Mahekal is located is very neat. The "nightlife" of playa del carmen is several blocks away, but the authentic restaurants and bars are just a block away from the resort. My favorite restaurant is Piola. The food and service is beyond comparison! It was nice to switch up eating lunch and dinner at Mahekal and going out for meals. Do not stay anywhere else, Mahekal is the best of the best!

Reviews.Title: “There are much better places out there.”
Reviews.Author: maybethatswhere
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in room 19C at the Mahekal for 4 nights in April 2010 to attend a wedding being held there. Playa was receiving more rain when we arrived than they had in 15 years, and the resort staff worked hard to deal with it, but they weren't very prepared. To be fair, I'm going to skip any issues related to the ridiculous amounts of rain. Mahekal is a small resort, made up of mostly individual bungalows and 2 story casitas, so you'll likely get your own private cabana, or have just one neighbor above or below you. The grounds are well maintained and everything in the resort is within a short walk. It's definitely a charming little place with tons of character and potential. It was quiet and peaceful for the most part. Surprisingly, most of the food was really good (better than we had at the Riu last October). The breakfasts were marginal (cooked to order egg dishes), but they serve lots of fresh fruit. Lunch can be served to you on the beach, and I recommend the Mexican Platter to split for two of you. That's all we tried on the lunch menu, but it was really good and plenty for lunch. Dinner was really good when served a la carte. When it was a buffet, it was hit or miss. Our last night there, my boyfriend and I made several trips to the buffet - once for chips and quacamole, once for salads, then again for our dinner. This was much more enjoyable that loading up one plate with a bit of everything. They serve a grilled fish at almost every meal, and they were all delicious. Alcoholic drinks are not included in the room price; they are reasonably priced ($3 beer, $4 margarita), but not very consistent. The first drink I had was really good, but it was downhill from there. They make each drink individually (no bulk premix), but never measure, so you never know what you're going to get. It takes quite a long time to get a drink at the bar, then you have to wait for the guy to print out a room charge bill to sign. Real inefficient. Aside from the grounds being well planted and maintained, the common gathering areas are far less than impressive. Especially the bar and gameroom. It has 2 pool tables, 2 ping pong tables, and an 80's style big screen tv. There are no more than 10 wobbly bar stools, and maybe 15-20 other chairs, along with 3-4 odd tables. It was dark and really uncomfortable, and getting drinks took a lot of effort. We probably wouldn't have spent any time in there had it not been raining so much or there was another place to gather with our friends. Our room, 19C, definitely needed some attention. They do a real good job keeping it clean, but it was long overdue for a fresh coat of paint and new tiling. The a/c leaked - not good when it's just above the head of the bed. And it blew straight down, again onto the head of the bed, even when we adjusted it. The matresses were decently comfortable, but the sheets and blankets were old and yucky. We spent as little time inside the room as possible because it just wasn't comfortable. The hammocks on the balcony were quite nice, however, and it seemed that a lot of guests were using them as a place to get out of the sun or rain (or room) for a while. I had read most of the TripAdvisor reviews before arriving at Mahekal. Unfortunately, I was pretty dissapointed. While Mahekal has a lot of charm, it is really lacking as a vacation get-a-way, romantic or otherwise. There are far better values out there, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: ArthurLondon
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and we are very lucky to have found Mahekal. I took a short trip with my daughter to explore the Riviera Maya and this place was the best. It offers something that is so hard to find. Peace and relaxation in a central setting. Each room is its own little bungalow, steps from the beach. Ours had a perfect view of the ocean and we slept with the windows open at night hearing the waves and feeling the breeze. Some much of Riviera Maya is massive all inclusive resorts. Mahekal offers great food, especially breakfast but it is also only a few block walk from 20+ excellent restaurants and tons of shops. I thought I would freak out without TVs in the rooms but it made the vacation better. The beach is perfect and safe. Wave just big enough to excite my 12 year old. Water is warm and the staff is friendly. I especially loved the 2 for 1 happy drink specials as the sun was setting. I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, low key place for families or couples”
Reviews.Author: JoyceChicago
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an alternative to the big resorts -- something more low key and this was such a wonderful find. My husband and I stayed at Mahekal for six days with our two kids, ages 6 and 2. We really loved our stay. The resort has such a nice feel. Our room was clean and comfortable with nice tiled floors and a delightful front porch with a hammock. Our kids loved the two pools -- especially the one with the great beach view -- and it is cut out like a donut -- with grass and a hot tub in the center. The beach here is really pretty and quiet -- no loud music blaring. The staff is very friendly -- the bellman & the restaurant staff in particular. There is a fun game room with pool table and ping pong for early evenings before the 7pm start of dinner, and a fun bar area with two wooden swings that our children enjoyed. The two meal option worked very well -- most days we went out for tours so had breakfast & dinner. With the exception of Italian night, we found the food to be very good. This was just what we wanted -- low key, laid back, relaxing, great value, fun. We hope to go back again. We found there were many regulars here who come back year after year, and we can see why.

Reviews.Title: “Unplugged, unpretentious, unexpected, unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: neddor
Reviews.Content: Spotless rooms, minimal rustic furniture, a meticulously maintained beach, no electronic distractions, friendly, mellow, laid back, with a relaxed staff, the perfect spot if you like to read a lot, fall asleep in a hammock, swim, walk miles of beach, want some quiet alone time with someone special, like to wander into town, explore, hang out; not the place if you're an e-junkie (I left my laptop at home, and enjoyed the absence of internet access, TV, radios, email & telephones.) There was no "dress code" at dinner, no pretense,(there's no one to impress if you need to make an impression to enjoy yourself) no "party hearty" crowd (as the drinks are not included) and it was one of the most relaxing and restful vacations we've ever had, even though the weather was cooler than usual. The resort was 100% booked when we were there, yet never felt crowded or busy; if you like glitz and glamour and everything brand new and shiny,if you want the newest in sleek European design, if you are in the mood for dramatic architecture and luxurious lavish finishes, then there are plenty of places for you in Playa, but this ain't one of them. It looks a bit worn in places, like a comfortable chair or favourite old jacket, and it has a vaguely '80s vibe that some people may find not to their liking but that makes it all the more appealing when you want to just disappear for a while. You can listen to the surf as you fall asleep, wake up to the sun slipping cheerfully out of the Gulf of Mexico, and remember the real reason you're alive. We're going back for 2 weeks in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience once again”
Reviews.Author: cohorn
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 children and I first visited this hotel 3 years ago and had a great time. So we were looking forward to coming back but also were a bit unsure how the new ownership may have changed things. Well we were pleasantly surprised. We had a garden view palapa on the caribe side for 1 week, from March 24-31. We were welcomed to our cabana with a ceramic hand painted dish, hanging by the door, with our surname on it which was ours to keep. What a nice touch! Unlike other reviewers we all really enjoyed the food, which is no small feat when trying to please a ten and thirteen year old. We were going to switch our dinner for lunch but found the evening restaurant to be relaxing, nicely lit and besides the food, the best part was the wait staff who are very attentive, friendly and helpul. 4 of the 7 nights were full service, 4 course sit down meals and 3 were buffet. Our favourites were the served meals and some of the memorable dishes were salmon in a spinach cream sauce, chicken and mushrooms, advocado and shrimp salad, and duck in a citrus sauce. The kids enjoyed the pasta dishes and the mexican buffets. The homemade soups were some of the best ever. My husband raved about the steak on the mexican barbecue buffet, and given we come from Alberta Beef Country that is saying a lot! As well as the wait staff being great, we also found our maid went above and beyond making towel art unlike any I have seen before, and Jose, the artist who paints ceramics, is very talented and a pleasure to be around. Our sons spent hours painting ceramics with him and were thrilled with the results. We spent lots of time at the resort, on the beach, at the bar playing pool and table tennis and at the pool. The hammocks at the beach were a nice new touch. The rooms are continuing to be upgraded. We never needed to use air conditioning given the breeze through the screened windows and the ceiling fan. We fell asleep to the sound of the waves and woke to the birds and sun coming through our windows. The showers were great and had lots of hot water. We strolled 5th ave. a couple of times and found for $3.50 you can get a cab to the bus station which is at the end of 5th and walk back. We had organized our transportation to and from the airport with the hotel in a mini bus for $170 return for the 4 of us, but realized a cab would have been cheaper and just as easy at $45 one way. We went on 2 tours, 1 to Xel Ha the other Rio Secreto and had a great time at both. It was easy and much cheaper to take a cab to town then grab a collectivo (local mini bus). The collectivo driver will drop you off right at the entrance to these parks. Overall we found this to be a great family trip and well worth the money spent. With our children, we have travelled to Mexico 5 times, Florida twice, and the Bahamas, this is our favourite place and we highly recommend it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Its like camping with all the amenities...”
Reviews.Author: The_Firestones
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a full service, all inclusive, pamper you resort that is chock full of planned or facilitated activities! You'll be disappointed if that's what you are looking for. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable, friendly, beach side resort to get away from the hustle and bustle of modern day living and actually spend time relaxing, interacting, and talking to your Spouse/Family then this is the place for you. They include 2 meals a day (breakfast/lunch or breakfast/dinner) which you can change every day after you look at the menu or know your plans. Breakfast menu covers the usual and doesn't leave you wanting. Lunch menu has a reasonable variety. Dinner menu changes nightly (buffet and table service depending upon the night). Quality of food is decent, but not over the top (Chili's, Applebees, etc.). If you want to change it up (which we did every day) you can head a couple of blocks off the beach and pick any type or style of restaurant you want. Downtown Playa is really that close! Cab rides to the heart of Playa Del Carmen averaged about $5/US. Rooms are comfortable, spotless, and decent size with basic toiletries. If you want in-room entertainment, bring a laptop and some DVDs. Patios/Balconies are nicely sized with tables/chairs and have 2 hammocks for chilling out. The beach is beautiful, has plenty of chairs in and out of the shade. The two pools are small, but big enough to service the size of the resort. Water sport rentals and Scuba are on-site. I had a great solo dive with a guide on a shelf at 100'. Nice accommodating staff and priced very reasonably. The staff at the resort are very nice and friendly. Bottom-line: We'd go back (with a laptop and DVDs!)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, so-so food.”
Reviews.Author: mfitzgerald
Reviews.Content: The good: Nice beach, not too crowded Good security Decent breakfast, good lunch Clean rooms, rustic, no TV, no Phone Bed was fairly comfortable Decent inexpensive restaurants within walking distance The bad: Buffet style dinner - not very good. Your best best is to take breakfast and lunch and find somewhere else to eat dinner, although the restaurant is nice looking. Grounds need some work, although they are addressing that in many areas. VERY LOUD techno music from the beach club a few hundred yards down the beach. It runs from afternoon to early evening and when I say it's loud, I'm not kidding. Resort is bisected by a public street / beach access area. All in all, for what we paid for a garden view room, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Best Beach in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Babunyanya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Mahekal from February 25 to March 5, 2010. THE FOOD: Breakfast and dinner (or lunch) was included which was very cost-effective. Unfortunately I suffer from a severe reaction to garlic: at Mahekal this proved no problem. On the first night I talked to the chef and he offered to make up a special plate for me which our waiter served even on the buffet nights. It was refreshing to stay in a place in which the staff confronted exceptions with graciousness. THE ROOM: We stayed in a section called "Pueblita Garden View" which I recommend for two reasons: it is the least expensive and the quietest. The oceanfront (too expensive) are nicely situated but the porches are private only early in the mornings or late in the afternoons. Otherwise there are always people on chaises right up against your steps. It is also true that if you are in a room near Calle 38 which provides public access to Playa Mamitas you're likely to find the traffic noise bothersome. Stay in the Garden View Pueblitas for comfort and quiet. The 50 meter walk to the beach will do you good. The room itself was clean, spacious and airy; the porch with twin hammocks was relaxing; the maid service was professional. THE BEST PARTS: The beach was wide, clean and uncrowded. A 10 minute walk in either direction will bring you to a beach that is narrower, dirtier, rockier, more crowded and throbbing to the beat of high-volume hip-hop.
