If you find that attractive, Mahekal is not for you. In addition the staff is friendly, helpful and professional. THE WORST PART: Flying back to Boston and winter.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal for what's included”
Reviews.Author: MoeJurek
Reviews.Content: Deal: The price of this hotel was incredible for what was included - 2 meals, which I would recommend changing your meals to breakfast and lunch since 5th avenue is so close and there's much more variety to choose from. The price of drinks was reasonable and the location was incredible. It was also not very crowded at this hotel compared to the others I saw when walking along the beach. It is quaint and cannot hold as many folks as some of the other hotels, which is nice when you are looking for a realaxing vacation. There were not many kids on this property, which was also nice for those of us that do not have kids. Room: The room was spacious and clean, though there were some mosquitos the first couple nights, we dealt with that becuase we wanted to keep the windows open (screened in of course). I never had a better night's sleep then when I was at this hotel. Staff: the staff were very friendly and accomodating. Pools: While they are not the best pools I have ever seen, and the water in the hot tub was not necessarily hot, I was more interested in laying by the ocean so it was not that big of a concern

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: MixedNationalities
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent two weeks here in a lovely room with an ocean view. The room was spacious and cleaned thoroughly every day. We loved our balcony with the hammocks and the very colourful mexican tiled bathroom. The site itself is well looked after and beautiful to look at. We walked the beach in both directions (an hour and a half each way) and Mahekal definitely has the best spot. We opted for breakfast only so did not experience the dinner but we did enjoy the few lunches we took by the pool overlooking the beach. The breakfast themselves were fantastic especially the egg selection. On occasions we headed out early to see some sites and the restaurant staff were more than happy to let us enter the breakfast room early so we could select some treats to take away in a breakfast box. The resort is lovely for a romantic getaway but also is suitable for children as there is a games room next to the bar with pool and table tennis tables. This is where you'll also find the only TV on the resort. Don't miss the happy hour, great value and is the place to meet others on the resort. The lunch and drink prices were very acceptable. Sometimes much cheaper than in town. Town was an easy walk, we walked every evening and often to the very end of town and back again. Restaurants are plentiful and of various types. Don't forget to visit the wonderful Mayan sites in the area - Chitzen Itza, Tulum and Coba. We also had a fun day at Xel-Ha where you can snorkel, walk and ride bicycles. Take a trip across to Cozumel too if you like to snorkel. The trip can be easily done in a day by taking the ferry by the bus station at the far end of town. All in all a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - but too many noisy young children.”
Reviews.Author: schraderenviro
Reviews.Content: Went with companion for Valentine's weekend. The staff was great. The Ocean view cabana was quaint and intimate. Dinners and breakfast included were delicious and varied, but lots of young noisy children. Our cabana was steps from the nice white sandy beach. Came as advertised. I know parents think that their preschool children's loud, lengthy squealings are cute. But they should realize that a child screaming right next to the massage tent kind of wrecks the mood of a couple's massage. Maybe I need to go to a more secluded private resort.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Resort”
Reviews.Author: chowthai
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place if you are interested in a more quaint atmosphere on the beach. The charming stucco bungalows are cute and painted bright colors that echo the feel of Mexico. The rooms are comfortable and cute, but dont expect anything grand. The food was fine, however, remember it is included! Town is a little too far to walk (especially after lots of shopping), taxis are always available, so you might want to go that route. All in all, our experience was nice, enjoyed our stay. The beach was nice and not too crowded. Make sure to book an ocean view room, its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, very!”
Reviews.Author: bomber9k
Reviews.Content: The resort layout map is not accurate. The map shows nothing around Mahekal when in fact there is a street, parking, and public beach access between Caribe and Aventura. We were placed in 36B, right next to the road, parking, and public access. We did not get any sleep! With grass roof rooms you hear everything!! Cars and people coming and going all night. Car alarms going off all night. Police on four wheelers patrolling all night; it was terrible! Not relaxing!! Could not even enjoy the hammocks because of all the traffic and noise! To spend all that money and leave feeling exhausted was very, very disappointing!!!! The breakfast omelet was the only decent food. Prices for beverages (soda) changed depending on... I don't know why but they changed!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Beautiful. Different. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Titulina
Reviews.Content: I just spent five days at this hotel with my husband and my two kids (three months old and 21 months old) and we absolutely loved it. The best part? That it is completely different than any other place in Playa del Carmen. All other resorts are big buildings with tons of people while the Mahekal offers you beautiful cabins next to the best beach in the area. The staff is AMAZING and they fell in love with our kids the same way we fell in love with them. They were sooooo sweet!!! We also loved the fact that it is a very quiet place. People still go to the bar and have fun but it doesn't have that annoying party atmosphere that other "all inclusive resorts" have. If you are thinking of traveling with kids, this place is perfect. If you are just going with your partner, this place is by far the most romantic place ever! (you gotta love the cabins!). Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical beach village close to town”
Reviews.Author: LaPortuguesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in 2005 and now 5 years later we're back. Still as wonderful as ever!! The good stuff: - ridiculously inexpensive for what you get - very very clean property, rooms, restaurant, etc (and I'm picky!) - on the best beach in Playa by far - great food (best guacamole in Playa) - bar/food service at the beach (I don't think we had this last time) - 2 for 1 happy hour special at the bar - room rate includes lunch OR dinner (last time it was only dinner) - Caribe Garden View section is 50 steps from the beach (how is that not considered Oceanfront??) The minor flaws: - late night receptionist didn't offer any info at check-in (no property map, no explanation of the lunch/dinner choice, etc) - twice beach towels weren't available to switch so we had to use the same ones throughout our entire stay - no phones in the room (wish we could call within the property, like to restaurant or reception) - not the best margaritas

Reviews.Title: “Veryyyyy Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mk90longisland
Reviews.Content: We were there two weeks ago. Upon arrival, it was pouring and we did encounter a few storms during the week, which I thought would drive us crazy w/no tv, etc. - BUT NO! The serenity of Mahekal is the best. The beach is beautiful, the food, breakfast, lunch and dinner were all great, the staff was very nice, the rooms, veryyy comfortable (hard beds, but good for your back), SPECTAULAR SETTING/PROPERTY. Absolutely stunning, make sure you walk around and check out every nook and cranny... We went to town most every night for dinner. We know the town and that's what we usually do. There are a few new restaurants. One is right across the street from the hotel, the name escapes me, but it was really excellent!! Please also visit Cuevo del Chango, right up the road, BEST Mole Sauce I've had in 15 years and Casa Mediterranea/Ristorante Italiano, around 4th Street. Home made pasta and you feel like you're in italy (I know, strange, you're in Mexico, but check it out). There are two pools, we hung at the quiet one a day or two due to the high winds we had on the beach and loved it. Nice music from the bar - speaking of! - Happy Hour, don't forget to attend. We have not one complaint, except of course, wish we could've stayed longer. BTW, there is a small gift shop, so if you want a snack/ice cream. and.... don't forget to keep an eye out for the interesting animals you might spot! veryyy cool. Thanks Mahekal, we loved you, ~ Michelle & Jim

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is perfection - laid back and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jgcAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just stayed at Mahekal for 4 nights and had an amazing experience there. It was clean, the entire staff was friendly and helpful and it was a great value. We had a "stay for 3 nights and receive the 4th night for free" deal. We chose to have 2 meals included and the food was fresh and good. It is located at the quiet end of the beach which suited us perfectly. We were able to walk into town at night and on the beach during the day if we were interested in more stimuli - which included an $18/ hour massage. If we walked the beach in the other direction - we were on an isolated strip of gorgeous beach. The concierge Boli helped us rent a car to visit Tulum and snorkel at Yal Ku in Akumal.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Mahekal Beach Resort -- Loved Every Minute!”
Reviews.Author: drewfromnyc
Reviews.Content: We have visited Playa before and stayed in hotels ranging from the wonderful (Aventura Mexicana) to the so-so (Hotel Mimi del Mar), but Mahekal Beach Resort was totally magic. We enjoyed every minute. Mahekal has a beautiful setting to the north of Playa with palapa roofed huts, impeccably kept grounds and four blocks of gorgeous beach. Our second-floor room came with a super-comfortable king-sized bed, tiled shower and bathroom, rustic wood furniture, shutters, fan, air conditioning, and porch (also with fan) with two hammocks. There are two pools, two restaurants, two bars (one with swing seats), a game room with ping pong and pool tables, computers (to rent) and a free one in the lobby. Breakfast and dinner (or, if you prefer, lunch) is included and the food was good. Great for rest and relaxation. The staff, especially the concierge Boli, are nothing less than fabulous and a big reason that Mahekal is such a wonderful place to stay. We just got home last night and are already planning a trip back later this year.

Reviews.Title: “everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: fasteddieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I looked all over mexico for a vacation and were lucky enough to book at Mahekal! Check in was a little confusing but no big deal. We stayed in the pueblito section upstairs and loved it! Awesome tile bathroom, comfortable king size bed, big deck with hammocks, and no TV.....awesome!! Breakfast is great and the lunch menu was good as well. Dinner was hit or miss but good overall. The staff really make this place great. Everyone remembered our names after a day. The beach and the resort are HANDS DOWN the best in playa!! other reviews complained about smelly beach and loud music but wasn't bad. music from a club down the beach just for a few hours on sat. and sunday. only bad thing and they are not affiliated with the resort as they previously were is the dive shop. dead reef diveing is no fun. Plus they are very dangerous as they took 3 people with a 2 hour pool "training" on and open ocean dive with only one dive master..DANGEROUS!! But believe the hype about the resort because it rocks!!! allready booked our trip for next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Low key peaceful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Fraz_LA
Reviews.Content: Staff were very courteous and helpful. The beach and the pools were great and the rooms very peaceful. The bathroom could do with updating but it was not a problem. Will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful getaway in a friendly beachfront paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelerfrompenna
Reviews.Content: I travelled with two sisters to Makehal Beach Resort in January 2010. It was exactly what we needed for a relaxed getaway. Our beach-view room was a private thatched hut with a lovely and modern interior, though our favorite spot was the front porch strung with hammocks overlooking the palm trees and ocean. We woke up each morning to the sound of birds and ocean waves. The food was delicious at each meal (don't miss the Sunday night Mexican-themed dinner with a fun Mariachi band). The beach was pristine and, when we were there, we always found plenty of lounge chairs available. The swimming was wonderful in the ocean and the pools (the pools were a bit chilly but we attributed that to the weather-- the Yucatan peninsula was experiencing an unusual cool snap). We also enjoyed happy hour on the swings at the palapa bar. Makehal is a 5-10 minute walk from the shopping and restaurants of Playa del Carmen, which is a fun place to visit. Something else that really sets this resort above the others we've visited is the personal, friendly service. By our second day, the waiters knew our names and where we were visiting from. They gave my sister a birthday fiesta that she will never forget. We look forward to seeing them again on our next visit (which cannot come soon enough).

Reviews.Title: “I'ts getting even better!”
Reviews.Author: blooney
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay. They are steadily making improvements on the grounds of the Hotel. Sidewalks have been re-done, sandy paths are not so sandy anymore and easier to walk. New plantings and trees. New fence along the property by the front desk looks beautiful. Now they need to get to the interior of the rooms. Heard that they will soon have wi-fi in the rooms and possibly telephones to call the front desk That will be good for security issues. Breakfast was great as usual. Dinner, so-so. This continues to be a great place. It was chilly during our stay too. Did not use pool or even go into water, but not the Hotels fault. We will be back in April and can't wait to see the changes there. P.S. I think the pools are great and the guys in the dining room are wonderful. I heard no outside noise, except waves!

Reviews.Title: “First Time at the Mahekal”
Reviews.Author: stargreen
Reviews.Content: We just got back from four nights at the lovely Mahekal. I had spent weeks reading reviews and doing research on TripAdvisor, so I felt pretty prepared and confident that this would be a wonderful beach vacation. For the most part, it was. The Mahekal is beautiful and comfortable (great beds and hammocks!), and when it is warm and sunny, the beach is great (except for the dredging; see below). I'd like this review to be helpful, so there are a few things I think you might like to know before you go. 1. The weather in January is not necessarily warm. - I obsessed over the weather before we went, checking the 10-day forecast as if it were the Bible. Don't bother. The weather will do what it wants, and for us that meant some chilly temperatures, lots of wind, some clouds, rain and some sun. And we were only there for four nights! The weather does seem to set a tone, and when it finally warmed up, everyone seemed cheerier at the resort. 2. Playa del Carmen is not a sleepy little Mexican town. It is more of a city, and some nights you can hear that city traffic from your comfortable hammock on your beautiful Mahekal porch. It was very weird to hear that traffic hum, the motorcycles revving their engines, and the occasional horn or siren. I did not expect this. Also, the 'Quinta', or Fifth Avenue, was not for us. It was nice to have someplace to walk to, and we did have a good dinner there, but it is very commercial and not very Mexican. You can get Starbucks, Haagen Das, or a hamburger. We didn't see a taqueria or tortilleria there. We ended up getting good food at the Mahekal - get the Mexican plate for lunch, and don't miss the Mayan dinner! Also, we bought ceramic bowls at the Mahekal gift shop for less than in town. Another thing is that the beach does not have a clear horizon at night. In the distance you see the lights of the hotels and cruise ships on Cozumel. I would have preferred a more natural horizon. 3. Because of erosion and beach damage, dredging is taking place. We found out that this was the cause of the overwhelming, strong sulfurous smell that permeated the beach. Because I am such a beach person, this really bothered me. I was hoping for the smell of the sea, as were the other guests we spoke with. At first, no one at the resort would acknowledge the odor, but we finally got an answer, and that helped a lot! Knowing that it wasn't sewer or dead fish helped us to enjoy the beach more. 4. Tulum is a fantastic day trip, and the ruins at Tulum provide access to an amazing beach. I knew there was a beach in Tulum, but I thought that meant the town, and not the actual ruins area. If you go to the ruins, and I highly recommend it, wear your bathing suit and bring your beach bag (don't leave it in the car, as we did). After you walk around the ruins, go down the stairs to the beach. If you are a beach lover, you will never want to leave. Absolutely gorgeous! 5. I would highly recommend getting a car. It's not a difficult drive to the Mahekal, and it's easy to go to Tulum or Coba for the day. If we had not had a car when it was chilly in Playa del Carmen, we wouldn't have enjoyed ourselves as much. There is really nothing to do at the Mahekal if you aren't at the beach, the pool or the bar. On a couple of days it was too windy to enjoy the beach, and the pools aren't anything to write home about (I don't care because I'm there for the beach). It's great that the Mahekal is so close to town, but you can only walk down the Quinta so many times. 6. Finally, though I thought there were a few times when the service could have been better, I actually started to cry when checking out to leave this magical place. Others have written about this man at the front desk, Boli, who makes you feel like family. He is wonderful, and on the whole, this is a great place. You don't need a cabana on the beach; all of them are gorgeous and comfortable. When we go back to Mexico, it won't be to Playa del Carmen because the town is too big and commercial and there's too much going on around the beach (cruise ships, jet skis, beach clubs). We definitely will go back to the Tulum area, but when we do, I hope we find a place as beautiful as the Mahekal.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, Sun, good food and very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: denmil
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Mahekal Beach Resort. We had a wonderful stay! The weather was not the best but the beach is very nice, rooms are confortable and staff is just great. Breakfast and lunch with plenty of choices was very good and dinner was delicious. We enjoyed very much the live music during dinner. You will not regret, come and visit this beautiful oasis!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: olgaehr
Reviews.Content: One thing I have to say, I am that this place was not destroyed to clear up space for new condos. I was so sad to hear about these plans but luckly management changed their mind. One of my favorite places I have ever stayed in Playa. You get breakfast and dinner. Breakfast is great, dinners could be hit or miss but we still loved it. Resort is full of separated cabanas. Some are with the ocean view and some are a bit away from the beach. The rooms are simple but with everything you really need - bed and shower. No TV, which is perfect for secluded vacation. I love their bar (happy hour drinks). Also you can get a massage or walk across the street for a yoga class. All the tours can be organized in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Mahekal is a magical experience, friendly, leisurely, and unique.”
Reviews.Author: ChilledColorado
Reviews.Content: We have gone to Mahekal (and its predacessor Shangri La) for many years, meet friends and enjoy the great staff. Grass huts on the beach conveys the theme, but they are much more. Simple, laid back, and excellent staff, food, location, and so much more, If your interests run to the all inclusive resort, this may not be for you, but if you are looking for a unique experience we would recommend it highly. Go to sleep with the sound of the surf, the wind, or just quiet, its all there.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting and location”
Reviews.Author: talsomer
Reviews.Content: I must have spent weeks trying to sort out our acco on the Yucatan Pensinsula. We were 3 couples of which 2 with children, so the resort had to meet quite a few expectations. In the end we decided to stay in Mahekal and our friends with children in the Sandos Caracol, about a 50 mins. walk along the beach up north. Our welcome to the resort was very disappointing. We arrived fairly late (8pm) after a horrible journey of 17 hours from Birmingham (UK), but the receptionist did not seem to care at all and did not bother to ask us how the journey had been. He managed to mumble 'welcome to Mahekal' and told us to sign the check-in form and reminded us that we had to pay the remaining balance then and there. I asked him whether we could do that the next day as we had had such a long journey and I wanted to check the amount. Under protest and stating that he was doining us a huge favour, he agreed. I believe his name is Raphael/Raffa. As soon as we were escorted to our Pueblito by one of the staff members, we forgot about the incident. The 'pueblitot' was in Mexican style with ditto interior. Very nicely done, clean and with plenty of space for clothes and suitcases. The bathroom had a big shower and the bed was big and very comfortable. The hut has a very spacious balcony/veranda and comes with two hammocks. The room was cleaned every day and clean towels were provided every day as well. We had asked for a top floor pueblito and were able to move the next morning without a problem. No TV or radio in the room, but we had no need for them anyway! The resort has been set up very well, with many footpaths connecting the 2 swimming pools and restaurants. We stayed in a pueblito at the back which we preferred as it was more quiet than the 'huts' on the beach (who I have to admit had amazing views out over the sea and were bigger). We had booked half board. Breakfast was buffet-style with plenty of choice. In addition, you could order any type of egg dish or pancakes. The egg dishes were delicious. We had dinner the first night, but weren't impressed and decided to swap dinner for lunch and ended up doing so for the rest of our stay as lunch was a-la-carte and much better. Staff in the restaurants were brilliant. Always in good spirit and very attentive. The beach is probably the best beach in Playa and Riviera Maya. We walked quite a long way across the beach on a few occasions, and the sand here is cleaner and whiter and the sea is very accessible without having to struggle your way in because of rocks. The swimming pool at the back is mainly used for diving refreshers or courses, but the one at the sea front is very nice and great if you have kids and want to be close to the beach at the same time. The staff also allow you to have lunch on the grass next to the swimming pool, with a great view of the beach and ocean. There are plenty of mosquitos, but you find them everywhere so make sure you stock up on repellent. The resort is about a 5/10 mins walk from La Quinta, a nice pedestrianised street with loads of shops, bars and restaurants. We can recommend La Case del Agua on La Quinta and 2nd. Great seafood and a wide selection of wines. Some side notes: 1. as the resort was fully booked, they ran out of beach towels for 2 days in a row 2. our shower had little or no pressure and it was difficult to regulate the temperature 3. Mahekal is only 500 meters away from Las Mamitas, a beach club with live DJs. They start playing at about 2pm and usually stop at around 10pm. The music is quite present and although we quite like a dance on the beach every now and then, I can imagine that some people would fine it disturbing. Overall I would recommend this place, although I think it is a bit too expensive for what you get (we paid USD 282 per night as it was high season). Maybe interesting for people considering either Mahekal or Sandos Caracol: We spent quite a few nights in Sandos with our friends (security was nowehere to be found) and found that Mahekal was a much better choice. The food in Sandos was very disappointing (we managed to have a few meals with our friends free of charge as they do not seem to check bracelets!). As it was peak season, it was impossible to reserve for the a-la-carte restaurants and our friends had to eat in the buffet restaurants (of which the International one was the only good one). Our friends had booked the Select Club, but did not manage to benefit from the extras (special restaurants were fully booked, they could not find the Kids Club until the very last day, no nanny service available on some evenings etc.). The beach is nice at Sandos, but it is a nightmare to get into the open sea as an adult as you have to climb over slippy sand bags and most of that part of the sea is bordered with ropes as the rest is for the jet skis. So no chance of a good and far swim for swimming fanatics like me! Sandos counts over 900 rooms, Mahekal has about 109.. Overall I would not opt for Sandos if you prefer a smaller resort closer to the centre of Playa. But then Sandos is all-inclusive and Mahekal is not (prices were similar).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, even better as Mahekal”
Reviews.Author: JSAATY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from December 28, 2009 to January 4, 2010. We booked an oceanfront room and were wonderfully impressed. We had also stayed here in January of 2009 under former management. Through the transition from Shangri-la-Caribe to Mahekal, the new management has done a great job of preserving the "feel" that made Shangri-la such as wonderful property, but also putting in thoughtful upgrades that make the experience even better. There are new showerheads and bedding, hairdryers and other convenience items available, but the atmosphere of the property through the transition is being carefully protected. No TVs or phones in the room, with beachfront property, this is truly a place that you can unplug and have a great time in the ocean and the surf. The standout elements of the property are the food, the careful attention to the lush vegetation, the colorful yet secluded palapas-style rooms, and the wonderful staff. They were always kind and helpful. Oswaldo and Bolle are especially recommended as the kind of caring and competent people that you want to land with at a world-class resort such as this. If you get the chance, I would recommend strongly a stay here. We have stayed all over the world -- one resort begins to look and feel like another. This one is special, and you will be sure to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews...It's a fantastic place.”
Reviews.Author: hampdenLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This resort had been recommended to me by a friend. He described it as chill and very relaxing. I couldn't agree more. There are no televisions or wifi in the room to distract you. The rooms are relatively simple and kept very clean. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The guy who organizes side trips like fishing and snorkeling was great. He hooked us up with the best guides and activities. I believe his name is Bolli or close to that. Anyway you can find him at his desk in the same area as check in. Happy hour starts at 5pm and most of the people I met there had been coming to this resort for years. In general they were a very relaxed easy going group of vacationers. The hotel is situated at the north end of the beach which is great because it's quieter then some of it's neighbors to the south and you tend to get more locals there getting sun which creates a very nice atmosphere. There tends to be a lot of security everywhere which didn't bother me. It just feels very safe and especially at night when you might be walking along the beach, you feel protected. I felt a lot safer in Playa than most American towns I've been in. The food at the hotel is just average. Not terrible but not great. We ate there half the time and the other half we visited some of the local restaurants in the town. It's just a short walk to town and is a lot of fun there at night. To sum up I would say the resort far surpassed my expectations. It was one of our best vacations ever. If you are looking for an atmosphere to relax in and leave city life behind you'll be more than happy here. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed in it.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to our favorite place”
Reviews.Author: babsandmark
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 nights at Mahekal (formerly Shangri-la Caribe) and as in our previous two trips there, we loved it. We were in a beachfront bungalow and our friends were in the one right next to us. The beach here is beautiful and we loved playing in the waves. There was always a breeze which helped with the heat and humidity which seemed a little more intense this trip than in the past. These bungalows were very spacious and had a big shower/tub. Ours had two queen beds and our friends had a king. The breakfasts were good, although the eggs were often cooked beyond requested. I would agree with another reviewer that the front desk service is much improved, and appreciated. The main bar is great,especially at happy hour, but we often wondered why the other bar never seemed to be open. Sometimes it was hard to get a drink when we were at the Aventura pool. We were very happy that you can now get lunch or dinner with the meal plan. We had lunch most times because there are so many fun restaurants we wanted to hit for dinner, including several great ones very close to the resort. This place has a friendly, relaxed vibe and is in a great location at the north end of town. Perfect for walking down 5th ave, or the beach. Not fancy or swanky, but our favorite place for vacation. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Annalies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in December, on our first trip to Playa del Carmen. there were so many hotels to choose from before we came, but I am so glad we picked Shangri La. We were dropped at our hotel after a tour to Chichen ITza, and stopped at all the big luxury resorts along the way. After each big resort my partner and i thought 'oh, our hotel wont be anything like these ones'. And it wasnt - and we were so glad. It doesnt have the big resort feel to it that the other hotels packed together in the centre of town have. Staff are lovely and helpful and remember your name. It is set on a beautiful stretch of beach slightly out of the crowded beaches of the main town, but is still an easy 5-10 minute walk to the centre. The restaurant and food were great, and the best thing - each room comes with its own hammocks. Fantastic place - if we come back to Playa will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “4th trip.... hope to go back soon!”
Reviews.Author: kathivan
Reviews.Content: Another great trip! My daughter and I love this place. The one difference we noticed this time is that it was like a ghost town the first few days we were there! Don't know if it was the "hurricane" (which ended up being almost nothing), or the economy, or what. We have always visited during November, so I realize it's off season, but still seemed very quiet. Other than that, we noticed no big change since the new owners took over. We were very excited to again see our favorite guys in the restaurant... Manuel, Rogelio and Ruben. Food was fantastic as usual, although they did change the ordering process. It used to be that it was a buffet or they gave you the choice of a couple different options. Now, they have an actual menu with a great variety of choices or on certain nights a buffet. Boli at the front desk is always fantastic, so sweet and helpful! One note regarding the hurricane- for 2 nights the sea was pretty big. In fact the first night I was a little concerned about going to sleep d/t water coming up to and past our unit. It was nice to see the security out there ALL night with their flashlights keeping an eye on the water!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: JodieVancouverB_C_
Reviews.Content: We were here on our honeymoon and had never traveled to the East coast of Mexico before....we loved the sand and surf, quite a change from the west coast of Mexico....Everyone at the resort was so accomodating, our room was simple, but very clean, the food in the restaraunt was very good...have the garlic shrimp for lunch or dinner, you won't be disappointed! The location was fabulous, and there was always security guards roaming the grounds....All in all it was truly a vacation to remember! We will return again someday! Soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: charcole1
Reviews.Content: The dinner selections were meh but other than that, this place fantastic. We stayed in one of the beach front bungalows and couldn't have been happier with our stay there. The staff were friendly and the accommodations were stellar. I thought the beach would be busier as it is located near a public access but it wasn't at all. The breakfasts were really good and the resort is within walking distance of downtown Playa del Carmen. I hope to be able to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: JennyR0620
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a week in December for a destination wedding. I loved it! I had never been to Mexico, and this was such a great experience. The hotel itself is comprised of two level buildings (one guest room is on the first level, another guest room is on the second level) and beachfront bungalos. We stayed in a garden room, and it was big enough to fit three people comfortably. The rooms really have no frills at all--it's just a couple of beds, a desk, and a chair--there are no TVs, telephones, or clocks. I thought I wouldn't be able to survive without these things, but it was actually really nice! The only problem is that a clock would have been nice to have an alarm wake me up in time for breakfast (breakfast and dinner are included in the rates, but the breakfast ends at 10:00 am, I think). The bathrooms were spacious, and I loved the tiling details throughout. My brother and his wife stayed in a beachfront bungalo and it was really cool! It was larger than our room and a bit nicer, but still didn't have any frills, which was fine because you really don't need anything when the beach and ocean are literally right outside your door! The breakfasts at the resort were the same almost every day---a waiter took your "main" order (waffles, french toast, omlette, etc.) and then you could go to an all you can eat buffet for side items that included hash browns (DELICIOUS!!!!!!), pastries, bacon, sausage, fruit, and toast. Coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice were included. We were on our own for lunch. That was fine with me because I usually pigged out so much during breakfast that I wasn't hungry until dinner. There's also a Walmart a short cab ride away, so we stopped there on our second day to pick up some snacks to tide us over throughout the day. Dinners were really nice and it was obvious that they put alot of effort into them. The waitstaff was GREAT! They did everything with gusto and seemed to truly take pride in their work. I can't say enough great things about them. The dinners were good but I was not in love with them. Usually, we were given 2-3 choices for main dishes, and a couple of days there was a buffet, which was awesome! A couple of days they also had a mariachi group that went table to table singing requests. While I wasn't crazy about the food at every dinner, the attentive staff and fun atmosphere made up for it. One thing that I should mention is that while the hotel provides breakfast and dinner, drinks are not included. My boyfriend usually drinks Coke with his dinner, and he was charged for it. I understand not including alcohol in the all-inclusive price, but I think at the very least, sodas should have been included. I also want to mention that while I love the waitstaff at the hotel, I did not really love the front desk staff. They were pretty slow and just didn't seem nearly as hospitable as the waitstaff. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, especially for people who want a vacation that is super relaxing. There wasn't much going on at night, and it was just completely laid back, which I loved. By the way, the wedding there was gorgeous and this was the best trip I have ever taken. I really will NEVER forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pibb1122
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked at how highly this hotel has been rated in recent months. For the amount my husband and I paid (150 USD excl tax in October) we expected much more considering this is not an all inclusive hotel (the hotel offers a European plan that includes bfast and dinner) and considering higher end chains were charging just as much during this period. We initially planned to stay 2 nights but left after 1 night and got a lower rate at the Omni in Puerto Aventuras where we had our own jacuzzi and balcony. Below are our impressions. Bad 1. No TV, no phone, no iron/ironing board, no fridge, no internet. Basically, no amenities. 2. No comforters on the beds - just a blanket over sheets. 3. Many aunts crawling around the room. 4. Weak air conditioning. 5. Construction - jack hammer next door started at 8:30 AM 6. Rooms are very sparsely decorated. Overall, property feels like a lodge, complete w/ table tennis in main bar area. Good 1. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Management was quite nice about returning our money for the 2nd night which we had prepaid at the desk. 2. Proximity to main street. However, I should note that wasnt a big selling point for us since it also meant the beach area is open to the public. 3. The hotel gives guests the option to transfer dinner (included w/ room price) to lunch should guests choose to dine out for dinner instead. As we left after one night, we can't comment on the quality of food. If the rate at Shangri La had been half of what we paid, we would have been more understanding of the quality but we thought the value was not there for the price, esp. during this low season.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best beach in PDC!”
Reviews.Author: jaydfwtx
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were able to checkin before the normal checkout was even over. We got right into our room, although we surprised the maid as she was finishing up! The OV room was great, the only issue we had was getting the room cold with the A/C that first day. The front desk staff gave us the option of changing rooms, however none could compete with the one we had, so we decided to stay put and got smart about it. We blocked off the gaps under the patio & entry doors where most of the cold air was escaping. Also, avoid using the fans during the day which can pull down hot air from the vaulted thatched ceilings. The beach here is very wide and nice. There are some small reef areas to snorkel in front of the hotel. Be careful not to bump into any sea urchins! We saw some kind of small ray in the shallow water, as well as quite a few different fish. It isn't mentioned anywhere, and maybe this was a special thing, but we were given the option of swapping dinner for lunch. You just had to decide by 11:30, and you could choose your meal including appetizer and dessert. This is a good option if you want to eat dinner on 5th ave a few times. Say hi to Rogelio! The resort is split by Calle 38, and it appeared most of the south side was closed while we were there. Whether it was because of renovations, or just b/c it is the low season is unknown to me. I didn't hear any construction noises. We did have a strong storm come through at 1am the second night. I believe it was fairly unusual, and caused our thatched roof to leak. For our room, this was only over part of the room, so it wasn't a big deal, just make an effort not to leave stuff like cameras where this can happen. I happen to think the roof is part of the charm of this place, and you just have to accept things like this can happen. We will definitely be returning here on future trips to PDC!

Reviews.Title: “glad they are not closing!”
Reviews.Author: Jdee3
Reviews.Content: we went a few years ago and loved it! I can still remember so great conversations with Ipolito and Miguel, our friends. And of course the excellent recommendations from Ipolito about a better cenote and ocean snorkeling reef than the typical touristy ones! When I heard they were going to close, I was very disappointed...but like another traveler, I got a postcard saying they will remain!! YAHOO, now we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Going back in August!”
Reviews.Author: corndoggie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here this April and we are going back and bringing friends this August. Check-in to check out this was a wonderful vacation. The staff was great and always helpful. The food was good and the rooms were clean.I loved that we could walk into town everyday or night and if we got tired it was a quick cab back ($5) We could book any tours right in the lobby and there is a fun bar with swings. You can't go wrong, so just go! Susan Conover

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-la is My Happy Place...it can be yours, too!”
Reviews.Author: ChellinND
Reviews.Content: My husband and 3 other couples stayed at Shangri-la in February 2009. Our stay was the 4th time visiting this resort and it is amazing! The pictures do not come close to giving you a complete vision of the property. When we thought Shangri-la was going to close (more on that later!), we were so sad to think that all the beautiful landscaping, villas, tiled sidewalks, bar with swings would be leveled. We have been to Mexico and Playa more times than I can count and without a doubt, Shangri-la is the place to stay if you want the perfect beach experience. All it takes is a stroll up and down the beach and you can see for yourself that the beach in front of this resort is where you want to be. The villas on the beach are so rustic and perfect...open the windows, turn on your ceiling fan and let the ocean breezes float through your room. No phone, no tv, no clock - no problem! You will not miss any of them! The morning breakfast is another huge plus becuase you can get any kind of eggs, pancakes to order, not to mention a full buffet of pastries, fruits, ceral, fresh juice, yogurt, granola, etc. etc. The wait staff are so accomodating and they remember your name and they even remember our family from year to year. Sweet, sweet, sweet! The Sunday dinner is the one to stay on property for becuase there is every kind of delicious dish for you to choose from. And again the staff is there to wait on you hand and foot! Plus it is fun when the marachi band comes around to play songs...it really brings you into their culture and it's an innocent, family-orientated kind of entertainment. It will surely bring a smile to your face! Don't miss the happy hour at the swing bar! Great way to start your night before walking down to 5th Avenue and experiencing all the fun bars and restuarants Playa has to offer! Now back to the closing of this resort. Just today we received a postcard in the mail saying that they are not closing, will improve their services and offering incentives to book. So we are thrilled and will be back! Don't wait! Book today for the experience you will always remember!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: 123456Mexico
Reviews.Content: I spent one week @ Shangrila Caribe. I can say that, this is the best hotel in playa with beachfront. The staff and the restaurant are the best of the hotel, you can enjoy mexican and internacional food. The hotel is located only 200 meters away from mamitas beach club. Many people is saying that the hotel is close that is not true, please visit it. [---]

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little paradise”
Reviews.Author: AngeLaPeregrina
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it's all the straw umbrellas on the beach or what but once you are inside the resort it is very nice. Feels like a tropical paradise kind of thing. The beach is so nice at this hotel and the rooms are adorable.I really liked their breakfast's. Get the poached eggs. The mall is something like a $1 cab ride away and the cutest restaurant 'Cave of the Monkeys' or something is next store. This part of Mexico is beautiful and the hotel is perfectly situated in it's surroundings. Also they have hammocks on your front tiled porch that I spend lots and lots of time in. Bring mosquito repellent. Otherwise go for it, you won't regret staying here. It's very romantic also oh la la.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Front Property....at the Shangri-la Caribe”
Reviews.Author: RaeTexas123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night vacation to the Shangri-la Caribe. As the George Strait lyrics go....We had our own "ocean front property...." We truly felt like we were in our own private paradise. We stayed in a charming, authentic mexican beach front cabana that was about 50 feet from the ocean. The front of our cabana had an expansive porch where we found ourselves relaxing, sipping our favorite tequilla, listening to the crashing waves or just lounging with books in our hammocks. This property is the perfect mix of relaxation, romance and FUN, which to me is what makes a perfect get away! If not strolling along the beautiful white sandy beaches or lounging in the sun under a palapa, we were headed into town for a late lunch, margaritas, shopping or some late night fun in the town! The heart of downtown Playa was just a short walk away. The staff was always gracious and the food a special treat each day with the beautiful morning sky, incredible ocean views and my favorite made to order huevos rancheros, fresh fruits and juices! Massages on the property with Blanca were heavenly and not to be missed! It is rumored this property is closing soon, but I know for certain that it will remain open for 2 more years. So go NOW and expererience your own little paradise and your own "ocean front property...", like no other!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful huts surrounded by beach and gardens”
Reviews.Author: pajaroDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a cool place to stay where the birds wake you up singing outside your adorable private palapa hut, complete with front porch and hammocks. Walk out the door to the beach, no elevator hassle, beautiful landscaped gardens, great food and service; plus they make swan, elephant, and unique animal designs out of your towels, decorate them with fresh hibiscus flowers, and place them on your bed everyday! Concierge is excellent -- arranged a great sidetrip for us to Sian K'aan biosphere, which is well worth seeing! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed most of it!”
Reviews.Author: loafy
Reviews.Content: Neat place! Some things were really good about this place; others really not so much. We traveled there during Easter week, April 9-16. The weather was nice; Playa was more crowded than my first time in Sept '07 and I probably wouldn't go during a holiday time again. BEACH: The beachfront location is very nice, plenty of chairs and palapas and a nice wide area of sand. The beach clubs a short distance south aren't that great, chairs and people are crammed together on an eroding beach front and I was glad this place had its own beach front. Ocean had waves and strong undertow much of the time. POOLS: This place had two small pools, both were clean and refreshing. The only really annoying thing were a few unsupervised kids screaming and running around at any given time of any day having been abandonded by thoughtless parents. When you're in the pool and getting bumped and splashed by these things, it can really get on your nerves in a small pool. Thankfully some left halfway through my vacation. (See above re avoiding a holiday period). BAR: Drinks are not included, and there is an option of charging drinks to your room or paying at the time of service. We did both, the bill was correct at the end of the stay. The prices were okay, and the drinks were fine. Bartenders were half the time pleasant, the other half not. In the bar area there was a pool table and ping pong which further enticed the presence of the screechy tweens so that area wasn't that great sometimes. Going in to Playa for 2 for 1 happy hours was easy enough a few times, most places seem to have that. FOOD: The food was interesting, I have been to really big all-inclusives before where there are numerous places to eat and dishes offered; this place offered breakfast and dinner in just two places as in, breakfast and grill items were always in one place, and dinner was always only in the other. A few nights were a la carte, the rest were buffet. The a la carte meals were okay, not inedible and not fantastic. The Mexican buffet night was nice with a mariachi band playing and a specialty tequila drink; the Italian buffet night was tasty and the place decorated nicely. Breakfast was fine with a selection of mexican egg dishes (yum!) ROOM: My biggest gripe. I paid for the least expensive room, and it was really awful. It was a big single story palapa which base was concrete - and the bed bases themselves were also concrete slabs! Beds in Mexico are hard enough, and this just made it worse. Threadbare bed linens. There were just 3 lights, 2 of which were sconces (pointing upwards) and all using those dim spiral "efficient" bulbs. There was no room mirror, the only mirror was a bathroom mirror that was just shoulders up. I liked the shower, it was a big walk-in concrete shower with good pressure and was always hot enough. Hammock and chair and table set on the little patio, no view of anything so didn't hang out there. Room service was well done. It was clean and they spray and clean for these teeny little ant-like bugs in the bathroom, though on my last day there I ran into a cockroach the size of my head on the floor. (wear shoes in your room if you're on the ground floor) I asked to switch rooms because of the awful bed, I was told they "were all like that" and none were available; not a nice response since the place seemed empty at the beginning of the week and many of the more expensive garden view palapa rooms had regular beds and decent mirrors and lighting (you could walk up to empty rooms and look inside). The beach front rooms looked really nice as well, however, it was very windy much of the time the closer you got to the beach. CONCLUSION: If I went again, I'd get the better room and I'd try to avoid a busy time just because it's a small place. It's a hike from 5th avenue so there is a lot of walking if you don't cab it, although you must watch the cab prices. Went to Alux, the cave place, that's a must-see! Take pesos, it's much easier. I love Playa and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “sweet and nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: chase2aidan
Reviews.Content: We got back yesterday from a six day stay. Our first impression was not so good. We payed 455.00 a night for an ocean view room. We were brought to a room with a slight glimpse of the water but more of the back of another hut/room. The layout of the property is that of a village of small huts with winding pathways and beautiful plants. Make sure you speak to Bolli, the concierge. He is very helpful and accomodating. He moved us to a wonderful room overlooking the pool and ocean. It was perfect and we were very thankful. One thing no one has mentioned is that the property is divided by a street and public beach entrance. It is not anything to be concerned with and I actually liked being so close to the culture and mexican people. They are so friendly and kind. Another thing we experienced was that the beach was extremely crowded. It felt like Daytona Beach but someone mentioned it was spring break/easter so they were on holiday as well. The food really was good. Breakfast and dinner were included and were quite yummy. I was a bit concerned b/c I have two picky boys but they were very happy. Lunch was also great. No need to leave the resort. Their tacos are delicious, esp. the fish tacos and guacamole!! yum! Margaritas were strong and threw me for a loop! Happy hour is from 5-6 and drinks are 2 for 1. It's a nice social place that we thoroughly enjoyed. The pools are nice and clean and the ocean was incredible!!! We had a great time and would definitley recommend it to anyone. It is older and quaint and a bit campy. Just be aware you are in for an experience unlike most other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: JanChan42
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 6 nights in a beachfront bungalow in Adventura section. Location was wonderful. Seemed more private than other rooms. Great front porch with two hammocks. Rooms are a bit basic but very clean and ample room with sitting area and seperate bathroom with shower and double sinks. Great windows with shutters which allows great ocean breeze into room. Great ceiling fans. Service was exceptional. Everyone at the resort was extremely helpful and friendly. We ate all of our meals at the resort and enjoyed them all. Dinners were great. I highly recommend staying at the resort for dinner which is included in the price along with breakfast. Security was great. A guard was always visible from our porch 24 hours a day. Concierge was also very helpful and friendly. He set us up with an ATV/zip line/cenote adventure that was lots of fun. He also set us up with a local guy that took us out snorkeling and fishing. We had absolutely no complaints until the last day and a half of our stay because of loud music from a resort down the beach. We were told that it was because local schools starting their spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDawn
Reviews.Content: What a special and beautiful property! Daniel at the front Desk was the best! What a great personality you have Daniel, we so enjoyed you!! Marco and Alberto our servers were so wonderul, the service was excellent and so was the food. I was so impressed by the food, the Chef is from the Yucatan and uses his Grandmothers secret recipes! I am totally in love with Mayan Coffee now!! The Bellman was fabulous, and so was our maid, We never got her name, but got to see her in the Pueblito next door as we were leaving to go check out so I was able to tip her more, She did such a great job on our room, She really pays attention to the little things. I never had a housekeeper impress me that much! The property is so special, it is right on the beach and it is a really nice beach, I think one of the best in Playa. It is about 7 minute ride to Avenida five though, and some of the reviews I read said you could walk to avenida five in five minutes, no you cannot walk, it is too far and with the heat, forget trying to walk it. Anyway, this is the most romantic charming property I have ever stayed at. It is quite unique!! The staff is great, the location is great, nuff said!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rustic and unique”
Reviews.Author: MountainOceanGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights at the Shangri-La Caribe at the end of March. We booked an Aventura ocean view room and were very happy to get one of the bungalows almost right on the beach. The bungalow was a bit rustic and could use a remodel for sure. Bits of the thatched roof fall down, a few bugs get in and bite you at night, the bathrooms have great Mexican tiles but are quite old, and the cushions on the sofas had heavy mold and staining, you have to put all of your toilet paper in the garbage too. At $400 a night I am not sure these negatives should have been there. On the Plus sides: The bungalow porch was fantastic with great hammocks and the sound of the ocean from our bed was great. They use energy efficient light bulbs which is great. The housekeeping was excellent. Adequate water and towels were provided. The breakfasts were awesome in the morning. The beach was very secure with many guards keeping the guests only at the beach and pool areas. The landscaping was pleasant and tropical. The dinners were not that great and started at 7 PM which is a terrible time if you have young children- we did. The overall service was a mixed bag. The restaurant and bar employees were very helpful and friendly. The front desk staff however was rude and entirely unhelpful. We asked for a crib which never came. We were made to wait while the front desk guy fiddled with one of his electronic gadgets and then he acted like he was doing us a favor by talking to us. The lady concierge told us she had confirmed a taxi hire for the day but the taxi never came. Someone spilled chocolate milk by the pool and it took 24 hours for someone to clean it up despite numerous guards and landscape and maintenance folk wlaking right by it. But the housekeeper was very friendly and very efficient. So all in all the service was not consistent. But if you want a bungalow resort that is right on the beach this is a fantastic choice. We ate most of our dinners at the Monkey Bar up the road and I highly recommend the place. The food and service and ambience are fantastic. Even fine for small kids since part of it has outdoor seating.

Reviews.Title: “If you want rest and relaxation, that is exactly what you are going to get!!”
Reviews.Author: Tbuck12
Reviews.Content: Shangri La was exactly what we were hoping for and more. My boyfriend and I just got back from a 6 day stay there. Reading TripAdvisor reviews really helped me out when I was planning this vacation many months ago. One thing that everyone needs to keep in mind when they read these reviews is that each person intercepts things differently and we all have our own tastes. There have been many things that I have read on these reviews that made me extremely nervous for our trip (bugs, terrible tasting food, parties, mean security guards, etc.). None of these happened to us. My boyfriend and I are in our early to mid twenties and were so excited to find a hotel that was did not have “Spring Break 2009” written all over it. We did not want a vacation of public drunkenness, we wanted rest and relaxation and that is exactly what we got. Our room: 13 P. My advice is to look through some of the pictures that have been taken by other reviewers to get an idea of any “specific” room you would like. I was enamored with a lot of the beach views and thought that was exactly what we were going to get.. and it was… kind of. Our room was behind the pool so it had a great view of the pool with the ocean behind it. I was quite disappointed as I had double checked the reservations and we were supposed to be on the Caribe side (which I was told had much better views) versus the Aventura side (which had bigger rooms) Upon checking in I was very upset because my boyfriend and I could have slept on a twin bed given the option if we could have had the opportunity for a better view. We stayed with 13 P, in the end, it just wasn’t worth the drama. For future reference confirm and bring a printout. The rooms as mentioned are very very sparse (bed, dresser, chair) Surprisingly we really appreciated this. There was no clock, no phone, and no television. No interruptions. We didn’t come to Shangri La to stay in our room; it was there to sleep in. The beds as described in most reviews are extremely hard (just be forewarned). The hammocks on the balcony are probably the best amenity offered and we loved it. It was wonderful to read your book and listen to the waves. One thing also to note about 13 P or any room in that general vicinity was that it is literally right next door to where breakfast is served. It was not that big of a deal to us as we usually were half away awake when the servers were getting everything ready and a couple of plates clanking together served as our call to get out of bed and start the day..(Who wants to be sleeping all day in paradise anyway?!?) The only issue that my boyfriend pointed out was that there was a burning smell each morning, not quite sure from what, but once I realized it the last day it was pretty potent. To sum it up: Get an ocean view room away from the restaurant and get double/triple confirmation on where you are at. Food: We have never stayed at an inclusive resort and found that Shangri La’s options suited us just fine. The breakfast as everyone has said is incredible. The fruits are fresh and juicy and there are enough options to please even the pickiest eater. We loved not having to “eat” lunch at the hotel. I think if lunch was included we would have felt like we were wasting money by not eating there. We ate out on the town almost every day. Aca Los Tacos has some of the best tacos ever, I highly recommend going and getting the chicken tacos with a side of chips (beware the green salsa makes your stomach churn it’s so hot) and a Cerveza Grande to go along with it. Before arriving in Playa I was horrified as to what dinner would actually be like based on previous reviews and I am a very picky eater. I don’t know what other people are used to but the food is definitely not as terrible as some make it out to be. I preferred the Mexican and Mayan buffet nights as I enjoy that type of food over some of the other nights but regardless the food is the equivalent of any buffet place in the states… besides who goes to the beach to eat?!? Misc: The happy hour was pretty decent. 2 for 1’s from 5-6, you end up spending about $8 for 4 drinks which is better than most bars. Outside of happy hour I think the beers were about $3 which is still super cheap. We had planned on buying a cooler and packing it with beer but were too lazy to drag it the couple of blocks, but if you are a drinker, this is the way to go. Also, people in previous reviews said that people did not come out early to get beach chairs – this is a lie. People get out there very early and acquire the best spots with their towels. Be very aggressive if you want a “good” spot. The beach was wonderful and the guards made it even better. Since every beach in Playa is public it was nice to get some local interaction but privacy as well. We also loved that no one approached us to buy something. We had spent some time in Mazatlan being bombarded by beach merchants and we did not see a single one.. Overall, our trip was wonderful! We plan to return to Playa soon after we see a little bit more of the world. Like everyone else I hope that the Shangri La does not get torn down as it is truly a great place and it is fantastic to see people there for their 11th year in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La was not for us!”
Reviews.Author: haylienick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late twenties and this was our first trip to Mexico. We broke the trip up among three areas (including staying in a rustic cabana in Tulum)...Playa del Carmen/Shangri-La Caribe was our last stop. We checked in early and this was not an issue, we were able to put our luggage behind the counter. We found the rooms to be very simple and basic, no extra comforts or luxuries but I guess we did not really need a whole lot since we hoped on not being in our room much. The hotel grounds and beach area were quite crowded and the beach itself is not very wide. The beach chairs were always taken, even first thing in the morning, people laid their towels on them. The guests were primarily middle-aged and tacky midwesterners. No offense, it just seemed that a lot of these people did not even attempt to use one word of Spanish and cared more about taking shots of cheap tequila and buying "One tequila, two tequila, three tequila...floor" shirts. I do not think we saw any other younger couples as this seemed like a resort for families and middle aged adults. When trying to sleep, we could hear people screaming and partying. We were hoping for something more romantic and quiet. The only thing we liked about staying here is that it was close the main area of town so we could walk to grab dinner and lunch. We only ate breakfast at Shangri-La, which I stuck with the fruit and oatmeal. The servers were not very friendly but maybe it was because they had to deal with rude people asking for bigger plates. At times, it was embarassing watching Americans interact with the people working there. Overall, we were not impressed with this hotel and maybe it is because it is simply not our kind of place. But we also do not plan on returning to Playa, it was just too touristy for us.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for the experience”
Reviews.Author: astonvillan
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La and the Las Palapas both seemed to offer an experience different from the run of the mill 5 star hotel or all-inclusive holiday. I was a little sceptical about paying so much for basic accommodation, but after reading the tripadvisor reviews I thought I'd take the plunge. My wife and I stayed for 10 mights at the beginning of March and we loved it. We were going to stay at Las Palapas as they offered a breakfast only option (as opposed to the Shangri-La's braekfast and dinner plan), but changed our mind after reviewers complained of the noise from the nearby Mamitas beach club. So we chose the Shangri-La. Rooms: We were in room 48A in the Peublito garden section. It was on the ground floor of a 2 storey cabana. The room was spacious and clean with a king size bed and table and chair. It also had 2 built in wardrobes. The bathroom had a wetroom type shower and was tastefully decorated with brightly coloured tiling popular in Mexico. Toilet tissue wasn't allowed to be put into the WC but had to be put into a nearby bin. Even though we were in the garden section, we could still hear the sea quite clearly which was very soothing. The room could have done with a refridgerator to keep drinks cold (you're supplied with a bottle of water each day). We ended up buying a cool box and ice from a nearby supermarket. Restaurants: There were 2 restaurants, one for breakfast nad one for dinner. Tables were always available even during busy times. Bar: This also served as a games room with 2 pool tables a table tennis table and TV. Happy hour was from 5 to 6 when you get 2 drinks for the price of 1. Beach: Situated along one of the best streches of beach in Playa. Seemed to always be a constantly strong breeze on the beach, which was great when it was hot but not so good when it was cloudy. One part is suffering from some erosion. There are always chairs available. The best area seemed to be at the Adventura end of the beach. Massage: My wife had a massge at the hotel. She says it was very good. It was $35 US (500 pesos) for half an hour, which is a little more expensive that other places in town or along the beach. Food: Breakfast was great. We had lunch once, but although value for money the portions were too large for us ofr a lunchtime meal. We both enjoyed all our dinners at the Shangri-La and can't understand the negative comments about the dinners. We ate there every night except one and didn't have a bad meal once. Some nights were better than others, but overall the food was very good. Staff: All the staff were friendly and very helpful. The Shangri-La exceeded our expectations and from a personal point of view was worth paying the extra money for. However it may not be everyones cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Olguitax
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, at the end of the crowd Playa del carmen, not too far and not too close, just perfect to go for a walk around the 5th avenue at night if you wish. Very good diving club!!!! Just be aware that there are many families with kids, but if that doesn't bother you it's ok. Try to avoid the rooms next to the restaurants, breakfast and dinner is included so could be noisy if you want to go to bed early sinc ethe generators are just behind the restaurant, they stop around 12 or so. The beach is amazing, service is good and food ok. But it's much better to be far from the center and just in front of the beach. The batroom is very nice with tipical mexican tiles and the upper rooms ceiling is like a hut, could be noisy if you don't sleep well. They have amazings hamacas in every terrace, just very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Location for a Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JHagen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at the Shangri La Caribe in Playa Del Carmen during the week of March 2nd, 2009. We have stayed at a variety of five star resorts such as some of the Sandals Resorts throughout the Caribbean, and some 3 star resorts. So the bottom line is we're going to give a fair review. We loved the hotel. As some people wrote, it is a little expensive for a hotel that is not all-inclusive. That and the food (which I'll get into later) is why we gave it a three out of five on Value. However, what you have to realize is that you are not paying for amenities of an all-inclusive. You are paying for the great location and the tranquility of the resort. It is on one of the best stretches of beaches in the Mexican Riviera. It is also on the north edge of Playa Del Carmen for easy access to great dining, night life, and other attractions like water sports. The hotel is not at all crowded. At times you feel like there is hardly anyone there. No need to get up early and reserve chairs at pools or beaches. They are always available. We always had chairs and umbrellas within eyesight of our room. The entire resort is built on the sand. There are neat paths cut through the immaculate landscape that give a very tropical feel. We found the staff to be very accommodating and friendly. We had a few ants in our room on our first night. I went to the front desk and within 5 minutes it was dealt with very efficiently. Rogelio (one of the restaurant wait staff) was super nice and helpful. Overall everyone else was very friendly and professional too. One of the bell boys (regrettably I forget his name) hooked us up with a cooler, free of charge to use during our stay so we could keep pop and beer cold in our room. It was much cheaper and more convenient to get these things at the convenience stores only two or three blocks away. The bar will provide you with ice for a very fair price (actually they didn't even charge half the time). We booked an ocean view room - got 8A on Caribe side which was almost as close to the ocean as the ocean front rooms. We had a spectacular view (see pictures). We were literally 100 feet from the ocean. We were close enough to get a nice ocean breeze and hear the waves lull us to sleep at night without it being too loud. There was a lot of surf during our stay so I can believe how people in ocean front rooms would think of the ocean being too loud. I would definitely save the money and get an ocean view over an ocean front. We were on the bottom level of a two level bungalow. You can hear the people upstairs some, especially when they move furniture or drop something on the floor, but overall it was a not an issue. The rooms were sparsely decorated but who needs decorations on your wall when you have a view of the palm trees, blue sky and turquoise Caribbean. Otherwise rooms were exceptionally clean. There were signs in the bathrooms asking guests to not flush toilet paper. This sounded a little awkward, but we quickly came up with a system of keeping our plastic bags from the market and using them for the number two jobs, and immediately discarding them in the outside garbage cans that are between all the rooms. Pools were very small but we only used them once with the ocean being absolutely perfect to swim in. Some said they were cold. As with most pools, they were cool at first but once you were in they were fine. I would not classify them as cold. Now for the food. Breakfast was outstanding, and included with the price. Lunch was good, but not included in the price. Dinner was nothing to write home about. There was theme night each night that offered only a couple options. Dinner was also included in the price. My wife and I like to try different restaurants so we went out for most of our dinners anyway. The bar is equipped with ping pong and pool. They serve very decent drinks, but again, not included in the price. If you want to exercise on your vacation, there is no gym on site but there are two gyms within a few blocks. On modern gym to the south, and one less modern but nonetheless equipped a half block north of the OXXO store. Overall, I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to get relax and get away from it all. It is all about R&R at the Shangri La. If you're looking for a party atmosphere you need to look elsewhere. In fact, everyone at that stays at the Shangri-La would probably appreciate it. This is really a dying breed of resorts that are becoming extinct to make way for the ever popular mega resorts that stack people on the beach like cord wood. It is truly a gem, like a well kept secret. It has been rumored that the hotel is going to be leveled to make room for more condos but nobody really seems to know for sure. I asked when I booked the hotel with the Turquoise Reef Group and I was told that it will be a few years before that happens, if at all. One of the gentlemen at the front desk told me the same. If you have any follow-up questions, please feel free to contact me via e-mail at five0@chibardun.net.

Reviews.Title: “OK to Good”
Reviews.Author: mooneysox
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Shangri-La Caribe after 7 days there, first time to Playa. Cute resort with low-level scattered colorful palapas instead of a large building, as you can tell from the photos. To the point: the price was OK, but a bit high for the near lack of amenities. The location is very good, right on the beach and a short walk to 5th Avenue, the happening part of Playa. Rooms are clean but are starkly sparse-2 beds and a small table, no wall decorations at all. There are 2 small pools, a volleyball court (but no ball-we had to buy one), a ping pong table and 2 pool tables. Our kids passed their time playing ping pong but grumbled about not enough to do. The food was OK, not great, the usual breakfast buffet and rotating dinner meals which varied from good to OK. The service was good and our housekeeper provided extra service in response to our daily $2 tip. The beach is nice, but is very small and was really crowded with locals on the weekend. Oddly, a public beach access route divides the resort into halves. Lots of security around, mainly to keep locals and interlopers from using their beach chairs and pools and we never felt unsafe. We were asked by security guards a couple of times if we were staying at the resort on our return back from the beach but I made a point to say hi to the guards so that they would know us, and that stopped. As for restaurants, the food in town was really inexpensive, probably less than we paid for the breakfast-dinner plan, so booking a room without the meal plan may be a better option. El Fogon was great as was the Monkey Cave (I think Cange de Chagon?) that's only a couple of doors away where we had shrimp tacos to die for. Our best food, though was lunch in Tulum, where we went on 2 days to enjoy the better beach. Mezzanine was great as was Blu Tulum with a great beach and even better laid back but chic attitude. We went to one of the cenote attractions, a smaller one and it was $40 to snorkel in a cave. It was far more expensive than it should have been and a bit cheesy unless you've never been in a cave and not worth it. Unfortunately our trip was jaded by a bad drive back to the airport. After getting US $ from an ATM to avoid bringing pesos home a gas station attendant attempted to give an 8 peso to a dollar exchange rate despite the sign next to her saying it was 12.5/1 at the station. On the drive to Cancun, despite being passed repeatedly by speeding locals and carefully watching my speed to avoid this very event, we were pulled over by local police who insisted that I was speeding we would have to either pay them cash or would have to go back 30 minutes south to the police station to pay a fine. I had a card from the rental agency that was supposed to handle this but to no effect and ended up having to fork out a bribe to be allowed on our way and make our flight. A friend had the same thing happen to him the day prior and had the time to argue and avoid the payoff. These two events left a bad flavor in my mouth as to what the locals really think of the Americans who vacation there. I would certainly go back to the area to enjoy the weather and the beaches, but might go further south toward Tulum as Playa's getting built up, and just go into Playa for the entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice beach location, but at upwards of $300/night the facilities need attention.”
Reviews.Author: calmtnman
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place with a friendly staff, and I wouldn't want to discourage anyone from giving it a try, but my one word of advice is to reserve the least-cost room that is available. All are within 100 paces of the beach and there is little difference in the amenities among the rooms. My wife and I rented the "penthouse" based upon photos at their website. The beautiful ocean view shown there did not materialize as we had to stand up and peer between the boughs and fronds of large palm and pine trees to see the water. One of the two lounges on the deck did not raise and recline properly and our request for a replacement was ignored. You would also think that for the price being charged they could keep us in hot water and keep thatch from the roof from dusting our pillow every night as we slept. But no, we had to brush our bed off each night before retiring and had to endure a couple of cold showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of all the hotels in Playa del Carmen we chose to book the Shangri La. Our room, 3C, was on the sand, about 20 steps from the water. It was gorgeous. It has more of a family resort feeling as opposed to a romantic getaway. Our room was clean and very basic. In all honesty my only complaint was that the mattress felt quite old and creeped me out a bit. If you are going to stay within the city of Playa I would recommend this hotel. You can easily walk downtown if you want to shop. The beach at the hotel is perfect. We were at Playa for a wedding and most guests stayed at the Deseo. The Deseo guests who booked suites found out that the suites were facing the street and were up until 4am due to all the noise from the clubs and the street. They also complained that at 7am the construction began. Another hotel that guests stayed at was Pueblo Escondido and those were condos, which came with a butler and private pool. This property sounded the best of all the places in town although I do not know how expensive it is. Personally I would never stay in Playa again as it is too crowded.
