I consider myself a pretty laid back and easily going person so my review of this resort I think will give you an honest and accurate account of what one might experience. Check in - we arrived at the resort around 12:00 noon, however our room was not going to be available until 3:00pm. We left our bags behind the check in counter and proceed for lunch followed up by some time under the sun. There were no issues until after lunch when we proceeded to make use of the lounge chairs and beach palapas. I was approached on three occasions by resort security to present proof of our reservation or stay at the hotel. Their English was non existent so luckily I had a print out of my hotel invoice showing proof of our stay. Basically, the dead give away was our lack of the orange towels the hotel provides for you during your stay. I would suggest that if you arrive several hours before check in and you plan to sit on the lounge chairs you should ask at check in for your orange towels. If not you can still sunbath but just have to stay off the lounge chairs. Beach - Awesome beach, white sand and well maintained, one important thing you should know that it is a public beach. If you revert back to the hotel website take note of the map plan of the resort, there is a gap between the Caribe and Adventura section. This is actually a road that ends at the beach giving public access; it really wasn't a problem you just have to keep in mind that there will be a local presence especially on the weekends. We noted a group of young adults who came everyday at the same time and situated themselves between the beach line and the resort lounge chairs. I had no issues with this until our last day (Friday) when they showed up earlier than usual. There was one girl who basically talked non stop from 10am to 4pm, I didn't mind at first, but she became more annoying as time went on and because it was our last day I wanted to spend as much time on the beach as possible. After a borderline nervous breakdown my wife and I couldn't take it anymore and left for the pool for the last few hours of sun. Aside from that one day, I would say that our overall impression of the beach was a perfect 10! Food - Breakfast was great with a wide variety of choices, the lunch menu was pretty reasonably priced and the food was good. With regards to dinner I would say overall that it was satisfactory, our first meal (Sat) was only two choices, chicken or steak. It was okay but I was worried about the limited choices offered, however going forward the meal selection improved and we were not disappointed. We ate diner at the resort every night except twice when we strolled down 5th Ave for something different. Please be reminded that all drinks and lunches are not included and must be paid for, you could set up a "tab" at check in or pay as you go, I elected to pay as I go. The best way to go if you are a beer drinker is buy a styrofoam cooler for your room, fill it with ice and store bought beer. There were quite a few people who did this, this would work especially well if you are staying in either the ocean view or beach front papalas. FYI, it is rare for the waiter to come and serve you on the beach, this happened only once from us during our stay. Depending on which part of the beach you are situated on, it could be long walk to the bar. Rooms - our room was very clean and we had no issues or complaints about anything, we never used the AC because of the cool ocean breeze at night along with the ceiling fan keep the room at a comfortable temperature. As noted on their website, there are no phones or TV's in the rooms, which created a very quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Facilities - This resort does not provide any evening entertainment or shows, there is a main bar with a lounge consisting of two ping pong tables and two pool tables. If you are looking for something low key and quiet this is the place for you. The main strip, 5th Ave is a 10min walk away, it is pretty dark from the hotel up to 5th Ave, the street lights were not work however it was only a short distance (100m) and perfectly safe, there are always people around. This resort provided the perfect relaxing vacation were looking for, it was simply amazing. If you have read previous reviews there were rumors stating that the hotel will be closing. We inquired and found that this was true, as to when the answer was not definite. I hope it stays around for a least another year so we could visit it one more time, if you have chance to stay at this resort I can guarantee that you will not be disappointed. If you wish to stay in the beach front or ocean view units, you will need to book well in advance. I hope this review helps, feel free to contact me should you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: benjaminthom
Reviews.Content: I have to report that I am very said to have logged on to the site today and see many rumors that the hotel is being sold? I wish there was a way to confirm this. We had an excellent stay at the Shangi-la. Both my wife and I have been in the hospitality industry for years and found that the staff was friendly and accomodating. There was a mix-up with our reservation which they fixed the very next day. My parents were there at the same time and had some noise issues with the adjoining room and the resort took $500 off their bill. I consider this to be above and beyond what is a necessary response. After all, if you're in Mexico there's going to be some loud drunks anywhere you're staying! Please disregard the negative reviews on this site as these people obviously have nothing better to do than complain. We had our wedding their so we had many, many guests staying at the same time and everyone agreed that it was one of the best resorts that any of us had ever frequented. The theme of our wedding week was, "Have another cocktail" and obviously that it what many of the people on this forum should have done! The reviews are correct in that dinner is marginal, but who stays and eats dinner at the resort anyway? Breakfast was fantastic and a lunch of guacamole and beers will tide you over until you head out for the evening. If you want a sanitized, Americanized, boring experience than don't stay here. However, if you want beautiful ambience and an excellent Mexican (Read: Not an American experience in Mexico) experience than stay here. I only wish it wasn't supposedly being closed down. If this is true we won't be able to celebrate our anniversaries in the place we were married. :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Location soon to close down”
Reviews.Author: robertburnett
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was in a great location the food was exellent the staff and policies however had something to be desired. I first of all had some things stolen from my room such as some money and a silver broche which I should have put in the in room safe. Also, they have a ridiculous policy if you lose your hotel issued beach towel that you have to pay 300 pesos which is about 30 USD. I was told all the hotels do this and that I had signed the agreement went I checked in. This is true but who the heck knows what your sighning when your getting off a long plane trip. I then asked security if they had any extra towels that they had found and of course I got the " Sorry, I don't understand English" (Yeah right). I'm sure the hotel got their stupid towels back and my 60 dollars for the two towels I "lost". I guess being from the States I'm a little rusty when it comes to having my guard up. So heads up to people going here. No matter how small of an item you might think it is LOCK IT UP and forget about using their beach towels bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Vkendon
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we visited in Mexico so when we arrived it seemed a rather pleasant hotel to stay at. The hotel itself is very pretty and its set up is ideal with sweet bungalows on the beachfront and around the pool. The beach front is extremely pretty as can be seen by our photos. Having walked up and down the beach I would have to say the Shangri-la Caribe is by far the prettiest hotel on the Playa del Carmen stretch as it is right at the end out of the way and taken back off of the beach so not as many people walk past. The one main problem we did have with this hotel was the food. To start with Breakfast was amazing with a huge choice of hot and cold, Mexican and traditional dishes which was fantastic as it gave you a great start to the day. HOWEVER, supper on the other hand was an absolute joke! The first night we went to the dining room, we were taken to our seat and pointed in the direction of the buffet, which is when it all went wrong. It was by far the most horrendous looking and minimalist buffet I have ever seen. The reason I say looked is because there was not a chance in hell I could ever have eaten it! My boyfriend, being a little more daring than myself tried some, obviously not knowing what is was as it all looked the same in different dishes, and felt quite sick. Sadly it did not end there! I then decided to skip the main course and try a dessert thinking how could they go wrong with that, to my disappointment though they had cleared away the desserts even though it was 8.30!!! From the time of entering and leaving the restaurant we had been there a total of 10 minutes – very disappointing especially as all our suppers were included and we could not eat there. We tried the restaurant once more whilst we stayed there and that lasted even less time, we walked in saw two plates with cling film over and were told that’s what we were expected to eat – trust me that was not going to happen EVER again! Overall our stay here was relatively pleasant but we were glad to be leaving after the 5 nights. In this hotel you get what you pay for and in this case the hotel is relatively cheap! Put it this way we will not be rushing back.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Postcard Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: Pigmango
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a lot of different beach resorts over the years (Greece, Cyprus, Fiji, Vanuatu) and the Shangri la Caribe is right up there with places 3 times the price. The service was fantastic - so friendly and efficient. The front desk and the concierge will help you out with anything - just ask and they will either arrange it themselves or make it as easy as possible. They handled all our dry cleaning for 2 weeks, posted our postcards, organised our snorkelling trips, ran around for an hour getting the spa jets working in the main pool just for us, and generally were wonderful. The rooms are quite basic but very clean - the maid even cleans all the windows every day so that your view of the Caribbean is perfect. They provide big orange beach towels and fresh bottled water each morning. The bathroom is shower only and very small. We stayed in an ocean view room upstairs in the Caribe section. The location is just right - a few blocks from the shops and busier beach bars, so that you can have absolute peace and quiet, or just wander up the beach for 10 mins for a cocktail. When it's really hot it's worth asking the desk to call you a taxi to go into town. The 2 pools are lovely, and the all day Bar is cheap and fun. Internet is also cheap and a fast connection. But the best thing about the Shangri-la is the food. We stayed at another resort (much more expensive) after it, and were expecting the same quality, but were sadly disappointed. This made us realise how special the food is at the Shangri-la. Breakfast and dinner are included in the room tariff, and they are not set servings, but as much as you want. The dinner menu changed every night and it was so good we couldn't wait to see what was next. There were even free tequila shots one night, and the desserts were awesome. The value is amazing - we can't wait to go back, even though it's 24 hours from Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: texascousin
Reviews.Content: Husband,myself and our 2 college age sons spent Christmas Week in 2 oceanview cabanas.To me this place was the ultimate beach vacation for our family.Location was perfect,walking distance to town,bicycles to rent for $5 if we didn't want to walk,or waiting taxis for $3.Dive shop on site with snorkle tours,scuba,jet skis,catamaran sailing etc,massage tent,pool tables,pingpong.Breakfast and dinner was delicious all 7 nights. This place is so casual I didn't wear makeup the entire trip except to go home.i understand the resort is to be sold soon or has sold, but I didn't see any lack of service or quality in anything other than the rooms could have used some updating. What I would do different...take more sunscreen! I paid 22.00 usd for what would cost 7.00 in the US, I walked to town to try to find it cheaper in a pharmacy or grocery store but it was all about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The best place and a great price on the Yucatan”
Reviews.Author: Ginger759
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my husband's birthday at this wonderful resort. The beach here is pretty quiet and spectacular but still great people watching. The staff was amazing, the rooms were charming, as well as, the grounds. Our unit was 11P, which overlooked the pool and beach, with the sound of waves putting us to sleep every night. The breakfast is delicous, with your choice of entree. They have facilities to scuba and snorkel right on site. It is just a few blocks from the main shopping area. We felt so lucky to have stayed here in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Wende
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Shangri-La based on the great reviews we saw on this website. All I could think about on the trip home was posting my review to warn travelers about this place. I booked the hotel through their website and reserved a king-sized bed for three nights. The day prior to the trip, I called the hotel to arrange transportation from the airport. I spoke to the receptionist who confirmed our stay with them and asked me for the flight arrival time. She told me a driver would be there waiting by the cab station with my name on a sign. When we arrived to Mexico, we went straight outside (on time) to the cab area and there was no sign. I asked the main guy who seemed to be in charge about the hotel driver and he said he had not seen them. So I called the hotel and spoke to the female manager who told me they didn't send transportation because I did not give them my flight number. I told her I wasn't asked that information and she told me that the receptionist who took my other information was new and basically it was my problem that I should have known what to tell her. So we took a cab for what should have only been $50 per the hotel turned out to be $85. When we arrived at the hotel, we went to the lobby’s front desk and there was lone staffer talking to another guest. This went on for awhile. We stood there waiting patiently with our luggage. The guest finally walked away and the man at the front desk then got on the phone. And we continued to wait. I could see a woman sitting at a desk in an office who never looked up to help (my guess was this was the rude person I spoke to on the phone earlier). My patience ran thin as he never acknowledged us so I finally loudly requested that we wanted to check in. He got off the phone and asked me my name. Hardly the greeting I expected from a hotel that had been so raved about. Once he checked us in, we asked to speak to the manager about the cab incident. He leaned into that office where the woman was and she would not come out. I could still see her through the window and see her telling him no. I demanded to speak to her face to face and she finally trudged out. She was just as rude in person as on the phone. I could see this was going nowhere, I was tired and frustrated so we were taken to our rooms by a very nice, smiling and helpful bellman "Bolley" (sic). I had yet to realize this would be the only delightful thing at the hotel. We got to our room and there were two doubles instead of the king as I reserved. I wasn't in the mood to walk back and deal with that staff so we decided to stay there that night. We went to the restaurant a little later for dinner and there was the female manager, in the line at the buffet. I thought it humorous she was too busy to greet customers but not too busy to eat. In fact, every time we ate she was always there eating as well. The food was so-so. The next morning we went to the office and inquired about the bed arrangement. The guy at the desk told me there were only 3 King beds at the resort and they were all taken. He even pulled out a map to show me exactly where those unavailable bungalows were located (strange). I continued to express my disappointment so the man went back to that see-through office to speak to the same woman and came back and “wa-la” there was a bungalow available after all. Beware of what you ask for. We were moved across the entire resort and put in a bungalow in the back directly across from a new resort being built which = CONSTRUCTION. It dawned on me since there were hardly any other guests in our area that they weren't using these because of the continuous noise. They should have made us aware of the situation and let us decide. ANYWAYS. The final night we wanted to check in at the airport and print our boarding passes for the flight home. The girl at the desk told us that the "internet was closed until 9am". ??? So we had to go into town to use an internet cafe. Finally, on the morning of check out, I asked the same front desk clerk for our bill. He never asked me how our trip was or anything. But this is the same guy who couldn't even mutter a "welcome" when we got there so I really wasn't surprised. He handed me my bill so I began to intently look over it as I wasn't about to put my trust in a hotel that doesn't have integrity. The man was rushing me to sign it (even though we were the only ones in the lobby). I told him I was looking over it and he turned away and made a ridiculous face (rolling his eyes, sticking out his tongue). I guess he didn’t think I saw him but I called him out on it and he acted like "no habla ingles". Over all the place is clean, pretty and the food average. The staff is HORRIBLE except for the bellman-Bolley (who hooked us up with a cab on the way out for only $40). They should put "Bolley" (sic) in charge of guest services, stat. In fact, they should put him in charge of the entire place. We will NEVER go back. We enjoyed Playa del Carmen again immensely but that place really put a damper on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: necoleo
Reviews.Content: Fairly rustic and very charming, the property is old and could be updated. Very laid back attitude except when it comes to the orange beach towels, you MUST turn in your towels with your key at check out. The food was pretty good and the drink and lunch prices were very fair. I would not hesitate staying there again. We had a beach front single cabana and just loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mexican style Robinson Crusoe experience”
Reviews.Author: songmaven
Reviews.Content: This resort is right on the beach and has very clean and quiet Mexican-style rooms. We stayed for 9 nights in what felt like a treehouse - it was on the top floor under a canopy of leaves with a balcony looking out over the water - very Robinson Crusoe. It was very quiet overall, but there was construction going on at the neighboring resort, so if you want it really quiet make sure you reqest a room on the side of the hotel away from the construction (which we did and we rarely ever heard anything). The best part of the resort was their scuba diving shack - the guides were great and they make professional videos of your dives that you can buy for family and friends. Even if you don't stay there I would highly recommend going to dive there. The food was ok, (nothing to write home about) but it was just a few steps up the street from an awesome restaurant called Cuevo del Changa (the Monkey Cave) where the food was superb! We ate there every day for lunch for about $9. I liked that the location was just a little bit off the beaten path and not in the center of town but it was close enough to walk everywhere. I'd definitely recommend the hotel - we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: johnathome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Shangri-La Caribe for first time. Traveled with my family and my sister-in-law and her daughter. After arriving in Cancun and renting a car, drove down in about 45 minutes to Playa. Plenty of parking at Shangri-La although there is a new condo/hotel being built across the street which will likely see more people and cars. Check-in was fine, they had our reservations. We were placed in 32B and 33B in the Caribe section. They were on the second floor and were connected which was nice for our family. Wasnt able to get beach front rooms as hotel was full our first few nights. My room had two queen beds and a small desk. Very humid this time of the year but the ac and fan worked. However, with the playa roofs (there were spots where you could see the outside), the rooms still felt humid. Bathroom has a shower only and water pressure was ok. No TV or phone which is part of the charm. Each room had a nice deck with hammocks which we really enjoyed. We were steps away from the Caribe pool and the beach. Enjoyed sitting in the hammock and reading my book. One of the best parts of the hotel. I was disappointed to find mice droppings on the floor when we first checked in. Not a positive start. Insects were of course plentiful (saw a few large roaches and plenty of ants in our room) but not unexpected. Housekeeping did a nice job of cleaning the room every day, changing the towels and leaving a bottle of water. Only 25 pesos if you wanted to buy bottled water. By the way, there is no noise insulation for the rooms. On our 1st night, a wedding group decided to party into the late hours after the bar closed. You hear everything so we left the ac on that night. The hotel was quiet after that large group left. As others mentioned, bkfst and dinner are included in the price. Bkfast was quite good with a decent selection. Eggs made to order and lots of fresh fruit. Dinner was just ok. We ended up going into Playa for dinner our last two nights. Staff in both dining rooms were great. We did make sure to leave a tip after each meal. There are two swimming pools. Although small to swim in, both have small sections for little kids. We used both and the kids enjoyed themselves. The beach is just lovely. There were always enough chairs and umbrellas. You are given orange beach towels when you first check-in and you can replace them for fresh ones at any time. The beach is public so you do see quite a few locals enjoying themselves on the beach (especially on Sunday). Swimming was great, with snorkeling gear, you could see fish a few feet out during low tide. Water was clear and calm for the most part. Most people we met at the hotel were European with a few other American. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Very laid back attitude here. There is wi-fi in the lobby and we were close enough that I was able to get a weak connection from my room. Otherwise they do have 3 computers for you to access email, etc. Did not use the dive center as didnt have time but would imagine diving would be wonderful here. Did get a massage which was quite good and relatively inexpensive. Although outdoors, the cool seabreeze was relaxing. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. If you are looking for a laid back, relaxing resort, this is a good choice although I would try to get a beach front room. Not luxurious but comfortable. Would have given a higher rating if not for the noise and the mice droppings. After Shangri-La, we drove up to Cancun and stayed at the Ritz which was quite luxurious and had a totally different atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Beach Cabañas”
Reviews.Author: DwaxAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Incredible location, impressive beach, two pools (one heated), good food, decent service and rooms that are just perfect. We stayed in one of the cabañas. It was a double unit, a stand-alone building with only one neighbor above us. The AC was great, not a bug in sight, plenty of space, 50m walk to the beach, hot shower and a comfortable bed. Breakfast and dinner were included and it's a short walk to another great restaurant up the street.

Reviews.Title: “great and quiet place”
Reviews.Author: matruf
Reviews.Content: a great place to stay and enjoy the caraiban sea. The dive center, just 20m from the room offer a very complete course with a very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: WTravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights to celebrate our honeymoon this year. I've been to Mexico before, but it was my first time to stay in the Yucatan Peninsula. I had a friend that recommended Playa, and through lots of research found Shangri-La Caribe. I've stayed in many hotels around the world and typically look for something that blends luxury with the local culture. I'm not the type to stay at an "all inclusive" that enialates every bit of the local culture that you wonder why you even went to another country. When I booked I was concerned about the weather reports saying that this time of the year was full of rain and thunderstorms. Throughout our entire stay - the last week of June to first week of July - it was nice and sunny. It must have rained once that entire week which cooled off everything nicely. I must say that this hotel was exactly what I was looking for. We stayed at one of the cabanas in the Caribe side which was literally no more that 30 feet from the beach. I recommend booking early to get one of these cabanas. You may spend a little bit more, but its definitely worth it. The staff was very courteous and friendly from beginning to end. The concierge knew exactly what we were looking for and arranged our entire week for us. The wait staff service varied a little, but eventually you knew the ones that had worked there for awhile and provided that extra service that made your trip memorable. Although not required, I recommend tipping whenever possible - $1/tip goes a long way. The bartender was always ready to serve you a drink so don't miss Happy Hour! Our accomodations included breakfast and dinner. Definitely do not skip breakfast since this included plenty of local fruits, juice, bread, and eggs cooked the way you like. I disgree with what other people wrote about the dinners here. It may not be the best Mexican food in town, but it also isn't the worse. Definitely try not to skip Mexican BBQ night. However if you have a short stay, then I would go to Quinta Avenida where you will find plenty of really good Mexican food for that romantic dinner. Other useful tips: 1. Take the bus from the Cancun airport to Playa Del Carmen. You can take a free shuttle (not Taxi) to Terminal 2 and catch the bus from there. 2. The price from Quinta Avenida (bus terminal) to the hotel is 30 pesos/$3 dollars. A tip of 10 pesos/$1 is plenty so bring plenty of $1 bills! 3. Yes, bring that small cooler to put drinks in. You can get ice either from the bartender, or from the corner convenient store right outside the hotel. 4. Rent a car and drive to the ruins as early as possible to beat the heat and the hoards of tourist buses. 5. Take the ferry and go to Cozumel. Rent mopeds and get as far away from the city center as possible. Go snorkeling at Punta Sur - worth the $10/entry fee. 6. Learn a little "conversational" Spanish before you go since this will go a long way at Playa. Have a safe and enjoyable trip! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trijman
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon in Mexico for 2 weeks. First week we stayed in Tankah Tres, near Tulum, last week in The Shangri-la hotel. It is really hard to judge if a hotel is what they say it is, we read the reviews on tripadvisor and they were very possitif, so we choose to go to the Shangri-la hotel. And what a choice it was... I dare to say that i haven't spend such a great time in another hotel ever! The location of the hotel is just fantastic, the beach is magnificent, just like the foto's on their website. The service is outstanding! We had a nice welcome when we arrived. The rooms are nicely situated and are only 2 levels high. All of them have those great palapa roofs made of straw. We hade a room in the Pubuelito area, wich are in my opinion the best roos, eventhough they are cheaper. The rooms are big, have airco, great bathrooms, hammocks and get cleand every day. We booked (coincedentaly) with dinner. No regrets at all. The food is fantastic, a lot of variety and excellent staff! The people that work there are friendly and happy, no one excluded! From our room it is a 45 second walk to the beach. The beach is mega clean and the sea looks like you know them from a brochure. There isn't a thing that we didn't like. Even the touristic center of Playa del Carmen is still a great place to be. You'll find some vendors trying to sell you stuff more active but they don't offend you, they stay relaxed. The center is really good taken care of, it's clean, haven't seen junkies and the Mexican people are pure friendly! We did a Whale shark trip one day, wich was truely fantastic. If you have the time and money ($180.- p/p) you defenatly should go out and swim with whale sharks! We would go back to Mexico just for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JustBear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the Shangri-la on July 8th-July 14th for our honeymoon. Having never been to Mexico before, this was the perfect place! The staff was very friendly and the resort was beautiful. It had so much character! Our room had a thatched roof that definitely added to the experience! We ate all of our breakfasts and dinners at the resort. The food was very good. The French toast at breakfast was one of my favorites. Hipolito, one of the waiters, had everything delivered to our table "in six seconds, my friends". The wait staff was always very cheerful and friendly. The front desk staff was helpful in answering any of our questions. We had a first floor room the first night (15A) and asked them if we could be moved to a second floor room (12B). They did not hesitate to satisfy our request. We used the concierge to find out information on getting down to Tulum cheaply and she was very helpful. She also coordinated a scooter rental for us, which was great fun! The beach at the resort is perfect. It's never hard to get a chair and it stays pretty quiet. The water is extremely blue and very warm. We did go into each pool once, but because of the temperature outside, it was almost like swimming in a hot tub. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's not as ritzy as the all-inclusive resorts, but definitely has some great amenities and feels more authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable for the right reasons.”
Reviews.Author: Crazy-kitten
Reviews.Content: Booked this directly on the web very easily. Stayed for 4 days and then returned from an inland tour for another 5 days. They let us leave a suitcase with them which was handy. Attentive service, spotlessly clean, unpretentious, and friendly. Great location, right on the widest part of the beach and the sand was swept every day. Internet room with 3 computers for those who can't leave it at home! Diving activities and snorkeling trips excellent and right on site. Only downside was the cocktails mixed at the bar and the lack of a fridge to provide a cold drink of water (or beer) in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED82
Reviews.Content: We were there with my wife for our honeymoon. The hotel is magnificent and everything was simply perfect. The people, the restaurants, and the rooms. We felt that there was a constant intention to make us feel tottaly at ease. Definitely the best place I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to go back”
Reviews.Author: Ylydon
Reviews.Content: My family, which includes two 18 yr. old girls and one 15 yr. old girl, stayed for 7 nights June 23-30 and loved every minute. There was plenty for the teenage girls to do and lots relaxing for my husband and I. We enjoyed the wait staff, who knew us by the end of the week. The food was better than expect after reading many of the reviews posted here. The mexican fiesta night was a blast. Lots of fun, mariachi band playing and tequila popper for those wanting to participate. This quaint resort was quiet, relaxing and well maintained. Our room was cleaned daily and we were provided with fresh water in our rooms. Our beach was SO much less crowded then the BIG resorts to the south. We never had a problem finding available beach chairs to use. We enjoyed walking 10 minutes to downtown to see the lively bars and restaurants, but it would not have been necessary if we weren't with teenagers. The 2 for 1 happy hour was a great way to meet other guest, play pool or ping pong, or just enjoy each other. I had a massage the last day and it was a little bit of heaven. We're going back in two years for our 25th wedding anniversary withOUT the kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why go anywhere else?...a wonderful vacation.”
Reviews.Author: ichterjr
Reviews.Content: This was the first family vacation we have taken in some time and it was wonderful. There are not too many places you may be able to agree upon with a 21,23,24,25 year-old and two parents but Shangri-La was perfect for all. It provided us a great mix of relaxing time to ourselves, time together snorkeling right from the beach, great family meals, and easy access for trips to Cozumel and Chichen Itza. The staff was absolutely wonderful and the food was great. We raved about the multiple different styles of eggs you could have for breakfast and dinner was well above our expectations after reading other reviews. Hippolito and Jorge are the best staff to serve you during meals! We were extremely happy with the rooms and a short walk to down town provided a great way to wind down the evening on 5th Ave. The resort is filled with very friendly other guests who you can become acquainted with over the nice 2 for 1 happy hour! A perfect vacation leaving all of us wanting to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This was paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Beachloveralways
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised to read the last few reviews. We stayed at the Shangri-la from June 16-20 and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a totally relaxing low key getaway. It is a lush, beautifully landscaped "village" with adorable little bungalows on a pristine beach. Since we had no complaints, our contact with the front desk was limited but always positive. When we made our reservation we were told there were no ocean view rooms available but when asked for one at check in, we were given one right away. The view was gorgeous and seconds from the beach. We were in 14A and would request the same room next year. We loved the pathways to the bungalows and our pretty front porch and relaxing hammocks were awesome. Our room was delightful. It was pleasantly cool , clean, bright and airy with comfortable beds and pillows. Each morning it was throughly cleaned. All the wait staff were helpful and friendly. The other guests we talked to were definitely as happy with the place as we were. We didn't see bugs but by the last day one of us had lots of little bites that were very itchy and bought Calamine lotion in the gift shop. We wrote down to remember lotion next year. Both the restaurants were charming and the servous was excellent. There was a variety of food and we found breakfast especially delicous. The Mexican buffet one evening was fantastic. The second day we went into town for dinner and both agreed, why bother paying for a dinner in town when we could have a better dinner free at "home". "Happy hour" was one of our favorite times of the day. The bar was low key and relaxing. We had terrific 2 for 1 Pina Colada's and Mojitos every afternoon. There was not a momment when we were not completely relaxed. The massage was so lovely and we found the price very reasonable. It was awesome to drift back to our hammocks after the massage was over. Each day we sat on comfortable beach chairs with big orange beach towels that could be exchanged for fresh ones any time. The pretty palapas umbrellas allowed you to be in the sun or the shade all day. Drinks and lunch could be ordered on the beach and brought to you. We had a shrimp cerviche which was to die for. We only had lunch one day because we were so full from breakfast. The hotel had nicely dressed security men walking on the beach who made us feel very safe. In my opinion, anyone who was not happy with the beach, would not be happy anywhere. If you are looking for a place with room entertainment, hot night clubs, and numerous restaurants to choose from, this is not the place for you. But for us, a plush atmosphere, good food and drinks, clean airy rooms, friendly staff, refreshing swimming pools, comfortable places to in sit enjoying the breeze and an absolutely fabulous beach- you can't go wrong. We're looking forward to be back next year at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Almost paradise - AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: jjsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-La for the second time in two years. Last time we were in 33P and had no problems at all. That's one of the reasons we returned this year. However, the only real problem we had was with bugs in the room. I read another person's review and realized that we had the same room - 34P. I wasn't going to write a review this time around, but after realizing that we both had the same room and the same problem, I thought I would mention it to anyone going to Shangri-La and requesting a beachfront bungalow. Don't get me wrong - this problem didn't upset me as much as it did the other reviewer. Once we alerted them about the bug problem, they immediately sent two men over to spray and change the linens on both beds. We still had bugs on the wall behind the bed from time to time, but it wasn't anything that I couldn't handle with a little of my own bug repellant. The bugs were tiny, tiny ants (I think). I didn't get bit by any, only mosquitos at night when we were outside. One thing you have to remember when you stay in a beachfront bungalow (or any with a thatched roof) at Shangri-La or anywhere in Mexico - there will be bugs. Let me stress one thing - I hate bugs. I pay a lot of money at home to an exterminator every two weeks so that I don't see any in my house. But when I'm in Mexico, I expect that I will see bugs. It's just different and you have to be prepared for it. I checked the beds every night and we never had any more ants in them. Everything else was perfect, just as before. We love this place and won't let a few bugs stop us from returning. I think I'll be sure not to stay in 34P again though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: sandy78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shangri La Caribe from 14th - 19th June 2007 and we absolutely loved it! Here are our thoughts: Check-In/Front Desk: We took the hotel airport shuttle service and the shuttle was on time and hassle-free round-trip. We had no problems at check in and Paulina at the reception was very welcoming and friendly even though we arrived at 10pm! Later, she gladly helped us out with shopping suggestions on 5th Ave when we asked her. However, the concierge was a different story! She was hardly ever there and when she was, she seemed too bored to answer your questions. We did go on one tour of the ruins in Tulum and Coba arranged through her and while the ruins were beautiful, our guide was really bad!! He was least concerned about his tour group or what they wanted. Beach: The beach is GORGEOUS!!! :-) It is all white sand and turquoise waters, just like a postcard! It isn’t a private hotel beach but there is plenty of security and it is very safe. And yes, you will see some topless sun bathers….. Room: We were in 26C , a garden view cottage in the Caribe section, which was a cozy corner cottage , just 10 steps from the beach! It was a single level cottage and I liked the fact that we didn’t have upstairs/downstairs neighbors! We could hear and partially see the ocean from our cottage and slept with our windows open at night. There are protective mesh coverings on all windows and we didn’t have any issues with bugs in the room. We did see mosquitoes a couple of nights but it was nothing that OFF spray couldn’t handle. Just make sure that your front door is closed at all times. I was a little concerned before I went that the air-conditioning may not be cool enough (I get warm real quick) but the air conditioning worked perfectly! The beds and linens are very comfortable! And the cottage itself is very lovely. We had 2 queen beds, a big table and chair in the room and a built-in closet which was more than enough storage space! The décor is all wood and white which lends a nice, bright tropical feel to the room and is quite Mexican. The hammocks on the front porch are the highlight of the room!!! We just LOVED them and spent hours there reading and listening to the ocean. House keeping was very regular and we didn’t have any issues with theft but we did keep money/passports etc locked up. Food/Restaurants/Bar/Shop: Breakfast has a lot of variety and it is located just off of the beach and is perfect to grab a bite and head back to the beach. So is the lunch restaurant. They have a limited selection but even with being vegetarian, I found enough options of delicious food. Dinner is a fun affair. The food is really very good and I must say that the Mexican food I had there was much better than any I have had in the US! The staff too is very friendly and they make a genuine effort to make your stay better! But I must admit that after 6 days of eating there, I was starting to tire of it! We didn’t fall sick eating in Mexico but then, we only drank bottled water with no ice and didn’t eat any pre-cut fruit/salads or uncooked food. The gift shop on-site carries bigger bottles of water at lower prices so look out for that. The drinks at the bar are average but the pool/ping pong area is fun. Look out for the book library at the lobby. Hotel: The hotel, on the whole, is fantastic! We selected this hotel for the experience of having a whole cottage to ourselves and it was completely worth it, esp. at the price! With lunch for 2 and a few drinks every day (not at happy hour) at the hotel for 6 days, our tab was just an additional USD110 totally! I didn’t lack for anything except maybe a hair-dryer :-) ….. and a telephone in the room to at least call the front desk. We certainly wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again but we may try the beachfront cottage the next time around, just coz they are right there on the beach!! It is unfortunate that some of the other reviewers had such a bad experience because this place is wonderful! Seriously, just head here for your vacation and enjoy it! We know we will, when we next get a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for thieves!”
Reviews.Author: ABCDCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from a week long vacation in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. We stayed at "Shangri-La Caribe". My husband and I have visited this lovely hotel several times in the past 12 years. We have always had nothing but wonderful experiences staying at Shangri-La and have recommended it to several family members, friends and co-workers, but we are not certain we can recommend this establishment any longer. I left yesterday with a sour taste in my mouth. It appears to us that they have hired THIEVES to do the cleaning or supervising of rooms! We stayed in 16B from June 11-18th and my husband had his Nautica swim trunks and a canvas hat stolen. My son had his Geoxx tennis shoes stolen. When a neighbor in 15B talked with me, he informed me that he had $100 stolen from the closet of his room. I realize that maybe tennis shoes, a hat and swim trunks seem petty theft, but I no longer trust that any of my things would be safe locked in my room! (especially after talking with the neighbor!) My husband filed a "report" with the "Security" but how do I know that they aren't part of the problem?!! When we discussed this with the front desk "Rafael", he didn't seem too concerned and acted as though WE were bothering HIM! He was basically useless and of NO help! What a waste! We were extremely upset and very disappointed! We can only suspect the cleaning people, since they are the ones that have a key to the room. My husband talked with one of the cleaning ladies, but of course she "didn't have any idea what happened...". I would keep an eye on those cleaning people and the so called security people! Also, a separate issue is the recommendation we received for a car rental. The staff recommended "Express Car Rental". It turned out to be a terrible, very unfortunate mistake on our part to have gone with this company. They provided a rusted out, unsafe, run down van with two flat tires and no reliable spare or the tools to change a tire! That company must be some major SCAM ARTISTS and I would never recommend them. After paying for "full coverage insurance", they wanted us to pay for the tire problems! They were very unreasonable! DON'T rent from EXPRESS Car Rental! They have offices in Playa del Carmen and CANCUN. I hope some corrections will be made at the Shangri-La, because no one will want to stay in a place where they do not feel safe!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: kstenger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Mexico between May 27 - June 10th of this year for our wedding / honeymoon. The first 8 nights of our trip were spent at the resort where we had our wedding, which was an absolutely perfect experience in every way. During our vacation planning, we opted to move to the Shangri-La Caribe during the middle of our vacation for a change of scenery, and regretted our decision to do so almost immediately. The day we arrived at the Shangri-La, my husband had become very ill. Checkout time at our previous resort was at noon, so when we arrived at the Shangri-La, he wanted nothing more than to lie down, however, check-in wasn't until 3:00. We asked the front desk staff if there was any way we could check in early and were told our room wouldn't be ready until 3:00. We got that, thought it would be worth asking, and went off to kill a few hours until the room was ready. We came back at 2:45 to check again as he was really starting to feel poorly by this time, and were told that it would be ready at exactly 3:00. At exactly 3:00, the gentleman that had told us our room would be ready got off shift and left, without saying a word to us (we were sitting in the lobby waiting until 3:00 as my husband had had enough of walking around at that point). At 3:05, I asked the person behind the front desk about our room and was told that it wouldn't be ready for another hour. In fact, we were not able to check into our room until 5:00 that evening, thus beginning our frustration with this resort. When we were finally able to get into the room (we rented a beachfront bungalow - 34P), we immediately turned on the A/C as the heat was stifling. Unfortunately, with the high ceilings of the beachfront bungalows, the A/C units are totally inadequate to even remotely cool the rooms down, so if you reserve one of these units, prepare to be hot. We resorted to opening up all of the windows (there are a lot of them) and if there is a good breeze going it's not bad, but if there's no breeze, good luck. The next thing we discovered with the room was that the palapa roofs are utterly infested with thousands and thousands of tiny insects. I practically bathed in bug repellent, including covering the sheets and pillows, but was still eaten alive that night by the insects. The next morning I was covered in hundred of tiny bug-bites, so we decided to pay the front desk a visit to inquire as to what they could do about the bug infestation, and were told that we could move next door to 35P. When we asked if we could expect more bugs in 35P, they staff told us that the current occupants of that room hadn't complained about the bugs. We then asked if the bugs were usually a problem and they told us very frankly yes, the bugs are a big problem due to the thatched roofs. We opted to have our room fumigated as opposed to moving to a new room that more than likely had the same issues, and were told it would take no longer than an hour. We vacated the room, and when we came back to the room several hours later, it was very clear that the room had been fumigated, as all of the furniture was covered in sheets and there were thousands of insect carcasses everywhere, however, they had neglected to send someone to clean up the horrendous mess afterward. Back to the front desk we go (no phones in the room, so if you're having issues, plan on a lot of walking back and forth) to ask for housekeeping to clean up the mess and unfortunately, we weren't able to use our room until 6:00 that evening. Later that night we went into Playa for dinner and when we returned at roughly 9:30, the bug situation was even worse than before - with hundreds of these insects all over our pillows and sheets. We marched down to the front desk yet again and told them in no uncertain terms would we be staying in the room another night to be devoured in our sleep, and asked about having our money refunded so we could find another place to stay. We were told that the manager wouldn't be in until 9:00 the next morning, and that until she was the only person with the authority to refund our money, but that they would be glad to move us to another room without a palapa roof for the night. She also suggested that refunding the difference to us between the beachfront bungalow and the "Ocean View" room wouldn't be a problem at all, but that a refund was unlikely. We decided to move to the new room to give it a shot, and found that while this room (sans palapa roof) didn't have the tiny insects of the other room, it did have roaches, as well as an A/C unit that dripped water on us all night, and loud construction that began promptly at 8:00 AM. Good times. At promptly 9:00 AM the next morning we made yet another trip to the front desk to meet with the manager, who didn't bother to show up until 9:20. At 9:30, one of the front desk staff came to tell us (mind you, she couldn't be bothered to come speak to us herself) that the manager was suddenly called into a staff meeting and wouldn't be available for another 40 minutes. We went and had breakfast (contrary to what many other posters have said with regard to the breakfast, we were not at all impressed) and then back to the front desk to wait for the manager. When she finally did come speak to us, to her credit, she was very apologetic and accommodating; at first she offered to find us yet another room, refund the first two nights to us, and refund the difference between the beachfront bungalow and the new room. After a few moments of deliberation, we decided to cut our losses and asked for a full refund; we were just not confident that we would be able to relax and be comfortable there, and we were quickly burning through our honeymoon days. In the end, Turquoise Reef (their booking agent?) found us another property in downtown Playa Del Carmen, refunded the first two nights at the Shangri-La to us, as well as refunding the difference between the Shangri-La and the new property, as the new property wasn't located directly on the beach and was quite a bit less expensive. Again, to their credit, for upset as we were with the Shangri-La and our experience there, we felt that in the end, they made it right. I was so looking forward to our stay at the Shangri-La and was incredibly disappointed. I'm amazed that the issues that we ran into haven't been more of an issue among other guests. We truly aren't hard to please when it comes to a hotel, honestly, the first resort we stayed at was incredible, and the hotel that we ended up staying at in lieu of the Shangri-La turned out the be fantastic as well...I guess 2 out of 3 isn't bad?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Ancient
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there over our Spring Break with our two kids (9 & 6). We have a fabulous time. We had the #4 Private Palapa on the Beach for a few days (free upgrade as our room wasn't yet available) then moved to a second level Room (#8 I think) which was every bit as good as #4, in fact I would request #8 again when we go back. I am forgetting the bellman's name but he's been there a while and he was so over the top helpful with tours, reservations & general information. And he always greeted us by name when he saw us. The food was so so, breakfast great, dinner not so great. They should stick with Mexican buffet as far as I am concerned. But it was nice to have breakfast & dinner included in a very relaxed setting. Maid service was excellent. The pools were normal sized, not "luxurious" by any means, but for us, perfect. Lots of kids for mine to pal around with & in fact my son basically disappeared into the ping pong & pool room for much of the trip. There was a Mexican woman who had set up a ceramic painting station & for a small fee our kids each selected a ceramic piece to paint then picked up the next day once the woman had baked them (and actually finished them off a bit for us). Town was a short walk away, our beach was lovely and uncrowded, especially when compared to the ones further south. There were 24-hour security guards for the beach to prevent access from outsiders and since we were right on the beach we appreciated it. We walked up and down the beach and frankly there wasn't another resort or hotel we would have preferred to stay at. We would go back there if we ever go back to Playa del Carmen. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: DiveandDine
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the neutral reviews on this board - I will share my impressions of the things that most stood out to us. Food: Dinner was terrible, skip it. The hotel would do well to allow people to opt out of paying for it. Breakfast, however, was wonderful with an excellent selection every morning and tons of fresh fruit. Delicious. Don't be in a hurry for your coffee, though; the waitstaff takes their time. Bar: This may be the only bar in Playa with bad margaritas. The guys were very friendly but the drinks were sub par. Room: I stayed in the Caribe section. Sparse but spotless. Our AC worked just fine and I was shocked by how comfortable the mattress was. I would have greatly preferred if housekeeping had not come to clean at 1:30pm, the exact moment when we got off of the dive boat and needed to shower. I loved the hammocks on our porch; we spent many hours there just hanging out and being happy. Staff: Most were wonderful but there were a few surly ones. Other: My massage was mediocre and expensive. WARNING: After talking to a lot of guests who had been coming to Shangri-la for a numbers of years, I got the impression that everything about the place had changed drastically. We were there at the same time as a large wedding party - 70 people plus. Just about every evening, a large group of men in their late 20's (I'm also that age) would gather by the pool with a boombox and drink beer from their styrofoam coolers. The hotel wasn't all that responsive to us when we asked them to kindly ask the loud, drunk men to settle down and kill the vulgar music. The fact that Shangri-la has tacky, inconsiderate guests isn't its fault, but I think this may just be the direction the area is going. The Dive shop - Cyan-ha - was absolutely wonderful. Every single member of the staff and crew were fun, professional and very safe. We really felt like our skills improved. Advanced divers are probably going to be a little bored but I highly recommend it for the novice/absolute beginner. To sum it up: This wasn't the best trip we've taken, but we did learn a little bit more about what is important to us. We still had a great time enjoying the nightlife, the diving and the laziness of the beach life. I would recommend this hotel to groups of friends who want to travel together, families with small children who want a laid back, pro-kid environment and novice divers. Couples seeking romance should look elsewhere. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “A luke warm stay at Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: Colomntnboy
Reviews.Content: I guess that I can be accused of being a bit of a research freak, so when it was time for my girlfriend and I to book a room for Playa Del Carmen, we looked directly to Trip Advisor as a staple for our research. Thank you all very much for your valuable insight and stories! It really helped us along. However, when it comes to the SLC I gotta say that I don't share many of your opinions. We booked a room for 7 nights at one of the beach front bungalows (34p). Now, while it is true that this hotel is located on one of the more gorgeous stretches of beach that Playa has to offer I found the hotel somewhat lacking. Perhaps it was just the room that we were in but I found it to be quite anitquated (in a not so charming way) and the room had a very musty smell when we checked it. Nothing that a $3 air freshener from Wal-Mart didn't fix. Further the bathroom was hotter than the blue blazes of hell and a bit funky also. Most of what we read about the food was fairly true... We only had dinner at the hotel one night (so many great restaurants in town) but it wasn't really all that great. Breakfast, on the other hand was awesome! Further, our server Eduardo couldn't have possibly been any nicer. The front desk staff was fairly helpful with the exception of one blonde woman... She was almost downright rude and her favorite word seemed to be no. Out of five requests, all of which quite legitimate she was able to fulfull none of them. By the end of the week it got to be quite irritating. The grounds at the hotel, in all fairness were gorgeous and the beach/ocean views from our bungalow couldn't be beat. But given the proximity to the "action" on Quinta and the shape our room was in I don't think that I personally would book this hotel again. There just seems to be a lot better deals in town for the price. The air conditioner in the room did little more than fan the flames of the scorching May weather we encountered... All told I was not horrible impressed.. But your experiences may vary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, great staff, beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerinTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in paradise at the Shangri-la Caribe. At first I was a bit worried booking this resort - the name caused more than one travel agent I spoke with to cringe, and while the pictures on the website were amazing, I wasn't sure quite what to think. I am glad I trusted the reviews on this website because the resort is fantastic! I booked an 'ocean view' room on the caribe side since the beach front rooms were all taken, and I'm glad I went that route. I requested a 2nd floor room with a king size bed, neither of which were guaranteed to me when I booked, but which the staff graciously accomidated. This meant that we had a basically unobstructed view of the beach and ocean which was only ~20 feet from the base of our stairs. The porch got a wonderful breeze all day and despite the heat, it was cool all afternoon. The rooms are rather sparsely furnished but we needed for nothing - it had a large, comfortable king size bed and a desk and chair, what else do you need?(wink):-). The A/C was rather noisy, but we didn't use it except at night since the daytime breeze was nice and strong. The construction behind the Aventura (playa?) side of the resort is nearly complete, so construction noise is no longer an issue. This side appears to be a bit newer and the penthouse 3rd floor rooms look very nice and come with some nice lounge chairs on the patios - a nice perk. We spoke with several guests who were very happy on this side of the resort - I think you probably can't go wrong no matter which side you choose. I'd avoid the rooms on the back side of the caribe section though - those have no view of the ocean at all and likely miss out on the afternoon breezes that make the heat tolerable. The grounds are beautiful and its hard to tell where the beach ends and the resort begins...I guess that is the point, right? There was never a rush on beach chairs and they all come with palpas to shade you from the hot afternoon sun (I'm a freckler, so I need this kind of thing!). The beach is amazing and generally quite empty during the week - we noticed the beach south of Shangri-la was much more crowded and we were happy to have our little section of seclusion. The pools were wonderful and again, never crowded. We took the advice here and brought our own cooler from home (it was collapsable...yeah TARGET!) and filled it every day from the corner store with beer. The drinks at the resort are moderately priced and VERY good - mmmmm margaritas. Happy hour is from 5-6 at the Caribe pool - 2x1 drinks! The food...breakfast was excellent - so many wonderful fresh fruits and beautiful pasteries. You can also order hot breakfast, and all of the selections were excellent. The french toast is great, but my personal favorite is scrambled eggs with choriso and peppers. YUM. Coffee is quite good. Lunch was also great. While we saw others suggest going elsewhere to eat, we were so comfortable lounging at the resort that the thought of walking up and down 5th when it was so hot just wasn't appealing, so we did most of our lunches (when on resort and not off snorkeling or on a tour) at the resort restaurant. Ceviche is wonderful, as are all the taco selections. We found the prices reasonable for a resort...and also compared to many 5th ave. eateries. Dinner was hit or miss, I agree. Our 1st dinner was not very good - choice of chicken or steak...and my chicken had many small bones which did a number on my throat...ouch. HOwever we tried dinner at the resort mid week and it was very good! The fish selections were all tasty, as was the 'carribean night'. We heard good and bad things about the mexican buffet - some said it was cold. Overall we ate at the resort for 4 meals and ate in town for 3. The staff was wonderful and very helpful every time we asked a question. The wait staff was super, remembering us and our room number at each meal. And I have to give props to the front desk attendants, who let my husband borrow a bicycle to head into town the last night we were there since there were no cabs outside and he had to pull cash to cover my doctor's visit (I broke my toe outside of the massage tent! Watch out for the hidden stump!). It is too bad I was laid up in the room with my toe on ice because I'll bet that was the funniest sight ever! Thanks Shangri-la for a wonderful vacation and for being so accomidating on the room selection - we felt you all went out of our way to make our trip wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as the other reviews state”
Reviews.Author: Snowcalfe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as the second leg of our honeymoon. The other reviews are pretty spot-on. So I won't repeat it all, just a few points: BUILDING The building work behind the Aventura section is still going on, but it's mostly inside and they must be finishing soon. Some noise mon-fri, they finish early on saturday and don't work sundays. BEACH The hotel is on the nicest stretch of beach in Playa by far, when you walk towards the centre of town, you realise how lucky you are and it's worth the ten minute walk into town. It's quite easy to get a sun lounger (this was in May), no need for a morning panic. ROOMS The hotel could do with an update, it's a bit 1970s decor, I know it's Mexican but for these prices, I would have hoped for doors onto the bathroom/toilet. The room was a bit sparse and lacks the luxe comforts you would expect of this rating of hotel. A fridge, TV, soft lighting and even some drawers would have been great also. MASSAGE I had a massage in the grounds of the hotel, man named Gabriel, very good. It's more expensive than in town but was nice to be near my room and very relaxing. RAIN There were two thunderstorms while we were there, one night everyone's room got flooded so if it looks like rain, don't leave anything on the floor and put electricals in the wardrobe. FOOD We ate breakfast everyday (great selection), but only ate dinner at the hotel twice. It was pretty basic (plus I'm a vegetarian) and it was good to get out as we wanted to avoid that all-inclusive vibe. Found a FABULOUS restaurant in Playa called Chicagos (on 6th, just off Quinta). Sound cheesy but it was lovely neighbourhood restaurant. Much nicer than the tourist traps on Quinta. We also ate at 100% natural and the food was very nice (if you like healthy/veggie stuff) but not very busy so no atmosphere. TRANSPORT We got the hotel transportation through Tropical Reef and it's probably quite costly ($55 airport-hotel and same again return) but it was stress free. VERDICT Lovely bit of beach, if the hotel was done-up, we'd probably stay again but Playa is quite touristy and tacky. A handy hop for the East Coast of USA.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, service is not.”
Reviews.Author: mattsonnicole
Reviews.Content: We chose the Shangri-La because of the dive shop (Cyan-Ha) that is on site. The beach front location was perfect for us and the dive staff were all excellent. However, I felt that the service staff at the hotel (particularly the Front Desk and concierge) were below the level of service I expected. Every time I spoke to them, they simply didn't care. There was never a feeling of hospitality or welcome when we saw the staff and several behaved as if guests were a giant inconvenience to them. Food and beverage staff were better, but still not overly accomodating. The food (breakfast and dinner were included) was average. You would be much better off walking the short distance to La Quinta Avenida for your culinary needs. In short, the beach location was great, but with so many beach front options in Playa, the Shangri-La needs to step up their service before I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Si, si Shangri La Caribe!!”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaW
Reviews.Content: We loved Shangri La Caribe (regrettable name notwithstanding) in almost unqualified fashion; one of the best holidays we've had in years. Also,less expensive trip than most others [can you spell dot.com bust?]. It was a trepidatious adventure for us (well, for me) because I tend toward luxe, small establishments in hideaway, private places. Whilst Shangri La Caribe isn't enormous, only 90 cabanas/rooms, that's bigger than the largest beach resort we've stayed in (Cap Juluca on Anguilla); and Caribe is on the north end of the town of Playa del Carmen so it's not a hideaway in any way, it sits directly on the town beach frequented by Caribe patrons, other tourists and locals (therein, by the way, is much of its charm as we learned). Caribe does restrict use of its palapas and beach chaises to guests but there's never a "rush" to stake out chairs since they are sufficient unto the demand. We, however, did early on claim our chaises because we wanted the palapa that was six feet from our beachfront cabana but that wasn't difficult to snag. There are several categories of lodging, we opted for a beachfront cabana (of which there only are 8 or so, thus reserving early is a plus); it's the most expensive level at $280/night for two including breakfast, dinner, taxes (which can mount up) and tip (although we added a substantial gratuity upon departure because the service was close to sublime). We were 20 yards from the waves with nothing between us and the view (except sun bathers, beach walkers and the occasional topless gal). Other categories are: penthouses (don't bother unless you're in great shape [on the third floor of a cabana and the underlying floors are generously tall]). Also, these are on the Playa side of the resort, the least interesting, and the beach isn't as nice for swimming as on the other (Caribe) end of the resort (but it's closest to breakfast); there's some construction going on in the Playa area, too. Caribe (where we stayed) is the best area -- close to the beach and ocean (and therefore cooler) if one didn't want to opt for a beachfront cabana, the logical mid-price choice would be a non-beachfront cabana (no one on top, no one below), your own little casita and it's worth it. One with an ocean view is worth it, too. Caribe is the largest area and the best, in my opinon. Pueblecito is in the rear of the property, furtherest from the beach and, therefore, from the cooling breezes (although rooms have AC which usually is a shame to use unless one really must). Pueblecito rooms are in a series of small groups, not free-standing cabanas. If the only way I could stay at Caribe is in a Pueblecito room, I wouldn't hesitate a minute, would book it happily, so wonderful is the overall experience. Besides, all lodgings come with two hammocks on a patio/porch/deck. Rates (April - Dec. 15, 2007) for doubles including breakfast, dinner, tax and gratuity are: $160, $180, $200, $220, $265, $280. Those rates are excellent for the area. Also, Shangri La Caribe is a family-owned establishment and cares about its customers. The beach is, as tourist brochures like to say, powder soft. The water in April was delightful, a bit chilly upon entry but then utterly fabulous, bouyant and to die for. I'm a waterbaby and adore bobbing about in the ocean. There wasn't a day you couldn't swim/play/bob in the water; it's calm and welcoming and gorgeously clear -- for as far out as you can swim, you can see the ocean floor. There are two nice-looking pools; we preferred the ocean (also the Playa-side pool seemed to be kid-central). Food -- if you research Caribe here at TripAdvisor, you'll see complaints about the food. Here's our take. Breakfast is splendid including limitless fresh fruit (pineapple, papaya, mango, oranges, banana, melon, sometimes grapefruit), and all the fresh OJ you can drink plus one other fresh juice (in April that was watermelon or a mango/papaya). There are Mexican pan dulces (which I adore) consisting of a variety of sweet pastries, some with custard. They are made in the Caribe bakery and are luscious. There's dry cereal, yogurt, real oatmeal and a large selection of hot meals including egg dishes (Mexican and not) and pancakes. I don't usually eat pancakes but these were wonderful so I had 'em four days in a row! Coffee and tea, of course, even decent tea. Downside of breakfast: no 1/2 'n 1/2, instead you have to poach from the jug of hot whole mile next to the oatmeal urn. Skim and low-fat milk is offered. One must ask for ice-water but it's safe. Lunch isn't provided as part of the rate but is available to order and the prices are reasonable. I hate to say this but the hamburgers were excellent (Mexican beef can't be beat). There are many places on the beach to lunch; we mostly skipped lunch (I was trying to sort-of diet, after all). Dinner -- now this is where TripAdviser posters let loose. I have to say, the food was good mostly. Not four star but I didn't expect it would be. We stayed seven nights and in that time had three buffets: BBQ, by far the best, don't miss it; Yucatean/Mexican was tasty; Caribbean was good to OK. Other dinners were three or four courses (salad, soup, entre, dessert) with a choice of two entres (usually between fish and meat/chicken or between meat/vegetarian) and were good. Other than juice and coffe/tea at breakfast as well as the liter-bottle of still water with which the room is replenished daily, drinks are extra but reasonably priced (don't miss Happy Hour from 5 to 6pm). The clientele -- now, this is interesting. I'd been expecting a majority comprised of North Americans. But, I'd estimate these demographics: 40% Norte Americano, 45% European and 15% Mexican. Some families with kids but not so many as to disturb me and I'm semi kidphobic. The Europeans in the main were Scandinavian, Polish, German and Dutch.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found for the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: MissingParadise
Reviews.Content: This trip was AMAZING. We went to Shangri La three months ago in January and it was so great that we rebooked for this trip in April. In January we stayed in the Pueblito section which was lovely but this time we stayed in the one of the penthouse rooms on the Adventura/Playa side – it was absolutely breathtaking. The views from this third level room are beyond words. At night we would leave all the windows open to hear the waves crashing. Even though the temperatures were HOT while we were there it was always cool in our room and balacony due to the ocean breezes – we only used a/c once. The rooms are always cleaned thoroughly & often we came back to fun designs made with our towels  As last time – the waitstaff was INCREDIBLE!!! Words can not describe how wonderful the waitstaff is – to name a few of the great: Hipolito, Manuel, Ignacio and of course the wonderful Ivan. These guys are SO friendly – they remember details – names, room numbers, what you like to drink etc … They treat you SO well – they work SO hard and always have a smile on their faces. I agree with other reviews that the front desk could take a lesson or two from the guys … the front desk comes across as cold and unwelcoming which isn’t very nice – especially when you first arrive. It would be nice to greeted by the frontdesk staff but this is not the case. The FOOD. Well, the food was terrific!!! We had breakfast and dinner on the property every day. Breakfast was delicious and dinner was too!! For dinner, there is either a buffet or you are served one of two entrees. We ate lunch @ the property three times (the other three times we went into Playa) – the guacamole and ceviche are GREAT!!!! For drinks we went to Wal-mart and bought A LOT of beer and a case of water. We brought a cooler with us and each morning after breakfast would buy a new bag of ice from the bar for $3USD. We went to happy hour on the property twice which was fun!!! Shangri La does NOT disappoint!!! This trip was simply put: perfect. It is a place that we will return to annually as it holds a very special place in our hearts. As I said before … Just go … It is paradise and you won’t want to leave! Emily & Mark from Minnesota … missing Shangri La very much.

Reviews.Title: “great stay...will return!”
Reviews.Author: holycitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with our two children in a beachfront bungalow. We were in 5c..last unit, and closest to the dive shop. Was total peace and quiet. Our children never missed not having a tv. The room was quite large and the views from the unit were great. The ocean was about 15 yards from our front door. The food was also not as bad as I expected. (based on other reviews) Breakfast was fine, and we just did a quick look prior to dinner to decide if we were eating in or eating off property. All I can really add, is if you are going to stay here, stay on the front beach. The grounds are very pretty, but it just doesn't compare to the ocean. One more thing about being front beach, with the constant breeze, we were never bothered by mosquitos, like some of the other guests we met who were staying off the beach. A really great time was had by our family, and we will definitley return! Girl's, if styling your hair is important, take a hair dryer!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann B
Reviews.Content: We have been to Mexico numerous times and have always opted for one of the 5 star all inclusives. After finding the Shangri - la however, we will never go anywhere else. We choose this place based on the previous reviews and pics and were not disappointed. We stayed in a beachfront bungalow. The waves were a little more active then usual at night and were quite loud at times. The beds however were VERY comfortable. (Good luck on getting a king size bed...its the luck of the draw.) The staff is great but the guests there are even better. This is a more intimate resort and we met some of the best people!!!! This made the stay even more memorable and enjoyable! This resort is ok for families but I feel is geared more towards couples who know how to appreciate life. There are a couple of liquor stores up the street where you can purchase Ice, beer or whatever. Since they didn't sell Corona we tried SOL beer. It was excellent and cheaper. Since there is no refrigerator in the room, we brought our own cooler from home. It was on wheels and looked like luggage so we used it as a piece of luggage and packed my husbands clothes in it . Definitely eat breakfast at the resort.... Lunch well...is a little pricey but right up the street is a great restaurant called El Curevo Del Chango. Again FABULOUS!!! You must get the Mango Margarita. They use fresh mangos. No need to dress up. We went in our swim suits and cover up. 5th avenue is a pleasurable walk but make sure you wear bug repellent. Plenty of restaurants-bars-shops. Some of which can be pretty pricey. My rule of thumb was that if the guacamole was more than $6, I would look to eat else where. (Oh...the guac at El Cuervo Del Chango was only $2.60 USD..) To reiterate previous comments..the grounds are extremly clean as are the rooms. Best vacation ever!!!! I do have more pics but the site wouldnt let me download more than 1.

Reviews.Title: “I work in the travel industry and have never encountered such rude and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: CarinaUk
Reviews.Content: A tip in advance - skip this badly managed place and stay in Hotel Secreto on Isla de Mujieres instead! A friend and I stayed here in March this year. I work in the travel industry and travel extensively and I have to say I have never encountered such rude and unhelpful reception staff - EVER! On arrival, the rude French reception staff did not even say "welcome to the hotel" - never mind " I hope you enjoy your stay with us" - she proceed to straight away demand our credit card for payment guaruntee for eventual extras. Later in the stay we had a problem with an outsourced car hire firm. The gentleman from the car hire firm waited 2 hours in reception for the staff to inform us he was there, even though we were in our room on the balcony the entire time! When I approached the reception staff about the inconvenience to the gentleman, again a female member of staff shrugged, made a face and said "it's not my problem" - unfathomable in a so called 4 star hotel. Normally, I would have complained directly but the manager was "unavailable" and I have a feeling he or she would most likely have had the same response. A pity that the front desk staff are so useless - the bar and restaurant staff were great. PS - don't leave anything behind in your room - I accidently left a bracelet and ring - I called the hotel later that week when I noticed the loss. I was advised to call back a day later. When I did I was informed that there was no sign of my jewellry and again - the hotel advises guests not to leave valuables in the rooms - again - "not their problem"

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a special occasion”
