Reviews.Author: tlegray
Reviews.Content: This place was just what we were looking for to celebrate our anniversary. It's right on the beach. Though the beach was smaller it was the nicest stretch of beach north of the Ferry pier...our opinion. We had a penthouse on the playa side that offered privacy. This is perfect for a special occasion. We would stay here again if we were in Playa for a special occasion. The staff were all wonderful and very friendly. The only drawbacks were; dinner was included...we never had dinner there. Most days our room was not cleaned until the 3 oçlock hour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: CocoSoCal
Reviews.Content: I have lived and traveled in Mexico extensively but hadn't been to the Riviera Maya in a number of years. I found the Shangri-la through Trip Advisor and books. My family and I agree it is one of the best vacations we have ever had. The hotel was absolutely delightful. The small size of the resort definitely beats out the giant all inclusives nearby. Our rooms in the Pueblito section were like staying in a child's treehouse. Everything was clean and kept up. The food was good and the staff were helpful and friendly. The close proximity to Playa del Carmen means that you are not trapped out in the country. A nice touch for my 10 yr. old was the pottery painting. Thanks to Miguel and his compadre at breakfast and dinner. Finally although transportation is plentiful do not hesitate to drive. I drove to Chichen Itza, Tulum and Xel-ha and found driving in this part of Mexico organized and safe. Thanks Trip Advisor Reviewers !

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: cocbrdt
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed at this resort from Feb 28-March 8. We had a fantastic vacation and loved Shangri-la Caribe and we will return. This is a lower key vacation resort. Most of the vacationers are families with children, couple and singles in their 30's and up. This is not a party resort. Two pools, both somewhat small. The pool on the Caribe side you can do laps in but only during off hours. Both pools are not deep. Agree with another reviewer that the pool with the Jacuzzi in it, on the Aventura a.k.a.Playa side, is occupied by small children including children in diapers or no suits at all. That was a huge turn off. The beach is quite nice but the ocean was rough during our stay thus we did not venture into the water. Just north of this property is another hotel, an approximate 10 minute walk on the beach, where the water is very calm. Much better swimming at that location. Breakfast is very good. The dinner buffets were very good and the ala carte evenings, while limited choice, were decent. Service was great everywhere, the property is very clean. We had an oceanview room on the Caribe side with 2 beds which sufficed for 2 people but the clothing storage was limited. The other two in our party stayed in an oceanview on the Aventura a.k.a.Playa side and had a much lager room with more clothing storage. Happy hour between 5-6pm was great. Two for one drinks, two pool tables and two ping pong tables. The drink prices outside of happy hour were not exorbitant. $4.50 for a regular Margarita which contained a good dose of booze. Other drinks went upwards of $7.00 which is not out of line with a restaurant drink in the United States. As for drinking the water... I am sensitive to those issues and had absolutely no illnesses at Shangrila. The use of cell phones at Shangrila was almost non-existent. Not used to that in past trips to other resorts. Either vacationers didn’t bring them or they were polite and used them in their rooms. Being away from cell phone usage was nice. Highly recommend Shanrgi-la Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip just as good as the 1st trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Trip Advisor from Dallas, TX
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second trip to Shangri La. We spent a week @ this hotel last March & a week this March. Last year we stayed in 11C on the Caribe side & this year we stayed on 33P which is an Oceanfront bungalow on the Playa or Aventura side. We loved the bungalow on the the beach. We had a huge porch with hammocks & could walk out our door right to the palapas & lounge chairs. The only thing that could be improved is the food at dinner. Breakfast & lunch is very good but dinner needs improvement. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. it is a joy to stay here & a totally relaxing vacation. I hope this hotel stays just like it is amidst all the growth & construction going on in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Review by a Hotel Manager on vacation”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: First off, let me tell you that I am hard to impress and love to stay in 5 diamond properties. While the Shangri-La Caribe would not typically meet a 5 diamond award I think it authenticity and location give it that grade. Here are some things to think about when considering this Hotel. This property is beachfront, that is a plus for access. There are many options for rooms, some have a lot of foot traffic passing them by others are remote and secluded. Be sure that you are asking for the exact room type that will make you happy. We started in 30P which is a penthouse at the far end of the property beside the mexican beach. It was up three flights of stairs, which was great because the exercise allowed us to eat a bit more! The room was fantastic, king bed, lots of space open air to a view and the breeze. For the last half we stayed in 5c a cabana right on the beach. Walk out the front door to your beach spot. The beachfront cabana can be noisy at night because people pass by having fun. There is ample security checking the grounds at all times. They move people along as quickly as possible...but it you are a light sleeper you may wish a different location. But then again, you'd miss out on the sounds, sights and smells of staying right on the beach! There are no hairdryers in the suites and amenities are sparse, sheets are standard not 300 thread count and no plush mattresses...but everything in the rooms is clean and comfortable..so no worries.. The food is satisfactory, but we didnt eat at the Hotel that much..because there are so many fantastic restaurants close by to experiences. Stroll down 5th avenue and thise choices are endless. Drink prices at the Hotel are pricey...we bought a cooler and drinks at walmart and a cooler and shipped it back home with us. well worth it. The Hotel should consider buying some small fridges for the rooms because they have the space. There are no phones or televisions in the rooms. The lack of a phone has its pluses and minuses...but you do get your exercise...All of the staff are friendly and well trained...great dive shop, nice pools, well maintained yards, good cleaning staff, nice food and beverage servers....overall I can't find anything to discredit this great Hotel. One of our favorite spots close to the Hotel is the Cuevo del chango...this is a great spot for a breakfast alternative... The hotel is expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: queencityfan
Reviews.Content: Just as a starting place this was my 4th trip to Playa Del Carmen since July. In that time I stayed at the Iberostar Del Mar, The Luna Blue and the Barcelo Maya Beach. We are no strangers to the beauty of this place and specifically booked at the Shangri La after we explored the property in September. That said: Check-in and Front Desk- Very helpful and friendly service as we arrived. In no time at all we had our room , safe keys, beach towels and the bellman took our bags to our room. We did use the service of the Consierge to book a reservation for dinner in town one night, very convienent. Rooms- We had an oceanview room, 1P on the first floor, the first two nights of our weeklong stay. This room is right in front of the large condos being constructed behind the Adventura side of the resort. We heard very little noise from the area and it never hindered our enjoyment of the room. I will have to say that they have the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in in Mexico, great sheets, lots of fluffy pillows. The room is very basic but the air worked great and the ceiling fans did too. The remaining part of our trip we stayed in 31P, beachfront. This large room was poolside on the Adventura side. Huge porch running the length of the bungalow and nothing but palm trees and ocean to look at while you have your morning coffee there. The room itself was very large but needed a chest of drawers as there was only a couple of shelves to put your clothes on. The weather was cool the first night we stayed here so we went to sleep with the windows open and let the ocean put us to sleep. As it got warmer during the week the air conditioner struggled to keep the room very cool due to the high palapa ceiling. Great tiled walk in shower and double sinks with hot water and good pressure for showering and flushing.Our housekeeper did a very nice job in keeping our room well supplied and clean. Property The grounds here are beautiful! Many flowers, trees etc and they are all very well kept. The pools are quite nice and refreshing but I too wish the babies would not take over the Jacuzzi. Although we chose to stay on the beach for a special occasion I would not hesitate to stay anywhere else on the property to save a few dollars, the beach is mere moments from any room.If you are interested in coming back you should be sure to walk the property, jotting down room locations that might appeal to you. They offer an Internet room as well as wireless access,just go to the desk to sign up, a nice gift shop sells souviners, ice cream etc The most important feature here is the spectacular beach and wonderful water. Food and Drinks We only missed breakfast one morning. For those of you who need that coffee before 7:30 they set up a coffee pot by both pools, just go get a cup in your jammies, it's pretty laid back here. The fruit was so delicious, great breads and pastries not to mention the Mexican specialties and many varieties of eggs and meats. Service was normally very good and attentive. We ate lunch here several days. Although it is a bit pricy the portions are very large and could easily be shared for an afternoon snack to tide you over till dinner. As we prefer to eat at one of the many great places in Playa for dinner we only had dinner at the resort one night. We happened to be there on a Mexican buffet night and it was pretty basic but good. We also thought the bar drinks were on the high side, just be sure to go at happy hour between 5 & 6 for a better deal. We did purchase a foam cooler for beer and soda in our room and at the beach. There is a small store a couple of blocks from the hotel that has most anything you could need by way of drinks and snacks. Small bags of ice can be purchased at the bars at the resort. Overall As a previous reviewer mentioned there were many families with small children staying here. Most were well behaved as were their parents but I can see why some people would like a quieter atmosphere. We found that sitting at the beach under a palapa you heard very little except the ocean waves breaking on the sand. Playa Del Carmen is a growing city, 10 years ago there only 12,000 people living there, now it is over 200,000 so of course there will be more of the conviences of the modern world, ie WalMart, chain fast food etc... Who are we ,as tourists, to object to that? The beauty of the Shangri La is that it still offers a warm relaxing setting in the fastest growing city in Mexico and I for one am glad they do.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaolaOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel it’s nice, it is a different type of resort. The rooms are like cabanas, and have hammocks outside your room where you can relax and enjoy!! Excellent service and food. It is not a quite place, it is more a family hotel. But beautiful! The beach is great and downtown is 15 minutes away, very nice walk. Playa del Carmen is a paradise, it has good energy everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great laid back hotel, felt like Gilligans Island”
Reviews.Author: ericbser
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before booking at the Shangri La and knew what to expect. The Hotel and beaches were exactly what we imagined and had hoped for. Took our own cooler, asked for the pueblito section, second floor ( to get away from construction noise). but mostly to experience the thatched roofs without the beach front price. The way the hotel is set up, this section is actually closest to the activities. When we placed our requests, they wouldn't confirm a room or floor until our arrival. But they did grant all of our requests. The vast majority of the staff is exceptional and friendly. We did not bring our kids this trip, but the staff really catered to and even played with other guests kids. I would highly recommend if your going to bring your children, of any age to Mexico, that it be Playa and even the Shangri La. The rooms are very clean and new with great beds. Very minimal water pressure in the showers, that change from hot, to very hot, to frigid without warning. But heh, this is Mexico, did not damper my spirit or attitude. If your looking for a laid back, rustic, sandy island vacation. This place is for you. If you want a high rise, glamor and late night party crowd, this isn't for you. Food is acceptable, but not exceptional. My only disapointment, isn't with the Shangri La, as I mentioned we did a lot of research prior to booking. We have been to most ports on the Western side of Mexico. This was our first try at the Carribean side. Can you say, Walmart, Sams Club, McDonalds, Burger King, Subway, no public transportation. $1 a mile cab fare. This was not an inexpensive trip to Mexico. Don't expect 10 peso beers or lobster and shrimp on the beach for $20 us. Expect a Mexican Disneyland, as everything is a theme park (Xel Ha and Xcaret) with high prices and a sucking sound aimed at your wallet. I long for my place on the western side of Mexico, where a $200 a night room offers your own infinity pool over looking the ocean, 10 peso Coronas with shimp and lobster delivered on the beach for $20 for 2. Can't tell you where it is or the price will go up and Walmart will move in. Lastly my hat is off to the service provided by little Miguel at the bar, who "may" be getting married in September, the seniorita at the lobby desk and both of the bell hops. Exceptional! Don't bother with the older bar tender, the older gentle man at the lobby desk or the consierge. They have seen too many tourist to care about your trivial questions. If your headed to the Riviera Maya, have lots of spending cash, want a peaceful laid back beautiful hotel, this is for you. Better book quick before development pushes it aside. I wish I could move the Shangri La to the Pacific side of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “will go back again, but..........”
Reviews.Author: AdventureRUs
Reviews.Content: We love this place and will return because it is like paradise. And as the huge condo buildings continue to gobble up all the space around it, Shangri La feels even more precious. We love the waiters, the nicest, most professional of anyplace we've stayed in the world. It was actually a joy to see them in the morning and talk with them about their families, etc. And the resort is as gorgeous as ever! No complaints at all, but it is not fancy. I do wish that there was a sign posted that infants in diapers may not use the hot tub. The infants and young children seem to have claimed it as their own, crowding out the adults who might want to use it. The bacteria level is probably pretty high since the temperature fosters more bacteria growth. I never saw a child in the kiddie pool the whole time I was there! Fifth Avenue is a wonderful street and we love to walk it each night. We found a number of excellent restaurants that were not like US chains. Pettit Marrakesh serving Moroccan food (Calle Corazon) was a favorite and we liked the French restaurant on the same block. The Italian restaurant Riviera served fresh and tasty pastas, fish, and more. It's closer to Shangri La than some of the others so the street is not as crowded. For authentic Mexican fare, try La Cueva del Chango just a block up from the resort. It's great fun on Sundays when the locals are there, does not feel touristy at all. And if you are adventurous, there is a Mayan restaurant as well that is interesing as well as delicious. We are return visitors who have a favorite room, which happens to be one of the most expensive rooms there. However, it was right next to the construction and we had, yes I really mean it, a chain saw going for three days straight. Another room was offered to us, but we did not want to move, asking instead for one free night (out of 10 there). No go. And, in contrast to the wait staff and bartenders, the front desk was surly, unhelpful and seemed not to care. To be fair, though, in contrast to another writer's experience, the concierge was quite helpful and gladly booked our dinner reservations. We missed the old on-site restaurant that allowed one to eat lunch outside, but I heard that when the hurricane blew it away, the decision was made not to re-build it. I don't know if that is true or not, but I much preferred eating outside to eating in the breakfast room. Because Shangri La is so laid back, the temptation is to not leave, but there are so many wonderful things to see from the Mayan ruins at Coba to the majestic Tulum. Also the biosphere at Sian Ka'an. I just read about the underwater caves and cenotes near Valladolid so we'll probably check that out next trip. I would recommend this place, but as you can see above, there are faults. We still had a lovely time and wish we were there right now!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hotrod100
Reviews.Content: Terrific place to stay, quite, good food unbelievable beach. Close to shopping and restaurants. Staff is the best, always happy and willing to help in any way. .

Reviews.Title: “Very unique”
Reviews.Author: runandgolf
Reviews.Content: The setting is beautiful and the hotel is so different and unique in the way it is set up. We had our own hut/palapa. Loved the peaceful of the surroundings and the hammocks on each patio in front were wonderful. We never had a problem getting chairs on the beach and the beach was absolutely gorgeous! Loved the happy hour from 5-6 and fun to play pool. Waiters at the restaurants and bartenders were very friendly, however the front desk needs some serious lessons in customer service. The first night we checked in they tried to put us in a room right next to the construction with all the noise. I had requested a room away from the noise before making the reservation, so I went to the front desk stating the facts and they didn't even apologize, just said there are no rooms available, after requesting a discount and asking to speak to a manager, guess what, they found an open room for me, interesting, huh??? The concierge was never there to help you and if you want to book a room, guess what, they hand you a phone book and let you go at it, no offer to help you. Overall, a wonderful place and I would definately go back, just think need to have a friendly front desk and better food. The restuarants down around 5th avenue are delicous, I would suggest eating your dinner outside of the hotel. We had no problems with loud people, it was a very quiet, relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “"Paradise"..can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: uppercreeker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights in January at the Shangri-La and absolutely loved it....we stayed on the upper floor of the Caribe Gardenview section and it felt like we were staying in the modern day version of the Swiss Family Robinson's tree house.No TV, no phone and not even a clock and we did not miss any of it . We could see the ocean from our hammocks on the deck and did not feel it necessary to pay the extra money to have an ocean view room as the garden area is much quieter but only a short distance to the beach. There is plenty of lounge chairs on the beach and never had a problem finding one any time of the day. The beach is beautiful and if you like to walk or jog for long distances in the early morning it is absolutley perfect. The breakfast buffet was great with a huge selection of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries along with a hot breakfast menu. Dinners alternated with a buffet one night and a choice of two meals the next night...we preferred the buffet as this gave you a larger selection to choose from. We took the advice of other reviews and went to Walmart and bought a cooler for our drinks as drinks are not included but we did partake in the Happy Hour that was offered each day from 5-6. We were happily surprised that there were no vendors on the beaches and if you wanted to shop you could just walk a few blocks and you would arrive at the pedestrian only shopping area of 5th Avenue. We had never been to Playa before this trip and if we had known how much we were going to enjoy it we would have definately booked for longer...but there is always next year..we will be back for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lehmdoj
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about encountering noise problems after reading some of the reviews here, but we were placed far away from the construction and heard very little of it. Security was on top of any excessive noise late at night. Staff was so friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good with fresh fruits and eggs, etc. Dinner is OK -- for mass-produced food, it's as expected. I wouldn't plan on eating every meal there. You should travel into Playa del Carmen and sample some of the restaurants there. I highly recommend Yaxche Restaurant for regional mayan cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: ZeelandDutchies
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful resort on a magnificent place on earth. Located right on the beach, with a 10 minute walk to the centre of Playa, a must for travelers that like to relax. The staff welcomes you with a warm friendly smile upon arrival. The rooms, which are cute little huts with verandah's, are well maintained and comfortable to stay in. We liked the lay-out of the permisses. 2 pools, beachbar, restaurants and enough space on the beach will make your vacation a memorable enjoyment. The time we stayed there, there was some construction in the neighbourhood, so we advice you to stay in the cheaper rooms (gardenview) as they are located in the centre of the resort but close enough to the beach. The all inclusive food was very good. Dinner buffets gave a lot of choice and varieties. Serving and housekeeping staff was very welcoming and helpful. Bar prices were within the reasonable limits (but what do you expect from a vacation resort?) All in all...a must for your vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Robinson Curusoe”
Reviews.Author: Hosta_La_Vista
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at a 5 star all-inclusive and then at the Shangri La for 5 nights. It was a totally different experience but much more satisfying. It is lovely to be able to walk along 5th Avenue to experience something other than the resort. Pros: - Location just far enough away from town but near enough to walk. - Laundry mat only 1 block away (I think the hotel should advertise this as many travellers are looking for that benefit. - The beach, pool and rooms are kept spotlessly clean daily. - Staff are very fun and very interactive - "Hello My Friend" - Lots of chairs at the pool and beach. The best part of the chairs is because the resort is right beside a public beach (both sides), guests can't leave their towels on the chairs to save them because if taken you owe $30. - Nice pool with jacuzzi a few degrees warmer. - Safe in the room (although small). I am uncertain why resorts insist on putting your room number on your key that is attached to your safe key - not really safe at all. - food, is very good. Breakfast is excellent and dinner is average. The reviewers that say the food is awful I suspect are never happy with food - other than 5 star. This is Mexico. - The view of the ocean is great from all of the Adventura rooms (feel like you are in a tree house). - hammocks on the balconies are a nice touch. - Internet (however it was down the full 5 days we were there and I suspect longer than that). - bar has happy hour and happy staff. A nice social area for people to mingle. - Security staff are very friendly and always out watching that the public does not come into the resort. The Shangri La needs a sign to say who they are as people are interested and walk off the beach into the resort to ask someone what the name is. - There is an aircondition and a fan, however just open the windows (that are all newly screened) and let the air blow through. Cons: -No fridge. You would think that when you are paying over $200 a night a fridge would be a nice asset. You are forced to hike down to Walmart and pick up a cooler that you can put your beer and water in). Interesting that there is never a cooler that the guest before you left behind. There is a store a block away that supplies ice for a meager $1.30. It is a pain though. Those with babies would really find it difficult. A Micro wouldn't be such a large expense either. - No TV - at least the ability to rent a DVD player and a movie when the weather is bad would be nice. Bring one with you or there is a Blockbuster a few blocks away. - Something to clean the sand out of your room (a little dustpan) so you don't drag sand into your bed each night. - Some parts of the structure are run down. - The lobby needs to be more inviting - dark and dingy with dirty furniture. You feel like you are walking into a hostel and not expensive resort. Some sort of orientation or a map would be a nice welcome from the staff at the front. We arrived a few hours early and had to wait until 3:00 exactly to get into our room - we know it was empty. The check out is a little late at 1:00 pm. - Mattress covers on the bed. For 3 or the 5 nights we had no mattress cover on the bed - just a sheet. YUCK! - The doors are not that secure. No extra locks or chains - just the one that the maid can open. No peep hole either. A phone in the room to contact security if there was a problem would definitely be safety consideration. - The pool on the Adventurer side has no food wash - just the full shower. When it is windy you have to run around to try catch the water (oh well, who really cares). Tips: - don't have the hotel/bell person arrange a cab to Cancun or the Airport for you. They arrange $70, you arrange $45. All in all we would highly recommend Shangri La. The encroaching development will definitely prove to be problematic for the public beach area in Playa Del Carmen. Over building and hotels are all sharing the same beach area (not the Shangri La). Now that truly is a sad beach area - wall to wall people.

Reviews.Title: “Closest thing to paradise”
Reviews.Author: J0hn0
Reviews.Content: This report is very detailed, because I find that lacking in many descriptions and I want anyone going there to know what to expect. First of all, this place is awesome and worth every penny. An aging all-inclusive resort from back in the day, when Playa was a small undeveloped secret, Shangri-la Caribe miraculously retains its serenity and unparalleled beauty. In the 1980s Shangri-la was on the outskirts; now, even though you can drive right up, park and walk in, it still has that tucked away feeling of an undiscovered secret. As many have said, it is located on the most beautiful, perfect stretch of beach in the area. Upon arrival, you find yourself at the end of calle 38, which ends in sand. Don't worry about parking, there will be a spot. No meters, just park anywhere, and be enthralled at the paradise that welcomes you. First, you see a spwrawling open-air palapa rotunda with a stone-tiled floor, strewn with couches and places to lounge. (Wireless-enabled throughout). There's no big sign, just a big front desk. The rooms are basically little cottages situated among windy stone and tile paths dotted with coconut trees: imagine a Mayan village at the apex of that civilization. Our cottage had a little patio with a table and 2 hammocks, a hexagonal shape mimicking the hexagonal shape of the room itself. Both the patio and the room are topped with palapas. (I was wary of this because I feared bugs getting through, but the thatch is very thick and resilient, and topped with netting for extra security). It issurprisingly airtight and yet somehow admits fresh air. The a/c works great. The room has a writing desk, two queen beds and several windows, with ingenious wooden shutters that open to reveal screens, should you be so insane as to wish natural air instead of a/c. There's also an overhead ceiling fan for extra comfort. I've seen other comments on the lack of shelves, but our room had plenty. We had a large closet with shelves to the right and over the top. Plenty of space to store shoes and clothing, as well as valuables in the safe. Kind of moot though, since your'e in Playa. Just bring a few swimsuits, diving gear and some shorts and flipflops. We hung our snorkle gear on the curtain rods. The bathroom is outfitted with tile sconces where you can store your toiletries, and is a stucco and tile affair, with a huge walk-in shower. I'm 6'1" and I hate short showers; this one was just about tall enough. The water pressure and temperature control are better than my shower at home. The shower releases water in about 50 tiny streams, so it's that kind of light and quiet shower, rather than heavy and splattery. The hotel provides a basket of quality soaps, shampoos, etc. The suite we had in Pueblito/Caribe comes with either 2 queens or one king bed. We got 2 queens and while I prefer a king, these beds were comfortable with quality mattresses, with built-in mattress pads on top. While I'm not too fussy about mattresses, I know a good one and these were not "hard" as so many have said beds in Mexico are. Compared to my $300 mattress at home, these were equal. (Incidently, I ordered a king - speaking Spanish really helps, but regardless, I was far from disappointed). Every cottage room has easy access to the pool and beach. A beachfront spot seems great, but since it takes 2 to 3 minutes to reach the beach from anywhere in the resort, the advantage of beachfront would only be the view. It's coconut trees and cats vs. lapping ocean waves. I love cats so it was great. Palapas are provided on the beach, and there always seem to be plenty avalailable. It could have been the season (August), but regardless, you can easily spend the whole day lounging, swimming and snorkeling right in front of the hotel. The restaurant on the beach delivers food several times a day, but it's not that cheap and we had a great time supplementing our pina coladas with a cooler full of snacks and beers. You can take a little walk up the street and find great little take-out places that will make you a huge lunch from about $5.00 to $25.00 for two (depends on what you want - I tend to seek out locals-only stands). There's also a bar on the Caribe side, maybe 1 minute's walk from your spot on the sand. The staff is friendly and keeps the property in perfect shape. Tips are not expected, but we noticed other people tipping and the bartenders are very happy with tips. The bar is well-stocked and the bartenders friendly, but shots are $6 and up, and drinks are pricey. Take advantage of happy hour, and just go elsewhere for serious drinking. The bar closes early (11 PM). There are 2 pool tables and 2 pingpong tables in the lounge next to the bar and swimming pool. The games are free, but the pool tables are pretty warped, so just do some drinking and don't bet on any 9-ball! The property has 2 swimming pools. The water is warm and shallow, making these great places to nurse a fruity drink. Bugs and vermin: in August/September, there are plenty of mosquitoes and possibly other biting insects. I found success with a 7% deet Cutter bug spray. It's not like swarms of bugs hassling you, like in South Carolina or something. They come out at night, and if you use bug spray, you might suffer a bite or two: a trifling nuisance. We also had small, almost microscopic, ants in our room, but we didn't keep much food around and they were harmless and infrequent. We also had a resident lizard, about 1.5 inches long. Lizards don't bother me, and they eat bugs! Food: I don't like all-inclusive resorts, but Shangri-la does not have a restrictive feel at all. It's worth the money even if you don't take advantage of all the amenities. The first night, I was travel-weary and had been up all night. The restaurant was serving a set menu: you could start with a salad of julienned carrots, jicama, tomatoes, peppers and greek olives on a bed of shredded lettuce with olive oil dressing, or half an avocado filled with shrimp in a cool, creamy dressing. The entree was either a chicken cordon bleu, which looked horrible, or a salmon steak with veggies and mashed potatoes. The salmon was a perfectly-cooked filet, prepared in butter with a mild green sauce. buttered broccoli accompanied it, perfectly done, and decent mashed potatoes. Dinner with served with a basket of bread and drinks were extra. It was okay all in all, and you won't be disappointed on a budget, but as anyone who's been to Playa will tell you, there a millions of cheap, awesome alternatives. The breakfast is also very good and there's a variety of Mexican and european favorites. Fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, oatmeal and Mexican specialties like Chorizo and eggs, as well as French toast and almost anything you want, made to order. Good coffee. If you're lounging on the beach, eventually someone will come by and ask you if you want lunch. There's plenty of variety. I tried shrimp tacos: small flour tortillas with beans, grilled onions and freshly grilled shrimp for $10, delivered to your lounge without you lifting a finger, and it's a lot of food. Still, take my advice and look elsewhere for food. Shangri-la Caribe is not a typical 5-star resort with valet parking and car service. It's staffed by helpful, informative and friendly people and it's really low-key. If you want the feeling of being left alone in a tropical paradise, while behind the scenes everything is taken care of for you, stay here. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, horrible food.”
Reviews.Author: sbeia
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a no frills, laid back, barefoot, hanging on the beach experience. The service here is outstanding. EVERYONE on the staff is wonderful and accomaodating. This is not a place to go if you want great food. The location is wonderful, right on the gorgeous Playa beach and a beautiful beach walk into downtown. The rooms are very basic, but clean with great service. We traveled with three 17 year old boys who had their own pueblito. Other reviews mentioned that this wouldn't be a place to bring kids, but I disagree..there were plenty of kids of all ages. Teens can wander on their own with no worries. You may just want to bring your dvd player for kids as there are no tvs/phones. All in all, this is a great place to stay if you don't want to dole out for an over the top all inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: roxo56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned this week from Playa del Carmen and we stayed the entire 4 days at Shangri La. We are avid readers of trip advisor reviews and rely heavily upon the opinions of others before we book reservations anywhere. We enjoyed our stay with Shangri La very much but probably will stay elsewhere next visit. What we liked: Very beautiful beach with excellent security. Close to town but not too close. We never even saw a beach vendor, which for us and Mexico was a first. Excellent breakfast cuisine and service was attentive. Very clean rooms with lots of space. Average beds though, kinda hard. They include 2 hammocks with each room, use them. 2 great pools kept spotlessly clean. Good bar, gameroom with nice happy hour. They ring the bell at 5:00pm and again at 6:00pm to bracket this 2 for 1 time. Good stocking of this bar with ALL mexican beers available. NO TV's , lots of Euro-guests. What we didnt' like: (nitpicking) Rooms need a mini-bar so that at least you can keep your drinking water cool. Rooms need phones so you can call the front desk or home. Better dinner food that isn't so bland. Although their Sunday night Mexican buffet was very good, we skipped the other dinners. Summary: All in all, this is a very nice place to stay and you should not worry if they don't have an ocean vew room available. The garden view rooms farthest from the construction (units 50-59) are the best. Ask for an upstairs unit with balcony. Many of the ocean view rooms are too close to the beach and lack privacy from other guests and locals walking by. We stayed in 51b. The most private, least crowded section of their beach is over on the side by the morning breakfast restaurant. After breakfast getting a palapa there was no problem and very quiet despite the contruction closer to the street. However the beach right there is rocky and difficult (painful) to wade out into. Better to walk 75 yards south and wade out there where it's mostly sandy but more crowded. My only non-nitpicking complaint is that the front desk staff is "indifferent". Not just to me because I experienced other people having the same problem. They need training on how to welcome guests when they first arrive. Oh, and here's an idea, hire a bellboy or two to carry the arriving guests luggage to their rooms and maybe even upstairs. This "attitude" is probably the only thing besides dinner keeping them from getting perfect rating from me. Overall, very nice place but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Setting”
Reviews.Author: NewTravelAdventures
Reviews.Content: Our group enjoyed 4 nights at the resort. The setting is terrific, close to the beach with the sound of waves at night. The food was good and the staff very friendly. We too were annoyed with the late night noise. It was unfortunate that some people were so rude to be out yelling and carrying on the middle of the night. There were security guards on the beach and in the pool area during the day but at night no one to be found. When you are paying premium dollar to stay in a beach front bungalow this really was unacceptable. Otherwise I would recommendate this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Shangri La!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigtimeFun
Reviews.Content: NO THOUSANDS OF ROOMS,no thousands of people, no midnight buffetts with ice carvings.Just simple,comfortable friendly surroundings. Chill, relax, eat well ( we are from Louisiana and KNOW FOOD :) drink hearty and just enjoy life. Food plentiful and wonderfully good, breakfasty was a superb treat then a late dinner hora felize watching the sunset and a lovely shower in the HUGE tile showers.Great beds,gret a.c. when needed.Stayed in penthouse on playa side and absolutely loved the view but tequilla and stairs don't mix. I love Mexico and the Mayan people,so short but such huge hearts and smiles.DO IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: spiburns
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a delightful one week stay at Shangri-La Caribe in Playa del Carmen. We had a wonderful time. First of all, it is at a wonderful location: we were able to walk into the town of Playa del Carmen everyday. The setting was lovely. Although there are condos going up across from the entrance, and the coastline is being built up, the Shangri-La property retains a quiet, uncrowded feel. Many of the casitas have views of the ocean. Charming little paths go through the village-like setting. The staff were outstanding. Everyone from security to the waiters and front desk were professional, friendly and generous with their time. The food was very good and they did their best to create a festive atmosphere over the holidays. Playa del Carmen is a growing town, very international with a lot of great restaurants. The town manages to stay very clean even though it can be crowded. We'd definitely recommend the Shangri La Caribe to anyone who wants to stay close to town, in a small resort that is charming, relaxed, friendly,and with top notch service. It has understated continental class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but do think about these two things”
Reviews.Author: Ravenwing7
Reviews.Content: This all-inclusive resort is quite lovely, and the staff are the friendliest I've ever seen. However, the construction and the drunken Americans really ruined our stay here in Dec 06. There are no phones in the rooms, so you must walk all the way over to the Front Desk in the middle of the night to request that someone please shut the drunks up. Whether or not action is taken is negligble; the group upstairs certainly didn't quiet down, and people were out yelling in the pool at 3:15 AM. These same people will grace your breakfast and dinner, as the plan is all-inclusive. We couldn't get away from the obnoxious partiers. We had hoped for quiet, peaceful days on the beach, and good sleeping at night. Didn't happen. Construction all day (yes, even on Sunday, no joke) and drunks at night. Not a nice vacation at all. Without the construction and drunks, the property is very nice. The staff is very eager to please, but seem unable to do anything about quiet hours, which we were told started at 8 PM and went until 8 the next morning. Definitely not so. There are no quiet hours. During our stay, several guests complained about the drunks but nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdoda
Reviews.Content: After staying a couple nights at a cheaper hotel off the beach (Aventura - nice hotel as well) we moved to the Shangri La Caribe. What was interesting was that we tried to book a room at this resort before our vacation and they said they were fully booked. But when we walked into the lobby on our trip to just check again we were able to book the top floor of a beach-side bungalow. It truly was right on the beach and we had a great view. The room was nothing fancy but large, air conditioned, and very clean, the balcony was terrific. Two hammocks right on balcony as well as lounge chairs and table. So when you’re not on the beach you can play cards or relax there. I did have a roach crawl on me one night while sleeping but hey.. they are true "thatch-roof" bungalows so it's understandable. Beach was great! Easy to get a towel and chair every day as well. We ate dinner and breakfast there many times during our stay. It was usually the same each day but pretty decent - definitely not any worse than anywhere we ate in town. Overall stay was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Tuga
Reviews.Content: Shangri-la Caribe was our first hotel in Mexico. We (my boyfriend and I) stayed there 4 nights in early December and had great expectations from all the wonderful reviews we had read. We were not disapointed. We stayed in a room at the Aventura/Playa section, right in front of the ocean with a wonderful balcony and two hamacas. There were always plenty of chairs at the beach to lay down and the beach is wonderful. We had read some less positive reviews about the food, but really cannot complain - breakfast was great, with a wide selection of different types of eggs (mexican style; we tried a different one each day), fresh natural juices, fresh fruit and the usual breads and cereals. Dinner was ok, though not very varied - there was only a meat or fish dish to choose from, but good quality and service. We had half-board (breakfast+ dinner) but drinks were paid separate. The hotel is very close to town (Playa del Carmen) and you can walk to the shops and restaurants, tough we were lazy and always took our rental car. All in all, the hotel is very beautiful and well taken care of and we always had a sense of privacy that make it ideal for couples. Would definitly recommend it and/or stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Weddingmoon E-V-E-R!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: enokleberg1
Reviews.Content: My husand and I were married on the white sand beach in front of the BEAUTIFUL Shangri-La resort on November 18, 2006. We had 43 friends and family in tow to share our wedding in paradise. It simply was the most wonderful time of both of our lives. Not only is the staff incredibly friendly and accommodating, but everything was clean and well maintained. We stayed in a third floor suite on the Aventura side right next to the Aventura dining room where we held our reception. The daily breakfasts were yummy, fresh and cozy with "delicious coffee." The dinners were great too! We just didn't understand what all the complaining about the food was, seriously. Oh! You HAVE to have a hamburger at lunch time and order a side of guacamole for your chips. I know it' s not traditional Mexican fare, but after a night of Don Julio shots and Tecate, you will be in tip-top shape again. If you decide to visit, please say hello to the waiter Miguel from Ryan and Erica! Everyone remembered our names and could not have been any nicer. Ok, the only thing we didn't like was the noisy construction next door, but THERE WAS A HURRICANE!! Of course they are going to re-build paradise, C'mon!!! Just get up early, get in your hammock and remember you are in paradise for a short amount of time so just ENJOY it!! They're making it better for everyone to keep coming back!! Truth be told, my parents bought a condo in town while we were there because they loved it so much in Playa. I would also agree to buy a cooler at Wal-mart and stock up on beer to bring with you down to the beach. There is a very cute little market up the street from the reception where you can buy hard liquor to make mixed drinks or tons of beer to choose from as well. Beer cozies really help too. We put them in the welcome bags we packed for everyone when they checked in to the hotel. Also, bug spray for your ankles and calves at night because that is the only thing the bugs seem to like attacking. Weird thing is, you don't even feel it until the next day. I am posting my pictures and please feel free to contact me if you have any questions because I could rave for pages and pages about how wonderful it is. If you are planning a destination wedding and want it to be everything you could ever imagine with all of your guests talking about it for the rest of their lives, contact Christine through the Shangri-La's website and tell them that Erica sent ya. You will have an amazing time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with noisy/ugly construction site in front”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: We researched a lot before choosing this hotel, and I must say that it was just what we've expected: great beach, relaxed atmosphere, good service and basic but clean and cozy rooms. Even the food was better than most reviewers have stated. The only problem with the hotel is just the ugly building being built accross the road. For one thing, this four story "temple like" building is totally out of place in front of the Caribbean palapas of shangri-la. (Check my pictures). It just ruins most of the setup. But what is really a problem, is the terrible construction noise, starting at 6:30 AM (no typo here). Most of the week it was annoying but bearable hand hammering, but on two days we got unbelievable noisy machine hammering which kept us awake. Moving to another room was not easy since most of the Aventura and Left Caribe Sections were affected and finally we had to downgrade to a Pueblito section room which, although not bad, was not the same as the Caribe room. The hotel reception staff seemed overwhelmed by the problem. So, my advice is: Coose a room as far away as possible from the construction (right side of Caribe section, next to Las Palapas, should be ok) or check whether there will be construction activity during your stay. For the rest, the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Phathed
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a 1 week stay at the Shangri-La Caribe. It was fantastic! We researched (on-line) probably every hotel from Tulum up to Puerta Morales, relying heavily on trip advisor reviews. Shangri-La was everything we expected and more. Our room, 2nd level Aventura side, was great. Clean, big, comfortable beds, and the tiled shower is nice. A large closet and a dresser for our clothes! Also a suit case rack that we used mostly for drying stuff - there was also a clothes line with clothes pins on the patio. The patio was great with two chairs a table and two hammocks. The bar at happy hour (5:00 - 6:00) was full of people but not obnoxious. It has 2 ping pong tables and 2 pool tables and always had some people having a good time. (unlike the bar next door at Las Palapas - we went there one night after Shangri-La happy hour and it was quiet and deserted - not even any music playing. Although their happy hour was from 4:30 - 7:00 and I guess if you go early there is a bar right on the beach at happy hour that is pretty fun). The staff at Shangri-La - especially the staff at the restaurants - is excellent. Always smiling and extremely helpful. They definitely made our stay more enjoyable. I was a bit nervous about the "all inclusive" food and atmosphere. I was pleasantly surprised. Each restaurant was set up like a restaurant. You could have nice romantic dinners and never felt like you were at a cafeteria. There were mixed reviews on the food that we had read. Maybe they have a new chef but, all of the food was good. Considering it is hard to spend less than $45 for a meal in town (and usually more with drinks and an appetizer), we thought the all inclusive deal was well worth it. The only thing negative I would say is that there was not a lot of variety from night to night - mostly a choice between pork or fish as a main course or a Mexican type buffet. There was more variety in the soups and appetizers for dinner. Breakfast was always good. There are some great restaurants in town to choose from and it is definitely worth it to walk over for a couple nights - an easy pleasant walk. Or it is a $3 cab ride. There is still construction going on behind/next to the resort. This could bother some people - it wasn't a problem for us. Really only the morning that the trash truck was there - did it wake us up. We never missed the TV or the phones in the room. There is internet service at the hotel for $1.50 for 30 minutes (although the keyboard was a little off - the "a" key typed a q and the "q" key typed an a - etc..). Tips: Bring a beer cozy to keep your beer or soda cool at the beach. Go the the market - there is a super market called "Mega" right in town - and get a disposable cooler for ice and drinks in your room. Bug spay for the evenings - it wasn't terrible but it is the tropics and mosquitos definitely come out. Renting a car was well worth the money if you want to go up and down the coast or to the ruins. Get the damage waiver as not all of the roads are perfect and there are plenty of trucks dropping rocks. We paid as much for the car as we would have just for cabs to and from the airport. Snorkeling in Aventura is great if you want to avoid the touristy waterparks. We saw Sea Turtles, reefs and all kinds of beautiful fish and only paid $10 for the equipment at the Aventura Dive shop. We would definitely go back to Shangri-La. We met nice people and had one of the best vacations we have ever had. It is quiet relaxing and has a nice beach with palapas, lounge chairs and great swimming areas. Also, it is one of the only hotels in Playa del Carmen with a pool right on the beach and a Jacuzzi. The Jacuzzi is not hot but is still warm and nice in the evening or when it gets cloudy or rainy. It is also close enough to town that you could go party every night if you wanted or you can just stay in at Shangri-La and enjoy paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise For Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Elenitamoreno
Reviews.Content: When we got there i was a bit worried couse the reception is so tiny and simple, just a desk and a computer under a palapa almost! But the place its amazing is soooo romantic. Even when we said we would be charged if we wanted a bottle a champagne we didnt!!! (maybe the forgot to charge???) and got freee fruit! wich was also suposed to be charged. The food is great and the staf and waitters are warm and friendly. The only one thing and that wasnt their fault its that it rained for 2 days sooooo much that the water almost got into the cabin! missed by about 4 inches! But that made the whole experience actually more fun!. I definetely want to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Our idea of paradise”
Reviews.Author: mayansunloungers4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this resort. We had a beach front bungalow only steps away from the ocean. The bungalow had two double beds a sitting area and a beautiful tiled bathroom. The patio had a table and two chairs and two hamocks that we spent a lot of time relaxing in. The beautiful beach was just off our patio where we could relax under palapas . It is only a five or ten minute walk to the famous fifth avenue either along the beach or out the front lobby you can walk the street. There are all kinds of shops, restaurants and bars. The Shangri-la offers supper and breakfast ncluded with your room rate. Breakfasts were always good with a buffet of fruits, yogurts, pastries etc. or you could order off the menu. Supper you get a choice of two entrees (different every night) most times a mexican or a fish dish , not bad. There are two restaurants at this resort but one was closd for renovations while we were there. The one that was open was over looking the pool and the ocean the other one is in the middle of the resort. While there were no coffee makers in the rooms you can go to the restauant at 6:00a.m. as they had a large urn of coffee with cups to go, (tea bags and water also). There are two pools as well and one is over looking the ocean the other is in the middle of the resort where you can get scuba instructions if you want there is also a very nice swing bar and an area where you can play pool etc. There are not a lot of activities here but it is a great place to relax and walk the beach. Fantastic views, best beach in Playa we can't wait to go back. The only thing we could comment about is that they don't have a fridge in the room, this would be a really nice touch. We went to Walmart ($4.00 taxi ride ) and bought a small cooler and you can buy ice from the bar at the resort so it was no big deal. There are other local mini-marts just up the street to stock up on food/drink or what ever else you need. All in all this was a fantastic place, sun, sand, ocean, shopping, it is all there. The price was right as compared to other resorts that we've been at that weren't as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Super Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Tuscan72
Reviews.Content: Simply fantastic! Bungalow close to the beach, clean, great food, lovely beach, friendly people, I'd recommend this resort to everybody! There was also a wedding cerimony and it was super!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: fourcrockers
Reviews.Content: What can we say, my wife and I stayed here after suffering three nights at the #1 Luna Blues rock hard beds. Well if we could go back in time we definitely would have done all 10 at the Shangrila, it is as nice as everyone says.. We stayed in the pueblito section which is very nice.. A little walk to the beach, but the rooms are all redone and in excellent shape... Food- as described breakfast is excellent, dinners a little more hit and miss somewhat monotonous, but the service was prompt and waiters always willing to help and extremely accomodating.. Rooms-Pueblito 52 B upper unit, very nice a little walk to the beach compared to the caribe section but very comfortable with nice remotely controlled air conditioning units and fans..Our stay in august was hot, and sleeping was a bit difficult but the rooms were still very comfortable. THe beds unlike what we have heard, were nice, firm but a bit pillowy on the top.. Bathrooms roomy and nice..Large tiled showers.. Patios-- large with two hammocks and if you are on the upper floors you get a nice ocean breeze... Disadvantage of an upper room is that with the high roof it is hard for the air conditioner to keep the room cool.. Lack of a fridge is a problem.. Bring a cooler and buy ice and drinks from wal-mart or the little store just down the street.. Drinks purchased from the bar or store are pricey but available.. Lack of lunch is a bit of problem.. You can either order from aventura restaurant or go out, or buy snacks and wait until supper.. We usually got up later, for breakfast which lasted from 7-10:30 and then just snacked on some crackers and food we had picked up from the wal-mart or mega. Yes they do have a wal-mart... Taxis-- Make sure to get the fare advice immediately from a reliable source... The drivers will definitely rip you off given the chance... Also if you are will to walk up to 10th rather than take the taxi directly from the Shangri Lato go downtown you will get at least a dollar or two cheaper rate... The door to hotel "tourista service" gets you a higher price...This tip was given to us by the hotel staff, and matters really only if you are using the taxis alot, but is nice to know... Grounds- Beautiful and always being worked on, staff is very hardworking, and if you didn't know about the hurricane the only evidence is the big piles of sand. Beach- As nice as everyone says...In a word "beautiful".. Amazing sand, gorgeous water, not crowded, and always palapas available.. A beautiful breeze kept it very nice even in the humid and hot summers of Playa.. Staff-- Excellent, restaurant, grounds, front desk, everyone was kind, friendly and accomodating... All in all if you want a relaxing vacation in a simply beautiful location, then the Shangrila is for you.. The food choices aren't like cruising or even a more expensive all inclusive, but they are definitely simple buty enjoyable, and if you want something more go out..... The Shangrila isn't about food, trust me its about having peace, quiet , tranquility and above all an amazing location which you will love.... Go,, you won't be sorry...Trust me you won't miss your T.V..!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to Shangri-La Caribe”
Reviews.Author: GMaks03
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Shangri-La Caribe in mid-June for our honeymoon & we loved it. We are already planning our next trip back. We booked our trip directly through the hotel based solely on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor (thank you!!!). We preferred that it was a small, beachy resort to a huge chain resort. While being relaxed, it was not too rustic (nice cold air conditioning & good service). The grounds were lush & beautiful. The staff was absolutely wonderful & we actually never once encountered a time-share salesperson. We really did like the food actually. We particularly loved the local dishes like slow cooked pork on banana leaves, and of course, the Mexican night (with the mariachi band) was great. We did not eat at the hotel every night though, because Playa del Carmen had so many interesting places that we wanted to check out. We were also thrilled that our end of the Avenida 5 strip was much more laid back and less touristy than the southern end near the Cozumel ferry. Our hope was to get away from a lot of that, while still feeling like there was a little civilization around to go play in. We felt we completely met this expectation. The beach at Shangri-La Caribe is hands down, the best beach in Playa del Carmen. The resort is directly on a large and immaculate beach and you are provided with plenty of loungers & shady palapas to relax under. When we passed the other beaches in town we were not impressed by the crowds, sandbags and boats anchored on shore. There is public beach access in the middle of Shangri-La’s beach area but it is pretty small & it never once made a difference to us. It was never crowded like the other Playa beaches (which also had plenty of public access). If you need to see the beach traffic just check out the resort's web-cam. As others have said, a great tip is to purchase a disposable cooler at the store right up the road. Since the rooms have no refrigerators this was key to keeping our beer nice & chilly. If you need to, there is even a Wal-Mart that you can walk to (or take a cab to) if you have to really stock up on snacks, water rafts, beer or supplies. Bug spray is a big must. Lastly, we took 2 tours arranged through Shangri-La Caribe from Alderban Tours. The Chichén Itzá tour was long and the driver had us a bit scared. The ruins were well worth it, but I think I’d have rather rode in a nice safe bus than to be crammed in a scary little rattly van for 3 hours. The second tour to Tulum & Xel-ha was excellent- same van, but shorter ride. The all-inclusive at Xel-ha was worth it too.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: senoraohora
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Caribe for one week in late July/early August 2006. It absolutley exceeded our expectations in all ways. Not only is it situated in a beautiful beachfront tropical setting, but it is also truly an escape from reality without being showy or pretentious like so many other resorts. We were worried about no TV or phone...but it mattered not! Our room was ample and comfortable. Relaxing on the porch (we had an oceanfront bungalow!) or on the beach was an easy option that was irresistable most days. Both were great for watching the fabulous skies, the turquoise Caribbean, or the variety of people out enjoying each day(although the beach is never crowded!). The restaurants & waitstaff were wonderful, the hotel staff was unobtrusive, but very friendly & helpful, and the proximity to town was perfect - an easy walk along the beach or via Avenida Quinto by bike or foot all made for a wonderful vacation. We highly recommend the Shangri-La Caribe!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach, Plenty of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: happynca
Reviews.Content: First, I must say that this was the most relaxing vacation we have ever taken. We originally had plans to visit all the beautiful Mayan ruins, and snorkle the clear waters, but you know what? Once we arrived at our beachfront room with two wonderful hammocks, we ditched our plans and opted to swim and sun at one of the most beautiful beaches in Playa. I must say that both the positive and negative TripAdvisor remarks about this resort are right on the money. When we first arrived there, the resort's neighborhood, which is still recovering from the hurricanes, gave us some concern. But as soon as we pulled up to the resort, and saw that it was fully recovered from the weather, we relaxed and enjoyed ourselves. The beach is pure bliss, there are always plenty of palapas and chairs right on the water and the environment is serene, with little to no loud destractions. There is more of a "fun in the sun" place down the beach 5 min or so. They work hard to keep the beach clean. There was a small storm overnight that left lots of seaweed and it took about 24 hours to fully clean it (by hand, with wheelbarrows). If I had arrived just on that day, I would have been disappointed in the beach, but it was wonderful when the water cleared from the storm. It is perfect for swimming and there is a tiny reef, but serious snorklers can go across to Cozumel. The beach earns this facility the most points in my book (5 stars) Our room was spacious, with a king bed and beautiful talavera tile bathroom. It was always spotless. The bed was hard, and it had a loud plastic covering on the mattress that we didn't like very much. But we slept well. The air conditioner and ceiling fans in our room worked nicely. The decor is simple and lovely. Those looking for more of a "resort" with a more generic and upscale appearance may be slightly disappointed. We loved the absence of TV and phone. The first bottle of water in the room is free (1L), but won't be nearly enough to get you through the day. You have to pay for more water after that. We went to a convenience store (not the expensive gift shop on site) and bought water regularly and at a more reasonable price. I've stayed in places in Mexico where they provided 5gallon water and dispensers for free or a nominal charge and I think Shangri-La Caribe should consider offering free water to it's guests. It is a small gesture that would mean a lot and wouldn't cost them much. We didn't see one bug in our room the whole week (though be sure to bring bug spray for mosquitos at dawn and dusk when you are outside) The rooms could use a comfort and convenience makeover just a bit. Overall, we were satisfied with the interior of our room, but we aren't particularly picky. Our room was on the ground floor and faced the beautiful water (about 15 ft. away). There were two hammocks from which you can alternately snooze, read and stare out at a million shades of blue. At night we laid out there and watched the moon rise over the water and listened to the waves. This was heaven. (Room and ammenities 2.5 stars, porch and view 5 stars) Food and drinks were fine for us. Some good selections and some mediocre. The breakfast is wonderful with lots of fresh fruit and made-to order hot entres. At dinner you are given 2 choices for a main dish. One meat, one fish. I liked the Yucatan feel of the food, but sometimes I ended up wishing I'd ordered the other thing. But overall, no complaints. There were 2 buffet dinners when we were there and I will say that the presentation was beautiful and not at all like a cafeteria. The ambiance was romantic in the open-air dining structure, dim, with candles. There were always plenty of tables, set apart for maximum privacy. Be sure to use bug spray before going to dinner. We weren't the only creatures dining. (Breakfast - 5 stars, Dinner 3.5 -4 stars) The grounds are simple and beautiful. The structures are charming and really give you the feel of an old-world tropical vacation. Although there were a few families, for the most part this is a very romantic, couples-oriented resort. There isn't anything fancy for the kids, though the ones I saw were having a blast (peacefully) The pools are simple and small, but most people were out on the beach, so they were never crowded and there was always a chair. A few visitors sunbathed topless. (Surroundings: 4.5 stars) We enjoyed very much taking the short 10 min walk up the beach to Avenida 5 and all the shops and restaurants. Every day we went in for lunch and watched the World Cup. We ate lunch at the resort one of the days, but it wasn't great and there are some really neat places to explore in town. I can't think of a resort with a more perfect combination of seclusion and convenience. (Convenience:privacy 5 stars) As many of the previous reviewers have mentioned, there are some very agressive time share folks who will try to lure you to them with promises of free tequila and cash for shopping. If you value your time, come up with any excuse to brush them off (we told them we had an appointment in town). We managed to avoid the presentation, but it was tiresome to make the effort to brush them off every time we ventured into the lobby. This was a very negative mark on the hotel and the most unpleasant aspect of staying there by far. They have no way of remembering who has brushed them off, so you must face these people time and again. The solution would be to provide information in the room for people to read and let those who are interested in the "perks" come forward. We left this feedback as we were leaving. I'm not saying it ruined our trip in any way because it is easy to avoid the lobby. (1 star) Staff are very friendly and deserve tips for excellent service. Be sure to tip a little something! We arranged for airport transfers through the hotel and it worked perfectly. The driver met us at the airport holding up a sign and we never had to wait. It was great to have this aspect of the trip run so smoothly. I recommend this service. (Staff: 5 stars) Just a note on the weather in June, in case you're planning to be there at that time. It clouded up and may have sprinkled a couple of times, but most of the rain fell during the night or only briefly in the day. There was a wonderful, steady breeze blowing off the water and we kept quite cool the entire time we were outside near the beach. In town is another story - it gets quite hot and sticky and doesn't get the ocean breezes. You might want to plan your shopping for early in the day, then go back to the hotel for a refreshing swim in the ocean or pool and enjoy the breezes. Like I said, we probably weren't the typical turists because we ended up just relaxing and not going anywhere. We felt like Shangri-La Caribe was the perfect place for us to unwind and enjoy each other's company. It was a wonderful experience and we will certainly be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rooms, nice service, and it's on the beach but... 1) The included meals aren't particular good. Breakfast is patchy and the evening meals are generous but dull. We found a few great places jus tfive minutes away that are better value, notably Cafe Corizon, Sur and Babes. 2) The endless timeshare selling by the concierge gets really tiresome. They can't recommend any local restaurants, they oversell their own fishing tours (starting at $200 USD per person), and if I get asked about going to a timeshare presentation again, I'm going to scream. The Happy Hour is good value at the bar. The pool tables need straightening. Quite a few kdis and families here too, but at least the beach is close.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Beach, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: camboy70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time the first week of June and could not have been happier. Firstly, it is amazing how well the hotel and the area in whole has recovered from last year's hurricanes. We saw very little evidence of any destruction at all. The hotel itself is as good as ever. Peaceful and relaxing is the name of the game at this resort with the perfect beach being the focal point. The setting is private and the grounds are meticulousily manicured.The rooms are basic yet comfortable with some beautiful decorative touches. The service is good to excellent and the food is about the same. Breakfest is excellent, dinner is good. The atmosphere and service pick up any shortcomings the food quality or variety may have. The Vanilla pancakes, fresh OJ, and all you can eat bacon is to die for. The hotel is probably an 8 out of 10 and the beach is easily a 10 out of 10. It all adds up to a beautiful and relaxing place to vacation. We will be back for a third visit in the not to distance future.

Reviews.Title: “40 year old world travelers - best vacation of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: savardi
Reviews.Content: My wife loved this resort, though she was a little concerned, upon booking, that it might not be "fancy" enough. The long and the short - she loved being able to truly relax. This is a pretty laid back resort. There were some children - but they were typically infants or very young. There were no kids running and screaming around the pools. Overall.... Accommodations - Simple but ample Service - Excellent Beach - Best in the area Food - Great Breakfasts was a must and diners very good. Margaritas - Off the chart Sailing - Catamaran / Hobie Cat rentals available close by via independent vendors Resort Value – Very strong Tips: Beach beverages: We bought beer up at the little 'convenience' store a couple of hundred yards up the road, packed it in a cooler and brought it out to the beach. Not because the beer at the resort was expensive - we just did not like having to walk to the bar each time. Xcaret: My wife liked it - I could have skipped it. Food: the resort food was the best we found. However, there appeared to be some upscale restaurants in town that we did not have time (or interest enough) to try. Bugs: did not see one or get bitten by one during our stay – though we had plenty of bug spray. Frisbee: we enjoyed playing with one in the morning before the wind picked up. Just go…

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: familySeattleWa
Reviews.Content: My family spent 5 nights at the Shangri La Caribe in April 2006. The hotel was fully booked for the easter holidays. We had a stand alone ocean front cabana for 4 nights and a standard room for 1. It was worth the money for the ocean front cabana. The second room we had was half way back into the resort in the Caribe section. The room was much smaller, amd much noisier due to the high density buildings. My one gripe is the Ocean front cabana was supposed to have queen beds, and they were doubles. The beach is lovely, the swimming is good and gentle (very small waves one foot high). Snorkeling is possible right off the beach to the north, and off the point to the north, but it is pretty poor. The 2 pools are small but nice. There are plenty of beach chairs to go around, even when the resort is full. We had no trouble with beach towels, there were guards watching day and night. The resort is well maintained, apparently the hurricane did a lot of damage to the vegetation, but if you didn't see pictures of the before, you wouldnt't know the difference. There is a big high rise being build directly behind the Aventura section, I woulnd't want to be in the back row right next to that. The map doesn't show clearly, but there is a public road and beach access that cuts right through the property, dividing the Caribe and Aventura sections. It just means the resort is not so pri vate or enclosed as you might think. The Shangri la is probably a 15 min hot walk to town, either along the beach or on the roads. WE drove in once, our teenagers never went. A bit too touristy for us, and if you don't like bars there didn't seem any reason to go. The food is good, sometimes very good, it you don't expect 5 star, you will be satisifed. The Mexican buffet was fun and good. The staff everywhere was helpful, and friendly. They were not overstaffed, sometimes you had to hunt to find someone to answer you question, etc. We would go back. Nice, comfortable, pretty location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property but terrible food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a somewhat rustic property with no crowds and don't care about the quality of the food at this "breakfast and dinner included" hotel, this is the place for you. A couple of tips if you stay here: Ask to opt out of the "dinner included" plan when you make your reservations. I didn't know it was an option to opt out, but another couple we met at the Shangri La did this. the dinner is remarkably bad, and breakfast is free to everyone anyways. You get a little discount (i think $30 or so per night), but unless you LOVE eating mall food everyday, you'll be better off. there are many cool restaurants to try in downtown PDC, so take a walk down fifth avenue and kill some time looking at the menus and finding a restaurant to eat at. don't lock yourself into eating at the hotel every night by doing the dinner included plan, especially since you can opt out. Second, try and make it to the breakfast each morning - though dinner is terrible, breakfast is surprisingly decent by comparison. Again, breakfast is free even if you opt out of the dinner plan, so you can't lose. Third, if you're going to drink beer, bring an individual beer cozy/wrap. It is HOT, and your drinks get warm very quickly. I read this tip in this forum before my trip but didn't listen. The second half of every beer I drank for the entire trip was warm. Fourth, BRING INSECT REPELLANT, especially if you're there between may through October. I can't speak for other areas or resorts at PDC, but there were a LOT of mosquitos at this resort (i'm sure they are everywhere during this time of year though). It was HILARIOUS to see all these people with dozens of giant red welts on their legs at the hotel. Luckily, I read a tip to bring repellant, and had zero bites. Finally, IF YOU HAVE KIDS THAT CAN'T SWIM, bring floatation devices (like those dorky inflatable arm things or doughnuts). The 2 pools on site are small, like glorified kiddie pools, but they are surprisingly deep! Only half of one of the pools is 3 foot deep or less, and that section amounts to an area of about 100-200 sq.ft. If you're kid can't swim, s/he will have very little space to wade around in at the pool without a floaty thing. With respect to the property itself, it is located about 3 blocks north from the start of the busy downtown area of PDC (5th street) where most of the shops and restaurants are located. Since the stretch of beach that the Shangri-La is located on is a few blocks from downtown Playa, the beach is not too crowded. Also, even though the hotel was at capacity, we had no problems getting a palapa on the beach (a giant thatch sun-shade/umbrella), and in fact there were many empty ones. all the rooms are in detached 2 story bungalows. They all have a large, covered porch with hammocks and large rooms. One thing we notced was that there were no drawers or shelves in the rooms - there was a closet to hang clothes, but we had to keep our underwear and other clothing in our suitcases because there was no where else to put them except the floor of the closet. Also, none of the rooms have telephones or televisions. The a/c is on the noisy side, but it works fine. I thought the services were kind of primitive - no phones (if you want to call in for a wake up call or something) and there are no clocks in the rooms. Drink and food service on the beach and pool areas are almost non existent. If you want a drink, you have to get it yourself. All in all, it is a nice place and worth the $175 per night or so we spent staying there. It isn't the 4 seasons resort, but it isn't a motel 6 either. The property in and of itself is nothing special, but what separates it from the dozens of other resorts in the area is that it is close to downtown playa, but still has no crowds at the beach. for this reason alone, I would return to the shangrila and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-la Caribe fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: lizajane67
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Mexico for the first time last June. I found the Shangri-la Caribe hotel listed in one of my travel books and on the web. It sounded appealing because it wasn't just another oversized all-inclusive where you have to fight the crowds and get up at the crack of dawn to reserve your beach chair. On the contrary, we found such a wonderful, charming oceanfront get-a-way that almost one year later, I can't stop thinking about this place and count the days until I can viisit again. We stayed in an oceanfront bungalow with our own little porch and hammocks. We fell asleep to the sounds of the sea every night! The breakfast buffet was memorable...a wonderful assortment of fresh fruit, fresh watermelon and canteloupe juice, delicious made-to-order vanilla pancakes, eggs, omlets and a variety of pastries, cereals, yogurt and breakfast breads.
