My husband and I travelled with two teenagers (ages 13 and 15), so they were a little apprehensive about going to a hotel with no TV. They were just fine without it! We painted pottery, played pool and went into town (5th Ave.) every day. One day it rained so we took the kids to the movies. We also enjoyed the dinners. My husband and I are great cooks so we are a bit particular with what we eat. The Mexican fiesta on Sunday was a great party! The staff was very friendly and can't do enough to accommodate you. The one thing they should think about providing the in the room is a refrigerator. We followed the advice of another Trip-Advisor reviewer and brought a cooler on wheels. The beach at this hotel was spectacular. Very, very clean and no seaweed. Just beautiful white sand and crytal clear turquoise water. I could go on and on with this review, but I'll stop with this comment. "You won't be disappointed with the Shangrila-Caribe!!!!!!!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Private, friendly and attractive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days and already are planning our return trip. Unlike many of the hotels in Playa, this one has a great beach that seems more private than the rest. The bungalos are well maintained and give you the sense of being on your own little beach. We took our four month old baby, and she was able to sleep every night in peace and quiet. We were able to take her everywhere around the hotel in a stroller without a problem. The best bungalos are those with a beachfront view, and those that are free standing units (single rooms). The food is good. A nice breakfast buffet and friendly staff. The facility nearly misquito free when compared to other hotels we visited. The hotel is nicely situated at the start of the "new" fifth avenue and there are a lot of trendy stores and restaurants within walking distance. We got the transport from the airport through the hotel and thought it was a great service. The staff are helpful and pleasant. I was a bit annoyed by the assualt by time-share agents you receive when you walk through the lobby and by the noise of the nearby construction, but both were minor irritations and not enough to turn me off. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with a family or a couple looking to stay somewhere rommantic.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay! Everything was perfect, from the gorgeous beach, 2 big pools, to the ping pong tables. Everyone can find something to enjoy! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not exactly what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: RobynV
Reviews.Content: When my fiance and I arrived at Shangri La, we were initally ecstatic. We had reservations for a Garden view 'caribe section' bungalow. I had tried to reserve a nicer room but this type of room was the only available. The grounds of the resort were beautiful and the beach was memorizing and certainly not too congested. The hammocks on the porch were relaxing, but not very private. There were a few things I was surprised about...the hot tub's jets were all broken, making the hot tub less than enjoyable. This problem was not fixed during our 7 day stay and I suspect will never be. I'm surprised a resort of this caliber would negelct the issue...Also, we had a huge bug problem in our bungalow. I was certainly understanding of this considering the bungalows have thatched roofs and sit on piles of sand, however, every day our bathroom floor and shower walls were covered in little mounds of ants. I also noticed quite a few other little bugs crawling in and out of the small cracks in the walls. I was moderately bothered by this but I can see how many people would be severely unhappy with sharing their room with a diverse community of bugs 24/7. And the bugs did get bigger; one evening as I was looking for something in my suitcase, I felt something land on the back of my neck. I brushed my neck off, only to watch a large cockroach come falling off of me. Now this definitely did disgust/disturb me. Fortunately, it was an isolated incident, as I didn't meet any more cucarachas the rest of our trip. No refrigerador is also quite inconvenient in hot weather, as you need to drink plenty of water and the hotel's water is not purified. As everyone else has already said again and again, breakfasts are great and dinners are really just so-so. If you can afford it I would reccomend exploring the town each evening for a place to have dinner. My fiance and I found that the further from Avenida 5 that we got, the cheaper, more authentic and more delicious the restaurants were. I am excited to go back to Playa at the end of the year, however, I'm not so sure I want to stay at Shangri La again. It would certainly be nice to stay somewhere that had the conveniences of a telephone, fridge, and bugless atmosphere. Although the beach at Shangri La may be the best on Playa so I guess you have to weigh your priorties. Shangri la is relaxing and rustic(perhaps a little too rustic) so I will be looking around to see if there is a place that has a comparable beach as well as a little modern convenience... Although I'm not so sure if this exists... If anyone has any suggestions or questions: r.vincent@wayne.edu

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley loved Shangri-la Caribe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most amazing place I have ever been. The food was SO yummy, the staff incredible! We loved our room and the beauty that surrounded us. I would highly recommend Shangri-la Caribe to anyone wanting a relaxing, soul feeding experience. The friendliness of the staff was suprizing- everyone there wanted nothing more than to please us and make us more comfortable. The waiters were great- they were all so welcoming and fun. The food was really good. I had read a few reviews that said it was just ok- but I would have to disagree- I thought it was all wonderful. Do not hesitate when booking here. You would have to impossible to impress if you didn't love it here. I will definitley be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Suzannah_F
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a perfect place to take my boyfriend for his 30th birthday and found it at the Shangri La Caribe. We were there three nights and we have returned completely refreshed! We had an amazing time and this place could not have been better! I found and picked Shangri La from the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed at all. Everything in the reviews were right on - from the friendly staff to the great beach and the laid back, stress-free ambiance. We had room 31B which is a second story room in the Caribe section with an ocean and pool view. It was also steps from the bar. It was a little noisy at times from the kids playing in the pool but it was never an annoyance. The rooms were basic, not fancy, but they were terrific. Beds were hard like other people have said but we did not find them uncomfortable at all. The pillows were great. Turning in your beach towel every day was a non-issue. Breakfasts were very good. Even though dinner is included, we went in to town every night for dinner which was fun. Had great dinners at Babes Noodle House (hip and fun) and Yaxche (elegant Mayan) and had not great sushi at Sushi Tlan. I would stay away from there. All restaurants were on 5th Avenue. We really enjoyed an afternoon horse back riding and snorkeling at Punto Venado. The horses were very well taken care of and the guides could not have been nicer. We were there over Easter weekend and I think it's worth mentioning that it is Sagrada Santa a.k.a. Mexican Holiday Weekend and there were many locals on the beach. The new road does lead right on to the beach which is a little crazy. It didn't make much of a difference to us at all but on Monday when they all went back to work, the beach was super quiet. I have travelled extensively in the Caribbean and have stayed at some of the nicest hotels in the world and will say that this was one of the most relaxing and enjoyable times I have ever had. I just hope that they don't try to change anything. It's absolutely perfect the way it is!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant departure from the big AI's”
Reviews.Author: monkeygirl44
Reviews.Content: Gave Shangri La Caribe a try in after 5 visits to an upscale IA (RP) in Playacar. Overall a great stay. Rooms are super clean, comfortable but sparce. Porches and hammocks are fantastic. We loved leaving the shutters open for the breeze to blow in all night long. Ran AC only 1 night of 7, it worked fine. Did not miss the TV or phone even once, glad they are not included! Even with some condo construction going on next door, the place was quiet and tranquil. I would expect that the resort would be too quiet for some, but that is what we loved about it. Overall service was above average, with a couple of outstanding wait staff members that worked their tails off. Tip the staff everyday, and they will work hard to make your stay enjoyable. Breakfast is as everyone describes, and very good. Dinners were hit and miss. Mexican night was great, others so-so. Check with the front desk daily to see the menu and make your decision. 5th street is very close, we walked to town everyday, and walked into town for dinner 4 of 7 nights. Taxi back for 3 dollars or so. Beach is fantastic, always a palapa and loungers available even when the resort was full. Beach was not as groomed as in Playacar, but just as pretty and we enjoyed the variety of people and the locals who walked up and down the beach in front of us. Never felt uncomfortable, beach and resort security was outstanding. Lots of kids at the resort, including ours (9,10) Shangri La is a departure from the crowds, noise and organized activities of the all inclusives, which was exactly what we were looking for. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful stay, cement trucks and all!”
Reviews.Author: AMSNashville
Reviews.Content: We arrived March 18--two adults with two boys 6 and 10--for four nights. Our room was on the Aventura side, room 11P. As we approached across a very sandy walkway, it looked to be the room absolutely closest to a sizeable four-story office/retail building going up probably 30 feet behind it. Hammers, beeping front loaders, falling wood--pretty much a total bummer based on what I had anticipated from this hotel. HOWEVER, the back wall of our room muffled the noise almost totally, and the second floor (15' x 15') balcony was super pleasant because of the constant breeze and the sound of the sea. What I thought was going to be a disaster ended up not mattering much at all. In fact, for the second leg of our stay (after a three-day trip to Chichen Itza), we requested the same room! The balcony was just lovely, with two hammocks and chairs. Our room was very clean, with tile floors and (blissfully) no TV. It was hot--so the AC was a welcome thing at certain times. Open windows were lovely, most of the time. The lack of telephone was an actual inconvenience because we had friends staying next door at Las Palapas and had to hike over to communicate with them. And restaurant reservations had to be made at the front desk phone. The staff were universally friendly and helpful with any request we made. Breakfast: great. Dinner: felt like we were on the Love Boat. Not terrible, but after a insanely tasty dinner in Playa at Yaxche, we knew there was much better food to be found elsewhere. Our two boys loved the beach, the pool, the sweet woman at the pottery-painting stall, the ping pong, and the billiard tables. Apparently the (beautiful) beach got a lot deeper after hurricane Wilma, because I watched four guys thatching a new second row of palapas one day. Fascinating to see how they do it. Lounge chairs were always available, and you could easily spend all week gazing at the spectacular blue water. The dive shop on the beach was extremely friendly and actually steered us AWAY from a snorkeling trip with the boys because the surf was too choppy. Very impressed at their honesty. My advice is to stay away from the Aventura side for the next months because of the construction. But if you do end up there, it really isn't the disaster you think it will be. In general, second floor rooms seemed to have more privacy--at least ours did. This is a great place to stay--and after we walked south on the beach to see what other hotels looked like, we realized that Shangri-la Caribe really is the loveliest beach in town. Low key and well run. Wish I were there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-day stay at Shangri-la with my sister. This was our second stay at the hotel, and I can't think of a reason to go anywhere else for a beach vacation. The hotel offers a perfect balance of great service, absolutely gorgeous beach, all-you-need in a room, delicious food options, privacy and reasonable price. There are always seats available on the beach (and this is during a relatively high season), and the clarity of water and fine sand are exactly as from a Caribbean vacation poster. The place may be romantic for couples but also very friendly to families with kids, and is a short walking distance from downtown where there are numerous going-out options. It has much more of an authentic Mexican feel than you would get in a large all-inclusive in Riviera Maya. The food was quite good. The breakfast may seem repetitive if you stay for a longer period but you can alternate between several hot options, fruit, cereal and bakery. My favorite was the fruit and the variety was probably as good as you can get anywhere in Mexico. The dinner was generally outstanding, our favorite was parrillada buffet (grilled meat), however the Mexican buffet night was just good (the choices seem to have gotten simpler since last year). Overall, I would say the quality of food is superior to what you find in a normal all-inclusive hotel. And definitely, the quality of drinks is superior since these are not included in the dinner price and you can order quite good wine from the list. All things considered, it was another perfect vacation on the beach. My compliments to the Shangri-la staff for making it possible.

Reviews.Title: “best place in playa”
Reviews.Author: OliviaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: very romantic hotel, nice and spacious rooms, clean with nice balcony. Breakfast was very nice, healty with plenty of fruits and musli, dinner was just ok, vegetabels a bit missing. Beach very nice. Pool area quiet and nice. Staff friendly and helpful and efficent. Unfortunately they were working on a new building accros the road and the noice was a bit bottering in the evening. If you look for a quiet and romantic vacation you will not be disappointed! It was a wonderful place and I would love to go back some times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Nilsson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Shangri La Caribe 8 feb-16 feb 2006. Shangri La is the best hotel on the best beach,and have the nicest cabanas in Playa Del Carmen. The staff in the restaurants was very funny and friendly and always helpful. There was a lot of space on the beach and always sunbeds free. Stayed in room Playa 5 and it was lovely and pituresc. If you are going to Playa Del Carmen you must stay at this hotel. If you are going to hire a car DO NOT take AVIS, they dont try harder in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “It is absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Shangri-la is absolutely perfect! The staff are so friendly and have such a friendly and laid-back air about them, they make you feel at home. The rooms are nice, just the necessities, but we were on the beautiful beach so much we basically just slept in them. The breakfasts are great. They had tons of fresh fruit, and anything else you wanted. The beach was so beautiful, and not crowded at all, which was very nice! The dinners were also good. One night some staff came and sang to us. I would recommend this hotel for everyone. (The staff do not get a tip unless you give them one, even though they say they do)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: E-Jill_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 10 days at Shangri-La Caribe and enjoyed every minute of it. The beach is as lovely as advertised - the best we saw on Playa Del Carmen - and the hurricane damage is hardly noticeable, especially if you haven't visited the place before. The hotel lost one restaurant, some palm trees, and a lot of garden plants to the hurricane, but have cleaned up so effectively that only those guests who had stayed at Shangri-La before noticed the difference. There are huge piles of sand, though, that are slowly being moved back to the beach. The Shangri-La staff are truly exceptional. All the staff that we dealt with were helpful and friendly, especially the restaurant workers. Their good humour and enthusiasm made every meal enjoyable. The food is good as well, especially the huge breakfasts. We stayed in one of the ocean-view rooms, second floor, just behind the beachfront units. The view was spectacular and there was a constant breeze so we didn't need the air conditioner. Our kids loved the bar area with the billiard and ping-pong tables (and the virgin pina coladas). The overall tone is relaxed and friendly, and the resort never felt crowded. We met a number of people who were staying at the mega-resorts down the coast, and we couldn't help feeling smug that we had found this gem. Three more points: Use the in-room safes. Be aware that there is construction going on behind the hotel (and almost everywhere else in PDC), which is an irritant if you plan to sleep late. And do plan to try scuba diving - the on-site dive shop is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: BUYLOW
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just returned from a week (Feb 5th-12th) at the Shangri-La in Playa del Carmen, and we loved it! I surprised my husband with a trip there for his 40th birthday. I am also 5 months pregnant, so this was also a needed getaway before staying up for a year with a new little one! The Shangri-La turned out to be very quaint and above all, quiet. We were awakened by a songbird every morning, and could hear the delicious crashing of the waves every night. We had a beachfront cabana, 3C, and it was incredible to look out the window every morning and see the gorgeous turquoise ocean and white beaches. We need to retire this way someday! The hammocks on the front porch were dreams come true...just swaying in the breeze, looking at the ocean and reading a great book had us straight in heaven!! You can even order lunch and drinks right there! HEAVEN. Since we left Super Bowl day, we were actually able to catch the game in the beach bar (we could then tell who all the Americans were at the hotel!), and it was wonderful. I very much enjoyed the strong European and Canadian flair that Playa had - even though they sure smoke a lot! People in general were very nice. Breakfast and Dinner are included with your room price, which made it very convenient, and took some pain out of the final bill (that and I couldn't drink, of course!). The food was very good, with some nights delicious buffets, and then others, a choice of four-course meal, including a soup, appetizer, main course, and dessert. My fave dessert was the little "Mexican Creme Puffs". They were little round chocolate eclairs! Breakfasts were very good, in my opinion - the fruit and yogurt were yummy, as well as the hot breakfast choices. The staff of the hotel were top notch, and very helpful. A server, Van, was our favorite...always joking and very sweet. He was a ray of sunlight every day. The beaches and the water were incredible! The salt water and the sun kissed us many times, we felt like new people. I was nervous about being pregnant and getting sick from something, but as long as you brush your teeth with the bottled water only, you are OK. I was even able to eat the fruit buffet in the morning, and drink ice water because all water served is purified. I never got sick once. If you stay in the tourist zones, you will be fine. Even in town on 5th Avenue, which is a short 10 minute walk away, the food and drink were top-notch. I was surprised at how big the area was and how diverse the shops on 5th in Playa were. Well, here I am a half-week later, still dreaming about our trip....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons to stay at the Shangri-La Caribe but probably the most compelling is the staff. We were originally given Penthouse #12 but as that was next door to a condominium construction site, we asked to be moved. That was done with a minimun of fuss. Angela at Reception encouraged us to go to lunch as the service was closing in a few minutes. She had Jorge, one of the bell boys, move our suitcases and bring the keys to the restaurant. The Penthouse #30 Playa was on the third level directly overlooking the beach. The room is spare but has an incredible view and was always clean and generously supplied with towels. The meals were varied and of very good quality. The waiters are extremely friendly and attentive. They made every meal a delight. It is clear that efforts are underway to restore the property to pre-Wilma conditions. Flowers and trees are being planted, walls are being painted and sand is being removed from walkways. When there were problems with arranged tours, Jenny, Miguel and Angela at Reception were very helpful. When the electricity was out for a few hours two days in a row, we were given a bottle of wine. This is a hotel for people who like a beautiful beach, lovely pools, a quiet atmosphere, and attentive service. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “All the Best to Offer”
Reviews.Author: MEBr
Reviews.Content: For you fellow travelers wondering about the state of affairs in and around Playa del Carmen post hurricane, and specifically, Shangri la Caribe Resort, not to fret. We visited at end of Jan 06 and the resort has been wonderfully restored. Much has been quickly rebuilt, and one can't tell a hurricane ripped through some 3 months ago. The rooms are comfortable, clean with beautiful grounds. Staff is wonderful, excellent, accomodating. Food is good, and not to miss are the dinner buffets. The beach is marvelous- no signs of erosion in front of the resort. A little bit of construction noise and traffic to content with, but otherwise, thumbs up all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy200579
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for 10 days and truly found paradise there. We had one of the Caribe Ocean View Rooms, which are located right on the beach (we could step out of the room and had our feet right in the sand). Being from a city I first had to get used to the noise of a wild sea at night though. But the hammocks on the deck were just too good to be true. The breakfast buffet was delicious, fresh fruit, yoghurt, ham & cheese, baked goods, juices and a nice menu with cooked breakfast (tried all Mexican dishes but are nothing special). The waiters were all cute and very funny. The beach is truly the best part about the Shangri-La - white sand and the most beautiful part of all of Playa Del Carmen. Dinner is good quality but gets a bit boring if you're there for 10 days, so we went out to Playa Del Carmen twice. The Buffets were a great hit though and so was the Live Music. Over all we had such a great time and got exactly what we went for: Relaxation & a great tan! And don't forget all the ways the housekeepers know how to fold towels!! Things I would change: housekeeping once came at 9am, once at 3pm, then again at noon, it was hard to plan ahead, even though we had the cleaning sign out everyday after 11am. But in the end we had a great time and we will return to the Shangri-La!

Reviews.Title: “Not a shangri la I'd ever want to return to!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't believe so many people think so highly of this place. Firstly, we thought the dinners were so terrible that we escaped to Playa del Carmen for dinner even though we had already paid for them at the hotel. We did stay for the Mexican buffet thinking that they couldn't possibly do a bad job with that - We were so wrong! As far as the service, for the most part everyone was really nice - but there were some problems. One day there was a terrential downpour and the water was flooding into our room. If my husband hadn't have gone out to move some of the sand that was blocking our drain area, we would have ended up with a foot of water in the room instead of just a few inches. During all this, one of the guys working for the hotel was running by, so we asked him to get us more towels. I could tell from his nod that he had no intention of following through. So finally, my husband made a dash to reception. The woman's response to our request for towels was - OK, but you have to bring them back. (They really do seem to have a thing about their towels!) Not the helpful tone one would expect. And of course, there are also the 6 ft drifts of sand everywhere (a sad result of the hurricane)which kept blowing around. And, can't forget the early morning construction everywhere. All in all, a real disappointment, especially considering the cost.

Reviews.Title: “More info about the towels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to clear something up about the towels. You do not need to use the same beach towel for your entire stay. You simply take your used towel to the front desk and they will replace it with a clean one. My husband and i exchanged our towels several times during our one week honeymoon at Shangri-la in September. It is true that you will have to pay a $25 fee if your towel is lost or stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Still needs more time.....”
Reviews.Author: dindelray
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Shangri-La (3 night stay). We originally were booked for 7 nights, but due the hurricane changed our plans. The good--the beach is fantastic. Laying under a palupa was the best. The food/drink service was outstanding. Food was above average. The bad--resort still under construction (loud). Not fully operational...only one restaurant opened--no internet--no tv room--buffet dinners b/c they couldn't accomodate the crowd. And all the sand...walkways from hurricane still under the sand. Couldn't walk anywhere without shoes--had to wear flip flops. Beware- people cut their feet walking around barefoot. Lastly...beach in front of Shangri-La is one of the best in Playa---many locals come there to enjoy---not as relaxing as I would have liked. We did enjoy our stay (glad that we stayed at RPR for the first 7 nights though)...Shangri La will be better in another month.

Reviews.Title: “Towels!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you get towels here you get 1 for each person. The towels you get are the towels you use the whole time. When you reserve a polupa(little hut) with your towels on the chairs be carefull, locals steal the towels and you have to pay $25 per every lost towel. One day when I was sitting under my polupa I saw all these security guards around a group of locals. The locals stole the towels and sat on them. Someone had to pay for those lost towels. How rude! And one of the women who stole the towels was lying on my towels at the pool the day before. She got them all sticky and wet. EWWWW! Don't let this scare you, but beaware!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Shangri-La Caribe and loved every second. It was incredibly relaxing and the staff was very friendly. The beach was immaculately kept and not crowded at all compared to surrounding hotels. It was a nice 10 minute walk down the beach and into town. The food was good, the atmosphere was great. Daily happy hour, snorkeling gear, ping-pong. We are thinking about going back and taking the kids because it is the kind of place you could turn them loose to have fun and not worry about them.

Reviews.Title: “You can not beat Shangi-la...but right now it is very noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: gypsymom
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It was just what we were looking for. Cabanas are very nice with great porches, some with views of the ocean. Step out your door and you are on a beautiful beach! Romantic atmosphere with a family friendly flair. Plus...you are very close to town (a short walk on the beach) without having to be right in it. Very nice staff. Clean pool area with shade. I could go on and on about how great this place was especialy if you are not an AI kind of person but one thing you must know, there is so much construction going on around the hotel right now (new condos going up right behind the Playa section) that after one night, we hated to... but we checked out. The caribe section seemed better because it was far enough away but we could not deal with the noise. Not our idea of a relaxing vacation. Oswaldo at the front desk was very understanding and worked with us to find another quiet hotel in Tulum, Las Ranitas. We had a great time there and would recomend it and the Shangri-la to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: gritz71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the shangri-la from Sept 27th for a week in a beachfront cabana. It was right by the pool and on the beach at 33 playa. I think it was the best place to stay in the whole place. I don't think I'd want to stay inside the resort in the garden views, if you can aford it, stay in the beachfront. Literally, 15 steps and it is the pool, 20 steps is the restaurant/bar, and 1 step off the porch is the beach. The rooms are very large and simple. Many windows and screens can be opened to let the fresh air in, or turn on the air conditioning if you want, too. The rooms are quite large. Having hammocks on the porch were cool, too. The beach is very wide and long, we walked the entire playa stretch and it is the biggest, less traveled, and almost all sand and no rocks. You can walk out to over my head deep in water without rocks. Tropical storm came through half way through the trip and the rain was going sideways, but the waves were really big and we had fun anyways. Employees were VERY helpful, especially Ivan in the restaurant. With a tip, they gave us whatever we wanted, or went out to find it for us. The resort is owned by a German family that lives in the Yucatan. There are very expensive condos being built behind the playa section ($280,000 +) and I think they may use the public portion of the beach... (remember, no beach in Mexico is actually private, the actual part with the water touching the beach is public, no matter where you go). We rented bikes and didn't like them, they were new but the seats broke constantly and everyone up town wanted to steal them. Happy hour is good, 2 x 1 drinks. Breakfast is a combo of a buffet with fresh fruits, breads, baked goods, cerals, etc. You can also order hot items special like scrambled eggs, omlets, french toast, etc. Breakfast was the best. We tried supper a couple of nights, was OK but need more selections. Service is TOP NOTCH. You won't find better, more honest service anywhere. These people like where they work and it shows. Please tip them. You will receive conserige-type service if you do. Saw a lot of europeans didn't tip. Probably about 20% americans and the rest from Europe. Definately would go back. They made it very memorable, even through a couple days of a tropical storm. Don't hesitate. Don't AI. But do enjoy yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place - Can't Wiat to Get Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place. It is our favorite Mexican destination. We even wanted to get married there, unfortunately it was unavailable during high season, so we spent our honeymoon there instead. The inclusive breakfast and dinner are good - don't forget to order the huevos rancheros, with extra crispy tortillas, from our favorite waiter Miguel. Also don't miss the Fiesta Americana on Sunday nights.

Reviews.Title: “great beach but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: staying here for 5 nights (have one more night to go!). due to heavy rains that caused a lot of damage, there is a lot of building work going on at this hotel at the moment. the sound of chainsaws, jack hammers and other tools starts early (by 7am) and finishes late (around 7-8pm)! there are numerous workmen on site and the noise level is not what you want when you are on holiday! added to that is building work next door! the beach is great, but accessible to the public so you don´t have to stay here to experience it. the staff are friendly and the rooms are nice. this place is very much for families and couples. due to the tropical storm it has rained for the last few days, and usually your room would be a haven. however there is no TV in the room to ease the boredom (there is a TV in a room off the restaurant) and with all the building noise it wasn´t very relaxing. if i had known about the building works i would have stayed elsewhere. find out before you go if you want to have a peaceful and relaxing holiday!

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the dinners”
Reviews.Author: snoozysooz
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, we had a fantastic cababa on the beach - 31P - and the beach was white sand and gently shelving. Some rocks directly in front of us but plenty of rock free beach also. My family also had 2 of the garden rooms which were also spacious and lovely. The hotel is very clean and attractive, all cabana style set in sandy grounds. The sand is raked every day and the paths are swept. The waiters in the restaurant were really pleasant especially with our 3 children. The mexican theme night on Sunday was fun and the food was good, but the dinners apart from that meal were only average. The breakfast buffets were always good and plentiful. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Caribe from August 27 through September 2. It has a beautiful beach and our family had a relaxing vacation. The rooms are rustic but pretty private and very clean. The meals were great and the staff was so friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La, Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Swisschick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 3 kids have just returned from an amazing vacation in Mexico. We flew to Mexico City, where we hired a car and slowly travelled through Mexico to the Yucatan peninsula staying in 8 different hotels until we finally spent 8 glorious days and nights at Shangri-la in Playa del Carmen. We finished our vacation with 4 days & nights at the AI Iberostar Quetzal. Travelling with our children (aged 6, 8 & 11), I carefully selected our hotels, but although they were all nice, none came close to the magical experience of Shangri la. We had originally booked a Penthouse Suite for us and an ocean view room for the kids which I had asked to be right next to the suite. As we arrived just 5 days after the hurricane, all the Penthouse suites had been damaged and so we were put in a beachfront cabana (31) on the Aventura side with our kids in another right next to us (32). The room we had really made the vacation, it was amazing, huge, right on the beach shaded by palm trees with a very large veranda. The ceiling was incredible, it had a very big bathroom and was spotlessly clean. We also had the best towel art we experienced during our entire vacation. I didn't find the bed to be any harder than any other I slept in in Mexico. I will never forget the sound of the ocean waves, lulling me to sleep each night - wonderful! As for the food, I had read other reviews and wasn't expecting too much. I was pleasantly surprised. We are from Switzerland right near the French border and are used to French cuisine. I found the food to be very tasty and varied and far better than at any of the other hotels we stayed in. My kids are still talking about Ivan, our waiter, who was wonderful and even taught them a few magic tricks. The staff were all fantastic, I was so impressed by the number of employees and how hard everyone worked to get the place up and running again after the hurricane. 4 penthouse roofs were completely redone during our stay and each day that passed saw immense improvement to the grounds. We were all very sad to leave Shangri la, including the children. I had booked the Iberostar as I was worried that the kids would be a little bored after 8 days with not much activities. How wrong I was, they loved playing ping pong and pool at the Shangri la bar and had made several friends amongst the very international clientele (particularly lots of French). Going to the Iberostar was a bit of a shock after Shangri la. It was our first experience of an AI and although it was more luxurious, we found it to be far too crowded and noisy and it lacked the personalized service we had loved at Shangri la. Also to have to hunt down transits amongst rows and rows after the beautiful and empty beach at Shangri la was very annoying. If we went back to Playa del Carmen we would spend our entire vacation at Shangri la without a doubt. Having said that, the beachfront cabana definitely added a huge plus to our vacation and can't compare with some of the other smaller, less private rooms in other sections. If anyone has any questions I will be pleased to answer by email.

Reviews.Title: “Battery Charging”
Reviews.Author: GoodluckTom
Reviews.Content: A most relaxing holiday spot..the staff worked so hard to repair the hurricane damage,but in such a unobtrusive way that one's stay there was not impaired in the least.The beach area was always tidy,ample beds and shade,good service at all times and the room was directly facing the sand...blissful.I confess I didn't want to do anything but take to my sunbed,read,swim,bask and take refreshment..I felt secure there at all times;there was always an attendant around even at night but again without having a strong-arm presence.The hotel guests were obviously having a good time;the friendly approach of the dining attendants ensured this at meal-times.The towels in the rooms were "sculptured" into an array of animals,with a new piece of artwork appearing at every room service. And as a final touch...on the morning of our departure,we were given a breakfast box;this contained appetising food and drink. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough....a credit to Mexico and a jewel in the Yucatan!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow... what an amazing week we had at Shangri La! The beaches, property, and character of the palapas was everything we could have asked for. The staff were all so kind and helpful, and always tried to accomodate our needs. The feel of Shangri la is simple relaxation! How great it was to lay in our hammacks or just sit out on the veranda enjoying the views- or of course, we could relax on the beach. We were beachfront -and we couldn't have been happier! I highly recommend spending the extra dollars for this. We had 33P, and I would request that palapa if you can. It was the perfect location, and seemed to have the most beach space. Our room was wonderful, although the beds really are HARD. It takes a little getting used to. The palapa rooms have so much character and personality- that they make up for the the few ammenities and luxury that a hotel offers. The food was o.k. - not fabulous, but not bad. It was great having both breakfast and dinner included in the price - and as most other reviews expressed - the breakfast was the best. We went down to Shangri-La to get married on the beach - and the entire experience exceeded my hopes and dreams. They (Beatriz!) handled everything - so we were able to just enjoy the end result. I couldn't have been happier. We had about 38 guests with us, and everyone had a wonderful time- and enjoyed their stay. I couldn't have asked for a more beautiful wedding. Although I had no idea what my flowers were going to look like, what the wedding cake was going to look like, or what we were having for our wedding dinner.... it was all great - and I was pleasantly surprised with everything. If you're looking for a luxury hotel with all the ammenities, this would not be the place for you... no tv's, no telephones in the room... but if you're looking for a unique, charming, and special place to relax on an incredibly beautiful beach without the crowds- where noone wears a watch - this is the place! This truly is the most beautiful beach front that we visited, and after walking down the beach to find nothing but crowds, we were amazed at how quiet and secluded Shangri la was. We will definitely be back, and truly enjoyed our time there. We left the day of Hurricane Emily - and we hope the resort is back up and running quickly. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach in Playa”
Reviews.Author: ddffdd
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have stated, the best thing about this resort is the beautiful beachfront setting. The hotel has a wide beach area, with plenty of shady palapas and palm trees. We stayed in a "garden view" room in the Caribe section. The room had a palapa roof, as it was on the second floor, and was in the 3rd row of bungalows from the water. We had a partial ocean view, and we preferred the Caribe area because the beachfront and water were better, and the bungalows only had 1 upper and 1 lower unit in each. Our room was about a 20 second walk from our beach chairs and palapa. The room was relatively spacious, although the bathroom was small. A great improvement would be the addition of small fridges for the rooms. All the rooms in this section of the hotel had air conditioning, as far as we could tell. The breakfast and dinner were more than adequate, but nothing too memorable. The service in the restaurants was very good. Try the french toast or omelets at breakfast. If the quality of the beach and water are very important to you, this is the place. We walked a few hundred yards south to the Puerto Real and Gran Puerto resorts, and were appalled at how crowded their small beach area was, and how rocky and full of seaweed the water was. We were SO glad to be at the Shangri La instead of there! Even our 9 year old loved it, and we would definitely return our next time in the Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to enjoy Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: SBN72
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Shangli-la and had a wonderful time. If you want a big, canned all-inclusive experience this isn't the place for you. There are places we've gone where an all-inclusive was worth it, Playa del Carmen isn't one of them. The town is worth frequenting so if you're the active type don't plant yourself at the resort, visit the town in the afternoons and evenings. Shangri-la, the layout and landscaping of the resort is excellent...it's a peaceful place. The pools are not as big as they seem in pictures, but were never crowded. During our stay the resort was 100% occupied, but it felt only half full...which I've been told is by design. Staff is friendly and helpful. Tip $2-3 for the maid/day and at meals. Also drop $1 for other services (drinks, etc). You'll be glad you did and they deserve it. The beach front at Shangli-la is the best in Playa del Carmen. We walked up and down and into the city and there isn't a more beautiful and peaceful stretch around. The difference is noticeable. If you aren't interested in SCUBA or snorkeling, but want to see some fish there is enough coral to keep you occupied about 15 feet off the beach front. The food (breakfast and dinner is included) is decent. Breakfast is better, but we also enjoyed the non-buffet dinner days. Don't expect excellent food, but it wasn't bad and the service was good. If you choose to have lunch at the resort, the portions are huge. You may want to split the meal among two people. We ate in town for all but two dinners and a lunch. The bar area is fine enough for the day, but pretty dead at night (go into town). Happy hour is 2 drinks for the price of one not half price off the drinks. Rooms were good. We were in a bungalow which was large, had 2 queen beds, a separate seating area indoors, a front porch (2 hammocks). Best part, we were 5 feet from the pool area and 15 feet from the beach. Most of the bungalows were very well situated. It took the AC about 4 hours to really cool the place down, but with the high, thatched room that is expected. Once it was cool, it stayed pleasant throughout the trip. We met people with garden view rooms who were not happy at all. You've been warned. This resort emphasizes rustic elegance so no TV, no telephone, no mini-bar in the rooms. We didn't miss the first two, but a mini-bar to store some food and drinks would have been nice. You can buy a cheap cooler and some ice at the convenience store a couple blocks away if you want to store drinks, food. Taxi to Playa is no cheaper if you order one from the front desk or walk street side. It will be $3. That said, we negotiated a trip to CUN airport for $30 with an individual driver (the going rate was $50). Don't take a taxi or a group van from CUN to Playa. Take the bus to Playa and a cab to the resort. It costs $7 pp (ticket stand is located to the right as you exit the airport), than $3 for the taxi. Compared to a shuttle bus, it will save you time since you don't have to stop to drop the other passengers, etc. Also, will cost about 1/3 the price. We took a shuttle bus...wish we didn't. See more of Playa, walk to town via the beach and back to the resort via the road at least once. Plenty to see, stores, restaurants, bars, etc. In general the food and drinks are priced similar to what you would pay in the States, but bargains are to be had by walking a block or two off the main drag. Random stuff: Beach towels seem to go early in the AM so make sure you get a fresh set before breakfast. The night before you leave ask the front desk to pack you a breakfast to go if you're leaving in the early AM. Internet access: Free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: nikiv13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day trip to Shangri La Caribe from June 30-July 4th and absolutely LOVED it! This is a long review but I just can’t say enough great things about this place, so here goes: Rooms: We stayed in 32 Playa, a beach front bungalow and I couldn't have asked for a better location and room on the resort. When we walked out we were smack dab in the middle of the pool (about 10 feet) and the beach (again 10 feet). Often times we found ourselves lounging in the hammocks and just watching the ocean in front of us…that was the best! Several previous reviews stated that this bungalow didn't have AC but when we arrived there was one in the room. I think all of the rooms are now equipped with an AC unit, which is tremendously good news, considering how hot and humid it is in PDC. At night, our room was quite chilly between the AC and fan blowing full speed, very comfy. I will say though, the beds are pretty hard but that's such a minor factor considering you're in such a beautiful setting. We met another couple at the resort who were given a Garden View Puebolito room and absolutely hated it. They said it was very small and clausterphobic, view wasn’t that nice and the ceiling was very constricting. I would highly recommend a Superior Garden View or higher grade during your stay and if you can, definitely go with 32 or 31 Playa Beach bungalows. The Aventura Playa side is newer. Also, a note, there are NO tv's, radios or phones in the room. We took our laptop and a couple of movies, which worked out great. On the nights that we were too tired to go into town, we popped in our DVD's and hung out in the room. We had a wireless card and were able to get a connection, weak but good enough to go on the internet and check emails at the least. Staff: The staff was wonderful. I wanted to practice my Spanish since I'm currently taking classes here in Houston, and when I mentioned this any of the staff, they were constantly encouraged me to speak to them and would teach me new ways to say certain things. Remember that most people in Mexico make next to nothing so even a $1 tip goes a long way. We always left a couple of bucks in the room for the maid and were rewarded with an exceptionally clean room and great towel art. Beach: The Shangri La beach, in my opinion, is by far the best stretch of beach in PDC. We walked along the coast to some of the big AI beaches, and they were small, crowded and somewhat dirty. Ours was very clean, peaceful, romantic and simply magnificent (I would go on, but you get the idea). The water was crystal blue and sands were breathtakingly white during high noon. Food: The breakfast buffets were great every morning. Don’t expect a lot of variety. What they do serve is an array of fruits, delicious pastries and the BEST hashbrowns. I think I inhaled those suckers every morning. They also have a variety of different egg dishes you can have made to order every morning and they were muy delicioso! We tried a different one every day. The lunch at the resort restaurant is over priced and not worth it. I would highly recommend venturing into town to try some of the local restaurant. Avenida 5 is a brisk 10 minute walk along the beach or a mere $3 cab ride. After my first day of walking and nearly melting in the heat, we opted to cab it every time. Some great restaurants to try are Babes (a great and cheap noodle place), Siam (another make your own noodle place) and Tango Taco. We had dinner at the resort 3 nights and ate in town one night. Dinner was actually pretty good. There are some who just hate the food, but honestly I think these people are very picky and expect gourmet meals at a 4 star hotel buffet. A word of advice: Caribbean resort food in general is NEVER spectacular, especially if it’s in buffet form. Food is generally more bland and they make it to accommodate several hundred people’s taste. Also, every evening they had happy hour from 5:00 to 6:00. You get 2 drinks for the price of one. I can’t tell you how many pina coladas I had. They make the best ones. In conclusion, if you’re looking for a huge, packed All-Inclusive with a set group of restaurants and tons of activities, avoid Shangri La. But if you’re looking for a romantic, peaceful and charming get away with almost a Robinson Carusoe feel to it, then definitely come to Shangri La Caribe. I promise you won’t be disappointed. We’re definitely coming back!!! If you have any questions at all, feel free to write me.

Reviews.Title: “If you come to PDC for the beach then STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Dadof7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 wonderful days at the SLC May 26-June 2. Our expectations were exceeded. Previous reviews have commented on the superiority of the beach compared with other hotels in PDC but the differences were understated. Only the adjacent Las Palapas Hotel has a comparable beachfront. Hotels farther south have either less distance between the hotel and the beach, more rocks, and/or small fleets of fishing boats moored to the shore. We are avid exercisers so the 1.25 mile walk into the main shopping area was a welcomed diversion to burn off calories from the large breakfasts. Also, if you run there is a 1/4 track at a soccer stadium less than 1/2 mile from the SLC. It is located on 10th Ave on about 32nd St. We tipped housekeeper $2 per day and were rewarded with beautiful towel art. Also, we left the waiters about $4 per meal which was equally appreciated. I have been learning Spanish for almost a year and enjoyed trying to communicate with the waiters. As a result of our efforts to communicate we made many good friends among the staff before we left PDC. We plan to return to PDC and will stay at the SLC.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Remember Why We Left”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at Shangri-La in May and are ready to go back. Our room was incredible. We stayed in the penthouse, which had a beautiful view of the ocean and stayed pleasant in temperature due to the breeze despite the 90 degree weather. We were about 50 feet from the beach, which allowed us both easy access and privacy. The beach was beautiful. The staff at the resort is quite friendly and worked incredibly hard. Breakfast was very good and dinner was average (I would go into town for at least a few dinners), but they are served in different buildings so you are not sitting in the same location for every meal. The restaurant that is open for lunch serves great tacos and fajitas. The one thing to be warned about is the drive to the resort is quite misleading. Although the resort appears to be building a new entrance off a nicer road, the current entrance is situated on a dirt road and the drive there certainly takes you through the less desirable part of Playa del Carmen. We both got a little nervous on the drive, but it quickly vanished once we checked in. If you're looking for a place that has activities scheduled every minute of the day, Shangri-La is not the place to go. But if you like sitting on the beach, reading a good book and just spending time with the people you are there with, I cannot imagine a better place and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Sit Back and Relax”
Reviews.Author: akulas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Shangri-La. We searched for the perfect place to relax and unwind and we found it. We are very picky (perhaps not as picky as some of the other reviewers) and we found the Shangri La to be more than adequate for the price. We stayed in one of the air conditioned 2-story cabanas on the top floor. The AC was nice after a hot day on the beach. I would recommend the top floor of the 2 story as you get to enjoy the tall thatched roof. By far, the two best things about the hotel are the location (beautiful stretch of beach but just blocks from the bustling downtown) and the porches. Each has two hammocks. We spent at least 2 hours every night, swinging in the hammocks, reading, listening to music. By day, we lounged in the chairs on the beach. As for the food, we agree with the other reviews. The breakfast was good but the dinners were just mediocre. Not terrible mind you, just not fabulous. We ate 3 dinners at the hotel and 3 elsewhere. We found a fabulous restaurant just blocks from the hotel. It's on Calle 38, The Monkey Cave. Fresh, handmade breakfast, lunch and dinner. We had lunch twice (try the mushroom and cactus empanadas) and dinner once. It was amazing! Quite affordable. Fabulous atmosphere. Great staff. As for the complaints about construction, perhaps it would help to keep in mind that these beautiful seaside resorts cannot be built silently when no one is around. And it's not like there is lots of heavy equipment all over the place. Just a few guys at each site with hammers and saws. We saw the construction near the hotel and downtown but it didn't bother us in the least. I would recommend a snorkling trip as well as a trip to the Spa Itza in town for a few minutes at the oxygen bar. Interesting if you've never tried it. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for five nights in early May. I would definitely return there! We were in an oceanfront cabana with a wonderful view of the beach. The beach location certainly seemed to be one of the best in Playa. It is clean, easy to swim (no rocks, little seaweed), and uncrowded. The atmosphere is laid-back fun, and accepting, with a wide variety of people using that strip of beach, including families, older, younger folks, topless sunbathers, clothed sunbathers, international tourists, and Mexican families. The pools and ambience at the Shangri-La are also excellent. The staff make an all-out effort to be enthusiastically helpful, and often succeed in being really funny. I agree with other reviews that the breakfast is very good, the dinner just mediocre, but the dinner buffet somewhat better. One day, we spent the afternoon on the front porch of our cabana, and someone came around to ask if we'd like to be served lunch or drinks. What a treat! On a morning when we were leaving at 7:20 am for a tour, before the beginning of breakfast, the staff packed a boxed breakfast for us. They offer massages in an open air cabana right on the property, and there is a dive shop in the hotel (which launches from the Shangri-La beach), as well as an excellent gift shop. All this made for a very relaxing stay. We could walk into town or take trips whenever we wanted, but didn't have to leave the hotel if we wanted a low-key day. I think the Shangri-La is in a terrific location close to town, but does not suffer from any of the crowding or meat-market atmosphere of some of the other hotels. The great advantage of this hotel is that you can stay right on the beach in a self-contained cabana. There are other hotel rooms off the beach, which seemed fine, but I would always stay on the oceanfront at this hotel. For those who are very picky, I could say that our cabana could have used some renovation and new linens, but it was fine the way it was. I would rather see the prices remain reasonable than see them spend a lot of money to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Buddys
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor, we were sure that we had found the perfect place for our vacation. We have just returned, and sadly, we were terribly disappointed. The food is below average at best, even the breakfast, and there is nothing to do there. You can snorkel out in front of the hotel, but there is not a coral reef and the dive shop actually advised against it, stating that there was nothing to see and that it was not worth the money (you have to rent the snorkel equipment, it is not provided free by the hotel). For $20 a person you can take a 1.5 hour snorkel trip to some dying coral reef about ten minutes away, but there is really nothing to see there either. There are no sunset cruises or sailing expenditions or anything. If you want to just sit on the beach all day, this is the place, but we were wanting a little more water action. The biggest dissapointment was our room. We booked our room through Tourquiose Reef, and were expecting to stay in a beach front cabana the first night, and a second floor "partial" ocean view room the rest of the time. The beach front cabana is very nice, right on the beach, but there is no air conditioner and even with the windows open and the fan, it was HOT. Also, it was loud, we could hear everything going on around us (very early in the morning). When we went to change rooms, we were told that there were not any second floor rooms available, and they put us in the only room they had left. The room was very small, and faced a fence, with the other side of the fence being a construction site. It was horrible. Although they agreed to refund us the price difference after several rounds of arguing, I would have rather had the beach view, as this was one of the selling points for Shangri La. There is construction going on all around the hotel. It is noisy and just overall not very nice. The best thing we did was to rent a car and drive up the coast to Akumal. There is a dive shop there and "Manuel" took us on a snorkel tour for $10 a person. We saw three turtles, an eel, manta rays, eagle rays, and lots of coral. It was great. After that Manuel took us to a cenote and we snorkeled there too, also very good. I would recommend the restuarant off 5th avenue, Yaxtche, it was excellent. Overall, Playa de Carmen is nice, but Shangri La is not.

Reviews.Title: “Paridise”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirlusa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent eleven days at the Shangril La in a partial ocean view room. The good points: the beach was awesome and quiet. The weather beutiful and very close to town. Most the staff were very nice and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job and so did the front desk. The over all room was good and the deck nice and large. Improvements I would make: Beds really Really hard would suggest bringing extra foam or something from home. They need small frig in room. Some kinda entertainment at resort or something. Bartenders need personality class. And the food. Breakfast more variety. Dinner more variety and more spices very bland and boring. Buffets were better if you liked fish. Over all food was not very good. In spite of the beds and the food the resort was very relaxing and we did have a great time. Lots of nude sunbathers and alot of euro people so not many spoke to us americans. Our Partial ocean view was very very partial and it would of been nice to see more ocean. Will try diffent hotel next time. but if your looking for quiet this is it

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: paradox991
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days at Shangri La Hotel in March, 2005 and would have gladly stayed for another 10 days! The hotel is well situated on one of the best and cleanest strands of beach in the Playa del Carmen area, only a 10 minute walk to the 5th. Ave. shopping area. Enjoyed early morning and late afternoon walks on the beach (away from the town) on a beach that goes on for five or six miles. Clean water, but strong undertows, so watch the kiddies! The rooms (most in high ceiling thatch huts) are clean, spacious and well maintained...Try to get one of the single unit huts in the Garden area. Contrary to other reviews, the beds are firm, but comfortable...no problem sleeping. There are two very clean swimming pools, plenty of shade, for the hot midday hours. The food: Breakfast is a delightful feast! Fresh fruits, juices, fresh baked breads, pastries, eggs any way you like them, and pancakes or french toast (if you still have room!). Dinner is fairly good to excellent...the buffets are the best, the soups are excellent, one squid dish (calamari style) was outstanding. The front desk staff is very helpful and cheerful...and the waiters in the dining area are hard working and very lively. Housekeeping maintains the rooms to a high standard of cleanliness, however your room may be made up early in the morning some days, late in the afternoon other days. Overall, a very pleasant , restful experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: EEL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri La Caribe for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon in Nov. 2004. It was everything we were hoping for. A quiet spot on the best beach in Playa Del Carmen. The food was better than average. The staff friendly and helpful. The beach... absolute paradise. You can walk to 5th ave. in about 5-10 minutes or rent bikes and ride around. We would go back in a second. Only complaints... the bed was really hard, and our shower did not drain properly. Other than those small problems, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-La Caribe Feb. 22-25, 2005. We found the service to be outstanding, everyone eager to help you. The meals were great, good variety. We stayed in the new garden view Pueblo section, which is still very close to the beach and is airconditioned. The only complaint we had was the hard bed. It was like sleeping on concrete. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-la Caribe - nice, but needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-la Caribe for one night at the end of January. We were scouting a location for our wedding next year. The Good - resort is kept very clean and picked up. atmosphere is very casual and friendly, rooms are close to the beach. wedding planning staff was very helpful and friendly. room was clean, plenty of hot water, a/c worked well. The Bad - we did not like the food at all. the breakfast buffet is ok, but it may take several times to get your eggs cooked all the way through. rolls/ bread/etc taste like the kind you get from Costco. the dinner was really bad - we each tried different dishes like pasta, meat, soup, etc. and we were reminded of airplane food. we walked into town for dinner and found good food. we may be a little biased being from san francisco, but we didn't think it was acceptable. as others said, hotel is almost impossible to find with construction going on in front. front desk staff is not very helpful. we were told at 4:30 in the afternoon that it was too late to get a beachtowel because the dive shop was closed - we would have to wait until the morning. checkout took 25 minutes because there was only one person at the desk. the morning of checkout, we came back to our room about 45 minutes before check out time. the maids moved all of our things off of the beds, stripped the linens and left the beds bare, and taken the towels - not cool. overall, a nice place if you want a nice, relaxing family vacation. not a good place if you are picky about food, expect great service, or are concerned about taking a group of people to a resort as your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Shangri La Caribe with our extended family last Christmas. We all rented beachfront cabanas, which were fantastic, though all the rooms are beautiful. The Shangri La is not a big, impersonal all inclusive resort. It is small, intimate, and lovely. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms lovely and each with their own tile work and decor, the staff is unbelievably friendly and competent, and the food is excellent. The hotel is small enough that you become familiar with the other families there. The beach is beautiful and not at all crowded. The staff is wonderful, and helped us with the several outside activities we did - like trips to Xel-ha, special dinners in Playa del Carmen, snorkling trips, etc. The waiters at breakfast and dinner knew our kids by name and often sat down to play with them. My sister and I had the best massages we've ever had right on the beach. If you are looking for a really nice family vacation, I highly recommend the Shangri La Caribe. It is an unbelievable value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Still searching for my Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: nc_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-La Caribe for 5 nights in early January '05. It was not what I expected based on the write-up in Frommers. I expected gorgeous and instead found a mountain of sand, trash, and rocks at the resort entrance. After a few days they came in with bulldozers and smoothed out most of the sand but left the pile of trash and rocks like it belonged there. The good things: the ocean view from the breakfast room and pool area was spectacular. I loved the towel art; every day our fresh towels were arranged on the bed in the shapes of birds - very unique. There is a fabulous collection of palm trees on the beach - most other resorts in the area had none. I thought the food was quite good and the dining hall was exotic. But in general the place looked very 1970's, in desperate need of a makeover. We did a lot of walking in to town - Shangri-La is far from the action, so it's quiet but a long hike. Our weather was persistently windy. We were told that the best weather month for visiting the area is May. Oh, another thing we liked is that both the resort and Playa del Carmen attract a very international crowd. There were many more Europeans than Americans when we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Simply paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Shangri-la so much, I decided to get married there this past November! This place has so much charm & character. The staff is incredible, and very friendly. Although it does not have as many selections as an all-inclusive, I found both the breakfasts and dinner delicious and much more enjoyable! The beach is fantastic. Very clean, long, and the water has hardly any rocks or sea grass. Although they are a bit more expensive, I would suggest staying in one of the beachfront palapas. They are very spacious, clean, and have a view to die for. Our only complaint , was the microscopic bugs we had twice in our room in the morning. This was mostly our fault - due to some food we had left on the table overnight. You have to expect a chance of bugs with a room with a thatched roof, and directly on the sand. But overall, it really wasn't a problem. In addition, the maid service was awesome. The maid we had spent at least 2 hours on our room each day. We can't wait to go back for our 1 - year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Romantic...just perfect”
Reviews.Author: tccgirl
Reviews.Content: We are a 30y/o couple looking for a beach vacation and after a long debate with myself whether to stay in at a cheaper hotel in town vs. Shangri La, i chose this hotel. My reasons: the beach, the private rooms, the balcony hammocks(loved those!), and the accessiblity to 5th Ave. Shangri La Caribe is located of one of the most beautiful stretches of beach i have visited (and we've been to a few so far including Tahiti, Hawaii,Aruba, St John, St Lucia) The sand is the perfect texture, the ocean is beautiful turquoise. We loved the grounds, they were clean with litttle pathways around each section leading to the different areas. The Housekeeping staff and all the staff were top notch. Everyone was friendly and accomodating. ROOM: we stayed in the just newly built Garden View Deluxe suites(#54-65) right next to the pool. It was a simple very clean room with a hard king bed, closets and a mexican tiled bathroom (one sink, open shower with pretty low water pressure) The best part were the Hammocks on the Terrace, we brought speakers for our Ipod and listened to relaxing music every morning and evening on our hammocks. FOOD: Breakfast was always delicious. Choice of very good mexican or american eggs. I always had the Motelenos Eggs (crispy tortilla with eggs on top, topped with tomato sauce and bits of ham and peas...yum!) there was also a buffet of fresh fruit, juices, yogurt, cheese, sweet rolls and pastries, oatmeal, cereal. We ate lunch and dinner in town every night (aside from the hotels Sunday Mexican Feast which was good) DO NOT MISS Babes noodle shop, a thai restaurant with the best food in all if playa, even though it isn't mexican food, also try the Mojito there, top notch! Il Oasis for shrimp and crab tacos, Yaxche for Mayan food (pricey though), and try the tacos Al Pastor anywhere! POOLS: We had some very breezy days, so the pools were to cold for my taste, spent alot of time in the jacuzzi where we always grabbed a louge chair and read in the sun. BEACH: as stated, the beach is perfect. white soft sand with hardly a rock or seaweed in sight, with perfect turquoise water. We had a great time in the water. The outside feb temps were ~80. we walked up and down the beach, which looked long but wasn't. We stopped by Mamitas Beach Club, very cute, beds on the beach for sunning with relaxing music playing and a beach bar. BAR: saw a famous face here! that was fun. The happy hour from 5-6p is great, 2 for 1 drinks. Try the Caipiranha (lime, sugar, rum) - so refreshing. We loved the swings at the bar!! INTERNET: didn't use it here but it is cheaper here than on 5th. only $3 for one hour. And there are phones if you need them MASSAGE: an open hut right in the middle of the grounds housed 2 massage beds, only $60 for one hour of bliss, you can hear the ocean as they knead away your stresses. I had 2 within 5 days, one with a pretty french woman(name?) she was excellent, and one with Blanca which was good. Her husband Gabriel also does them. 5th Ave: The main pedestrian walkway in Playa del carmen. It is a short walk, but we always took a cab ($3 each way) We walked up and down 5th every afternoon and evening. There is so much people watching, great cute shops(for the shopaholic in me) as well as drugstores, souvenir shops, dessert spots. The bars at night are great (reminiscent of South Beach) Have a drink at DESEO's rooftop bar, and check out BLUE PARROT on the beach at night. Minor Complaints: the bad was Hard, but we survived. The shower pressure was low, but we did fine. Since we were in the newer section we didn't have any other furniture aside from the bed. we would have liked an extra bedside table or desk for all of our crap. Lastly, a complaint about myself, i continually read not to bring any fancy clothes or heels, but didn't listen. This place is casual, flip flops are good anywhere. All in all a perfect vacation of relaxation and fun. it was nice to have the options of eating and bar hopping of 5th Ave at night after hours of nothing all day. I highly recommend this place and we will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoFunMom
Reviews.Content: Fantastic trip - better than I imagined possible. We traveled with 2 small children who had the best time of their lives. My husband and I did too - so you know it was perfect! Our room was right on the beach (ocean-view, caribe section) so we could still enjoy the ocean during nap times. My husband I enjoyed cocktails on our patio while the kids dug 3 feet off to the side. My 2 year old preferred swimming in the pool and we used both of them. Plenty of steps and shallow water areas to keep her happy as a clam. We are not organized activity types and prefer low-key, upscale accommodations. This hotel fit the bill. This hotel is small and that allowed us to meet other families with kids. We saw them at meals and our kids met friends to play with (allowing adults more free time!) Shangri-la is full of couples and young families. It is not a singles scene and there were not a lot of older kids. The rec room has pool and ping pong tables and also a paint-your-own pottery which my 4 year old loved. There are wooden swings at the bar which were fun too! The beach is gorgeous and stretches for miles with wide white sandy expanses. Walking on the beach is EXTREMELY popular. This allows for ample people watching and did not seem to bother the kids in the least. People just stepped around their castles and trucks. The water was turquoise and calm. We took our 4 year old out in a sea kayak and also rented boogie boards from the dive shop. His favorite activity though was playing in the sand with his shovels and trucks. The beach was quiet and very relaxing. Lots of shade and we never had trouble finding lounge chairs. The rooms were simple and kept very clean. No TV's and no phones - we didn't even notice. The patios were outstanding with hammocks and a table and chairs. Meals were excellent. Breakfast and dinner are included. Breakfast is a continental buffet with hot items like pancakes and bacon. Excellent!!! We only ate dinner at the hotel 2 nights. My only complaint about this trip is dinner. Dinner starts at 7:30!! It is too late and my husband and I were starving before it started - the kids simply could not make it that late. There are no appetizers available beforehand. We got PB&J for the room and still found that dinner was too late. So we went into town - which was fantastic every time we went. There is a yoga studio across the street and I went to a class attended by tourists and locals alike. It was in Spanish and a pretty cool experience. Travel Notes: If you are driving to this hotel, just plan on getting lost the first time. Even armed with a map and directions it took 45 minutes to find it. The streets in this section of town are not marked and this hotel is not on a street anyway. It is on the beach. They are also doing construction up the street from the entrance and we actually had to move a construction barrier to drive down the sandy "street." We asked at least 5 people before I went into another hotel and pulled a worker out to practically walk us there. Everyone I spoke to at the hotel had the same experience - it is kind of a joke there. But once you find it you will know Playa a lot better and it is definitely worth it! Also - bring more cash than you think you need. The dive shop, gift shop and pottery places, even though located at the hotel, do not allow you to charge to your room. Cash only. We ran out and it was kind of a pain to get to an ATM.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE FOUND!!”
Reviews.Author: relaxedgirl
Reviews.Content: I just spent 16 days at Shangri La. It was absoultely marvelous. The physical grounds are authentic and pristene. The beach is likely the best Playa has to offer. The staff is polite, professional and genuine. I stayed in the penthouse (18P) which was lovely and private. The views were magnificent and whiling away the early evening breeze on the deck was a gift. If you want a get away with telephones and television and canned entertainment or wild parties, this is likely not your hotel. I am married without children and found this hotel to offer a perfect combination of quiet solitude and plenty of entertainment (ie: snorkling, kayaking, diving, people watching, etc.) with the Euro-quaint village of Playa just a short jaunt away. I ate dinner away from the hotel almost every night - as I was interested in expanding my experience. I enjoyed breakfast at the hotel every morning (just great!). I also had a rental car for the entire trip so was able to explore much of Quintana Roo. It was amazing to make only 3 telephone calls and watch no television for my entire stay - that is a REAL getaway. Enjoy - you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of October. The weather was perfect, the water and beaches beautiful and the walk to town convenient yet a small work-out. We stayed in a bungalow right on the beach. The service was outstanding. Our only complaint was the late dinner hours (it starts at 7:30) and the menus seemed to be very similar from day to day. However, I usually get sick of Mexican food after 1 or 2 days. It took me the week to get sick of it here. Good quality. We took our two small kids and the staff loved them. We will certainly return to this spot in the future.

Reviews.Title: “THE SHANGRI-LA IS FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: traveltweaker
Reviews.Content: After going to so many all inclusives, my husband and I wanted to try a more relaxed, authentic Mexican feeling resort. After reading all of the great reviews and looking at the web site, I chose the Shangri La and it was exactly what we needed. It is really laid back with a slow motion bohemian vibe, similar to what I felt in Jamaica. We stayed in the Penthouse suite 12P. Ask for this room! It felt like our own Swiss Family Robinson Treehouse!! It had a great view and a huge balcony with two hammocks and a lounge chair which we would pass out on every night while listening to music from our Ipod and drinking some ice cold Bohemia's. The beds are nice and hard, just the way we love them. The staff was very nice and hard-working and the property was clean and very beautiful.
