The beach is lovely white sand with palapas and palm trees. Although the little rooms on the beach look cool, and I wanted one at first, the penthouse is far more private and romantic. It would suit anyone except those not wanting to climb about 45 stairs. No big effort and it helped to work off all of the beer calories. The food was good and plentiful. I am a bit of a foodie and love variety, so we ate out 5 of the 7 nights during our stay. Do not miss the restaurants Babe's (Thai) or Yaxche (Mayan), very good! Overall, this place is really chilled out with a barefoot, super casual vibe. No make-up or fancy clothes needed here. If you have any questions, feel free to email me. I know you'll love the Shangri-La!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: djhskh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an anniversary trip for four nights to Shangri-la (Dec. 18-22). After researching through all the various hotels, I just couldn't get my mind off the beautiful pictures on the web site. We are so glad we chose this resort. We stayed in the garden view caribe (18) and had a/c although we didn't need it except for the first night when there was an all night party going on about two blocks away from the resort. It must have kept the north part of Playa awake so this was not the resort's fault. Our room was clean, no bugs and only saw little ants when we left some peanuts out overnight so that was our own fault!! The beds were a bit hard but after the first night we didn't even notice and we both slept great. We enjoyed the walk into town and the resort was peaceful and quiet (at least after that first night!) The breezes lulled us to sleep everynight and although our room was "garden-view", as soon as we opened our door, we had a wonderful view of the beach and were literally steps away from the ocean. Yes, there was some construction going on in Pueblito but we really didn't notice it. The pools were chilly but we didn't plan on swimming anyway as we didn't have the children with us. We've seen many beaches but the sand and the water here rivals any we've ever seen, including Siesta Key in Florida. The staff was just wonderful, very friendly. The breakfasts were delicious: freshly squeezed juice, GREAT coffee, yogurt, sweet breads, cereals, oatmeal, fresh fruit (wonderful pineapple) plus your choice of a breakfast entree (try the pancakes with bacon - wonderful). Seriously, we didn't need to eat again until dinner time with these breakfasts. We were in town most nights for dinner so cannot comment on the dinners except the Mexican fiesta which they have on Sunday nights. Live mariachi music plus great Mexican food, although I discovered I really prefer Tex-Mex as opposed to Mexican!! We've been home two days and still have the webcam picture up, wondering what our acquaintances are up to at the beach....Will definitely return, though I'm sure not nearly soon enough.....This is truly paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: jillywade
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Shangri-la. It was exactly what we wanted to get away from the city. We stayed in one of the bungalows. No a/c, no tv, no phone, perfect!!! The bungalow was steps from the beach. The beach was beautiful and clean. The food and drinks were great. The staff was very nice. Once our luggage arrived 1 day after we did the front desk had it to our room in minutes and we were happy to see it. We had a wonderful stay and will definately go back one of these days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Shangrila”
Reviews.Author: donross
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 12 nights at the most unique Shangrila Caribe. As a solo traveller with a walking problem I was treated very well by their caring staff. The room I had in the air-conditioned Pueblito section was average in size with two very hard double beds. The terrace was large, with hammocks, table and chairs aand next to La Loma restaurant, for dinner. Breakfast was at the Aventura restaurant overlooking one of the pools and the Caribbean sea beyond. Plenty of thatched huts and comfortable chairs there. The second pool was closer to my room with the lunchtime grill overlooking the pool and gardens. Food was quite good and the staff wondeerful. Housekeeping is tops. Drawbacks? No phone in case of emergencies and no refrigerator or ice machines to enable a cold drink. No night life though the bar, with pool and ping pong tables, was open until 11pm. Just peace and quiet in beautiful surroundings. Some rooms right on the beach. All rooms have good overhead fans. Would go back tomorrow. Came home rested and relaxed, just missing Shangrial and it was for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Shangri LA”
Reviews.Author: Susanna
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from a one week trip to Playa Del Carmen. We stayed at Shangri La Caribe from Oct 1st - 8th and had a wonderful time !! We were a little worry about the weather, but it turned out to be beautiful. It rained a couple of nights, but the next day the sun would shine even brighter. We were very happy to have chosen Shangri - LA, a small resort, compared to the huge ones in Cancun. We had a room on playa section, literally a few steps from the beach. Just a wonderful view .. walking out of our room was the white sand with palm trees and then the beautiful blue water. The water was warm and clear. My husband describes it as Paradise. The room was great, clean and spacious, no TV or telephone but you realize you don't need them. Nor a/c, we had a fan which was just fine. Plus you can't beat the ocean breeze. The staff is wonderful.. they'll bring you drinks while relaxing on lounge chairs under a palapa. Absolutely the best. We did tip, we felt it was well deserved. The food is good.. especially dinner. Breakfast could get a little redundant, but they have a wide choice of fruits and breads that can go with your selection of eggs. Playa Del Carmen is walking distance, we only took a taxi once going there. We usually walked to la 5ta Avenida. There is a wide variety of restaurants to choose from. We recommend "La Parilla", great Mexican food. We did take advantage of our days there and went to the archeological sites plus to Xcaret! Shangri-LA was a great choice, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best beach vacation I've ever had. As a point of reference, we've been to Hawaii 9 times (Oahu, Kaui, and Maui), Puerto Vallarta, and Ixtapa. Playa del Carmen hands down is the best so far. And Shagri-La Caribe exceeded our expectations. We were touring the Yucatan for nine days in August and unfortunately only stayed 4 days and 3 nights at this resort (August 17th to 20th). We will return and stay a least a week. We were in bungalow #5 on the Caribe side. We loved our bungalow (which happens to be the closest one to the water). Didn't need AC even in August. The bungalow was exceptionally clean and the beds were a little firm but a minor downside to paradise found. The best beach in the whole Yucatan. (Skip Cancun; either the ocean's too rough on the Carribean side or too shallow facing Isla Mujeres). Price- An absolute bargain since a hearty breakfast and full course dinner (except for drinks at dinner) comes with your rate. Also tax is included. Once you've stayed in Cancun, you'll realize what a bargain Shangri-La is. Beach - White sand. Coconut trees. Blue, warm, clear water. Other perks - Two hammocks on your porch, excellent lounging and people watching. Very diverse clientelles which we love. Service - genuingly warm and friendly staff. Everyone from front desk to housekeeping was professional and helpful. Wait staff were exceptionally charming and kind. Sidenote: Please tip remember to tip the staff, especially house keeping as these people are paid the least for their hard work. Food - Breakfast included fresh fruits, excellent fresh juices, and wonderful egg selections (diff. omelets.) Dinner - All three meals were great. Point of reference - we don't like fast food or greasy diners. We're not exactly picky and love Mexican food. The selections varied and many options were available when we were there. Fish, beef, chicken, pork, fruits, salads, and deserts. No complaints. Lunch (not included) was quite good. We loved the ceviche and pulpo (fresh octopus). There's a t.v. room, an internet room, a game room, and a bar. The best message I've ever gotten was from Blanca. Deep tissue and aroma therapy; by the time she was done, I felt like I was floating on a cloud. The other message therapist was Gabriel which my partner stated was also very good. We both had another message the next day. Yes. That good. Quinta Avenida (Playa's hip restaurant, bar, clubs, cafes) was a 10 minutes walk from the resort. We walked back and forth from the resort and always felt safe. We will definately return very soon. Hopefully in Spring. Feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions.
